name: Indian Fry Bread
description: Fried bread is a slice of bread that has been fried. It is used as a substitute for toast in various dishes or meals. Various oils, butter, lard, bacon drippings, or ghee can be used.
ingredients: 4 cups flour, 2 tbsp. baking powder, 1 tsp. salt, 1/2 cup shortening, 1 cup warm water
instruction: Mix flour, baking powder and salt. Slowly add in shortening. Add enough water to make the dough stick together. Knead dough until it is smooth Divide dough into several palm-size balls. Place balls back in glass bowl for 15 minutes. *If using self rising flour omit baking powder and salt. Pat down the flour into palm size flat pancakes, Punch hole in center of dough. Fry in hot cooking oil in a cast iron skillet. Brown each side until they are golden brown. Drain on paper towels.

name: Baked Indian Pudding
description: Delicious baked pudding with maple syrup. Great for that Thanksgiving or Easter feast. Served warm, but also great cold. Great with ice cream or light cream on top.
ingredients: A½ cup cornmeal, 4 cups hot milk, 2 tablespoons butter, Â¼ cup molasses, 2 eggs â slightly beaten, Â½ tsp. salt, 1/3 cup brown sugar, 1/3 cup granulated sugar, Â¼ cup honey, Â¾ tsp ginger, Dash of ground cloves, Â½ cup cold milk
instruction: Preheat Oven 325 degrees: In a double-broiler top, slowly stir cornmeal into hot milk. Cook over boiling water, stirring occasionally for about 20 minutes. Lightly butter a baking dish. In a bowl combine rest of ingredients except cold milk; stir into cornmeal mixture and mix well. Pour into prepared dish; and pour cold milk over the top, without stirring. Bake uncovered for about 50 minutes or until just set. Do Not!! Overbake. Let stand 15 minutes before serving. Serve with vanilla ice-cream or fresh whip cream.

name: Cabbage Pachadi (salad)
description: Cabbage Pachadi is a South Indian salad made with shredded cabbage mixed with a flavorful coconut and yogurt-based dressing, tempered with mustard seeds, curry leaves, and red chili. It's refreshing, tangy, and provides a burst of flavors in every bite.
ingredients: 1/1 a medium cabbage (inner leaves only) finely shredded* (about 6 cups), 4 medium tomatoes, finely chopped, ½ cup ground, roasted peanuts, 2/3 cup grated fresh coconut, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon brown sugar (regular sugar is also ok), 6 teaspoons fresh lemon juice, 2 tablespoons oil, ½ teaspoon mustard seeds, ½ teaspoon cumin seeds, ¼ teaspoon turmeric, ½ teaspoon asafoetida powder, 1 tablespoon hot green chili, seeded and minced, 4 tablespoons coarsely chopped, fresh coriander leaves, you can also use the coleslaw cabbage packet available in the grocery store.
instruction: Place the cabbage, tomato, peanut powder, coconut, salt, sugar, and lemon juice in a large bowl. Mix well and set aside. Fry the mustard seeds in oil in a small pan over moderate heat until they crackle. Add the cumin seeds, turmeric, asafetida, and green chili. Fry until the cumin seeds turn a darker shade. Remove from the heat. Add these above prepared spices to the cabbage. Toss the salad thoroughly and make sure that the spices have been properly mixed in. Garnish with the coriander leaves. Chill and serve cold. The longer you keep this salad, the better it tastes. Make this at least 1 hour ahead and chill in the refrigerator. This develops the taste.

name: Shepuchi Bhaji
description: Shepuchi Bhaji is a traditional Maharashtrian dish made with fresh green dill leaves sautéed with onions, green chilies, and spices like turmeric and cumin. It's a quick and flavorful vegetarian side dish often served with roti or rice.
ingredients: 1 bunch Dill leaves / Shepu leaves, 2 tbsp. Moong dal, 2 green chilies 2, 4-5 garlic cloves, 1 cup Water, Salt to taste, 2 tsp. cooking oil
instruction: 1.Soak moong daal for 30 minutes. 2.Chop Dill leaves and wash in water. Strain the water and keep it aside. 3.Heat oil in pan. Add garlic and green chilies. 4.After garlic becomes golden brown. Add soaked moong daal. 5.Saute moong dal for 2 minutes(do not let it cook more time, it will change its color) 6.Add Dill or Shepu leaves. Sauté for more 2 minutes and add 1 cup of water. 7.Cover with lid and cook for 6-7 min. 8.Then add salt, mix well and cook till it is done.

name: Beetroot Cutlet
description: To make beetroot cutlets, grate boiled beetroot and mix with mashed potatoes, breadcrumbs, and spices. Shape into patties and shallow fry until crispy. Enjoy these delicious and nutritious snacks!
ingredients: Beetroot - 1 No. (small), Potato - 2 Nos. (medium), Onion - 1 No. (big), Ginger - 1" Piece, Garlic - 4 pods (medium), Brown Bread - 5 slices, Chopped mint leaves - 1 tsp, Chopped coriander leaves - 2 tsp, Green Chillies - 3 nos. or as per preference, Cinnamon - 1" stick, Cardamom - 1 No., Cloves - 3 Nos, Bay leaf - 1 No. (small), Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Cumin Powder - 1/2 tsp, Salt to taste, Oil for sauteing and tempering
instruction: Pressure cook Potato and beetroot till 3 whistles Dry roast, cinnamon, cardamom, bay leaf and cloves, powder it & keep ready Finely chop ginger, garlic, onion, green chillies, mint leaves and coriander leaves Sprinkle water over the brown bread, leave it for a minute, then nicely knead it like you do with chapathi dough, keep ready. Heat a tsp of oil in a wok, add chopped onion, fry till it becomes transparent, then add ginger, garlic and saute well for two minutes, cool down and grind it to a paste Peel the potatoes. Dice the beetroot and one & half potato Grate the remaining half of potato and few diced cubes of beetroot To that add salt, mix well Heat 3 tsp oil, add the ground paste, powdered masala, Coriander powder and Cumin Powder and fry for a minute Add the potato beetroot mixture and fry for a minute Add chopped mint leaves and coriander leaves, mix well Keep it covered and cook for 5 minutes (by removing and stirring it occasionally to prevent burning) Allow the mixture to cool Make equal sized balls now take a portion of the bread dough, like paratha stuffing, make a bowl shape, place a portion of beetroot stuffing, close, roll and slightly flatten Grease a non-stick pan or tava, place the prepared cutlets or tikkis over it, pour a tbsp of oil around it, cook over medium flame. When one side is done, flip it and cook the other side too till the crust turns golden brown in colour.

name: Mattar Samosa
description: Mattar samosa is a popular Indian snack consisting of crispy pastry filled with a spiced mixture of peas (mattar). The pastry is typically made with flour and filled with a mixture of cooked peas seasoned with spices like cumin, coriander, and garam masala. The filled pastries are then deep-fried until golden brown and served hot, often with chutney or sauce for dipping.
ingredients: For crust, 2 cup refined flour (maida), 1 tsp. carom seed (ajwain), Salt to taste, 1 tbsp. pure desi ghee, Water for dough, For filling 2 cup boiled peas, Salt to taste, 1 tsp. cooking oil, 1 green chili chopped, 1 tbsp. green coriander chopped, 1 tsp. lemon juice, Â¼ tsp. cumin seeds, Â¼ tsp. red chillies powder, Â½ tsp. coriander powder, A pinch of garam masala, Other ingredients: Oil for deep frying, Tomato ketchup, Green chutney
instruction: For crust, In bowl add flour, salt, carom seeds and ghee and mix well with figure tips. Now add enough water slowly for tight dough like for kachori and samosa. Keep covered under a wet cloth for at least half an hour. For filling Heat the pan on medium flame and add cooking oil in it. Add cumin seed when they start crackle, add boil peas. Now add green chillies, coriander, lemon juice and spices. Cook for 5 min. and keep aside for cool. For preparation Divide the dough into small sized balls and roll out one of them. Cut in the centre to get two pieces. Make cones from the pieces using few drops of water to seal the corners. Stuff the masala matter (peas) filling and press the corners to seal the samosa. Repeat for rest of the dough and stuffing. Heat oil and deep fry the samosa on medium flame till golden brown and crisp. Drain the excess oil on a tissue paper and serve hot with green chutney or sauce and tea.

name: GAJAR KA HALWA
description: Gajar ka Halwa is a popular Indian dessert made from grated carrots, milk, sugar, and ghee. Carrots are cooked in milk until they become soft and absorb the milk's flavor. Sugar is then added to sweeten the mixture, and ghee is used to enhance richness. The dessert is typically flavored with cardamom and garnished with nuts like almonds and cashews. It's a deliciously sweet and aromatic treat enjoyed especially during festivals and celebrations.
ingredients: 1/4 c. corn oil, 1 kg. carrots, grated, 1 c. evaporated milk, 6 tbsp. powdered milk, 1 tsp. vanilla essence, 3/4 c. sugar, 5 tbsp. butter, 1 tbsp. raisins, 1 tbsp. chopped cashew nuts
instruction: Saute grated carrots in hot oil for 5 minutes. Add milk and vanilla. Simmer until milk is absorbed into the carrots. Stir occasionally. Add sugar, butter and raisins, continue stirring until liquid is absorbed. Garnish with cashew nuts.

name: Tawa Fry Stuffed Vegetables
description: Tawa fry stuffed vegetables is a flavorful dish where assorted vegetables are hollowed out, stuffed with a mixture of spices, herbs, and sometimes paneer (Indian cottage cheese), and then shallow-fried on a tawa (griddle) until crispy and golden brown. It's a popular Indian recipe that combines the goodness of vegetables with aromatic spices, resulting in a delicious and satisfying dish perfect for any meal.
ingredients: Mix vegetables: 4 round small brinjals, slit halfway, 2 medium sized bitter gourd (karele), slit in between and cut each into half, 4 - 5 ladyfinger, slit in between and cut into half, 2 - 3 potato, peeled and cut into wedges, 2 tomato, cut from top and remove the pulp, For the tawa masala: 2 tsp coriander seeds, 2 tbsp fennel seeds (saunf), 2 tsp cumin seeds, 2 tsp methi seeds, 2 tsp onion seeds (kalonji), 2 tsp pomegranate seeds (anardana), A pinch of asafoetida, 2 dried red chilli, 1 tsp turmeric powder, 2 tsp mango powder, For stuffing bitter gourd (karela):, 2 onion, finely chopped, 1 tsp ginger garlic paste, salt, as per taste, oil for cooking, 2 tsp tawa masala (mentioned above) For stuffing tomato: 1 small onion, chopped, ¼ Cup grated cottage cheese (paneer), 1 tsp tawa masala (mentioned above), 1 cube processed cheese, grated, salt, as per taste Other ingredients: Salt, as per taste, Oil for pan frying, 2 tbsp mustard oil
instruction: To make tawa masala Clean coriander, fennel, methi, cumin and put them on a hot Tawa (flat pan) to roast. Add red chillies to the roasted spices and dry roast for 1 minutes. Allow the spices to cool off then grind them to fine powder along with other spices except turmeric powder. Put turmeric powder to the grounded spices and mix. Salt, as per taste can also be mixed in this masala if you don’t want to add it later. To stuff vegetables Clean, wash and dry all the vegetables. For stuffing ladyfinger and brinjal, slit them halfway and fill in each pieces with spoonful of tawa masala, coat exterior as well with tawa masala and sprinkle 2 tbsp mustard oil so that masala stick nicely to vegetables. Set aside meanwhile you prepare other vegetables. Sprinkle tawa masala over potato wedges along with tbsp of mustard oil and set aside. For preparing bitter gourd: Peel out the skin and remove seeds of bitter gourd, slit in between and cut into half. Rub each piece with generous amount of salt and leave aside for atleast 6 hours. Once all the water has drained out of bitter gourd, rinse it under cold water and dry with a kitchen towel. Set aside. To prepare filling, saute onions in oil until golden, add ginger garlic paste and saute again for 5 minutes. Add tawa masala and mix nicely. Fill in spoonful of filling in each piece and tie it with cotton thread/butcher’s string. For preparing tomatoes: Cut a small disc on top and with the help of desert spoon scoop out pulp and seeds from inside. To prepare filling, saute onion in oil, once translucent add grated paneer and tawa masala. Adjust salt, as per taste. Mix nicely. Fill inside hollow tomatoes, press filling with your fingers and add grated cheese on top. Set aside. In a large heavy bottomed flat pan, heat oil for pan frying vegetables. Once oil is heated, arrange all the vegetables in it. Do not overcrowd the pan if pan is small you can do it in batches. Keep on turning vegetables until golden and crisp on both sides. Keep gas flame to low. Potato, ladyfinger and tomato will take less time whereas brinjal and bitter gourd requires more time to get cooked from deep inside. Once all the vegetables done, serve hot in a platter with lemon wedges along with main dishes.

name: Capsicum Corn Rice
description: Capsicum corn rice is a flavorful and colorful dish made by stir-frying cooked rice with diced capsicum (bell peppers) and sweet corn kernels. The dish is seasoned with spices like cumin, turmeric, and chili powder, along with garlic and onions for added flavor. It's a quick and easy recipe that's perfect for a delicious and satisfying meal.
ingredients: Ingredients 2/3 Cup of Cooked Rice, 2 Green Capsicum or Bell Pepper, 1/2 Cup of Corn, Frozen 1 Large Onion, Finely chopped, 2 Medium Size Tomatoes, Finely chopped, 1 Green Chilly , Finely chopped, 1 Tsp of Ginger - Garlic Paste, 1/2 Tsp of Turmeric Powder, 2 Tsp of Sambhar Powder, 1 Tsp of Garam Masala Powder, 2 Tbsp of Chopped Cilantro / Coriander Leaves, 2-3 Tsp of Oil / Ghee, Salt as needed, To Temper, 2-3 Tsp of Oil / Ghee, 1 Tsp of Mustard, 1 Tsp of Urad Dal, Few Sprig of Curry leaves
instruction: Wash and soak rice in water for 30 mins. Drain the water completely. In a pressure cooker, cook the rice by adding 2 Cups of water for 3 whistles. Once it done, switch off the stove. Heat a pan with oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal and curry leaves, after they sizzle, add chopped onion, green chilly and salt, fry for 2 mins until it turns golden brown. Add ginger garlic paste, saute this for a min until raw smell vanishes. In a medium flame, add turmeric powder, sambhar powder and garam masala, saute this for another 1 min. Add chopped tomatoes, saute well with masala until oil separates. Add chopped green capsicum and frozen corn, saute well with the masala, just sprinkle little water and cover the pan and cook it for 2-3 mins. Don't overcook the vegetables as it loses the nutrients. Check the salt and switch off the stove. Gently mix the veggie and the boiled rice. You can add some little butter or ghee at this stage, gives a nice flavor. Finally garnish it with chopped cilantro. Hot capsicum corn rice is ready.

name: Pizza on Tawa
description: Tawa pizza is a quick and easy way to enjoy pizza at home without an oven. It uses a no-yeast dough made with all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, and yogurt or buttermilk. The dough is rolled out thin and cooked on a griddle (tawa) until bubbly. Then it's topped with pizza sauce, cheese, and your favorite toppings, and cooked until the cheese melts.
ingredients: for the Pizza Dough, 2 cup wheat flour, Salt to taste, Water for dough, For the Topping, Pizza topping sauce, 1tbsp. fine chopped carrot, 1tbsp. capsicum , cut into small pieces, 1tbsp., tomatoes cut into dice, 1 tbsp. onion cut into dice, Â½ tbsp. sweet corn, 1/2 cup thickly grated processed or mozrella cheese, Butter for cooking, Salt to taste, chaat masala, chilli flakes, oregano
instruction: For the Pizza Dough Combine wheat flour and salt together, now add water in a flour to make dough like a chapatti/Indian flat bread. Take a big portion of dough and roll it as little thick by rolling pin. Keep the heat tawa on high flame. When see just white patches, turn it, see the below pictures. Cook second side little bit more (fully cook). How to prepare topping for Pizza Heat a non-stick kadhai, add butter and cook all veggies mixture on a medium flame for 4-6 minutes with salt. Keep aside to cool. How to cook Pizza on Tawa Apply Â½ tsp. of pizza sauce on the pizza base (cook well side use for topping) and spread it evenly. If pizza sauce not available, spread tomato ketchup on the base. Sprinkle the cook vegetables on top and spread them gently. Sprinkle the grated cheese evenly. Heat the butter on a non-stick tawa and gently place the pizza on it, such that the bottom of the pizza faces tawa. Cover the pizza with a deep vessel or deep plate and cook on a medium flame till the base becomes crisp and the cheese melts. Serve hot with chilli flakes, chaat masala and oregano.

name: Doodhi Thepla
description: Doodhi Thepla is a flatbread from Gujarat, India, made with grated bottle gourd (doodhi), whole wheat flour, and spices. It's a delicious and healthy option for lunch or a snack. You can enjoy it plain or with a side of chutney or pickle.
ingredients: 1 cup grated Doodhi Bhopla/Lauki/bottle gourd, 1 1/2 cup Wheat Flour, 1 green chili ,finely chopped, 1/2 tsp. Ginger paste, 2 tbsp coriander, finely chopped, 1/2 tsp. Turmeric powder, 1 tbsp Red chili powder, 1/2 tsp. Coriander powder, Salt to taste, 1 tbsp Oil + more for making thepla, 3-4 tbsp Yogurt /curd
instruction: 1.Mix wheat flour, green chilly, grated doodhi, ginger paste and coriander in a bowl. 2.Add all dry spices turmeric powder, red chili powder and coriander powder, salt and mix well with flour mixture. 3.Add 1 tbsp oil and mix everything properly. 4.Add 1 tbsp curd /yogurt at a time and knead the dough. If curd is not enough, you could use water to knead the dough. 5.Dough should be smooth and soft same as chapatti dough.(Do not let it rest because as it rest Lauki leaves its water it becomes very soft and sticky.) 6.Divide it into small equal size balls. 7.Roll each ball into 5-6 inch circle just like roti. Use dry flour while rolling, so it will not stick on the platform. 8.Heat the tawa or pan on medium heat. Once hot put the rolled Thepla on it. Flip it once it has little brown spots and roast from other side till it become little golden-brownish. 9.Apply little oil using brush or spoon on it. Flip it and press it very gently using spatula until it is cooked. Again apply some oil and flip it. Press from other side too. 10.Once cooked remove it from the pan and keep into a insulated container to keep it warm or serve it right from the pan to the dish. Serve Doodhi Thepla with Curd or Tomato chutney.

name: Pav Bhaji
description: Pav Bhaji is a classic Indian dish featuring a rich vegetable curry (bhaji) served with toasted buns (pav).
ingredients: 15 buns (or as per your need), 3 cloves of garlic - finely chopped, 1 tomato - finely chopped, 2 onion - finely chopped (save half for topping), Bunch of coriander leaves - chopped for topping, About 500g in total of chopped potatoes, green capcicum, cauliflower and green peas, 2 tbsp Pav Bhaji Masala, 2 tsp Red Chili Powder, 1-2 lime, Salt to taste, Butter for frying the buns and 1tbs to top the mash
instruction: Boil all the vegetables till really soft for mashing. In a wok, heat oil and fry the garlic, onions and tomatoes. Add the masala and chili powder and some salt and stir till the raw smell is gone. Add the boiled vegetables, add more salt to taste. Make sure the vegetables coat the masala well and start mashing the vegetables. (You may blend the vegetables). Add little water if the wok is too dry. Taste the salt. Off the stove and squeeze half a lime and top with some butter. Fry the buns in butter and serve this with the mashed vegetables topped with some chopped onions, coriander leaves and slices of lime.

name: Palak Paneer
description: Palak Paneer is a vegetarian dish made with spinach and paneer (Indian cottage cheese) in a creamy sauce.
ingredients: 500grams Fresh spinach, Inch or 2 2 Green chilies, sliced, Two Garlic clove (optional), 11-inch ginger, roughly sliced, For Your Palak curry:, Inch Medium onion, finely chopped, Inch Medium sized tomato, sliced, 4 5 Garlic, finely chopped, 1/2 tsp Cumin seeds, 1/4 tspTurmeric powder, 1tsp Red chili powder (optional), 1/2 tsp Garam masala powder, Inch Bay leaf, 200 g Spinach, Inch or two tablespoon Milk, Two tablespoon Oil or ghee or unsalted butter, 1 teaspoon, Fenugreek leaves, As requiredSalt, As requiredWater, Few tsp Butter for topping
instruction: Rinse the lettuce and Brush until the onions become tender. Now insert the garlic and also tomatoes.fry until the berries become tender. Last but not least incorporate salt and garam masala. Making the palak curry: Drain and puree the spinach into a blender or hand grinder with garlic, ginger and green chilies. Produce a puree. Heating oil or ghee in a bowl Insert the lettuce. If required, Include some water. Drain and instantly include the leaves at a bowl or pan containing icecold water. Stir and then add the paneer and then .add the milk and then stir fry. Simmer for 30 minutes or perhaps even a minute.at the ending you might also incorporate some smashed kasuri methi leaves. Include the garlic powder, red chili powder stir fry and simmer for a number of minutes. Simmer for 67 minutes or longer until the spinach is cooked. Fry the cumin . Add the bay leaves and onions. Switch off the flame and add the lettuce leaves from the hotwater. Close with a lid and make the lettuce leaves sit at the water for 23 mins. Boil water in a bowl with a few salt.

name: Kosambari
description: Kosambari is a refreshing South Indian salad made with lentils (usually moong dal), chopped cucumber, fresh coconut, coriander leaves, and a touch of lime juice. It's a quick and healthy dish with a burst of flavors and textures.
ingredients: 1 Cup grated carrot, 1/2 Cup chopped onions, 2 Tbs grated coconut, 2 Green chilli's sliced, 1 Tbs lemon juice, Pinch of salt, Cilantro for garnish
instruction: Wash carrots and wipe them with a cloth. Peel off the skin with a peeler & grate them. Mix carrot, onion, green chilli & coconut in a bowl. Add salt & lemon juice to the mixed veggies & mix them well. Garnish with finely chopped cilantro and serve this salad as a side dish.

name: Punjabi Style Aloo ki Sukhi Bhaji
description: "Punjabi Style Aloo ki Sukhi Bhaji" is a traditional North Indian dry potato dish bursting with flavors. It involves cooking potatoes with a blend of aromatic spices such as cumin, coriander, turmeric, and chili powder until they are golden brown and tender. This dish is typically served as a side dish or as a filling for sandwiches or wraps, providing a delicious and comforting addition to any meal.
ingredients: Medium-sized 6-7 potatoes, 1 tsp cumin seed and mustard seeds, 1 spoon salt, garam masala, red chili powder, turmeric powder, 1 spoon dhaniya leaves, and 1 spoon of oil.
instruction: Medium-sized 6-7 potatoes, peel them and put it into the water, and then cut them into small chunks. 1 tsp cumin seed and mustard seeds 1 spoon salt, garam masala, red chili powder, turmeric powder, 1 spoon dhaniya leaves, and 1 spoon of oil. All these ingredients are easily available in the Indian kitchen. You don’t require any fancy ingredients for making aloo ki sukhi bhaji. We will state with making small chunks of potatoes. Put the pan on flame and heat the oil. Add cumin seeds and mustard seeds. Roast them for few minutes. Add potatoes chunks to the pan. Mix it gently for 2-3 minutes on high flame. Add turmeric powder, salt, red chili powder and mix it well. Turn the flame to medium and cover it with a lid. Cook it for 5 minutes. Keep stirring it a little bit after 2 minutes. To check if the potato is cooked try to cut it from the center with the spatula. Sprinkle some garam masala and dhaniya leaves over the potatoes. Mix it well. This is strictly optional, If you haven’t tried it before, give it a try once: Add 1 spoon of butter and mix it well. Bring your flame to low and let it cook for 2 more minutes. And your aloo ki sukhi bhaji is ready. It is so simple to make and smell too good. Put your dry potatoes into the bowl and serve it with roti or parantha. Try this version of the Jeera Aloo Recipe for kids.

name: Veggie Delight Pizza
description: A delicious and colorful vegetarian pizza.
ingredients: Pizza dough, Tomato sauce, Mozzarella cheese, Bell peppers, Red onions, Olives
instruction: Preheat oven to 425°F. Roll out the pizza dough. Spread sauce, add toppings, and bake for 15 mins.

name: Spinach & Feta Stuffed Mushrooms
description: Savory stuffed mushrooms with a Mediterranean twist
ingredients: Mushrooms,Spinach,Feta cheese,Garlic,Olive oil,Bread crumbs
instruction: Clean mushrooms and remove stems.Saute spinach and garlic. Mix with feta and stuff mushrooms. Bake.

name: Lentil & Vegetable Soup
description: Hearty and nutritious lentil soup with veggies.
ingredients: Lentils,Carrots,Celery,Onion,Garlic,Vegetable broth
instruction: Saute onions, garlic, and veggies. Add lentils and broth. Simmer until lentils are tender.

name: Quinoa Salad with Lemon Vinaigrette
description: Refreshing quinoa salad with a zesty dressing.
ingredients: Quinoa,Cucumber,Cherry tomatoes,Feta cheese,Red onion,Lemon vinaigrette
instruction: Cook quinoa and let it cool. Mix with veggies and feta.Toss with lemon vinaigrette.

name: Chickpea Stir-Fry
description: Quick and protein-packed chickpea stir-fry.
ingredients: Chickpeas,Broccoli,Bell peppers,Soy sauce,Ginger,Garlic
instruction: Stir-fry ginger and garlic. Add chickpeas, veggies, and soy sauce.Cook until tender.

name: Eggplant Parmesan
description: Classic Italian dish with baked eggplant
ingredients: Eggplant,Marinara sauce,Mozzarella cheese,Parmesan cheese,Bread crumbs
instruction: Bread and bake eggplant slices..Layer with sauce and cheese. Bake until cheese is melted.

name: Black Bean Burritos
description: Spicy and satisfying black bean burritos.
ingredients: Black beans,Rice,Salsa,Avocado,Tortillas,Cilantro
instruction: Cook black beans and rice.  Assemble burritos with salsa, avocado, and cilantro.

name: Greek Spinach Pie
description: Flaky phyllo pastry filled with spinach and feta.
ingredients: Phyllo dough,Spinach,Feta cheese,Onion,Dill,Olive oil
instruction: Saute spinach and onions. Layer phyllo with spinach mixture and feta. Bake until golden.

name: Mushroom Risotto
description: Creamy and comforting mushroom risotto
ingredients: Arborio rice,Mushrooms,Vegetable broth,Parmesan cheese,White wine
instruction: Saute mushrooms and rice. Add wine and broth, stir until creamy. Finish with Parmesan.

name: Caprese Skewers
description: Elegant skewers with fresh tomatoes and mozzarella.
ingredients: Cherry tomatoes,Mozzarella balls,Basil leaves,Balsamic glaze
instruction: Thread tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil onto skewers. Drizzle with balsamic glaze.

name: Vegetarian Chilli Shepherds Pie
description: Vegetarian Chili Shepherd's Pie is a hearty vegetarian twist on the classic comfort food. It layers a savory vegetarian chili filling with creamy mashed potatoes, offering a satisfying and flavorful meal. Imagine a warm hug in a dish!
ingredients: 100g/4oz Vegetarian Mince, ½ 400g/15oz can,Dark Red Kidney Beans, ½ 400g/15oz can, Chopped Tomato, 1 medium brown Onion, ½ small Red Pepper, Ground red or green Chilli to taste, 1-Tbsp tomato paste, 250ml/½ Vegetable Stock Sea Salt, Ground Black Pepper. For the topping: 500g/1lb Mashed Potato
instruction: Chuck the vegetarian mince into the pressure cooker. Drain and rinse the Kidney beans and add ½ in too. Put the remainder into a sealed container and refrigerate. Do the same basic thing with the can of tomatoes. Put the unused half can into a container for the fridge. Use the vegetable stock to get the last bits from the tomato can then add that to the pot. Chop the Onion and the Pepper. Add to the mix. Add in around ½-1 tsp of ground chilli according to taste. Spoon in some tomato paste to colour and thicken. Season with salt and pepper. Following your pressure cooker manufacturers instructions, seal and raise the pressure. Cook for 5-10 minutes then carefully cool. Remember, *Steam is Dangerous* so carefully cool before opening. Mashed Potato Topping Prepare ahead of time then keep in the fridge. This is a deliberate leftover which is well worth doing. Final Assembly Spoon the Vegetarian Chilli mixture into an oven proof dish. The aim is to roughly half fill a 20cm/8cm dish. keep the liquid level down otherwise the mashed potato will become submerged. Using a dessert spoon, cover the chilli sauce with mashed potato. The trick is to work around the edges first but switching from one side of the dish to another. Then fill in the middle and smooth over. Use a work to make _railway tracks_ on the top surface. Well that was what we always called them. Cook in the oven for 30-40 minutes at 220°C/450°F/Gas 6. The mashed potato topping should brown and crisp. Serve with some green vegetables such as broad beans or peas

name: Stir Fried Vegetarian Mutton With Curry Leaves
description: This dish is a vegetarian take on a mutton stir-fry. It likely uses a plant-based meat substitute like soy curls or mycoprotein flavored to resemble mutton. The "mutton" is marinated with spices, then stir-fried with aromatics and curry leaves for a fragrant and flavorful dish.
ingredients: 400g vegetarian mutton, 1 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, 1 1/2 tsp corn flour, 2 dried red chilies - snipped into small sections, 1 green chili - sliced thinly, 3 shallots - sliced thinly, 4 garlic - sliced thinly, 1/2 ginger - sliced thinly, 1 tsp mustard seeds, 1 tsp cumin seeds, 2 sprigs curry leaves, 4-5 tbsp olive oil, 1/2 lime - extract juice, Salt for taste
instruction: Gently rub cornflour, turmeric powder and a pinch of salt (cornflour will prevent the rolls from breaking up when stir fried) over the muttons rolls.Keep aside. In heated oil saute all ingredients for 1-2 mins except fried rolls and lime juice. Add fried rolls, pour lime juice and season with a pinch of salt. Stir fry until rolls becomes glossy and sunshiny. Dish out/remove from heat.

name: No Guilt Chili (Vegetarian) Crock-Pot
description: This vegetarian chili recipe for the crock-pot is packed with flavor and skips the meat, making it a healthy and easy meal. It's perfect for those looking for a lighter chili option that is still satisfying.
ingredients: 2 tablespoon olive oil,to wake up spices, 1 large onion,chopped, 1 large green pepper, 1 or 2 large fresh jalapenos seeded and diced (optional), 3 clove of garlic chopped, 1 can(s) of black beans (rinsed), 1 can(s) of pinto beans (rinsed), 1 can(s) red-beans (rinsed), 1 can(s) large kidney beans (rinsed), 1 can(s) large can tomato juice, 1 c celery,chopped, 1 c fine chopped mushrooms, 1 bag frozen vegan beef if you want the chilli heartier., 2 can(s) 2 cans diced or 4 chopped fresh tomatoes, 1/4 c brown rice, raw or white.brown is better for you, 1 c water,temp doesn't matter, cube vegetable bouillon (i use this in any and everything that calls for boulin now since i cant cook with meats), 3 Tbsp unsweetened cocoa powder, 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper or more depending on your taste, 2 Tbsp chili powder, 1 Tbsp cumin, cilantro, fresh (optional), avocado (optional), CROCK-POT VEGETARIAN CHILI (YOU WILL NOT MISS THE MEAT)
instruction: If you are going to do this in a Crock Pot just RINSE all the beans first. It will remove a lot of the sodium. After rinsing all the beans and chopping all the veggies just put it ALL in your Crock Pot and walk away. But,Please saute' your spices in a bit of oil to open up the flavor before you add in the Crock. Heat oil and spices on low heat while you are chopping your veggies up.This wakes up the whole flavor of your spices although you "Do Not" have to do this. Chop all fresh veggies and put in your crock-pot as you go. Add water Put a Strainer in your sink.Open all cans of beans,pour then into the strainer and rinse them. This gets rid of some of the salt and the slimy juice they are in. Add beans to the crock-pot. Add all tomato products to pot. Add rice.(note...you will not see the rice when chili is cooked and finished,it's to help make the chili thicker and it seems to add where the meat is gone. Add All Spices and the oil add a small amount of water to get all the goodies out of the pan. Set Crockpot to high cook for 6/8 hours or longer.The longer it cooks the better. Serve with Corn chip and shredded cheddar. After all this is low in fat so you Can add the little extras. If you would like to take this one step more add a Good sloshing of Balsamic..gives this chili more of a kick!

name: Vegetarian Mutton (Mushroom) Rendang Nasi Lemak
description: This dish is a vegetarian twist on the classic Malaysian Nasi Lemak. It features a rich and flavorful mushroom rendang made with spices, coconut milk, and tamarind.  Mushrooms are substituted for mutton (lamb) for a meatless protein option. The rendang is typically served with fragrant coconut rice (nasi lemak) and other traditional accompaniments.
ingredients: 1/2 packet (about 300g) vegetarian mutton - break up as individual rolls, gently rinse and squeeze out water, 5-6 kaffir/limau purut leaves, 1/2 lime-extract juice, 4 tbsp oil, Salt and sugar for taste, For the rendang paste, 10 dried red chilies, 5 shallots, 1 inch galangal/lengkuas, 5 garlic, Blend/process to a thick paste
instruction: When oil is heated, fry paste till aromatic and oil splits. Add mutton and all the other ingredients. Gently stir as not to break the mutton rolls. Once the gravy thickens (depending on how thick you prefer), remove from heat.

name: Vietnamese-style Fried Vegetarian Spring Rolls
description: Vietnamese fried vegetarian spring rolls are crispy rolls filled with savory ingredients like tofu, mushrooms, and noodles. Wrapped in rice paper and fried until golden, they are served with a dipping sauce for a delicious appetizer or light meal.
ingredients: 2 pcs. Vietnamese spring roll wrappers, 1/2 cup sweet potato, cut into tiny cubes, 1/2 cup green beans, sliced into 1-inch diagonal pieces, 1/2 cup shredded cabbage, 1 cup water, 1 tbsp vegetarian stock powder, 1/2 cup Olive oil
instruction: In a large wok, add in water, sweet potato, green beans and cabbage. Add vegetarian stock powder. Stir and bring to a quick boil. Reduce heat and simmer until vegetables are cooked. Remove from heat, drain and set aside to cool. Soak each spring roll wrapper in water for 15 seconds. Place soaked wrapper on a large plate or clean surface. Add 1-2 tbsps of the vegetable mixture in the center of the wrapper. Fold and roll. Heat Olive oil in a large wok over medium-heat. Fry the spring rolls until they turn golden brown and crispy. Remove from heat and place on a plate lined with paper towel to drain excess oil. Serve warm with a side of sweet and sour sauce or a mixture of vinegar and chili pepper.

name: Maltese Stuffed Marrows
description: Maltese Stuffed Marrows are a hearty dish made with hollowed-out marrows ( zucchinis) filled with a savory meat, vegetable, and herb mixture. They are then baked in a tomato sauce until tender and bubbly.
ingredients: 800 grms large marrows - not "zucchini" type but if only those are available use the largest possible., 1 large onion finely chopped, 1 clove of garlic minced, 2 fresh bay leaves, 3 large tomatoes, chopped, 2 tbls tomato paste, 600 grams minced beef (Traditionally, 300gms meat and 300gms corned beef - the type you get in a can- was used - frugal gourmet style!), 150 grams of bacon (vegetarians can use 700gms of ricotta mixed with some parsley and a bit of milk), 2 eggs beaten, 4 tbls of grated parmesan cheese, Olive oil, Semolina Sea salt & freshly ground pepper
instruction: Preheat the oven to 180C/350F Cut the marrows lengthwise in half and scoop out the insides with a teaspoon. Reserve about half the pulp. Fry the onion, garlic and bay in some olive oil until soft. Add the chopped tomatoes and tomato paste and cook for a further few minutes.Place the bacon in a food processor and blend until finely minced. Add the beef and bacon to the onion mix and cook until done. (vegetarians, add the ricotta mix) Stir in the marrow pulp and then allow to cool. Once cool add the eggs and cheese and season the mixture to taste. Fill the marrow halves with the meat mixture and then lightly sprinkle with semolina. Place in a lightly oiled baking dish and then drizzle a little more olive oil over the filled marrows Bake for about 45 minutes until the meat mixture is golden and crisp. Another alternative is to slice about 6 potatoes and an onion and place them on a dish, then add the stuffed marrows and cook the whole thing together. A great meal in one dish

name: Green Bean, Carrot and Mushroom Medley
description: This is a simple side dish recipe featuring fresh green beans, carrots, and mushrooms sauteed together. It's a quick and healthy option that's perfect for a weeknight meal.
ingredients: 1/2 pound fresh green beans, trimmed & cut into, 1.5-inch lengths, 2 carrots, cut into thick strips & same length as beans, 1/4 cup butter, 1 medium onion, sliced (about 6 ounces), 2 garlic cloves, minced, 1/2 pound mushrooms, sliced, 1/2 teaspoon salt, or more to taste , 1/4 teaspoon white pepper or lemon pepper, Additional herbs and seasonings as desired: rosemary, dill weed, basil, parsley, red pepper flakes, Better Than Bouillon Chicken or Vegetarian Base, lemon juice or white wine. (I used about 1 teaspoon total of mixed dried herbs, together with 1/2 teaspoon chicken bouillon base, a splash of wine,and a few shakes of Kirkland’s No Salt Seasoning.)
instruction: Place green beans in 1 inch of boiling water. Cover and cook 3 minutes. (Or instead use a steamer basket.) Add carrots, cover and continue to cook until beans and carrots are just barely tender but still firm; drain.Meanwhile melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Saute onions, garlic and mushrooms until almost tender, Reduce heat, cover and simmer 3 minutes. Stir in drained green beans and carrots and all desired seasonings. Cover and cook 3 minutes over medium heat.

name: Vegetarian TVP Spaghetti Sauce
description: Here's a vegetarian spaghetti sauce recipe using TVP (textured vegetable protein) for a meaty texture: Saute onions and garlic, then simmer rehydrated TVP with tomatoes, herbs, and spices for a flavorful sauce. Serve over your favorite pasta.
ingredients: 150 gr miso paste (dark brown color), 4 cups (946 ml) water, 1 pkg (283 g) TVP Textured vegetable protein, 3 tbsp. (42 ml) olive oil, 1/4 cup (56 g) chili flakes, 2 large onions, diced, 3 large carrots, diced, 4 celery stalks, diced, 1/2 tbsp. (7g) paprika, 3 garlic cloves, finely chopped, 2 large cans (796 ml) diced tomatoes (plain or spiced), 2 cans (156 ml) tomato paste, 2 cans (680 ml) tomato sauce (plain or spiced), 2 bay leaves, 1 tsp (5 ml) dried basil, 1 tsp (5 ml) dried oregano, 1/8 tsp (.5 ml) cinnamon powder, 1/8 tsp (.5 ml) ground thyme, 1/8 tsp (.5 ml) ground cloves, 1/2 tsp (2 ml) each salt and pepper
instruction: Preheat oven at 350 degrees F. In a saucepan, mix the miso and water and bring to a boil. Add the TVP and mix well. Remove from the heat and let TVP absorb all the mixture, uncovered, while you prepare the rest of the recipe. Prepare and dice the onions, garlic, carrots, celery by hand or using the food processor. In a large dutch oven (Creuset type), cook the onions and garlic for 5 minutes. Add the carrots, celery and cook until the vegetables are a little soft, while mixing for 5 to 7 minutes on medium heat. Add the miso and TVP mixture. Add the diced tomatoes, the tomato sauce and the tomato paste. Mix well. Add the spices and mix well. Bring to a boil on top of the stove and then remove from heat. Place the dutch oven in the oven at 350 degrees F. for another 1 hour 30 minutes or so, uncovered. Mix once or twice during this cooking period. You can also cook this recipe on top of the stove for approx. 1 hour or so, while mixing during the cooking period. Adjust spices at the end of the cooking to your taste. Serve on cooked spaghetti or pasta of your choice with flaked chili and parmesan cheese with garlic bread and a green salad. Enjoy!

name: Potato Skins
description: Crispy potato skins are filled with melty cheese, bacon, and your favorite toppings. They're a fun appetizer or game-day snack.
ingredients: 8 large potatoes, 1 quart of vegetable oil, for frying, 6 pieces of thick cut bacon, cooked and chopped, 1 cup of shredded cheddar, 1 cup of cheddar jack cheese, 1 bunch of green onions, chopped, Dipping Sauce:, 1 cup sour cream, Â¼ cup mayonnaise, Â½ pack of dry,, Ranch Dressing mix, 2 teaspoons of Frankâs Red Hot Sauce, 1 teaspoon of tobasco sauce, Salt and Pepper to taste
instruction: Place all of the potatoes in a sink, and wash thoroughly. Dry the potatoes, rub with a small amount of vegetable oil, then coat salt and pepper. Pierce each potato, then place on a baking sheet at 375 degrees and cook for an hour, or until a knife can penetrate the entire potato easily. Remove the potatoes, and let cool for 20 minutes. Cut each potato in half, then scoop out Â¾ of the potato from the inside.Place the vegetable oil in a soup pan, making sure the oil is no more than half way up the pot. Place over high heat,until the oil reaches 350 degrees. Carefully drop three potato skins in at a time, and let them cook for two minutes, or until they become golden brown.Remove the potato skins from the oil, and let drain on paper towels for 2 minutes. Place all of the cooked potato skins (skin side down) on a baking sheet covered with aluminum foil. Combine the cheddar and pepper jack cheeses, and place over the potato skins. Place the bacon over the cheese, and season with salt and pepper. Place in a pre-heated 350 degree oven, and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is bubbling. Garnish with chopped green onions.

name: Vegetarian Jajang Myeon (Noodles w Black Bean Sauce)
description: Vegetarian Jajang Myeon is a twist on a Korean classic, featuring thick wheat noodles coated in a savory black bean sauce packed with veggies.
ingredients: 1 300 gram package of chunjang paste (jajang myeon sauce), 1 package of kalguksu noodles (or jajangmyeon noodles if available), 2 potatoes or sweet potatoes, diced, 2 carrots, diced, 1 zucchini, diced, 1 onion, diced, 1 cup corn, 2 tbsp cornstarch + ½ cup cold water, ½ cup cold water, 2 tbsp oyster sauce, 4 garlic cloves, finely minced, cucumber, julienned (optional for garnish/topping)
instruction: In a large wok or frying pan, bring 4 cups of water to a rapid boil. Add minced garlic and chunjang paste, mix thoroughly until paste is fully dissolved. Next add all the vegetables to the mix, cooking on medium heat for about 15 minutes. Meanwhile, bring another pot to a boil. Cook the noodles according to package directions. Lastly, add oyster sauce and the cornstarch/water mixture to the jajang sauce. Be sure to stir in the cornstarch mixture to prevent clumping. The sauce will thicken within minutes. Place noodles in a serving bowl, ladle sauce on top, and enjoy some awesome jajangmyeon!

name: Vegetarian Chili
description: This hearty chili is packed with flavorful veggies like bell peppers, onions, and sometimes carrots.  It gets its protein boost from a variety of beans like kidney, pinto, or black beans. Spices like chili powder, cumin, and oregano add depth of flavor.  The chili simmers with crushed tomatoes and broth until thickened, creating a satisfying and comforting meal.
ingredients: 2 tbsps olive oil, 1 large onion, chopped, 4 - 5 cloves garlic, chopped, 2 medium carrots, peeled, diced, 2 tbsp chili powder, 2 tbsp cumin powder, 2 tbsp pure cocoa powder, 1 tsp cinnamon powder, 2 tbsp dried oregano, 1-28 oz can diced tomatoes, 2 small cans tomato paste, 1-19 oz can tomato sauce, 3 cups water (or more), 1 cup barley, 1 red pepper, diced, 3 - 19 oz cans kidney beans, drained and rinsed, 1 small can corn, drained and rinsed or equivalent frozen corn, 1 - 19 oz can lima beans, drained and rinsed, 1 - 19 oz can black beans, drained and rinsed, 1 unit chipotle pepper in adobo sauce, minced, 1 1/2 tsp salt, Pepper to taste, Optional: Fresh cilantro sprigs
instruction: Cook the onion, garlic and carrots in the olive oil over medium heat in a heavy casserole or creuset stirring frequently for about 5 minutes until the onion is transparent and carrots are soft. Add the diced tomatoes, tomato paste, tomato sauce, water, barley, corn, red pepper and beans. Also add the spices: chili powder, chipotle, cumin, oregano, cocoa powder, cinnamon, salt and pepper. Continue cooking on low heat, stirring frequently for approximately 1 1/2 hour to 2 hours or until the barley is cooked and the chili has thickened. You may need to add more water as the barley will soak up the water during cooking time. Adjust spices to your taste at the end of cooking time. Ladle into serving bowls and top with cilantro sprigs. Serve with tortilla chips or fresh baked bread or with cooked white rice.

name: Vegetarian Fried Mee Hoon (Chinese Style)
description: Vegetarian Fried Mee Hoon is a flavorful stir-fry packed with vegetables and rice vermicelli noodles. It's a quick and easy vegetarian take on a popular Southeast Asian dish.
ingredients: 150g (2 slabs) mee hoon - soaked in water to soften, 4 shiitake (Chinese black) mushroom - soaked in hot water to soften and sliced into long pieces., 1/2 (about 250g) cabbage - shredded/sliced, 7 garlic - chopped, 2 tbsp fermented black bean paste (tauchu), 1 tbsp blended/grounded dried red chilies, 2 stalks spring onions - cut into 1 inch length, 4-5 tbsp oil, Salt for taste
instruction: Heat oil in a large wok and when heated, add garlic and blended / grounded chilies. Fry until oil splits. Add fermented bean paste / taucu and and mushroom.Stir, add mee hoon and season with salt (use sparingly as bean paste is already salty) Continue to stir to combine all together. Off the heat and stir in cabbage and spring onions.

name: Authentic Mohanthal For Diwali
description: Mohanthal is a traditional Gujarati sweet made with chickpea flour (besan), ghee, sugar, and nuts. It has a rich, melt-in-your-mouth texture and is a popular Diwali treat.
ingredients: 3 C Chickpea flour, coarsely grounded (Besan) available at any Indian grocery store, 1-1/4C Ghee + 2 Tbsp Ghee, 2-3 Tbsp Warm Milk, 1 C Khoya | Mava (optional), 3 C Sugar + 1/2 C water for sugar solution, 2 thread consistency syrup, For Garnishing, Few strands of Kesar, Handful of Almond slices, 5-7 Cardamon, crushed into powder
instruction: In a food processor mix together, besan (chicpea flour), 2 Tbsp Ghee and 2-3 Tbsp warm milk.Put it on a pulse mode and pulse it together for atleast 4- 5times until you get nice coarse powder something similar in the picture. Set aside. Simultaneously on the other side make the sugar solution and keep it ready, for that you will have to mix together sugar and just enough water to cover sugar and boil until you get 2 thread consistency for sugar syrup. Take if off from the heat. Allow it to cool. In a wok, add this mixture with rest of the ghee and roast in on a medium flame just like in picture 2 of 1 for until you get nice aroma and light brown color.If you are using Khoya | Mava, you will have to add it at this point of time and roast for another 5-7 mins. Take off the heat once it has golden to slight brown color. Allow it to cool. Cooling of both sugar syrup and besan mixture is very important. Do not miss this step of the recipe. If the either one is hot it will bring out all the ghee and form an extra ghee layer on top from the besan mixutre which would be then difficult to mix in. After cooling mix thoroughly besan mixture with sugar syrup, add crushed cardamon powder, kesar (saffron strands). Keep stirring until a homogeneous mass is formed. Pour it into a greased dish (with ghee), allow it to set and sprinkle sliced Almonds over it. Cut into a diamond or square shape. and store it in air tight container for later use... Enjoyyy!!!

name: Indian Style Curried Tofu & Mixed Vegetables
description: This dish is a flavorful vegetarian curry with tender tofu and colorful mixed vegetables in a fragrant spiced sauce. It's a hearty and satisfying meal that's perfect for serving over rice.
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds, 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds, 1/2 teaspoon sesame seeds, 1/4 teaspoon compounded asafetida powder, 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder, 4-5 dried red chili peppers, 1 bay leaf, 1 1/2 teaspoon chana or garam masala powder (tip: find a masala brand and type that you like b/c the taste varies greatly), 1 to 2 teaspoon(s) of salt to taste, black pepper to taste, hot chili powder to taste, 2 tbsp of canola oil, 1 medium onion finely chopped. 1 tbps of ginger/garlic paste, 3 cups of organic frozen mixed vegetables (carrots, green beans, corn, peas), 1/2 cup of tomato paste, 10 ounces of firm tofu cut into 1/2 inch pieces
instruction: Heat the canola oil in a stir fry pan and roast the mustard, cumin, sesame seeds, turmeric & asafetida for about a minute. Take care not to burn the seeds and cover the oil roast with a splatter screen to contain the popping seeds. Add the finely chopped onions, bay leaf, and dried chili peppers. Saute for about 3 minutes until the onions begin to become translucent. Add the ginger/garlic paste and continue to saute for 1 minute. Add the mixed vegetables and continue to saute for 5 more minutes. Stir frequently to avoid burning. Add the tomato paste, salt and the masala at this point. Add the tofu pieces and continue to stir fry for up to 5 more minutes until desired vegetable tenderness. Add more salt, black pepper, or chili powder to taste.

name: Basmati Rice with Herbs
description: Fragrant basmati rice is cooked with aromatic herbs for a fluffy and flavorful side dish.  This recipe is simple and can be customized with your favorite herbs.
ingredients: 1 tsp olive oil, 1 cup basmati rice (uncooked), 1 garlic clove, minced, 1 cup water, 1 cup low-fat chicken broth, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/4 cup chopped green onions, 1/4 cup toasted pine nuts, 3 Tbsps Parmesan cheese, grated, 1 Tbsp fresh basil, chopped, 1 tsp fresh thyme, chopped, 1/2 tsp fresh ground black pepper, 2 Tbsps chopped fresh Cilantro (optional)
instruction: Heat oil in medium skillet on high heat. Add rice and garlic to the pan and saute for 2 minutes to toast rice. Add water, broth, and salt to the pan and bring to boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer for 15 minutes, or until rice is tender. Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes. Stir in green onions, pine nuts, Parmesan, basil, thyme, pepper and Cilantro. Fluff and serve!

name: Onion Bahjis
description: Onion bhajis are crispy fritters made with chickpea flour (gram flour) and onions. They are a popular Indian snack or side dish.
ingredients: 1 cup Chick-Pea Flour or Gram Flour, 1/2 tsp Chili Powder, 1/2 tsp Turmeric, 1 tsp Baking Powder, Salt, 1 tsp Ground Cumin, 4 Large Onions, halved and thinly sliced, 25g / 1oz finely chopped Fresh Coriander, Cold water to mix, Vegetable oil for deep frying
instruction: Sift the flour, chili, turmeric, cumin, baking powder and salt into a large mixing bowl. Add the water and mix well. Now add the chopped coriander and onions and mix well until all onion rings are coated with batter. Preheat the deep fryer to 180ÂºC /350ÂºF. Very carefully drop spoonfuls of the mixture into the hot oil and fry until the bhajis are golden brown and crispy. Drain on kitchen paper and serve while still piping hot. Serve with Onion bhajis with plain yogurt mixed with chopped mint and a few drops of chili oil!

name: Moong Dal Vada
description: Moong Dal Vada is a crispy fritter made with split mung lentils.
ingredients: Moong dal split-150g, Large onion-1/2cup, Coriander Leaves-1/2cup, Garlic-2cloves, Green chili-4, Salt-to taste, Oil-for frying
instruction: Soak and wash the moong dal for 1hr,then blend to a corse. After add finely chopped onion,garlic,green chili,coriander leaves,salt and mix well. Take a moong dal mixture,press the both hands in vada shape. Heat oil and deep fry till it is golden brown. After 2 mins slowly turn the vada in both sides. Hope and enjoy ur recipe :)

name: Mughlai Malai Kofta Curry
description: Mughlai Malai Kofta Curry features dumplings (kofta) made from paneer and potato in a rich, creamy cashew-based gravy. The kofta are fried until golden brown and then simmered in the flavorful sauce. It's a decadent vegetarian dish perfect for special occasions.
ingredients: 4 - 5 Medium Potatoes, boiled-peeled-grated, 2 Thai Green chillies, finely chopped, 1/2 C, Paneer (cottage cheese), grated, 1/2 C Carrot & Peas, partially boiled & squeezed to remove excess water, 1/4 C, Fresh Cilantro, finely chopped, 1/4 C Cornflour/ corn starch, 1/4 C Golden Raisins + Chopped Cashew, Salt to taste, Oil for Deep Fry / Spray to bake,
instruction: Boil the potatoes, cool, peel and grate them. Grate paneer. Wash all green chillies, deseed and chop them fine. Peel carrots,grate them, add peas and some water, boil them in microwave for 10 mins. Once done, remove excess by passing & squeezing it through a muslin cloth. Peel onions, cut them into halves and boil with a cup of water for ten minutes. Drain excess water, cool onions and grind them into a smooth paste. Set Aside. In a bowl, mix mashed potatoes, paneer, some chopped green chillies, boiled carrot-peas, corn flour and salt. Mix well. Divide into 20-22 equal sized balls. Stuff raisins & cashew into them. Deep fry in hot oil until slightly golden brown. Drain and keep aside. Fry one kofta and check for binding, if it breaks, add a little more cornflour. Deep fry in hot oil. OR BAKE in a 375F pre-heat oven, by arranging & spraying oil on these koftas placing them on a cookie sheet wraped with aluminum foil,for 10 mins. Keep a close watch, with the help of tongs, turn them once they are slight brown on one side. On the other side heat oil in a kadai, add shahjeera, boiled onion paste and cook for five minutes. Add ginger & garlic, few chopped green chillies, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, and salt. cook for a minute. Add tomato puree and red chilli powder and cook on medium flame untill oil separates from gravy. Add half&half along with some water & bring it to a boil and simmer for ten minutes on a slow flame. Stir occasionally. Stir in fresh cream and garam masala powder. Gently put all of these kofta's in the gravy when ready to serve. Simmer for another 2 mins and enjoy this rich, creamy gravy with Nan/Roti (Indian Flat Bread.)

name: Tepla
description: Thepla is a flatbread from Gujarat, India, made with whole wheat flour and often stuffed with fenugreek leaves (methi). It can also include other flours like chickpea (besan) and millet. The dough is kneaded with yogurt or water, spices, and rolled out thin. Theplas are then cooked on a griddle with oil until browned on both sides. They are similar to roti but are thicker and have a longer shelf life, making them ideal for travel.
ingredients: 1 - 1 1/2 cup wheat flour (atta), 2 crushed green chilies, 1 1/2 tsp red chilli powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, 1 tsp cumin powder, 1 tbsp ginger & garlic paste, 1 tsp Ajwain, A pinch of asafoetida (hing), 1/2 bunch of fenugreek leaves, Salt, Oil and water to knead
instruction: Mix all the ingredients in a bowl with some water and oil to knead into dough. Keep it aside for 15 minutes or more. Then roll out and roast each side with oil. Serve warm with chutney.

name: Atta Chakuli
description: Atta Chakuli is a savory Odia pancake made with whole wheat flour. It's crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, and typically served with chutney or curry. Imagine a well-spiced wheat crepe with a satisfying crunch.
ingredients: Atta ( Wheat flour ) - 300 gm, Suji ( Rava ) - 75 gm, Chini ( Sugar ) - 200 gm, Pan Mahuri ( Aniseeds) - 2tsp, Dahi chhena stuffing - 4tbsp(Optional)(in place of this u can use only grated coconut), Ripe Banana-2(smashed), Ghee/Refind Oil - As per requirement, Salt - As per requirement
instruction: Add Wheat flour, rava, sugar, aniseeds, dahi chhena stuffing or grated coconut, banana,salt as per taste and required water to make a semi liquid batter. Whip well and keep it for 30 mins. Heat tawa (non stick will be better) on a medium flame. Spread a little ghee/oil (1tps) on the tawa. Take the batter in a tablespoon and spread it on the tawa like a dosa. Turn the pitha upside down after 1 min. When turns golden brown from each side, remove it from tawa. Serve hot.

name: Masale Bhat
description: Masale Bhat is a flavorful Indian rice dish originating from Maharashtra. It features rice cooked with a fragrant mix of spices, vegetables, and herbs. The vegetables can vary, but commonly include onions, peas, potatoes, and chilies. The key to Masale Bhat is the aromatic base, which is typically made by tempering mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves in oil, followed by the addition of ginger, garlic, and various spices like turmeric, chili powder, and goda masala. The rice is then added and cooked with the vegetables and spiced mixture until fluffy and flavorful.
ingredients: 2 cups Basmati rice, 5 to 6 Curry Leaves, 1 tsp. Mustard Seeds, 2 tsp. Cumin seeds, Pinch of hing, 3 tsp. Coriander seeds, 1 inch Cinnamon stick, 5 Cloves, 2 Bay leaves, 1 Onion sliced, 1 Potato cubed, 2 tsp. Ginger paste, 4 tsp. Peanuts, 2 tsp. Red Chili powder, 1/2 tsp. Turmeric powder, 2 tsp. Goda Masala
instruction: Wash Rice with water and soak it for 15 minutes. heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds, coriander seeds, bay leaves, cinnamon stick ,cloves, mustard seeds and curry leaves with a pinch of hing. Sauté for a while. Then add onion and sauté till it becomes translucent. Add ginger garlic paste. Mix it well. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder and peanuts. Saute till everything get a nice mix. Add rice ,potato, salt and goda masala. Pour sufficient warm water and let it boil for 10 minutes. After all the water is soaked into rice, reduce the gas to low heat and let it cook for again 5-7 minutes. Garnish with coriander leaves or mint leaves.Serve 'Maharastrian Masale Bhat' with Curd or Raita.

name: Aamras Puri
description: Aamras Puri is a sweet and savory Indian summer dish. It features fluffy puris, a fried flatbread, served with a chilled and creamy mango puree called Aamras. The sweetness of the Aamras perfectly complements the savory puris.
ingredients: Mango Pulp, 6 ripe Alphonso Mangos, sugar, if needed, Puri, 2 cups Wheat flour, 1tbsp rava/semolina/suji, 6 tbsp Water, 1 tbsp Oil, 1 tsp Salt, 2 cups Oil for frying puris
instruction: Aamras Preparation: First,you peel them, and chop the inside mango into pieces.Grind them into food processor.Taste them if you need sugar.If mangoes are sweet, no need to add sugar. Your Aamras is ready.Keep in refrigerator and serve cool. You can was them and squeeze by hand till it become soft from all sides.In bowl, take out all pulp from mango and remove the seed.Then, put all pulp into food processor or grinder or smooth texture Aamras. Puri's preparation In a bowl, add flour, rava, salt and add water slowly to make a firm dough. For puris, we make little firm dough and not soft. Add oil and knead it one more time and keep it rest for 10-15 minutes. Make small balls from this dough and roll each ball into round shape. Place these puris on paper towel. eat oil for frying in kadhai or pan. Once oil is hot, place puris and fry them till they get golden brown color on both sides. Do not fry for more time, it will become tough puri and do not fry for less time, then it will have raw taste.Once you put puri inside, it will puff and check other side for brown color, if has turned to brown , change side of puri and fry for few seconds and then take out. Take out these puris on paper towel, so excess oil will get absorbed.

name: Kesar Pista Kulfi
description: Kesar Pista Kulfi is a dense Indian ice cream packed with pistachios and saffron.
ingredients: Milk - 1 Liter, Cream/Malai - 4 Tbsp, Sugar - ½ Cup, Saffron - Few Strands, Cardamom - 4-5 Pods, Pistachio - 1½ Tbsp, Almonds - 1½ Tbsp
instruction: Start by heating a pan with the milk. Once it gets a roaring boil, add a huge tablespoon of it to the saffron and keep aside.Now add the cream to the milk, stir well and cook in medium-high flame until it reduces to half, most probably about 20 minutes. Once its reduced to half, add the chopped nuts and sugar. Stir well and cook for 5 more minutes. Switch off the flame, add the cardamom and let it cool to room temperature. Add to the kulfi moulds and freeze for 5-6 hours. You can insert bamboo sticks after 2-3 hours as well. Take the kulfi moulds out, use a butter knife and loosen the edges. Serve and enjoy

name: Sukha Aloo - Potatoes with Indian spices
description: Sukha Aloo, also known as dry potato curry or potato fry, is a simple Indian side dish made with potatoes and aromatic spices. It's a quick and flavorful dish that involves pan-frying boiled potatoes with cumin seeds, coriander powder, turmeric, and chili powder for a delicious and slightly spicy taste. Some variations include adding chopped onions, tomatoes, or a touch of mango powder for a tangy twist.
ingredients: 5-6 Russet or other potatoes washed, striped (peeled leaving some of the skin on), and chopped in 2/3 inch cubes, 1/3 cup vegetable oil, 1 tsp Cumin Seeds (I used 1 tsp mustard seeds and 3/4 tsp ground cumin), Pinch of asafoetida (don't have so I left out), 3/4 tsp ground tumeric, 1/2 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp ground coriander, 1 tsp mango powder (amchur) - I didn't use this, 1 tsp kosher salt
instruction: Boil potatoes for 6-8 minutes until just softened Heat oil in a skillet or large sauce pan over medium. Add the cumin or mustard seeds (and asafoetida if you have it) and let them sizzle for 30 seconds. Add all the spices and the potatoes. Stir fry gently for 1-2 minutes. Cover and cook for 5-6 minutes. Uncover and stir for another 60 seconds before removing to serve. (You can just stir fry without covering but they may be a little dry)

name: Malai Kesar Peda
description: Malai Kesar Peda is a delicious and traditional Indian sweet that's often prepared during festivals and special occasions. It's made by reducing milk to form khoya (milk solids), and then flavored with saffron (kesar) and cardamom. The mixture is shaped into small, round pedas, and garnished with chopped nuts like pistachios or almonds. Malai Kesar Peda has a rich, creamy texture and a delightful combination of flavors, making it a popular and indulgent treat.
ingredients: Whole milk 1 litre, Saffron (kesar) a few strands, 2 tablespoon normal milk, 2 tablespoon warm milk, ½ cup Sugar, 2 pinch Citric acid, 1 tablespoon corn flour
instruction: Soak the saffron in two teaspoons of warm milk and keep aside. Mix the corn flour with normal milk and keep aside. Mix the citric acid in one tablespoon of water and keep aside.

name: Litti
description: Litti Chokha is traditional dish of Bihar.One can say it is a must made dish of Bihar for any special ocassion,party or festival
ingredients: For Dough:2 cup wheat flour, 1/2 teaspoon onion seeds, 1/2 teaspoon carom seeds, 4 tablespoon yogurt, 1/2 cup water (luke warm), salt to taste. For Filling:1 cup sattu ( gram flour made by fried gram), 5-6 cloves garlic( chopped ), 1 tablespoon ginger( chopped ), 3-4 green chilies ( chopped ) or to taste, 1/4 cup coriander leaves ( chopped ), 1 teaspoon carom seeds, 1 teaspoon onion seeds, 2-3 teaspoon lemon juice, 2 tablespoon pickle masala, 2 tablespoon pickle oil or mustard oil or any veg oil, salt to taste. For Baking:cooking oil spray. For Serving:Chokha.
instruction: For Dough: In a large bowl,add flour and yogurt,mix lightly with finger tips and with water knead it into stiff dough. Make balls out of dough and keep aside. For Filling: Mix all ingredients of filling,in a large bowl.Keep aside. Flatten the dough ball,in your palm and spoon the filling in the center of each balls and close it from all sides,like kachori,take care that no cracks are there. Apply oil on litti with brush,and place on baking tray;which is lined with a foil paper. In a preheated oven,bake litti from both side @ 180 degrees C for 30-40 min or till done. NOTE: Vegan can avoid yogurt in dough,but then add 2 teaspoon of oil or 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder for softness. Avoid heat or adjust according to kids choice,otherwise this one is,very spicy dish.

name: Easy Rock Cheese Toast - Crispy Veg Rava Appetizer |Quick Suji Bread Toast
description: Rock cheese toast is easy and quick and also a very healthy and nutritious food for kids. It can be served anytime of the day and appeals to all age groups. They make a very good party starter and is also a kids favorite. Suji Toast is an instant appetizer & eaten any time of the day. Semolina toast is an open sandwich recipe. it is prepared by using semolina, vegetables, fresh cream & bread.
ingredients: 1 Cup Chopped Vegetables(Carrot,Capsicum,Cabbage,Tomato,Onion), 4 Slice Brown Bread, 2-3 Tbsp Cream, 2 Tbsp Semolina(Rava/Suji), 1 Tbsp coriander, 1 Tbsp Chill Flakes, 1 tsp Oregano, Salt to Taste. Grated Cheese for Garnishing.
instruction: Take chopped vegetables in a bowl. Add cream, semolina(rava),coriander,chill flakes, oregano & salt & mix all ingredients well. Apply this mixture on bread. Bake it at 180*C for 15-20 minutes or till it becomes crispy from the bottom side. After removing from oven spread grated cheese on top. Serve hot.

name: Nankhatai
description: Nankhatai is a popular and delicious eggless Indian cookie with a melt-in-your-mouth texture. These sweet treats are made with a combination of all-purpose flour, ghee (clarified butter), powdered sugar, and a hint of cardamom for flavor. The dough is shaped into small rounds and garnished with chopped nuts before being baked to golden perfection. Nankhatai is known for its crumbly and soft texture, making it a favorite during festive seasons and a delightful accompaniment to tea or coffee.
ingredients: Powdered Sugar: 1 cup. Dalda/shortening">Crisco/Veg Shortening: 1 cup. Flour: 2 cups. Baking Powder: 1 tsp
instruction: Mix flour, powdered sugar and baking powder. Add dalda (shortening) into this. Rub the shortening into the mixed flour with your fingertips till it resembles sand like texture. You can also pulse everthing together in a food processor (which is what I do, always). Take a handful of dough and press hard to make into a ball. Place them on a baking tray lined with parchment paper or silpat. Bake at 180 degree C for 18 minutes. The center will seem to be a bit undercooked; remove the tray from the oven and keep the cookies in it for 2 minutes. Store in airtight containers when they are completely cool. NOTES: To make powdered sugar: Powder sugar and measure into a 200 ml cup. There is no vanilla essence in this recipe. The cookies should be a little undercooked in the center and it should not be allowed to brown on top as nankhatai should be white in color. Oven temperature varies with oven and make sure you preheat the oven.

name: Vegeterian Chili
description: Vegetarian chili is a flavorful and hearty dish made without meat, typically using a variety of beans, vegetables, and spices. Common ingredients include kidney beans, black beans, tomatoes, bell peppers, onions, and a blend of chili spices such as cumin, chili powder, and paprika. It's a nutritious and satisfying alternative to traditional meat-based chili, offering a rich and savory flavor profile with a hint of spice. Serve it with toppings like shredded cheese, sour cream, or fresh cilantro for added texture and taste.
ingredients: 2 tbsp canola oil, 3 onions, chopped, 2 tbsp minced garlic, 2 zucchini, diced, 1 package (227g) fresh mushrooms, sliced, 2 tablespoons chili powder, 1 tablespooon ground cumin, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper, 1 can tomatoes, 1 can black beans, drained, 1 bottle tomato sauce, 1 can tomato paste, 1 cup basmati rice
instruction: Heat the oil and fry onions and garlic for 3-5 minutes. Add the zucchini and mushrooms and cook for 5-8 minutes. Add the chilli poweder, cumin, salt, cayenne and cook for another minute. Add the tomatoes (break apart with a wooden spatula). Add the beans and tomato sauce and bring to a low boil. Reduce heat and let simmer for 20 minutes. Add tomato paste to thicken and simmer on low for 5-10 minutes.

name: Usal with sprouted green moong
description: Usal is a very popular Maharashtrian dish made most commonly with Matki or moth beans (a brown colored oval shaped bean). But you can prepare the dish with green moong just as well. The moong is cooked and then added to a mild masala gravy - the dish can be dry masala or a gravy masala, as per your choice. Mine was semi gravy! I've added a Keralite twist to the dish by adding curry leaves in the dish. It does add a lot of flavor.
ingredients: Sprouted green moong - 2 cups, Turmeric - 1/4 tsp, Red chilli powder - 1/4 tsp, Salt - to taste, Water - 3 cups (to pressure cook the sprouted moong). For tempering:Black mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp, Dry red chillies - 2, Curry Leaves - 5-6 leaves, Oil - 2 tblsp. For the gravy:Medium onion - 1 (finely diced), Ginger - 1/2 inch piece (peeled and finely minced), Turmeric - 1/4 tsp, Red chili powder - 1/4 tsp, Garam masala - 1/2 tsp (or use Kaala Masala), Chaat Masala - 1/2 tsp, Salt - to taste. For Garnish:Lemon juice - juice of half a lemon, Freshly grated coconut -2 tblsp  (I din't add this), Freshly chopped cilantro leaves - a handful, Red onion - cut into thin strips or diced into tiny cubes, Lemon wedges - as per choice
instruction: Cook the sprouts in a pressure cooker with 3 cups of water with the spices and salt. Let it whistle for about 3-4 times. (I made mine quite well cooked, almost soggy , so I did about 5-6 whistles). In a kadai, heat the oil and crack mustard seeds, dry red chillies and curry leaves. Then add the ginger and onions and saute for few minutes. Add the spices - turmeric powder, red chilli powder, garam masala, chaat masala and salt and let it cook foo few minutes. Now add the cooked sprouts and combine well. Finally add the lemon juice. Garnish with chopped Cilantro, grated coconut and diced/sliced onions before serving!

name: Ravioli
description: Ravioli is a type of pasta characterized by small square or round dough pockets filled with various savory or sweet fillings. Common savory fillings include ricotta cheese, spinach, meat, or a combination of these ingredients. The pasta is typically served with a variety of sauces, such as marinara or brown butter and sage, and may be boiled or pan-fried. Ravioli is known for its delicious combination of soft pasta and flavorful fillings, making it a popular and versatile dish in Italian cuisine.
ingredients: 2 (25 ounce) packages frozen cheese ravioli, 4 (14.5 ounce) cans diced tomatoes with juice, 4 (8 ounce) cans tomato sauce, 1 onion, chopped, 2 tablespoons Italian seasoning, 1 teaspoon salt, 1 cup water, 16 ounces shredded mozzarella cheese, 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 2 cloves garlic, minced
instruction: In a medium stock pot combine the diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, chopped onion, Italian seasoning, salt and water. Stir in the minced garlic in quantity desired. Allow mixture to simmer for 2 hours. If sauce seems dry add additional water. In large pot of boiling salted water cook the ravioli until done. Drain. In a 9x13 inch pan layer sauce and cooked ravioli. Top with grated Parmesan cheese and grated mozzarella cheese. In a preheated 400 degrees F(205 degrees C) oven bake for 30 minutes, or until light golden brown. Let cool 15 minutes before serving.

name: Lentils Veg Upuma
description: Lentils Veg Upma is a nutritious and flavorful South Indian dish made with roasted semolina (rava), lentils, and an assortment of vegetables. The dish is seasoned with mustard seeds, curry leaves, and aromatic spices, creating a delicious and wholesome breakfast or light meal. Lentils add protein, while colorful vegetables contribute vitamins and minerals, making it a healthy and satisfying dish enjoyed for its unique texture and taste.
ingredients: 1 cup lentils (red or yellow), soaked, 1 cup semolina (rava/sooji), 1 onion, finely chopped, 1 tomato, chopped, 1 carrot, finely chopped, 1/2 cup green peas, 1/2 inch ginger, grated, 2-3 green chilies, finely chopped, 1/2 tsp mustard seeds, 1/2 tsp cumin seeds, A few curry leaves, 2 tbsp oil or ghee, Salt to taste, Water
instruction: Prepare Lentils: Soak lentils for about 30 minutes. Drain excess water. Saute Ingredients: In a pan, heat oil or ghee. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and let them splutter. Add chopped onions, green chilies, and curry leaves. Saute until onions turn golden brown. Add Vegetables: Add chopped tomatoes, grated ginger, carrots, and green peas. Cook until vegetables are slightly tender. Cook Lentils and Semolina: Add soaked lentils to the vegetables. Cook for a few minutes. Add semolina (rava/sooji) and roast it until it turns aromatic. Add Water and Salt: Pour water gradually while stirring continuously to avoid lumps. Add salt to taste. Cook Until Done: Continue to cook on low flame until the upma is well-cooked and reaches a thick consistency. Serve: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot.

name: Rice pudding
description: Rice pudding is a creamy and comforting dessert made with rice, milk, sugar, and often flavored with vanilla or cinnamon. The rice is cooked until tender in the sweetened milk, resulting in a rich and satisfying treat. It can be served warm or chilled, and various toppings such as cinnamon, nutmeg, or raisins are commonly added for extra flavor. Rice pudding is a classic dish enjoyed in many cultures around the world.
ingredients: 1 cup white rice, 4 cups whole milk, 1/2 cup granulated sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon (optional), A pinch of salt.
instruction: Rinse the rice under cold water until the water runs clear. In a medium-sized saucepan, combine the rice, milk, sugar, vanilla extract, and salt. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring frequently to prevent the rice from sticking to the bottom. Reduce the heat to low, cover the saucepan, and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the rice is tender, stirring occasionally. If desired, add ground cinnamon for extra flavor. Once the rice is cooked and the mixture has thickened, remove it from the heat. Let the rice pudding cool slightly before serving. It can be served warm or chilled.

name: Mee Siam Kuah/Gravy (Vegetarian)
description: Mee Siam Kuah/Gravy (Vegetarian) is a flavorful and spicy noodle dish originating from Southeast Asia. It features stir-fried rice vermicelli noodles served with a tangy, sweet, and savory gravy made from a blend of aromatic spices, tamarind, and coconut milk. The dish is typically garnished with tofu, bean sprouts, chives, and lime, providing a delicious balance of textures and flavors. Mee Siam Kuah is a popular vegetarian version, making it suitable for those who prefer plant-based options.
ingredients: For the kuah/gravy: 10 dried red chillies , 5 shallots , 1 tbsp taucheo/fermented soy paste , 5 garlic , 1 lemongrass (add if you have, otherwise omit) , blend/pound/process to a paste , Others , Rice noodles or any other you like - as needed (blanch to soften) , Tofu pok/white soft tofu - cut into pieces , Boiled eggs (omit if you are a pure vegetarian) , Bean sprouts - pour hot water over and quickly blanch. , Sawi/Chinese mustard leafy veg - pour hot water over and quickly blanch. , Spring onion - as needed (slice thinly) , Calamansi lime - as needed , 3 tbsp oil , Salt - as needed (use sparingly because taucheo is salty).
instruction: In heated oil, fry gravy paste till aromatic and oil splits.  Pour enough water.  Season with salt.  Simmer to a boiling point.  Keep it simmering.  Assemble noodles with tofu, bean sprouts, egg(s) and spring  onion.  Pour gravy over and serve with calamansi lime.  Optional - top with sliced red chillies.

name: Corn pudding
description: Corn pudding is a delicious and comforting dish made with corn kernels, eggs, milk, sugar, and butter. The ingredients are mixed together to create a smooth and creamy batter, then baked until golden brown. The result is a sweet and savory side dish or dessert with a custard-like texture, perfect for holiday gatherings or as a comforting treat.
ingredients: 2 cups corn kernels (fresh or frozen) , 1 cup cornmeal , 1/2 cup all-purpose flour , 1/4 cup sugar , 1 teaspoon baking powder , 1/2 teaspoon salt , 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted , 2 cups milk , 3 large eggs, beaten , 1 teaspoon vanilla extract.
instruction: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a baking dish. In a large bowl, combine the cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. In another bowl, whisk together the melted butter, milk, beaten eggs, and vanilla extract. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Fold in the corn kernels.  Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish. Bake for 45-55 minutes or until the pudding is set and the top is golden brown. Allow it to cool slightly before serving.

name: Sweet pumpkin
description: Indulge in the warmth of fall flavors with our Sweet Pumpkin Recipe. Tender chunks of pumpkin are delicately simmered in a rich blend of spices, including cinnamon and nutmeg. Sweetened to perfection, this dish captures the essence of autumn in every bite. Whether served as a delightful dessert or a comforting side, our Sweet Pumpkin Recipe is a celebration of seasonal goodness that will leave your taste buds longing for more.
ingredients: 2 cups diced sweet pumpkin , 1/4 cup brown sugar , 2 tablespoons unsalted butter , 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon , 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg , 1/4 teaspoon salt , 1/4 cup maple syrup , 1/4 cup chopped pecans (optional, for garnish).
instruction: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). In a mixing bowl, toss the diced sweet pumpkin with brown sugar, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, and salt until well coated. Transfer the pumpkin mixture to a baking dish and dot with small pieces of unsalted butter. Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until the pumpkin is tender, stirring halfway through. Drizzle maple syrup over the baked pumpkin and toss to combine. If using, sprinkle chopped pecans over the top. Return the dish to the oven and bake for an additional 10 minutes until the edges caramelize. Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly before serving.

name: Tomato tart
description: A delightful Tomato Tart is a savory pastry dish featuring a crisp crust filled with a flavorful combination of ripe tomatoes, aromatic herbs, and rich cheeses. The tomatoes are usually sliced and arranged over a layer of creamy filling, creating a visually appealing and tasty treat. This dish is perfect for showcasing the vibrant flavors of fresh tomatoes and is often enhanced with ingredients like basil, garlic, and mozzarella. Enjoyed as a light and savory dish, the Tomato Tart makes a great addition to brunches, lunches, or as a delightful appetizer.
ingredients: 1 sheet of puff pastry, thawed , 4-5 ripe tomatoes, sliced , 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese , 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese , 2 tablespoons olive oil , 2 cloves garlic, minced , Fresh basil leaves for garnish , Salt and pepper to taste.
instruction: Preheat the Oven: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Prepare the Puff Pastry: Roll out the puff pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface to fit your tart pan or baking sheet. Assemble the Tart: Transfer the rolled-out puff pastry to your tart pan or baking sheet. Prick the pastry with a fork to prevent it from puffing too much.
