Sadhya showcases the rich culinary diversity of Kerala and is a symbol of communal celebration and cultural heritage.
ingredients: For Rice and Side Dishes: 2 cups rice (preferably parboiled) , 1 cup sambar (lentil-based vegetable curry) , 1 cup rasam (tamarind soup) , 1 cup avial (mixed vegetable curry with coconut) , 1 cup thoran (stir-fried vegetables with coconut) , 1 cup olan (pumpkin and coconut stew) , 1 cup kootu curry (vegetable and lentil curry) , 1 cup pachadi (yogurt-based side dish) , 1 cup inji curry (ginger curry) , For Accompaniments: Banana chips , Pappadam (crispy lentil-based snack) , Pickles.
instruction: Cook rice and keep it aside. Prepare sambar, rasam, avial, thoran, olan, kootu curry, pachadi, and inji curry as per individual recipes. Arrange the side dishes on a banana leaf or a large plate. Serve a portion of rice in the center, and place small portions of each side dish around the rice. Add banana chips and pappadam on the side. Serve pickles as an accompaniment.

name: Curd Rice
description: Curd Rice is a soothing South Indian dish made by combining cooked rice with creamy yogurt and seasoned with a tempering of mustard seeds, cumin, green chilies, and optional tempering ingredients like curry leaves and lentils. Garnished with fresh coriander, this cool and comforting dish is often enjoyed as a side or a Main Course, especially during warm weather. It offers a delightful balance of textures and flavors, making it a popular and easy-to-make dish that's loved for its simplicity and refreshing taste.
ingredients: 1 cup cooked rice , 1 cup plain yogurt (curd) , 1 tablespoon oil , 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds , 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds , 2-3 green chilies, finely chopped , 1/2 inch ginger, grated , 1/4 cup chopped coriander leaves , Salt to taste , For tempering: curry leaves, urad dal, and chana dal (optional).
instruction: Cook rice and let it cool to room temperature. In a mixing bowl, combine the cooked rice with plain yogurt. Mix well until the rice is evenly coated with yogurt. In a small pan, heat oil. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and let them splutter. Add chopped green chilies, grated ginger, and sauté for a minute until the raw smell disappears. Optional: Add curry leaves, urad dal, and chana dal for tempering. Sauté until the dals turn golden brown. Pour the tempering over the curd rice and mix thoroughly. Add salt to taste and garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Chill in the refrigerator for a while before serving.

name: Dhokla
description: Dhokla is a popular Indian steamed cake made from gram flour, yogurt, and aromatic spices. This spongy and savory treat is flavored with turmeric, ginger-chili paste, and lemon juice, creating a delightful balance of tanginess and warmth. The batter is leavened with fruit salt, resulting in a light and fluffy texture. After steaming, it is tempered with mustard seeds, sesame seeds, and green chilies for added flavor. Garnished with fresh coriander and optional grated coconut, Dhokla is commonly served as a wholesome snack or breakfast item, paired with chutneys for a burst of taste.
ingredients: 1 cup gram flour (besan) , 1/2 cup yogurt , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon ginger-green chili paste , 1 tablespoon lemon juice , Salt to taste , 1 teaspoon fruit salt (eno) , 2 tablespoons oil , 1 teaspoon mustard seeds , 1 teaspoon sesame seeds , 2-3 green chilies, slit , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish , Grated coconut for garnish (optional).
instruction: In a bowl, mix gram flour, yogurt, turmeric powder, ginger-green chili paste, lemon juice, and salt to make a smooth batter. Add water as needed to achieve a thick yet pourable consistency. Grease a steaming dish or thali with oil and set aside. In a large pot or steamer, bring water to a boil. Just before steaming, add fruit salt (eno) to the batter and mix well. The batter will become frothy. Immediately pour the batter into the greased dish and place it in the steamer. Steam the dhokla for about 15-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Once done, remove the dhokla from the steamer and let it cool slightly. Cut the dhokla into squares or diamonds. Heat oil in a small pan and add mustard seeds. When the seeds start to splutter, add sesame seeds and slit green chilies. Remove from heat and pour this tempering over the dhokla. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and grated coconut (if using). Serve dhokla warm with green chutney or sweet tamarind chutney.

name: Avial
description: Avial is a traditional South Indian dish that features a delightful medley of mixed vegetables in a coconut-yogurt sauce. The vegetables are cooked until tender, then mixed with a blend of grated coconut, green chili, cumin seeds, and yogurt. Seasoned with turmeric and tempered with mustard seeds, curry leaves, and asafoetida in coconut oil, Avial is a flavorful and aromatic dish. Served warm with steamed rice, it's a nutritious and colorful addition to any meal.
ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, pumpkin, drumsticks, etc.), cut into bite-sized pieces , 1 cup grated coconut , 1/2 cup yogurt , 1 green chili, chopped , 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds , A handful of curry leaves , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons coconut oil , 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds , A pinch of asafoetida (hing).
instruction: Cook the mixed vegetables until they are tender but still have a slight crunch. Drain and set aside. In a blender, grind together grated coconut, green chili, cumin seeds, and yogurt to form a smooth paste. Mix the ground paste with the cooked vegetables. Add turmeric powder and salt. Combine well. In a separate pan, heat coconut oil. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter. Add curry leaves and asafoetida. Pour the seasoned oil over the vegetable mixture and gently mix. Serve Avial warm with steamed rice.

name: Bisi bele bath
description: Bisi Bele Bath is a traditional South Indian rice dish bursting with flavors. It combines rice, lentils, and a medley of vegetables in a fragrant spice blend known as Bisi Bele Bath powder. This one-pot dish is cooked with tamarind pulp, giving it a delightful tangy taste. Garnished with fresh coriander, it offers a perfect balance of spicy, tangy, and savory notes. A comforting and wholesome meal, Bisi Bele Bath is a favorite for its rich taste and ease of preparation.
ingredients: 1 cup rice , 1/2 cup toor dal (split pigeon peas) , 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, peas) , 1 small onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 2 tablespoons Bisi Bele Bath powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , A pinch of asafoetida (hing) , Tamarind pulp (size of a small lemon) , 2 tablespoons ghee , Salt to taste , Chopped coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Wash the rice and toor dal together. Cook them with enough water until soft, or use a pressure cooker for quicker results. In a separate pan, cook the mixed vegetables until they are tender. In a large pot, heat ghee. Add asafoetida and chopped onions. Sauté until the onions turn golden brown. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and mushy. Add Bisi Bele Bath powder and turmeric powder. Mix well and cook for a couple of minutes. Add the cooked vegetables to the pot and mix everything together. Now, add the cooked rice and dal mixture. Mix thoroughly. Dilute tamarind pulp in water and add it to the pot. Stir well. Season with salt according to taste and let it simmer for a few minutes until the flavors blend. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves before serving.

name: Baingan bharta
description: Baingan Bharta is a classic Indian dish featuring roasted eggplant mixed with aromatic spices and tomatoes. The eggplant is charred for a smoky flavor, and its pulp is combined with a flavorful blend of onions, garlic, ginger, and spices. This vegetarian delight is cooked to perfection, resulting in a creamy, spiced dish that pairs wonderfully with rice or Indian bread. Garnished with fresh cilantro, Baingan Bharta is a delicious and satisfying choice for those seeking a taste of traditional Indian cuisine.
ingredients: 1 large eggplant (baingan) , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1 teaspoon ginger, grated , 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , Fresh cilantro for garnish , 2 tablespoons oil.
instruction: Roast the eggplant over an open flame or in the oven until the skin is charred and the flesh is soft. Allow it to cool, then peel off the skin and mash the pulp. In a pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds. Once they splutter, add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chilies. Sauté for a minute until the raw aroma disappears. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and oil starts to separate. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well. Add the mashed eggplant and mix thoroughly with the spices. Cook for 5-7 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Panta bhat
description: Panta Bhat is a traditional Bengali dish celebrated during the Bengali New Year. It involves soaking parboiled rice overnight, then mixing it with mustard oil, salt, turmeric, green chilies, and optionally cilantro. The mixture ferments for a few hours, creating a slightly sour flavor. Served with grated coconut and a squeeze of lemon, Panta Bhat is a refreshing and symbolic dish enjoyed during festive occasions, offering a unique culinary experience with its fermented rice soaked in water.
ingredients: 1 cup parboiled rice , 2 cups water (for soaking) , 1 tablespoon mustard oil , 1 teaspoon salt (or to taste) , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 2-3 green chilies, finely chopped , 1 tablespoon chopped cilantro (optional) , 1 tablespoon grated coconut (optional) , 1 lemon (optional).
instruction: Rinse the parboiled rice thoroughly under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in 2 cups of water for at least 12 hours or overnight. Drain excess water from the soaked rice. In a large bowl, mix the soaked rice with mustard oil, salt, turmeric powder, chopped green chilies, and cilantro (if using). Allow the mixture to ferment for 4-6 hours or until a slightly sour aroma develops. Before serving, you can add grated coconut for additional flavor. Optionally, squeeze lemon juice over the Panta Bhat for a tangy taste.

name: Aloo baingan
description: Aloo Baingan is a flavorful Indian dish that combines diced potatoes (aloo) and chunks of eggplant (baingan) with aromatic spices. This vegetarian recipe involves sautéing onions, green chilies, and ginger-garlic paste before adding the potatoes and eggplant. The vegetables are then cooked until tender with a blend of turmeric, coriander, and red chili powder. Garnished with fresh coriander leaves, Aloo Baingan is a satisfying and wholesome dish, perfect to be served with rice or flatbread. This quick and easy recipe offers a delightful medley of textures and flavors.
ingredients: 2 medium-sized potatoes, peeled and diced , 1 large eggplant, cut into chunks , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, diced , 2 green chilies, chopped , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons cooking oil , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Stir in ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Sauté for a minute until the raw smell disappears. Add diced potatoes and eggplant to the pan. Mix well to coat them with the spices. Sprinkle turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix thoroughly. Cook covered on medium-low heat until the potatoes and eggplant are tender, stirring occasionally. Add diced tomatoes and continue cooking until they are softened and the vegetables are fully cooked. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or flatbread.

name: Palak dal
description: Palak Dal, also known as Spinach Lentil Curry, is a wholesome Indian dish featuring yellow lentils cooked with vibrant spinach and aromatic spices. The lentils are boiled until tender, and then combined with a flavorful blend of onions, tomatoes, green chilies, and a mix of spices. The addition of fresh spinach adds a nutritious boost and a vibrant green color to the dish. Palak Dal is not only delicious but also rich in protein and essential nutrients. This comforting curry is often served with rice or Indian bread, making it a satisfying and nutritious meal.
ingredients: 1 cup split yellow lentils (dal), washed and drained , 3 cups fresh spinach (palak), chopped , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons oil or ghee , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Boil the lentils in a pot with water until they are soft and cooked. Set aside. In a separate pan, heat oil or ghee. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Sauté for a minute until the raw smell disappears. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and the oil separates. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. Add the chopped spinach and cook until it wilts and blends with the masala. Pour the boiled lentils into the spinach mixture. Mix thoroughly and let it simmer for a few minutes. Adjust the consistency by adding water if needed. Bring it to a gentle boil. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

name: Pani puri
description: Pani Puri, a popular Indian street food, features small, hollow puris filled with a delightful combination of mashed potatoes, boiled chickpeas, chopped onions, and tangy tamarind chutney. The puris are then immersed in a spiced mint-coriander water, creating an explosion of flavors with each bite. This beloved snack offers a perfect balance of sweet, tangy, and spicy notes, providing a refreshing and satisfying culinary experience. Enjoyed in a few quick bites, Pani Puri is a favorite among food enthusiasts for its unique taste and interactive assembly.
ingredients: For Puri: 1 cup semolina (sooji) , 1/4 cup all-purpose flour (maida) , A pinch of baking soda , Water (as needed) , Oil for frying , For Pani (Spiced Water): 1 cup fresh mint leaves , 1/2 cup fresh coriander leaves , 1 green chili , 1-inch piece of ginger , 1 tablespoon tamarind paste , 1 teaspoon roasted cumin powder , 1 teaspoon chaat masala , Salt to taste , 2 cups chilled water , For Filling: 1 cup boiled and mashed potatoes , 1 cup boiled chickpeas , 1/2 cup finely chopped onions , Tamarind chutney (store-bought or homemade) , Sev (crispy chickpea noodles).
instruction: Puri Preparation: Mix semolina, all-purpose flour, baking soda, and water to form a stiff dough. Rest the dough for 15-20 minutes, then roll small balls and flatten them into small discs. Heat oil and deep fry the discs until they puff up and turn golden brown. Pani (Spiced Water) Preparation: Blend mint leaves, coriander leaves, green chili, and ginger to form a smooth paste. In a bowl, mix the paste with tamarind paste, roasted cumin powder, chaat masala, salt, and chilled water. Adjust the seasoning according to taste. Assembling Pani Puri: Make a small hole in the center of each puri. Stuff the puris with mashed potatoes, boiled chickpeas, chopped onions, and a spoonful of tamarind chutney. Dip the stuffed puri into the prepared spiced water. Optionally, top with sev for added crunch.

name: Shev puri
description: Shev Puri is a popular Indian street food known for its burst of flavors and crunchy texture. It consists of small, crisp flatbreads (puris) filled with a delightful mixture of mashed potatoes, sprouted moong beans, chopped onions, and tomatoes. The puris are then drizzled with tangy tamarind and green chutneys, sprinkled with chaat masala, and generously topped with fine sev (gram flour noodles) for added crunch. Garnished with fresh cilantro, Shev Puri is a delicious and satisfying chaat that captures the essence of Indian street cuisine in every bite.
ingredients: 30 puris (small, round, crisp flatbreads) , 1 cup boiled and mashed potatoes , 1 cup boiled and sprouted moong beans , 1/2 cup chopped onions , 1/2 cup chopped tomatoes , 1/4 cup chopped cilantro (coriander leaves) , 1/4 cup tamarind chutney , 1/4 cup green chutney , 1/2 cup fine sev (crisp gram flour noodles) , Chaat masala to taste , Salt to taste.
instruction: Arrange the puris on a serving plate. Gently make a hole in the center of each puri, creating a small pocket. In a bowl, mix boiled and mashed potatoes with salt. Stuff each puri with this potato mixture. Top each puri with boiled and sprouted moong beans, chopped onions, and tomatoes. Drizzle tamarind chutney and green chutney over the puris. Sprinkle chaat masala according to taste. Garnish with chopped cilantro and generously top with fine sev. Serve immediately and enjoy the burst of flavors in every bite!

name: Dahi puri
description: Dahi Puri is a popular Indian street food that tantalizes the taste buds with its burst of flavors and textures. These bite-sized delights feature crispy puris filled with a delightful mix of mashed potatoes, chickpeas, and sweetened yogurt. Topped with zesty tamarind and mint-coriander chutneys, along with a medley of fresh vegetables and spices, each Dahi Puri is a harmonious blend of sweet, tangy, and spicy notes. Finished with a sprinkling of sev and chaat masala, it's a perfect snack for those who crave a savory and refreshing treat.
ingredients: 30 puris (store-bought or homemade) , 1 cup boiled and mashed potatoes , 1 cup cooked and mashed chickpeas , 1 cup sweetened yogurt (curd/dahi) , 1/2 cup tamarind chutney , 1/2 cup mint-coriander chutney , 1 small onion, finely chopped , 1 small tomato, finely chopped , 1/4 cup sev (thin gram flour noodles) , Chaat masala, red chili powder, and cumin powder for garnish , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Prepare the puris as per the package instructions or use store-bought ones. Gently make a hole in the center of each puri to create a cavity for the filling. In a bowl, mix the mashed potatoes and chickpeas. Add salt and spices to taste. Carefully stuff each puri with the potato-chickpea mixture. Top each puri with a spoonful of sweetened yogurt. Drizzle tamarind chutney and mint-coriander chutney over the puris. Garnish with chopped onions, tomatoes, sev, and fresh coriander leaves. Sprinkle chaat masala, red chili powder, and cumin powder for added flavor. Serve immediately and enjoy the burst of flavors in each bite!

name: Bhindi Masala
description: Bhindi Masala is a popular North Indian dish made with tender okra cooked in a flavorful blend of spices. The okra is sautéed with onions, tomatoes, garlic, and ginger, then seasoned with cumin, coriander, turmeric, and chili powder. This vegetarian dish is rich in flavor and texture, with the okra becoming soft and succulent while retaining a slight crunch. It's a delicious and satisfying side dish that pairs perfectly with roti or rice for a hearty and wholesome meal.
ingredients: 500g fresh okra (bhindi), washed and dried , 2 tablespoons oil (preferably vegetable oil) , 1 large onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1-inch ginger, grated , 1 green chili, finely chopped (optional) , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish.
instruction: Trim the ends of the okra and slice them into 1-inch pieces. Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chili (if using). Sauté for another minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and mushy. Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add sliced okra to the pan and mix until the masala coats the okra evenly. Cover the pan and cook for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the okra is tender. Once the okra is cooked, garnish with fresh cilantro leaves. Serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Cilantro Mint Chutney
description: Cilantro Mint Chutney is a vibrant and refreshing condiment made with fresh cilantro, mint leaves, and spices. It's a zesty and versatile accompaniment that adds a burst of flavor to Indian snacks, appetizers, and main dishes. This green chutney is quick and easy to prepare, blending the bright flavors of cilantro and mint with tangy lemon juice and aromatic spices. Perfect for adding a touch of freshness to your favorite meals.
ingredients: 1 cup fresh cilantro leaves, washed and chopped , 1/2 cup fresh mint leaves, washed and chopped , 1 small onion, chopped , 2 green chilies, chopped (adjust according to spice preference) , 1 tablespoon lemon juice , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , Salt to taste , Water (as needed).
instruction: In a blender or food processor, combine cilantro leaves, mint leaves, chopped onion, green chilies, lemon juice, cumin seeds, and a pinch of salt. Blend the ingredients until you achieve a smooth paste, adding water gradually as needed to reach your desired consistency. Taste the chutney and adjust seasoning if necessary, adding more salt or lemon juice as desired. Transfer the chutney to a serving bowl or an airtight container for storage. Serve the cilantro mint chutney with your favorite Indian snacks, appetizers, or main dishes.

name: Bharli Vangi
description: Bharli Vangi is a traditional Maharashtrian dish featuring small brinjals stuffed with a flavorful mixture of spices, coconut, peanuts, and sesame seeds. The stuffed brinjals are then cooked until tender and infused with aromatic spices. This dish is known for its rich and earthy flavors, making it a popular choice for both everyday meals and special occasions. Bharli Vangi pairs well with rice or roti and is sure to delight your taste buds with its savory and spicy goodness.
ingredients: 6 small brinjals (eggplants) , 1/2 cup grated coconut , 1/4 cup roasted peanuts , 2 tablespoons sesame seeds , 2 tablespoons chopped coriander leaves , 1 teaspoon tamarind paste , 2 teaspoons jaggery or sugar , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 2 teaspoons red chili powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 tablespoon oil , Salt to taste , For Tempering: 1 tablespoon oil , 1 teaspoon mustard seeds , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , A pinch of asafoetida (hing) , Few curry leaves.
instruction: Wash the brinjals and make a cross-shaped slit on each brinjal without cutting it into two pieces. Dry roast grated coconut, roasted peanuts, and sesame seeds until they turn golden brown. Grind them into a coarse powder. Add tamarind paste, jaggery or sugar, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin seeds, chopped coriander leaves, and salt to the powdered mixture. Mix well. Stuff each brinjal with this mixture. Heat oil in a pan for tempering. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, asafoetida, and curry leaves. Let them splutter. Place the stuffed brinjals in the pan. Cover and cook on low heat until the brinjals are tender, stirring occasionally. Once the brinjals are cooked, garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with chapatis or rice.

name: Buttery Garlic Naan Bread
description: Buttery Garlic Naan Bread is a soft and fluffy Indian flatbread infused with the rich flavors of garlic and butter. Made with simple ingredients like flour, yeast, yogurt, and garlic, this naan is a delicious accompaniment to any meal, especially Indian dishes like curry or tikka masala. It's cooked on a skillet until golden brown and brushed with melted butter for extra flavor. This homemade naan bread is easy to make and sure to impress with its irresistible aroma and taste.
ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour , 1 teaspoon active dry yeast , 1 teaspoon sugar , 1/2 teaspoon salt , 2 tablespoons plain yogurt , 2 tablespoons melted butter , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1/4 cup warm water , 1/4 cup milk , Additional melted butter for brushing (optional) , Chopped cilantro for garnish (optional).
instruction: In a small bowl, combine warm water, sugar, and yeast. Let it sit for about 5 minutes until foamy. In a large mixing bowl, combine flour and salt. Add the yeast mixture, yogurt, melted butter, minced garlic, and milk. Mix until a dough forms. Knead the dough on a floured surface for about 5-7 minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic. Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover with a damp cloth, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1 hour or until doubled in size. Once the dough has risen, divide it into small balls. Roll each ball into a thin oval or round shape. Heat a skillet or tawa over medium heat. Place the rolled naan on the skillet and cook for about 1-2 minutes on each side until bubbles form and it's lightly browned. Optionally, brush the cooked naan with melted butter and sprinkle with chopped cilantro. Serve warm and enjoy with your favorite curry or dip.

name: Vegetable Biryani
description: Vegetable Biryani is a fragrant and flavorful rice dish that originated in the Indian subcontinent. It's made with aromatic basmati rice cooked with mixed vegetables, fragrant spices, and herbs. The vegetables are sautéed with spices and layered with parboiled rice, then cooked together until tender. This one-pot meal is both nutritious and satisfying, perfect for vegetarians and anyone looking for a delicious and wholesome meal. Serve Vegetable Biryani with raita or yogurt for a complete and satisfying dining experience.
ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice, soaked for 30 minutes and drained , 2 cups mixed vegetables (such as carrots, peas, potatoes, bell peppers), diced , 1 onion, thinly sliced , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 2 green chilies, slit lengthwise , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1-inch ginger, grated , 1/4 cup plain yogurt , 1/4 cup chopped cilantro (coriander leaves) , 1/4 cup chopped mint leaves , 2 tablespoons ghee or vegetable oil , 1 cinnamon stick , 3-4 cloves , 2 cardamom pods , 1 bay leaf , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon chili powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , Fried onions (optional, for garnish).
instruction: Heat ghee or oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add the cinnamon stick, cloves, cardamom pods, bay leaf, and cumin seeds. Cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the sliced onions and cook until golden brown. Stir in the minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chilies. Cook for another 1-2 minutes. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and turn mushy. Add the mixed vegetables, turmeric powder, chili powder, and salt. Cook for 5-7 minutes until the vegetables are partially cooked. Stir in the drained basmati rice and coat it with the vegetable mixture. Add the plain yogurt, chopped cilantro, mint leaves, and garam masala. Mix well. Pour in 2 cups of water and bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the water is absorbed. Remove from heat and let it sit covered for 5 minutes. Fluff the vegetable biryani with a fork and garnish with fried onions, if desired. Serve hot with raita or your favorite side dish.

name: Methi Malai Matar with Paneer
description: Methi Malai Matar with Paneer is a creamy and flavorful North Indian dish made with fresh fenugreek leaves (methi), green peas (matar), and paneer (Indian cottage cheese). The dish is cooked in a creamy gravy made with onions, tomatoes, and cream, flavored with aromatic spices. It strikes a perfect balance between the slightly bitter taste of fenugreek leaves and the creamy texture of the gravy, making it a delicious and satisfying vegetarian dish. Enjoyed with naan, roti, or rice, it's a popular choice for a hearty meal that's both nutritious and indulgent.
ingredients: 200g paneer (Indian cottage cheese), cubed , 1 cup fresh fenugreek leaves (methi), finely chopped , 1 cup green peas (matar), fresh or frozen , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, pureed , 1/2 cup fresh cream , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons cooking oil , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish.
instruction: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Let them splutter. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute until the raw smell disappears. Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates from the masala. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well. Add chopped fenugreek leaves (methi) and green peas (matar). Cook for a few minutes until the methi leaves wilt and peas are tender. Add paneer cubes and mix gently to coat them with the masala. Pour in fresh cream and mix well. Let it simmer for 2-3 minutes. Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with fresh cilantro leaves. Serve hot with naan, roti, or rice.

name: Cabbage With Green Peas
description: Cabbage with Green Peas is a simple and nutritious dish that combines thinly sliced cabbage with vibrant green peas, flavored with aromatic spices. It's a quick and easy recipe where the cabbage and peas are sautéed with onions, garlic, and tomatoes until tender and flavorful. This dish is both comforting and wholesome, making it perfect for a satisfying weeknight meal. Enjoy the crunchy texture of the cabbage and the sweetness of the peas in every bite!
ingredients: 1 small cabbage, thinly sliced , 1 cup green peas (fresh or frozen) , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, diced , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , 1 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons cooking oil , Fresh cilantro for garnish (optional).
instruction: Heat cooking oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add minced garlic and chopped onion. Sauté until onions turn golden brown. Stir in diced tomatoes and cook until they soften and release their juices. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. Add thinly sliced cabbage and green peas to the pan. Mix until well combined. Cover and cook for about 10-15 minutes, or until the cabbage and peas are tender, stirring occasionally. Once the cabbage and peas are cooked through, sprinkle garam masala and mix gently. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes. Garnish with fresh cilantro (if using) and serve hot.

name: Undihyu
description: Undhiyu is a traditional Gujarati mixed vegetable dish made with a variety of seasonal vegetables, fresh fenugreek leaves (methi), and aromatic spices. The vegetables are typically cooked with coconut, coriander, and other flavorful ingredients, resulting in a fragrant and wholesome dish. Undhiyu is often enjoyed during festivals and special occasions and is a delightful blend of flavors and textures.
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (such as potatoes, sweet potatoes, eggplant, green beans, peas, and yam), chopped , 1 cup fresh fenugreek leaves (methi) , 1 cup fresh coriander leaves, chopped , 1 cup fresh grated coconut , 2-3 green chilies, finely chopped , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon cumin-coriander powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1 tablespoon sugar , Salt to taste , 3 tablespoons oil , Fresh lemon juice for garnish , Chopped cilantro for garnish.
instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine chopped mixed vegetables, fresh fenugreek leaves, fresh coriander leaves, fresh grated coconut, green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, cumin-coriander powder, garam masala, sugar, salt, and 2 tablespoons of oil. Mix well to coat the vegetables with the spices. Heat the remaining oil in a large pan or pressure cooker. Add the vegetable mixture and cook over medium heat for 5-7 minutes. If using a pressure cooker, add 1/4 cup of water, close the lid, and cook for 2-3 whistles. If using a pan, cover and cook until the vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally. Once cooked, garnish with fresh lemon juice and chopped cilantro. Serve hot with roti, puri, or rice.

name: Punjabi Kadhi Pakora
description: Punjabi Kadhi Pakora is a traditional North Indian dish featuring creamy yogurt-based gravy infused with aromatic spices like cumin, mustard, and fenugreek seeds. Tender chickpea flour (besan) fritters called pakoras are added to the gravy, providing a delightful contrast of textures. The dish is simmered to perfection, resulting in a tangy, savory, and comforting curry that pairs perfectly with steamed rice or chapati. It's a beloved dish in Punjabi cuisine, cherished for its rich flavors and hearty appeal.
ingredients: For Kadhi: 1 cup yogurt (curd) , 2 tablespoons gram flour (besan) , 2 cups water , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 tablespoon mustard seeds , 1 tablespoon fenugreek seeds (methi) , 2 tablespoons vegetable oil , Salt to taste , For Pakoras (Fritters): 1 cup gram flour (besan) , 1 onion, finely chopped , 1 green chili, finely chopped , 1/2 inch ginger, grated , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon baking soda , Salt to taste , Vegetable oil for frying.
instruction: In a mixing bowl, whisk yogurt, gram flour, water, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt until smooth. Heat vegetable oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, and fenugreek seeds. Let them crackle. Pour the yogurt mixture into the pan and stir continuously to avoid lumps. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes until the kadhi thickens. Stir occasionally. In the meantime, prepare the pakoras. In a separate bowl, mix gram flour, chopped onion, green chili, grated ginger, turmeric powder, red chili powder, baking soda, and salt. Add water as needed to make a thick batter. Heat vegetable oil in a deep frying pan. Drop spoonfuls of the batter into the hot oil and fry until golden brown and crispy. Remove from oil and drain excess oil on paper towels. Once the kadhi is thickened, add the pakoras to the kadhi and let them simmer for another 5-10 minutes. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with steamed rice or chapati.

name: Green Moong Dal
description: Green Moong Dal is a traditional Indian dish made from whole green mung beans. It's a nutritious and flavorful lentil-based curry, commonly enjoyed as a Main Course or side dish. The dal is cooked until soft and creamy, then flavored with aromatic spices like cumin, turmeric, and coriander. It's typically garnished with fresh cilantro for added freshness. Green Moong Dal is not only delicious but also packed with protein, fiber, and essential nutrients, making it a healthy addition to any meal.
ingredients: 1 cup whole green moong dal (green gram) , 4 cups water , 1 tablespoon ghee or oil , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1-inch piece of ginger, grated , 1 green chili, chopped (optional) , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon cumin powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , Salt to taste , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish.
instruction: Rinse the green moong dal under cold water until the water runs clear. In a pressure cooker or large pot, combine the washed dal and water. Cook until the dal is soft and mushy. If using a pressure cooker, cook for about 3-4 whistles. In a separate pan, heat ghee or oil over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent. Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chili (if using). Sauté for a couple of minutes until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they are soft and mushy. Add turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for another minute. Once the dal is cooked, add the prepared onion-tomato mixture to it. Mix everything together and let it simmer for a few minutes. Adjust the consistency by adding more water if necessary. Bring the dal to a gentle boil. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Dal Dhokli
description: Dal Dhokli is a traditional Gujarati one-pot meal that combines spiced wheat flour dumplings (dhokli) with a flavorful lentil curry (dal). The dumplings are rolled out and cooked directly in the lentil soup, absorbing its delicious flavors. This comforting and hearty dish is seasoned with aromatic spices and typically garnished with fresh coriander leaves. It's a wholesome and satisfying meal that's perfect for any day of the week.
ingredients: 1 cup whole wheat flour , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds , Salt to taste , 1 cup pigeon peas (toor dal), cooked and mashed , 2 tablespoons ghee (clarified butter) , 1 tablespoon oil , 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds , 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds , A pinch of asafoetida (hing) , 2-3 cloves garlic, minced , 1 green chili, finely chopped , 1 tomato, chopped , 1 tablespoon jaggery or brown sugar , 1 tablespoon tamarind pulp , Chopped coriander leaves for garnish , Lemon wedges for serving.
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine whole wheat flour, turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin seeds, salt, and enough water to make a smooth dough. Knead well and let it rest for 15-20 minutes. Divide the dough into small balls and roll out each ball into thin circles (like rotis). In a separate bowl, mix the cooked and mashed pigeon peas (toor dal) with some water to make a thin dal. Heat ghee in a large pan. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and asafoetida. Let them splutter. Add minced garlic and chopped green chili. Sauté until garlic turns golden brown. Add chopped tomato and cook until it turns soft. Pour in the prepared thin dal mixture. Add jaggery or brown sugar, tamarind pulp, and salt to taste. Let it simmer for 5-7 minutes. Carefully add the rolled out dough circles (dhokli) into the simmering dal, one by one. Make sure they are not overlapping. Cover and cook for about 10-15 minutes or until the dhoklis are cooked through. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with a squeeze of lemon juice.

name: Jeera Aloo
description: Jeera Aloo is a simple and flavorful Indian dish made with potatoes (aloo) seasoned with cumin seeds (jeera) and a blend of aromatic spices. The diced potatoes are sautéed in oil with cumin seeds until tender and golden brown, creating a delicious side dish or accompaniment to any meal. This dish is quick and easy to prepare, making it perfect for a satisfying and comforting meal.
ingredients: 4 medium-sized potatoes, peeled and diced , 2 tablespoons vegetable oil , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds (jeera) , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , 1 teaspoon ground coriander (dhania) powder , Salt to taste , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish.
instruction: Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds until they start to release their aroma. Add diced potatoes to the pan and mix well with the cumin seeds. Sprinkle turmeric powder, red chili powder, ground coriander powder, and salt over the potatoes. Mix until the potatoes are evenly coated with the spices. Cover the pan with a lid and let the potatoes cook for about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they are tender and cooked through. Once the potatoes are cooked, remove the lid and continue to cook for a few more minutes until they are slightly crispy and golden brown. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Paneer Bhurji
description: Paneer Bhurji is a flavorful Indian dish made with crumbled paneer (Indian cottage cheese), sautéed with onions, tomatoes, and aromatic spices. It's a quick and easy vegetarian recipe that's bursting with flavors and perfect for a hearty breakfast or a satisfying meal. The crumbled paneer absorbs the spices beautifully, creating a dish that's both comforting and delicious. Enjoy it with roti, naan, or bread for a wholesome and fulfilling experience.
ingredients: 200g paneer (Indian cottage cheese), crumbled , 2 tablespoons oil or ghee , 1 onion, finely chopped , 1 tomato, finely chopped , 1 green chili, finely chopped , 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Heat oil or ghee in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent. Add finely chopped green chili and sauté for a minute. Add finely chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and mushy. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. Add crumbled paneer to the pan and mix gently until well combined with the spices. Cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the paneer is heated through and well coated with the spices. Sprinkle garam masala and mix well. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with roti, naan, or bread.

name: Chana Saag Aloo Curry
description: Chana Saag Aloo Curry is a flavorful and nutritious Indian dish made with chickpeas (chana), spinach (saag), and potatoes (aloo), cooked in a rich blend of aromatic spices. This vegetarian curry combines the earthiness of chickpeas and potatoes with the vibrant green of spinach, resulting in a hearty and satisfying meal. The dish is packed with protein, vitamins, and minerals, making it both delicious and wholesome. It's perfect for a quick weeknight dinner or as part of a festive spread.
ingredients: 1 cup dried chickpeas (or 2 cans, drained and rinsed) , 2 cups spinach leaves, chopped , 2 medium potatoes, diced , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 3 cloves garlic, minced , 1-inch piece of ginger, grated , 1 green chili, chopped (optional, adjust to taste) , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons cooking oil , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish.
instruction: If using dried chickpeas, soak them overnight in water. Cook the soaked chickpeas in a pressure cooker or large pot until tender. If using canned chickpeas, rinse and drain them. Heat oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chili. Sauté for another minute. Stir in chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and mushy. Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. Add diced potatoes and cooked chickpeas to the skillet. Mix until the potatoes and chickpeas are well coated with the spice mixture. Pour in a little water to deglaze the skillet and create a gravy. Cover and cook until the potatoes are tender, stirring occasionally. Once the potatoes are cooked, add chopped spinach leaves and garam masala. Stir until the spinach wilts and combines with the curry. Adjust the seasoning if needed. Cook for a few more minutes until everything is heated through. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Tandoori Paneer Tikka
description: Tandoori Paneer Tikka is a classic Indian appetizer made by marinating cubes of paneer (Indian cottage cheese) in a blend of yogurt and spices, then grilling them until they are charred and aromatic. This dish is bursting with flavors from the marinade, featuring tangy yogurt, aromatic spices, and smoky charred notes from the grill. It's a perfect vegetarian option for barbecue parties or as a starter for Indian meals. Enjoy the succulent and flavorful Tandoori Paneer Tikka with a squeeze of lemon and some mint chutney on the side.
ingredients: 250g paneer (Indian cottage cheese), cut into cubes , 1/2 cup yogurt , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 tablespoon lemon juice , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon ground cumin , 1 teaspoon ground coriander , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 1 onion, cut into chunks , 1 bell pepper (capsicum), cut into chunks , Cooking oil for grilling , Lemon wedges and fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, red chili powder, ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt to make the marinade. Add paneer cubes to the marinade and coat them well. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator. Preheat the grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. Thread marinated paneer cubes, onion chunks, and bell pepper chunks onto skewers, alternating the ingredients. Brush the skewers with a little oil and place them on the grill. Grill the skewers for about 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, until the paneer and vegetables are cooked and have grill marks. Once cooked, remove the skewers from the grill and transfer the Tandoori Paneer Tikka to a serving plate. Garnish with lemon wedges and fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with mint chutney or yogurt dip.

name: Varan Bhaat
description: Varan Bhaat is a traditional Maharashtrian dish consisting of split pigeon peas (toor dal) cooked to a smooth consistency and tempered with mustard seeds, cumin seeds, dried red chilies, turmeric, and asafoetida. It's typically served with steamed rice (bhaat) and garnished with cilantro leaves. This comforting and nutritious dish is a staple in Maharashtrian cuisine, enjoyed for its simplicity and delicious flavor.
ingredients: 1 cup split pigeon peas (toor dal) , 3 cups water , 1 tablespoon ghee or oil , 1 teaspoon mustard seeds , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 2-3 dried red chilies , A pinch of asafoetida (hing) , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , Salt to taste , Chopped cilantro leaves for garnish.
instruction: Rinse the toor dal under cold water until the water runs clear. In a pressure cooker or pot, combine the toor dal and water. Cook until the dal is soft and mushy (approximately 15-20 minutes in a pressure cooker or 30-40 minutes in a pot). Once the dal is cooked, use a whisk or spoon to mash it to a smooth consistency. Add more water if needed to adjust the consistency. In a separate pan, heat ghee or oil over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. When the seeds start to splutter, add dried red chilies and asafoetida. Stir in turmeric powder and quickly add this tempering to the cooked dal. Mix well and let it simmer for a few minutes. Season with salt to taste and garnish with chopped cilantro leaves. Serve hot with steamed rice (bhaat).

name: Lachha Paratha
description: Lachha Paratha is a traditional Indian flatbread known for its flaky, layered texture. Made from whole wheat flour, the dough is rolled out, brushed with ghee or butter, folded into pleats, and then rolled into a spiral before being flattened and cooked on a hot griddle. The result is a deliciously crispy and golden brown bread that pairs perfectly with curries, chutneys, or yogurt. It's a versatile and flavorful dish that's sure to be a hit at any mealtime.
ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour , 2 tablespoons ghee or melted butter , Salt to taste , Water as needed , Additional ghee or oil for cooking.
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, salt, and ghee or melted butter. Gradually add water and knead the mixture into a soft and smooth dough. Cover the dough and let it rest for 15-20 minutes. Divide the dough into equal-sized balls, about the size of a golf ball. Take one dough ball and roll it out into a thin circle using a rolling pin. Spread some ghee or oil evenly over the rolled-out dough circle. With a sharp knife, make cuts from the center towards the edges of the circle, but do not cut all the way through. Start folding the dough from one end, making pleats as you go along. Once the dough is completely pleated, roll it into a spiral and tuck the end underneath. Gently flatten the spiral and roll it out again into a circle. Heat a tawa or griddle over medium heat and place the rolled-out paratha on it. Cook the paratha on both sides, applying ghee or oil as needed, until golden brown spots appear. Repeat the process with the remaining dough balls to make more parathas. Serve hot with your favorite curry, chutney, or yogurt.

name: Aloo Paratha
description: Aloo Paratha is a popular Indian flatbread stuffed with a spiced potato filling. The dough is made with whole wheat flour and rolled out into circles, then filled with a mixture of mashed potatoes, spices, and herbs. The stuffed dough is rolled out again and cooked on a griddle until golden and crispy. Aloo Paratha is typically served hot with yogurt, pickle, or chutney. It's a comforting and satisfying dish enjoyed for breakfast, lunch, or dinner in India and beyond.
ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour , 2 medium-sized potatoes, boiled and mashed , 1 small onion, finely chopped (optional) , 2 green chilies, finely chopped (adjust to taste) , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves, chopped , Ghee or oil for cooking.
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine whole wheat flour, mashed potatoes, chopped onions (if using), chopped green chilies, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, salt, and chopped coriander leaves. Mix well to form a dough. Add a little water if needed to make a soft dough. Divide the dough into equal-sized balls. Take one dough ball and roll it out into a small circle (about 4-5 inches in diameter) using a rolling pin and some flour for dusting. Place a portion of the potato mixture in the center of the rolled-out dough circle. Bring the edges of the dough together to cover the filling and form a ball. Flatten the stuffed dough ball gently with your hands and roll it out again into a circle, taking care not to break it. Heat a tawa or griddle over medium heat and place the rolled-out paratha on it. Cook the paratha for 1-2 minutes on one side until bubbles start to appear. Flip the paratha and cook the other side for another 1-2 minutes. Apply some ghee or oil on both sides of the paratha and cook until golden brown spots appear on both sides. Repeat the process with the remaining dough balls to make more parathas. Serve hot with yogurt, pickle, or any chutney of your choice.

name: Idli Sambar
description: Idli Sambar is a traditional South Indian dish consisting of soft and fluffy idlis served with a flavorful lentil-based stew called sambar. Idlis are steamed rice cakes made from a fermented batter of rice and urad dal, while sambar is made with toor dal, mixed vegetables, tamarind, and aromatic spices. This comforting and nutritious dish is a staple breakfast or snack in South Indian households, enjoyed for its delicious taste and wholesome ingredients.
ingredients: For Idli: 2 cups idli rice , 1 cup urad dal (split black gram) , Salt to taste , For Sambar: 1 cup toor dal (split pigeon peas) , 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, potatoes, drumsticks, etc.), chopped , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 1 onion, chopped , 2 green chilies, slit , 1 tablespoon sambar powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , A small piece of tamarind, soaked in water , Salt to taste , Water as needed , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: For Idli: Wash and soak the idli rice and urad dal separately for at least 4 hours or overnight. Grind the soaked rice and dal separately to a smooth batter using a little water if needed. Mix both batters together, add salt, and let it ferment overnight or for 8-10 hours. Grease idli molds and pour the batter into them. Steam the idlis in a steamer for about 10-12 minutes or until done. Remove from molds and set aside. For Sambar: Cook the toor dal in a pressure cooker until soft and mushy. Set aside. In a large pot, heat oil and add chopped onions. Saute until onions turn translucent. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy. Add mixed vegetables, slit green chilies, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook for a few minutes. Extract tamarind juice from the soaked tamarind and add it to the pot. Add sambar powder and mix well. Cook until vegetables are tender. Add cooked toor dal and water as needed to achieve the desired consistency. Let it simmer for 5-10 minutes. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

name: Dahi Vada
description: Dahi Vada is a popular Indian snack made from lentil fritters soaked in seasoned yogurt and topped with chutneys and spices. These savory vadas are crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, and bursting with flavor from the tangy yogurt and aromatic spices. It's a refreshing and satisfying dish enjoyed as a snack or appetizer in Indian cuisine.
ingredients: 1 cup urad dal (black gram lentils) , 1/4 cup moong dal (split yellow lentils) , 2 cups yogurt (curd) , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon grated ginger , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , A pinch of asafoetida (hing) , Salt to taste , Oil for frying , 2 cups water (for soaking vadas) , 1/2 cup tamarind chutney (optional) , 1/4 cup mint-coriander chutney (optional) , Chaat masala for garnish (optional) , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Wash and soak urad dal and moong dal in water for 4-5 hours or overnight. Drain the water and grind the soaked dal into a smooth paste using a blender or grinder. Add a little water if necessary to achieve a smooth consistency. Add grated ginger, chopped green chilies, cumin seeds, asafoetida, and salt to the batter. Mix well. Heat oil in a deep frying pan. Take small portions of the batter and drop them gently into the hot oil. Fry the vadas until they turn golden brown and crispy on the outside. Remove from oil and drain excess oil on a paper towel. Soak the fried vadas in lukewarm water for about 20-30 minutes, then gently squeeze out the excess water by pressing each vada between your palms. Arrange the squeezed vadas on a serving dish and pour beaten yogurt (seasoned with a little salt) over them. Optionally, drizzle tamarind chutney and mint-coriander chutney over the yogurt-covered vadas. Sprinkle chaat masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Mango Lassi
description: Mango Lassi is a refreshing and creamy Indian drink made with ripe mangoes, yogurt, milk, and sugar. Blended together, it creates a smooth and tropical beverage perfect for hot days. Garnished with mint leaves, it's a delightful balance of sweetness and tanginess, offering a taste of India's vibrant flavors in every sip.
ingredients: 2 ripe mangoes, peeled and diced , 1 cup plain yogurt , 1/2 cup milk , 2 tablespoons sugar (adjust to taste) , Ice cubes (optional) , Fresh mint leaves for garnish (optional).
instruction: In a blender, combine the diced mangoes, plain yogurt, milk, and sugar. Blend until smooth and creamy. Taste and adjust sweetness by adding more sugar if needed. If desired, add a few ice cubes to the blender and blend until the lassi reaches your desired consistency and temperature. Pour the mango lassi into glasses. Garnish with fresh mint leaves, if desired. Serve immediately and enjoy!

name: Veg Kadai
description: Veg Kadai is a flavorful and aromatic Indian dish made with a variety of mixed vegetables cooked in a rich and spicy gravy. This vegetarian delight is seasoned with a blend of aromatic spices and herbs, creating a burst of flavors in every bite. The colorful assortment of vegetables adds texture and nutrition to the dish, making it both delicious and healthy. Veg Kadai is a popular choice for vegetarians and is often served with rice or Indian breads like naan or roti. It's a versatile dish that can be customized with your favorite vegetables and spice levels, making it a perfect choice for any occasion.
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, carrots, cauliflower, and peas), diced , 2 onions, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 2 green chilies, slit , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon coriander seeds , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon dried fenugreek leaves (kasuri methi) , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons cooking oil , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Heat oil in a kadai or a deep skillet over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and coriander seeds. Let them crackle. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and slit green chilies. Sauté for a minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Mix well and cook for a couple of minutes. Add diced mixed vegetables and salt. Stir to combine. Cover and cook until the vegetables are tender but still have a slight crunch. Crush dried fenugreek leaves between your palms and sprinkle over the vegetables. Mix well. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Ras Malai
description: Ras Malai is a popular Indian dessert made from soft, spongy cheese balls (chenna) soaked in sweetened, cardamom-infused milk. Garnished with nuts and saffron, it offers a delicate and creamy texture with a hint of aromatic flavors. This delectable treat is served chilled and is beloved for its rich taste and indulgent appeal.
ingredients: 1 liter whole milk , 1/4 cup lemon juice , 1/2 cup sugar , 4 cups water , 4-5 cardamom pods, crushed , A pinch of saffron strands (optional) , Chopped nuts for garnish (almonds, pistachios).
instruction: In a large pot, bring the whole milk to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and add lemon juice gradually while stirring continuously. Continue to cook until the milk curdles and separates into curds (chenna) and whey. Turn off the heat. Line a strainer with a cheesecloth or muslin cloth and strain the curdled milk. Rinse the chenna under cold water to remove the lemony taste. Gather the cloth and squeeze out excess water from the chenna. Hang the cloth for about 30 minutes to drain excess water completely. Meanwhile, prepare the sugar syrup by dissolving sugar in water in a separate pot. Add crushed cardamom pods and saffron strands (if using) to the syrup. Bring it to a boil and then simmer for 5-7 minutes. After 30 minutes, knead the chenna until it becomes smooth and soft. Divide the chenna into small portions and shape them into flattened balls. Gently add the chenna balls into the simmering sugar syrup. Cover and cook for 15-20 minutes on low heat. The balls will double in size. Remove the cooked chenna balls from the syrup and let them cool. Garnish with chopped nuts before serving. Serve chilled.

name: Chilli Paneer
description: Chilli Paneer is a popular Indo-Chinese dish featuring crispy cubes of paneer (Indian cottage cheese) tossed in a spicy and tangy sauce with bell peppers, onions, garlic, and ginger. This flavorful and aromatic dish is a perfect blend of Indian and Chinese cuisines, offering a balance of heat, sweetness, and tanginess. It's a versatile dish that can be served as an appetizer or as a Main Course with rice or noodles. Enjoyed for its vibrant flavors and satisfying textures, Chilli Paneer is a favorite among vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike.
ingredients: 200g paneer, cut into cubes , 1 onion, finely chopped , 1 bell pepper (capsicum), diced , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1-inch ginger, minced , 2 tablespoons soy sauce , 1 tablespoon tomato ketchup , 1 tablespoon chili sauce , 1 tablespoon cornstarch , 1/4 cup water , 2 tablespoons vegetable oil , Salt to taste , Fresh cilantro (coriander) leaves for garnish.
instruction: In a small bowl, mix cornstarch with water to make a slurry. Set aside. Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add chopped onions, green chilies, garlic, and ginger. Saute until onions turn translucent. Add diced bell peppers and cook until they are slightly tender. Add soy sauce, tomato ketchup, and chili sauce to the skillet. Mix well. Stir in the cornstarch slurry and cook until the sauce thickens. Add paneer cubes to the skillet and toss gently to coat them with the sauce. Cook for another 2-3 minutes, allowing the paneer to absorb the flavors of the sauce. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves. Serve hot as a starter or with rice or noodles as a Main Course.

name: Rice Kheer
description: Rice Kheer is a creamy and aromatic Indian dessert made by simmering rice in milk and sweetening it with sugar. It's flavored with cardamom and often garnished with chopped nuts and saffron. This indulgent treat has a comforting texture and is enjoyed warm or chilled. Perfect for celebrations or as a comforting sweet dish after a meal.
ingredients: 1/2 cup basmati rice , 4 cups whole milk , 1/2 cup sugar (adjust to taste) , 1/4 cup mixed nuts (almonds, cashews, pistachios), chopped , 1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder , A pinch of saffron strands (optional) , Raisins for garnish (optional) , Edible silver leaf (optional).

name: Paneer Jalfrezi
description: Paneer Jalfrezi is a popular Indian dish featuring paneer (Indian cottage cheese) cooked with colorful bell peppers, onions, and aromatic spices. This vibrant and flavorful dish is quick and easy to prepare, making it perfect for a weeknight dinner or special occasion. The paneer is sautéed with a medley of vegetables and spices, creating a delicious and satisfying vegetarian meal. Garnished with fresh cilantro, Paneer Jalfrezi is a delightful addition to any Indian meal spread.
ingredients: 250g paneer, cubed , 1 onion, sliced , 1 bell pepper (capsicum), sliced , 1 tomato, chopped , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1-inch ginger, grated , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons vegetable oil , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish.
instruction: Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add minced garlic and grated ginger. Sauté for a minute until fragrant. Add sliced onions and green chilies. Cook until onions turn golden brown. Add sliced bell peppers (capsicum) and cook for a few minutes until they are slightly tender. Stir in chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and release their juices. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. Add cubed paneer to the pan and gently mix with the masala. Cook for 2-3 minutes, allowing the flavors to blend and the paneer to absorb the spices. Sprinkle garam masala over the paneer jalfrezi and mix well. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves. Serve hot with naan, rice, or roti.

name: Creamy Vegetable Korma
description: Creamy Vegetable Korma is a rich and flavorful Indian dish featuring a medley of vegetables simmered in a creamy coconut-based sauce. This vegetarian recipe is seasoned with aromatic spices like coriander, cumin, and garam masala, creating a fragrant and comforting dish. It's perfect for those looking for a hearty and satisfying meal that's both delicious and nutritious. Enjoyed with rice or naan, this Creamy Vegetable Korma is sure to be a crowd-pleaser at any dinner table.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1-inch piece of ginger, grated , 2 potatoes, peeled and diced , 1 carrot, diced , 1 cup cauliflower florets , 1 cup green peas (fresh or frozen) , 1 bell pepper, diced , 1 can (400ml) coconut milk , 2 tablespoons tomato paste , 1 teaspoon ground coriander , 1 teaspoon ground cumin , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt and pepper to taste , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish.
instruction: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or pan over medium heat. Add chopped onions, minced garlic, and grated ginger. Sauté until onions are translucent. Add diced potatoes and carrots to the skillet. Cook for a few minutes until slightly softened. Stir in cauliflower florets, green peas, and diced bell pepper. Cook for another 5 minutes. In a small bowl, mix together coconut milk, tomato paste, ground coriander, ground cumin, turmeric powder, and garam masala. Pour the coconut milk mixture over the vegetables in the skillet. Stir well to combine. Cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and cooked through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Paneer Fried Rice
description: Paneer fried rice is a flavorful Indian rice dish made with crumbled paneer (Indian cottage cheese), vegetables, and cooked rice. It's a quick stir-fry that's typically seasoned with soy sauce, vinegar, and chili for a savory and slightly spicy taste.
ingredients: 2 tbsp oil, 20 cube paneer, 2 chilli, finely chopped, 2 cloves garlic, finely chopped, ½ onion, finely chopped, 5 beans, chopped, 1 carrot, chopped, ½ capsicum, chopped, 2 tsp chilli sauce, 2 tsp schezwan sauce, 2 tsp vinegar, 2 tsp soy sauce, ½ tsp pepper powder, 1 tsp salt, 3 tbsp cabbage, shredded, 4 cups cooked rice 2 tbsp spring onion, chopped
instruction: Firstly, in a large wok heat 2 tbsp oil and fry 20 cubes paneer. Fry until the paneer turns golden brown, keep aside. In the same oil, add 2 chilli, 2 cloves garlic and fry on high flame. Now add ½ onion, 5 beans, 1 carrot, ½ capsicum and fry on high flame. Fry until the vegetables turn crunchy. Keeping the flame on high, add 2 tsp chilli sauce, 2 tsp schezwan sauce, 2 tsp vinegar, 2 tsp soy sauce, ½ tsp pepper powder and 1 tsp salt. Stir fry on high flame until the sauces are well combined. Add in fried paneer, 3 tbsp cabbage and mix well until the sauce is coated well. Now add 4 cups of cooked rice and mix well making sure everything is well combined. Finally, add 2 tbsp spring onion and enjoy paneer fried rice.

name: Sweet Potato Korma
description: Sweet Potato Korma is a vegetarian twist on a classic Indian dish.  It replaces chicken with tender, roasted sweet potatoes and features a creamy sauce made with cashews, coconut milk, and warm spices like turmeric and garam masala. You can enjoy it over rice for a complete meal.
ingredients: Rice: 2 3/4 cups plus 2 tablespoons water, 1 cup coconut milk, 3/4 teaspoon salt, 1 1/2 cups uncooked basmati rice, Korma: Cooking spray, 1 1/2 cups chopped onion, 1 tablespoon minced peeled fresh ginger, 2 teaspoons ground coriander, 2 teaspoons garam masala, 2 garlic cloves, minced, 4 cups chopped peeled sweet potato, 1 cup water, 2/3 cup chopped plum tomato, 3/4 teaspoon salt, 3 tablespoons finely chopped cilantro, 1 teaspoon chile paste with garlic, 1 (14-ounce) package reduced-fat water-packed firm tofu, drained and cut into (1/2-inch) cubes, 3 tablespoons plain fat-free yogurt, 2 tablespoons finely chopped dry-roasted cashews
instruction: To prepare rice, bring first 3 ingredients to a boil in a medium saucepan. Stir in rice, and cook, uncovered, for 5 minutes. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat; let stand 10 minutes. Fluff with a fork before serving. To prepare korma, while rice cooks, heat a Dutch oven over medium heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add the onion; cook 7 minutes or until tender, stirring frequently. Add ginger, coriander, garam masala, and garlic; cook 2 minutes, stirring frequently. Add sweet potato, 1 cup water, tomato, and 3/4 teaspoon salt. Bring to a boil; cover, reduce heat, and simmer 10 minutes or until sweet potato is tender. Stir in cilantro, chile paste, and tofu. Serve korma over rice, and top with yogurt and cashews.

name: Eggless Sponge Cake With Curd
description: This cake is made without eggs but uses curd (yogurt) to create a soft and spongy texture. Sugar, flour, baking powder, baking soda, oil, and vanilla extract are whisked together with the curd to make a batter. The batter is then baked in a preheated oven until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
ingredients: All purpose flour/Maida-1 1/4cup, Curd-3/4cup, Sugar-3/4cup, Vanilla Essence-1tsp, Baking, Soda-1/2tsp, Olive Oil/Refined Oil-1/4cup, Salt-a pinch
instruction: Preheat the oven 180 degree Fahrenheit for 10mins and grease a cake pan and keep aside. Add olive oil/refined oil and vanilla essence to the curd mixture and combine well. Now slowly add the flour little by little and stir gently. Pour the batter in a greased pan and bake for 20mins.

name: Cashew-nuts rice
description: Cashew nut rice, also called Kaju Pulao, is a flavorful Indian dish made with basmati rice, cashews, and fragrant spices. It's a vegetarian option with a rich taste.
ingredients: Boiled Rice-2 bowl, Cashew-nut Powder-3tsp, Fried cashew-nuts-10, Large onion-1, Cardamom-1, Cinnamon-1/4stick, Cloves-3, Aniseeds-1/4tsp, Poppy seeds-1/4tsp, Crushed ginger-few, Shred coconut-1/4cup, Green chili-2, Curry leaves, Coriander leaves, Red-chili powder-1/2tsp, Coriander powder-1 1/2tsp, Turmeric powder-1/2tsp, Cumin powder-1/4tsp, Gram masala-1/4tsp, Salt-to taste, Oil/Ghee-3tsp
instruction: Take a kadai, add oil/ghee, cardamom, cinnamon, cloves, aniseeds, ginger, greenchili and poppy seeds. After poppying the seeds add sliced onion and curry leaves. Onion comes in slightly brown add shred coconut,salt and fry well. After coconut comes in a round shape. Take a plate add all powders,water and mix well (except cashew-nut powder).do not add more water.mixing a correct consistency. After add mixing powders and fry well.fry 2 or 3mins. After 3mins remove the pan in heat.Add cashew-nuts powder and mix well. Add boiled rice,coriander leaves and mix well. Finally add fried cashew-nuts and decorate some coriander leaves. Hope and enjoy ur recipe :)

name: SAMBAR
description: Sambar is a hearty lentil and vegetable stew from South India. It's made with lentils (usually toor dal), vegetables like pumpkin, potato, and eggplant, and a unique spice blend called sambar powder. The lentils are cooked separately until soft, then simmered with the vegetables, tamarind for tanginess, and the sambar powder for flavor. Finally, a fragrant tempering with mustard seeds, curry leaves, and sometimes ghee is added for an extra punch.
ingredients: Half cup of Masoor Dhal (can also be made with Toor Dhal), 6 cloves of garlic, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, 2 cups of water, 3 - 4 tbs oil, 1/2 tsp mustard seeds, 1/4 tsp jeera, 1/4 tsp broken urad dhal, 4 pepper corns, A pinch of asafoetida, A few curry leaves, 1 onion sliced, 4 - 6 green chillies slit into two, 4 red chillies, 3 tomatoes sliced (keep a few for garnish), 4 tbs coriander leaves (keep aside some for garnish), Salt to taste
instruction: Put nos 1 to 4 in a pot and boil it till there is a little water left in the dhal and the dhal is cooked. If the dhal is not cooked do not pour cold water, you can pour a little boiling water. Add the oil in a frying pan and heat itâ¦..when it is hot, add nos. 5 to 10 and after the mustard splutters, add the curry leaves and immediately add Nos 12 to 14. When the onions are slightly brown, add Nos 15 to 17. When that is fried a little put it into the dhal that has been cooked. While you are seasoning keep the dhal on slow fire. After the seasoning has been added to the dhal let it boil for 2 to 3 minutes and you can take it down. Put it into a deep dish and garnish with coriander leaves, mint leaves and sliced tomatoes. SAMBARâ¦â¦.is almost the same recipe but with a slight variation For Sambar Toor Dhal is a must The only difference is after seasoning add a little tamarind juice (taken out the juice from a ball of tamarind the size of a lime) and one and a half tablespoon of sambar powder. Let the dhal boil for 5 to 7 minutes after adding these two ingredients. While adding these two ingredients you can add some vegetable which has been cooked earlierâ¦â¦..like brinjal, drumstick, carrots, chow chow, etc.

name: Capsicum Tofu
description: Tofu and bell peppers come together in a flavorful dish!  The tofu is seasoned and cooked (possibly stir-fried or curried), and then combined with colorful bell peppers for a satisfying and protein-packed meal.
ingredients: tofu - 350 gm, diced, capsicum - 1 cup, shredded thinly,  onions - 1 cup, sliced thinly, oil - 1/4 cup, soya sauce - 1 tsp, ginger paste - 1/2 tsp, garlic paste - 1/2 tsp, salt - to taste, coriander leaves - 2 tsp, for garnish, vinegar - 2 tbsp
instruction: Take the oil in a frying pan and heat on high flame. Take the oil in a frying pan and heat on high flame. When the oil is hot, add onions, ginger, garlic and capsicum in it over high heat and fry until the onions and capsicums look wet. Keep stirring while frying. When the oil is hot, add onions, ginger, garlic and capsicum in it over high heat and fry until the onions and capsicums look wet. Keep stirring while frying. When the onions and capsicums look wet, add the soya sauce, vinegar, tofu and salt to it and mix well. When the onions and capsicums look wet, add the soya sauce, vinegar, tofu and salt to it and mix well. Your capsicum tofu is ready, garnished with coriander leaves and serve hot. Your capsicum tofu is ready, garnished with coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Mango Pickle
description: Mango pickle is a tangy and spicy condiment made with unripe green mangoes, a vibrant mix of pickling spices, and oil. It's a flavor explosion in every bite!
ingredients: 1 semi/unripe mango - remove seed and cubed., 2 tbsp gingerly oil, 1/2 tbsp plain chili powder, 1 tsp black mustard seeds, 1/4 tsp fenugreek seeds, 1/2 tsp turmeric/kunyit, A pinch of asafetida powder, 1/2 cup vinegar (more of less depending on taste), 1/2 tbsp sugar (quantity depends on the sweetest of mango), 3-4 sprigs curry leaves, Salt for taste
instruction: In the heated oil, splatter mustard seeds. Add chili and turmeric powder. Quickly stir and goes in all the other ingredients. Stir and cook mango to a texture or crunch you prefer. Remove and once cool down, pack in bottle and store in fridge.

name: Carrot Halwa
description: Carrot halwa is a rich Indian dessert pudding made by simmering grated carrots in milk and sugar, flavored with cardamom. Nuts and ghee add a decadent touch.
ingredients: 4 C Carrots, peeled - thickly grated, 1 Tbsp Ghee, clarified butter, 2 Thsp Nuts ( almonds + cashew + pistachios), 1 tsp of Raisins, 1 C Sugar, 3 C Milk, 3 Tbsp Khoa / Mawa / paneer, 2 tsp Green Cardamom powder, finely crushed
instruction: In a non stick wide bottomed pot, add ghee, as it melts add nuts and slightly roast it, do not make it brown. Now add grated carrots, milk and let it cook in an open pot on medium flame untill cooked, with constant stirring. Once the water is evaporated from carrots, add sugar & khoa, cook untill the sugar syrup is thickened. Switch off the gas/flame, and add cardamom powder. Serve hot. Note: Using a wide bottomed pot makes it easier & it gets cooked faster. Instead of using khoa/ mawa, you can aslo use paneer from curdled milk. It will only give that rich taste which is much needed in this recipe. Enjoy this carrot pudding/ halwa warm or cold. Can be also added with vanilla ice-cream.. Stays fresh in fridge for atleast a week.

name: Badam Halwa
description: Badam halwa is a rich Indian dessert made with almonds, sugar, and ghee. Almonds are soaked, ground to a paste, and cooked with sugar syrup until it thickens. Ghee is added throughout to give it a luxurious texture and nutty flavor. It's a delicious and festive treat!
ingredients: ALMOND -1 CUP, SUGAR -1 CUP, ROSEWATER-1TABLESPOON, PACHA KARPOORAM-A PINCH, GHEE-1TBSP, MILK -1/4 CUP
instruction: COARSE GRIND THE SKIN PEELED ALMONDS WITH MILK HEAT A THICK BOTTOM PAN AND MELT THE GHEE ADD THE GROUND MIXTURE TO THE HOT GHEE SAUTE IT WELL FOR 10 MIN ADD THE SUGAR,MIX WELL ADD THE ROSEWATER AND THE PACCHAKARPOORAM STIR WELL AND COOK FOR 10 MIN GREASE THE DISH WTH LITTLE GHEE AND POUR THE HALWA SERVE THE DELICIOUS HALWA

name: Kala Jamun
description: Kala jamun is a rich Indian dessert that combines fried dough balls with a fragrant sugar syrup. Imagine bite-sized, deep-fried dumplings made with a base of milk solids, flavored with cardamom and saffron, then dunked in a sweet, cardamom-scented syrup. The result is a soft, melt-in-your-mouth treat with a beautiful deep brown color.
ingredients: Khoya - 2 cups, Paneer - 3/4 cups, Plain flour - 2-3 tbsp (all pupose flour), Cardamom powder - 1/2 tsp, Milk to bind, approx 1-2 tbsp, Sugar - 2 1/2 cups, Water - 4 cups, Pinch of saffron, Few drops of rose essence
instruction: Shred the Khoya and Paneer and mix them well together. Add the flour, cardamom powder, and mix them well. Use milk to bind them well. Make sure the dough you prepare is soft and tender. It should not be dry, else it will break when you fry them in ghee. Now prepare the sugar syrup. Bring water to boil and add sugar. Bring to medium flame until the syrup reaches single thread consistency. To this syrup add the rose essence and the saffron. Make sure you keep this syrup warm or else it will crystalise. Now make small balls, or to your desired size. Let the ball surface be as smooth as you can make them. Heat Ghee in a frying pan - you will feel the difference by using ghee. This is the authentic preparation too! Once it is hot, reduce to low flame and gently drop the jamun balls in the ghee. Let it cook slowly. This will take some time, only then Jamun will get cooked in the inside. You will know once done, the below one will take some more time. It is half way through, we don't want half cooked. It is very important that you cook in low flame. Now, once done transfer to the syrup immediately. More important thing is, the syrup should be maintained more than warm for the jamuns to absorb the sugar. What I suggest is, you keep them in a preheated oven or use a double broiler to keep them warm. I wanted to share the speciality and a silly sentiment attached to this sweet. Of all sweets my favorite sweets is Badhusha. I like Kala Jamuns when I was carrying Hasini. she had plenty of them right from my tummy. Back to our recipe, Let this get soaked in syrup for couple of hours. You can taste one for testing, nice way to treat yourself before anyone does. This much soaking is more than enough.

name: Fried Green Peas
description: Fresh green peas are coated in a light batter or seasoned flour, then fried until crispy on the outside and tender within. This quick side dish offers a delightful pop of green and a satisfying crunch.
ingredients: Fresh Green Peas 150 gms, Red Onion 1 midium sized chopped finely, Potato 1 midium sized, chopped in 1-1.5 cm cubes, Green chillies 3 chopped finely, Cumin 1 tea spoon, salt, sugar, 5 table spoon cooking oil
