instruction: In a frying pan add oil when hot add cumin seeds than chillies. let the chillies change color slightly than add chopped onions and chopped potatoes. fry until potatoes are start getting soft. now add Peas, half tea spoon salt(to taste) and pinch of sugar. cover the pan as peas will tend to come out, and fry for about 3-4 mins. Enjoy....

name: Dhoodh Peda
description: Doodh peda is a melt-in-your-mouth Indian sweet made by simmering milk and sugar down to a thick paste. It's flavored with cardamom and sometimes saffron, then rolled into balls for a delightful treat.
ingredients: 1 litre milk, 200 gms of sugar, 1 tbsp. of corn flour, 1 tbsp. of butter, 1/2 tsp. cardamom powder, 1 tbsp. of grated dry fruits and nuts
instruction: Thick bottom pan is usually preferred. Add the milk to the pan an reduce to half the quantity. Dilute the corn flour using little amount of water. Add the diluted corn flour , sugar and butter. Keep stirring continuously. At one stage the mix will become thick. At this stage remove it from the flame and smash it evenly with out any lumps. Allow it to cool down. Knead the khoya adding the cardamom powder . Also add the dry fruits and nuts. Make pedas in desired shapes. Garnish it with grated pistas. The green colour of pista and the semi-white colour of peda goes well.

name: Bharwa Karela
description: Bharwa Karela is a dish of bitter gourd (karela) stuffed with a savory and spicy masala. The bitter gourd is hollowed out, seasoned to reduce bitterness, then filled with a mixture of spiced vegetables, lentils, and herbs. These stuffed gourds are then pan-fried or simmered in a flavorful sauce for a delicious and slightly bitter side dish.
ingredients: 4 medium-sized bitter gourds (karela) , 2 tablespoons oil , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 green chilies, chopped , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1 teaspoon cumin powder , 1 teaspoon amchur (dry mango powder) , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish , For the stuffing: , 1 cup besan (gram flour) , 1 tablespoon fennel seeds (saunf), crushed , 1 tablespoon coriander seeds, crushed , 1 tablespoon roasted peanuts, crushed , 1 teaspoon garam masala powder , Salt to taste
instruction: Wash the bitter gourds and scrape off the rough outer skin. Slit each bitter gourd lengthwise and remove the seeds. In a bowl, mix all the stuffing ingredients until well combined. Stuff each bitter gourd with the prepared stuffing mixture. Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Let them splutter. Add chopped onions and green chilies. Saute until onions turn golden brown. Stir in ginger-garlic paste and saute for a minute. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, amchur, and salt. Mix well. Carefully place the stuffed bitter gourds in the pan. Cover and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes or until the bitter gourds are tender. Occasionally, gently turn the bitter gourds to ensure even cooking. Once cooked, garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with chapati or rice.

name: Capsicum Rice
description: Capsicum rice is a flavorful dish made by sautéing capsicum (bell peppers) with spices and mixing them with cooked rice. It's a simple yet delicious recipe where the vibrant colors and distinct flavor of capsicum elevate the taste of the rice.
ingredients: 1 cup Basmati rice , 2 cups water , 2 tablespoons cooking oil , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 2 bell peppers (capsicums), diced (use a mix of colors for visual appeal) , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , Salt to taste , Fresh cilantro (coriander) leaves for garnish
instruction: Rinse the basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Drain and set aside. In a large pot, heat the cooking oil over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and sauté until they begin to sizzle. Add the chopped onions and minced garlic to the pot. Cook until the onions are translucent. Stir in the diced bell peppers and cook for another 2-3 minutes until they begin to soften. Add the rinsed basmati rice to the pot and stir well to coat the rice with the vegetables and oil. Sprinkle the turmeric powder and coriander powder over the rice mixture. Season with salt to taste. Pour in the water and bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover the pot with a lid, and let it simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked through and all the water is absorbed. Once the rice is cooked, fluff it with a fork and garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving. Serve hot as a main dish or as a side dish with your favorite curry or yogurt raita.

name: Methi Pulao
description: Methi Pulao is a fragrant rice dish made with fresh fenugreek leaves. It involves sautéing onions, garlic, and spices, then adding washed rice and fenugreek leaves along with water. The mixture is cooked until the rice is tender and flavored with the earthy bitterness of fenugreek. It's a nutritious and aromatic dish often served with yogurt or raita.
ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice , 1 bunch fresh fenugreek leaves (methi), washed and chopped , 1 onion, thinly sliced , 2 green chilies, slit , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1-inch piece ginger, grated , 1 tomato, chopped , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , Salt to taste , 2 cups water , 2 tablespoons oil
instruction: Wash the basmati rice thoroughly and soak it in water for 20 minutes. Drain and set aside. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add sliced onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Sauté for a minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy. Now add chopped fenugreek leaves (methi) and cook for 2-3 minutes until they wilt. Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. Add soaked and drained basmati rice to the pan. Stir gently to coat the rice with the masala mixture. Pour 2 cups of water into the pan and stir. Bring the mixture to a boil. Once it starts boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover the pan with a lid, and let it simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and water is absorbed. Once done, turn off the heat and let the pulao rest for 5 minutes. Fluff the pulao gently with a fork and serve hot with raita or any curry of your choice.

name: Paneer Roll
description: Paneer roll is a popular Indian snack made with paneer (Indian cottage cheese) wrapped in a soft roti (Indian flatbread).
ingredients: 200g paneer (Indian cottage cheese), crumbled , 1 large onion, finely chopped , 1 large tomato, finely chopped , 2-3 green chilies, finely chopped , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons cooking oil , 4-6 whole wheat tortillas or rotis , Fresh coriander leaves, chopped (for garnish) , Mint chutney or ketchup (for serving)
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Sauté for another minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy. Add crumbled paneer, cumin powder, garam masala, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes. Sprinkle chopped coriander leaves and remove from heat. Warm the tortillas or rotis on a griddle or in a microwave. Place a portion of the paneer mixture in the center of each tortilla or roti. Roll the tortilla tightly, securing the filling inside. Serve hot with mint chutney or ketchup.

name: Arbi Sabji
description: Arbi sabji is a savory Indian dish featuring taro root (arbi) cooked with aromatic spices. Imagine tender arbi pieces bathed in a warm, flavorful masala for a delightful side dish.
ingredients: 500g taro roots (arbi), peeled and sliced , 2 tablespoons vegetable oil , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon mustard seeds , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 2 green chilies, slit , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and mustard seeds. Let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent. Add chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until tomatoes are soft and mushy. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Mix well and cook for 2 minutes. Add sliced taro roots (arbi) to the pan. Stir to coat the taro roots with the spice mixture. Cover the pan and cook on low heat for about 15-20 minutes or until the taro roots are tender, stirring occasionally. Once the taro roots are cooked, garnish with fresh cilantro leaves. Serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Paneer Bhurji Gravy
description: Paneer bhurji gravy is a vegetarian dish with savory scrambled cottage cheese in a spiced tomato and onion sauce. Unlike the classic drier version, this gravy is richer and pairs well with breads like roti or paratha.
ingredients: 200g paneer (cottage cheese), crumbled , 2 onions, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, pureed , 1 green chili, finely chopped , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons oil , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Let them crackle. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and chopped green chili. Sauté for another minute. Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates from the masala. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. Add crumbled paneer and garam masala. Mix gently. Add water to adjust the consistency of the gravy. Simmer for 5-7 minutes. Garnish with freshly chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Matar Paratha
description: Matar paratha is a delicious flatbread stuffed with spiced green peas. It's made with whole wheat flour dough wrapped around a savory filling of mashed peas, aromatics, and spices. Cooked on a griddle until golden brown and flaky, it's a satisfying and flavorful meal.
ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour , 1 cup fresh or frozen green peas (matar), boiled and mashed , 1 small onion, finely chopped , 2-3 green chilies, finely chopped , 2 tablespoons fresh coriander leaves, chopped , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , Salt to taste , Ghee or oil for cooking
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine whole wheat flour, mashed green peas, chopped onion, green chilies, coriander leaves, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Gradually add water and knead into a soft dough. Let it rest for 15-20 minutes. Divide the dough into equal-sized balls and roll each ball into a circle using a rolling pin, dusting with flour as needed to prevent sticking. Heat a griddle or tawa over medium heat. Place a rolled paratha on the hot griddle and cook until bubbles appear on the surface. Flip the paratha and spread some ghee or oil on the cooked side. Cook until both sides are golden brown and crispy. Repeat the process with the remaining dough balls. Serve hot with yogurt, pickle, or any chutney of your choice.

name: Oats Chilla
description: Oats chilla is a savory Indian pancake made with a batter of ground oats, gram flour (chickpea flour), and vegetables. It's a healthy and quick breakfast option that's packed with flavor.
ingredients: 1 cup rolled oats , 1/2 cup gram flour (besan) , 1/4 cup finely chopped onions , 1/4 cup finely chopped tomatoes , 1/4 cup finely chopped bell peppers (capsicum) , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , 2 tablespoons chopped fresh coriander leaves , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder , Salt to taste , Water as needed , Cooking oil for greasing
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine rolled oats, gram flour, chopped onions, tomatoes, bell peppers, green chilies, coriander leaves, turmeric powder, cumin powder, and salt. Gradually add water and mix well to form a smooth batter with a pouring consistency. Heat a non-stick skillet or tawa over medium heat and grease it lightly with oil. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the skillet and spread it evenly to form a thin circle. Drizzle a little oil around the edges and cook for 2-3 minutes until the bottom turns golden brown. Flip the chilla carefully using a spatula and cook the other side for another 2-3 minutes until cooked through. Repeat the process with the remaining batter to make more chillas. Serve hot with chutney or yogurt.

name: Biryani Rice
description: Biryani rice is a flavorful and aromatic rice dish cooked with fragrant spices like cardamom, cloves, and bay leaves. It's often layered with fried onions, nuts, and fresh herbs for a textural contrast.
ingredients: 2 cups Basmati rice , 1 large onion, thinly sliced , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 1 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, potatoes) , 1/4 cup yogurt , 2 tablespoons biryani masala , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 1/4 cup chopped cilantro , 1/4 cup mint leaves , 2 tablespoons ghee or vegetable oil , Whole spices (2 cloves, 2 cardamom pods, 1 cinnamon stick) , Salt to taste , Saffron strands soaked in warm milk (optional)
instruction: Wash the Basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes, then drain. In a large skillet or pot, heat the ghee or oil over medium heat. Add the whole spices and sauté until fragrant. Add the sliced onions and cook until golden brown. Stir in the ginger-garlic paste and cook for another minute. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften. Mix in the mixed vegetables, biryani masala, yogurt, cilantro, and mint leaves. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the drained Basmati rice to the pot and gently stir to combine with the vegetables and spices. Pour in 4 cups of water and season with salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the water is absorbed. Once cooked, fluff the rice with a fork and let it sit covered for another 5 minutes. Serve the biryani rice hot, garnished with saffron-infused milk if desired.

name: Paratha
description: Paratha is a layered flatbread from India. It's made with whole wheat flour dough that's rolled out, layered with fat like ghee, and folded to create flaky layers. These layers are then cooked on a griddle until golden brown and delicious.
ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour , Water (as needed) , 2 tablespoons ghee or oil , Salt to taste
instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour and salt. Gradually add water and knead the dough until it becomes soft and pliable. The dough should be firm, but not too stiff. Divide the dough into equal-sized balls, roughly the size of a lemon. Roll out each ball into a small circle using a rolling pin and some dry flour to prevent sticking. Spread a teaspoon of ghee or oil over the rolled-out dough circle. Fold the dough circle into half, then fold it again to form a triangle. Roll out the triangle gently into a larger triangle, ensuring it doesn't stick to the surface. Heat a skillet or tawa over medium heat and place the rolled-out paratha on it. Cook the paratha on one side until small bubbles start to form. Flip the paratha and spread a teaspoon of ghee or oil on the cooked side. Cook the other side until it turns golden brown and crispy. Repeat the process with the remaining dough balls. Serve hot with your favorite curry, chutney, or yogurt.

name: Shakarpara
description: Shakarpara is a sweet, crunchy Indian snack perfect for tea time. Imagine diamond-shaped, flaky cookies made with flour, dipped in a sugary syrup for a delightful bite.
ingredients: 1 cup all-purpose flour , 1/4 cup semolina , 1/4 cup powdered sugar , 1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder , 2 tablespoons ghee (clarified butter) , Water, as needed , Oil for deep frying
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, semolina, powdered sugar, and cardamom powder. Add ghee and mix well until the mixture resembles bread crumbs. Gradually add water and knead into a stiff dough. Cover the dough and let it rest for 15-20 minutes. Divide the dough into small portions and roll each portion into a thin circle. Use a knife or pizza cutter to cut the rolled dough into small diamond or square shapes. Heat oil in a deep pan over medium heat for frying. Once the oil is hot, carefully drop the shaped dough into the hot oil in batches. Fry until the shakarpara turns golden brown and crispy. Remove from oil and drain on paper towels to remove excess oil. Allow it to cool completely before serving or storing in an airtight container.

name: Paneer Korma
description: Paneer korma is a decadent vegetarian dish featuring cubes of paneer (Indian cottage cheese) simmered in a creamy, fragrant sauce. This rich gravy is typically made with nuts, yogurt, spices, and sometimes coconut milk, offering a delightful mix of sweet, savory, and aromatic flavors.
ingredients: 200g paneer (cottage cheese), cubed , 2 onions, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, pureed , 1/2 cup yogurt , 1/4 cup cashews, soaked and ground into a paste , 2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , 2 tablespoons vegetable oil , Salt to taste , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for another minute. Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates. Stir in coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook for 2 minutes. Add cashew paste and yogurt. Mix well and cook for 3-4 minutes. Add cubed paneer and garam masala. Stir gently to coat the paneer with the gravy. Cover and cook for 5-7 minutes on low heat until the paneer is heated through. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Chawal Ke Pakode
description: Chawal ke Pakode are crispy fritters made with leftover cooked rice. They're a delicious way to transform leftover rice into a tasty snack. Imagine golden fried rice patties packed with flavor!
ingredients: 1 cup leftover cooked rice , 1/2 cup chickpea flour (besan) , 1 small onion, finely chopped , 1 green chili, finely chopped (adjust according to taste) , 2 tablespoons chopped coriander leaves , 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1/4 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust according to taste) , Salt to taste , Oil for frying
instruction: In a mixing bowl, mash the leftover cooked rice using a fork or your hands. Add chickpea flour, chopped onion, green chili, coriander leaves, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt to the mashed rice. Mix well to form a thick batter. If the batter feels too dry, you can add a little water to adjust the consistency. Heat oil in a deep frying pan or kadhai over medium heat. Take small portions of the batter and shape them into round pakoras or fritters. Carefully slide the pakoras into the hot oil and fry them until they turn golden brown and crispy on all sides. Make sure to fry them in batches to avoid overcrowding the pan. Once done, remove the pakoras from the oil using a slotted spoon and drain excess oil on paper towels. Serve hot with your favorite chutney or sauce.

name: Jeera Rice
description: Jeera rice, also known as cumin rice, is a simple and flavorful Indian dish made with basmati rice, cumin seeds, and ghee (or oil). The rice is cooked with aromatic cumin seeds for a warm, earthy flavor. It's a fluffy and delicious side dish perfect for any curry.
ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice , 2 cups water , 1 tablespoon ghee or clarified butter , 1 tablespoon cumin seeds (jeera) , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish (optional)
instruction: Rinse the basmati rice under running water until the water runs clear. Drain and set aside. In a large saucepan, heat the ghee over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and sauté until they start to sizzle and become fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the drained rice to the saucepan and stir well to coat the rice with the ghee and cumin seeds. Pour in the water and add salt to taste. Bring to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover the saucepan with a tight-fitting lid, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the water is absorbed. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it sit, covered, for another 5 minutes. Fluff the rice with a fork and transfer it to a serving dish. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves if desired. Serve hot as a side dish with your favorite curry or dal.

name: Poha Cutlet
description: Poha cutlets are crispy fritters made from flattened rice (poha), mashed potato, and vegetables. They're a delicious and savory snack or light meal.
ingredients: 1 cup thick Poha (flattened rice) , 2 medium potatoes, boiled and mashed , 1/2 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, corn), finely chopped , 1 small onion, finely chopped , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , 1/2 teaspoon ginger paste , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons coriander leaves, finely chopped , 2 tablespoons bread crumbs , Oil for shallow frying
instruction: Rinse the poha under running water and drain well. Let it sit for 5 minutes to soften. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened poha, mashed potatoes, mixed vegetables, chopped onion, green chilies, ginger paste, turmeric powder, coriander powder, garam masala, salt, and chopped coriander leaves. Mix well to form a dough-like consistency. Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into round or oval cutlets. Spread the bread crumbs on a plate. Roll each cutlet in the bread crumbs to coat evenly. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat for shallow frying. Once the oil is hot, carefully place the cutlets in the pan in a single layer. Shallow fry the cutlets until golden brown and crispy on both sides, flipping them occasionally. This usually takes about 3-4 minutes on each side. Once done, transfer the fried cutlets to a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess oil. Serve the crispy poha cutlets hot with your favorite chutney or sauce.

name: Palak Rice
description: Palak rice, also known as spinach rice, is a vibrant green dish made with fragrant rice cooked in a flavorful spinach puree. The spinach puree is often spiced with aromatics like ginger, garlic, and chilies for a delicious twist.
ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice , 2 cups spinach (palak), finely chopped , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , 1-inch ginger, grated , 3 cloves garlic, minced , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons cooking oil , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Rinse the basmati rice under running water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for 15 minutes, then drain and set aside. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for another 2 minutes. Add finely chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy and the oil separates. Now, add finely chopped spinach (palak) to the pan. Cook until the spinach wilts and reduces in volume. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt to taste. Mix well. Add the soaked and drained basmati rice to the pan. Stir gently to coat the rice evenly with the spinach mixture. Pour 2 cups of water into the pan and bring it to a boil. Once it starts boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and let it simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and all the water is absorbed. Once the rice is cooked, fluff it gently with a fork. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with raita or your favorite side dish.

name: Mooli Paratha
description: Mooli paratha is a savory Indian flatbread stuffed with grated white radish (mooli). It's a delicious and comforting dish made with simple ingredients.
ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour , 1 medium-sized radish (mooli), grated , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , 2 tablespoons chopped coriander leaves , 1 teaspoon grated ginger , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , Ghee or oil for cooking
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine the grated radish, green chilies, coriander leaves, grated ginger, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Gradually add the whole wheat flour to the mixture and knead it into a smooth dough. Add water as needed. Divide the dough into equal-sized balls. Roll out each ball into a small circle. Place a portion of the radish mixture in the center of each circle. Bring the edges of the circle together to seal the filling inside and flatten the stuffed dough ball. Roll out the stuffed dough ball into a paratha. Heat a griddle or tawa over medium heat and cook the paratha on both sides, applying ghee or oil until golden brown spots appear. Repeat the process with the remaining dough and filling. Serve hot with yogurt, pickle, or chutney.

name: Dry Fruit Barfi
description: Dry Fruit Barfi is a rich and decadent Indian sweet made with chopped nuts and dried fruits, bound together with condensed milk or milk cooked down to a thick consistency. It's a delicious treat with a delightful textural contrast of chewy and crunchy.
ingredients: 1 cup mixed dry fruits (almonds, cashews, pistachios, walnuts, etc.) , 1 cup grated khoya (mawa) , 1/2 cup sugar , 1/4 cup water , 1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder , 1 tablespoon ghee (clarified butter) for greasing
instruction: Chop the mixed dry fruits finely or grind them coarsely in a food processor. Heat ghee in a pan and roast the mixed dry fruits for 2-3 minutes until fragrant. In another pan, heat khoya on low flame until it becomes soft and crumbly. Add sugar and water to the khoya, stirring continuously until the sugar dissolves and the mixture thickens. Add roasted dry fruits and cardamom powder to the khoya mixture and mix well. Cook the mixture on low heat, stirring constantly until it forms a thick dough-like consistency. Grease a plate with ghee and spread the mixture evenly on it. Let it cool down completely and then cut it into square or diamond shapes. Dry Fruit Barfi is ready to serve. Enjoy!

name: Palak Saag
description: Palak Saag is a vibrant green dish made with wilted spinach leaves cooked in a rich blend of spices. It often features aromatics like onions, ginger, and garlic, and can be finished with a touch of cream for a luxurious feel.
ingredients: 500g spinach (palak), washed and chopped , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 2 green chilies, chopped , 3 cloves garlic, minced , 1-inch ginger, grated , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons oil or ghee
instruction: Heat oil or ghee in a pan and add cumin seeds. Let them crackle. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add minced garlic and grated ginger. Sauté for a minute. Add chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until tomatoes are soft and mushy. Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well. Add chopped spinach (palak) to the pan. Stir well. Cover and cook for about 10-15 minutes on low heat until spinach is completely wilted. Once the spinach is cooked, mash it lightly with the back of a spoon or a potato masher. Sprinkle garam masala on top and mix well. Cook for another 5 minutes. Serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Roasted Makhana
description: Roasted makhana is a simple and healthy snack made with fox nuts (makhana) dry roasted until crisp, then tossed in warm spices for a flavorful crunch.
ingredients: 2 cups makhana (fox nuts) , 1 tablespoon ghee (clarified butter) or olive oil , Salt to taste , 1/2 teaspoon black pepper powder (optional) , 1/2 teaspoon chaat masala (optional)
instruction: Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat. Add ghee or olive oil to the pan. Once the ghee/oil is hot, add the makhana to the pan. Roast the makhana on low to medium heat, stirring continuously to prevent burning, for about 8-10 minutes or until they become crisp. Sprinkle salt, black pepper powder, and chaat masala over the roasted makhana. Mix well. Remove the roasted makhana from the pan and let them cool completely. Once cooled, store the roasted makhana in an airtight container.

name: Methi Puri
description: Methi puri is a crispy fried flatbread flavored with fragrant fenugreek leaves. Imagine a savory and puffy poori that gets its unique taste from these delightful herbs.
ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour , 1 cup fresh fenugreek leaves (finely chopped) , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , Salt to taste , Water (as needed for kneading) , Oil for deep frying
instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine whole wheat flour, chopped fenugreek leaves, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Gradually add water and knead the mixture to form a smooth and firm dough. Divide the dough into small lemon-sized balls and roll them out into small puris using a rolling pin. Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat. Once the oil is hot, carefully slide in the rolled puris and fry them until they puff up and turn golden brown on both sides. Remove the puris using a slotted spoon and drain excess oil on paper towels. Serve hot Methi Puris with your favorite curry or chutney.

name: Gond Ke Laddu
description: Gond Ke Laddu are energy balls packed with goodness! Made with roasted nuts, fragrant coconut, and edible gum (gond), they're bound with melted jaggery or sugar for a sweet and nutritious treat.
ingredients: 1 cup wheat flour , 1/2 cup edible gum (gond) , 1/2 cup ghee (clarified butter) , 1/2 cup almonds, chopped , 1/2 cup cashews, chopped , 1/2 cup raisins , 1 cup powdered sugar , 1 teaspoon cardamom powder , Saffron strands (optional)
instruction: Heat ghee in a pan and fry the edible gum (gond) until it puffs up. Remove from the pan and keep aside. In the same pan, roast the wheat flour until it turns golden brown and aromatic. Remove from heat and let it cool. In a separate pan, lightly roast the chopped almonds, cashews, and raisins. Remove and keep aside. Crush the fried edible gum into small pieces using a mortar and pestle. In a large mixing bowl, combine the roasted wheat flour, powdered sugar, crushed edible gum, roasted nuts, raisins, cardamom powder, and saffron strands (if using). Mix well until all the ingredients are evenly combined. Take small portions of the mixture and shape them into laddus (round balls) while the mixture is still warm. Allow the laddus to cool completely before serving.

name: Shimla Mirch Ki Sabji
description: Shimla Mirch Ki Sabzi is a vibrant stir-fry made with colorful bell peppers (Shimla Mirch) simmered in a fragrant blend of warming spices, onions, tomatoes, and fresh ginger-garlic. This simple dish pairs perfectly with rotis or rice for a delightful vegetarian meal.
ingredients: 4 medium-sized green bell peppers (Shimla mirch) , 2 medium-sized onions, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 2 green chilies, chopped , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons cooking oil , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Wash and chop the green bell peppers into medium-sized pieces. Remove seeds if preferred. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent. Add ginger-garlic paste and chopped green chilies. Sauté for a minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. Add chopped bell peppers and stir to combine with the spices. Cover and cook the bell peppers until they are tender, stirring occasionally. Once the bell peppers are cooked, sprinkle garam masala and mix gently. Garnish with freshly chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Aloo Bhindi
description: Aloo Bhindi is a classic Indian dish that combines tender potatoes (aloo) and okra (bhindi) in a flavorful, spiced mix. This dry curry (sabzi) can be made simply with onions, chilies, and basic spices, or with a richer base of tomatoes and ginger-garlic paste. The okra adds a slight crunch, while the potatoes become soft and absorb the delicious masala. It's a vegetarian side dish perfect for any occasion.
ingredients: 250g okra (bhindi), washed and chopped , 2 medium-sized potatoes (aloo), peeled and diced , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 2-3 green chilies, slit lengthwise , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons oil , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add diced potatoes to the pan and fry until they start to turn golden brown. Now, add chopped tomatoes, green chilies, turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well and cook until tomatoes are soft and oil separates from the masala. Add chopped okra to the pan and mix gently with the masala. Cover the pan with a lid and cook on low heat for about 10-15 minutes or until the okra is cooked through and tender, stirring occasionally. Once the okra and potatoes are cooked, garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Punjabi Wadi
description: Punjabi Wadi is a flavorful and versatile lentil-based dish from Punjab, India. Made with ground urad dal (black gram) and aromatic spices, these sun-dried dumplings add a unique savory twist to various recipes. Enjoy them fried in curries, crumbled in stir-fries, or simply savor them as a protein-rich snack.
ingredients: 1 cup Punjabi wadi (sun-dried lentil dumplings) , 2 tablespoons oil , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, pureed , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for another minute. Stir in the tomato puree and cook until oil separates from the masala. Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. Crumble the Punjabi wadi and add it to the pan. Mix with the masala. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the wadi is well-coated with the masala. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Tomato Pulao
description: Tomato Pulao is a flavorful one-pot rice dish featuring tangy tomatoes as the star ingredient. This vegetarian dish combines fluffy rice with aromatic spices, often including cumin, coriander, and turmeric, for a satisfying and colorful meal.
ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 1 onion, thinly sliced , 2 green chilies, slit lengthwise , 1-inch ginger, finely chopped , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 2 tablespoons oil , Salt to taste , 2 cups water , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Rinse the basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes, then drain and set aside. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add the sliced onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add the chopped tomatoes, green chilies, ginger, and garlic. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and mushy. Add the turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well and cook for another 2 minutes. Add the soaked basmati rice to the pan and sauté for 2 minutes, ensuring the rice is well coated with the tomato mixture. Pour in the water and stir gently. Bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and let the rice cook for 15-20 minutes or until the rice is tender and all the water is absorbed. Once done, remove the pan from heat and let it sit covered for another 5 minutes. Fluff the rice with a fork, garnish with fresh coriander leaves, and serve hot.

name: Dry Jamun
description: Dry Jamun is a delightful Indian dessert with a unique twist. Imagine soft, fried dough balls flavored with cardamom and saffron, then coated in a light sugar syrup instead of being soaked in it. These sweet treats offer a delightful textural contrast - crisp on the outside, melt-in-your-mouth soft on the inside - with a burst of fragrant sweetness.
ingredients: 1 cup milk powder , 1/4 cup all-purpose flour , 1/4 teaspoon baking powder , 2 tablespoons ghee (clarified butter) , 1/4 cup milk (adjust quantity as needed) , 1/2 cup powdered sugar , 1/2 teaspoon cardamom powder , Sliced almonds or pistachios for garnish (optional)
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine milk powder, all-purpose flour, and baking powder. Heat ghee in a pan and add it to the dry mixture. Mix well. Slowly add milk and knead the mixture into a smooth dough. Add more milk if needed to achieve the right consistency. Divide the dough into small equal-sized balls and roll them between your palms to make smooth balls. Heat ghee in a frying pan over low-medium heat. Fry the dough balls until golden brown, turning occasionally to ensure even cooking. Once fried, remove the balls from the ghee and let them cool for a few minutes. In another pan, heat powdered sugar with a little water to make a thick syrup. Add cardamom powder to the syrup. Dip the fried dough balls into the sugar syrup, ensuring they are well-coated. Garnish with sliced almonds or pistachios if desired. Let the Dry Jamuns cool completely before serving.

name: Dahi Bhalla
description: Dahi Bhalla is a delightful Indian street food combining fluffy lentil fritters (bhalla) drenched in creamy yogurt (dahi). The dish is a symphony of textures with contrasting soft vadas and cool yogurt, perked up by tangy and spicy chutneys.
ingredients: 1 cup urad dal (black gram lentils), soaked overnight , 1 cup moong dal (split mung beans), soaked overnight , 2 cups thick yogurt (curd) , 1 tsp cumin powder , 1 tsp chaat masala , 1 tsp red chili powder , Salt to taste , Tamarind chutney and mint chutney for serving , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish , Oil for deep frying
instruction: Drain the soaked lentils and grind them to a smooth paste using a little water if needed. The consistency should be thick yet pourable. Heat oil in a deep frying pan. Take small portions of the lentil batter and drop them into the hot oil using a spoon. Fry the vadas (balls) until they turn golden brown and crispy. Remove them from the oil and drain excess oil on paper towels. Soak the fried vadas in lukewarm water for about 10-15 minutes until they become soft. Beat the yogurt until smooth and add salt to taste. Squeeze out the excess water from the soaked vadas and arrange them on a serving plate. Pour the beaten yogurt over the vadas generously. Sprinkle cumin powder, chaat masala, and red chili powder over the yogurt. Drizzle tamarind chutney and mint chutney over the yogurt. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve chilled and enjoy!

name: Chana Pulao
description: Chana Pulao is a flavorful one-pot rice dish featuring fluffy basmati rice cooked with savory chickpeas, aromatic spices, and sometimes vegetables. The chickpeas add a delightful protein boost, while the spices create a warm and inviting aroma.
ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice, soaked for 30 minutes , 1 cup cooked chickpeas (canned or boiled) , 1 onion, finely chopped , 1 tomato, chopped , 2 green chilies, slit , 1-inch ginger, minced , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 cinnamon stick , 2-3 green cardamom pods , 4-5 whole cloves , 1 bay leaf , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons oil or ghee , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil or ghee in a large pan or pressure cooker over medium heat. Add cumin seeds, cinnamon stick, cardamom pods, cloves, and bay leaf. Saute for a minute until fragrant. Add chopped onions and saute until they turn golden brown. Add minced ginger and garlic, slit green chilies, and chopped tomatoes. Cook until tomatoes are soft and oil starts to separate. Add turmeric powder and garam masala. Mix well. Drain the soaked rice and add it to the pan along with cooked chickpeas. Stir gently to combine. Add 2 cups of water and salt to taste. Stir, cover, and cook until rice is tender and water is absorbed. If using a pressure cooker, cook for 2 whistles. Once done, fluff the pulao gently with a fork. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with yogurt or raita.

name: Easy Aloo Ki Sabji
description: Comforting Potato Curry: Tender potatoes cooked with aromatic spices like cumin and turmeric, for a simple and flavorful side dish.
ingredients: 4 medium-sized potatoes, peeled and diced , 2 tablespoons oil , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust according to taste) , Salt to taste , Chopped cilantro leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add diced potatoes to the pan and stir well. Cook the potatoes for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they start to turn golden brown. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt to the pan. Mix well to coat the potatoes evenly with the spices. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and let the potatoes cook for about 10-15 minutes, or until they are tender, stirring occasionally. Once the potatoes are cooked through, remove the lid and cook for another 2-3 minutes to crisp up the edges, if desired. Garnish with chopped cilantro leaves before serving. Serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Tandoori Roti
description: Tandoori roti is a classic Indian flatbread made with whole wheat flour. Unlike regular roti, it gets its signature touch by being cooked in a tandoor (clay oven), resulting in a slightly puffed and smoky flavor. You can recreate this taste at home using a pan or skillet.
ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour , 1 teaspoon salt , Water (as needed for kneading) , Ghee or butter (for brushing)
instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour and salt. Gradually add water and knead the dough until it's smooth and elastic. The dough should be soft but not sticky. Divide the dough into equal-sized balls and roll them into smooth balls. Preheat a tandoor oven or a grill to high heat. If using a grill, make sure it's well heated. Roll out each dough ball into a thin circle, about 6-8 inches in diameter. Carefully place the rolled-out dough onto the hot tandoor oven or grill. Cook for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until the roti puffs up and gets golden brown spots. Once cooked, remove the roti from the tandoor oven or grill and brush with ghee or butter for extra flavor. Serve hot with your favorite curry or yogurt.

name: Aloo Gajar Matar
description: Aloo Gajar Matar is a classic Indian comfort dish featuring a trio of wholesome vegetables: potatoes (aloo), carrots (gajar), and green peas (matar). Fragrant spices and aromatics simmer the vegetables together creating a flavorful and colorful curry.
ingredients: 2 medium potatoes, peeled and diced , 2 medium carrots, peeled and diced , 1 cup green peas (fresh or frozen) , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1-inch piece of ginger, grated , 2 green chilies, finely chopped (optional) , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons oil , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies (if using). Sauté for another minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add diced potatoes, carrots, and green peas. Stir to coat the vegetables with the spices. Pour in 1 cup of water and mix well. Cover the pan and let the vegetables cook until tender, stirring occasionally. This will take about 15-20 minutes. Once the vegetables are cooked and the curry reaches your desired consistency, sprinkle garam masala and mix well. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves. Serve hot with rice or chapati.

name: Palak Mushroom
description: Palak Mushroom is a flavorful Indian curry that combines earthy mushrooms with a creamy spinach gravy. The spinach is pureed into a vibrant green sauce, often spiced with aromatics like ginger, garlic, and warm Indian spices. This vegetarian dish is a delightful blend of textures and tastes.
ingredients: 250 grams mushrooms, sliced , 200 grams spinach (palak), finely chopped , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons oil
instruction: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Let them crackle. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Sauté for a minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy. Now add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Mix well. Add chopped spinach and cook until wilted. Add sliced mushrooms and salt. Mix well. Cover and cook for 8-10 minutes or until mushrooms are cooked and the gravy thickens. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Paneer Curry
description: Paneer curry is a flavorful vegetarian dish made with cubes of paneer (Indian cottage cheese) in a rich andromatic sauce. The base typically involves fragrant spices like cumin, coriander, and garam masala simmered with onions, tomatoes, and sometimes cashews or cream to create a smooth and creamy texture. The paneer is pan-fried or baked for a delightful textural contrast.
ingredients: 250g paneer, cubed , 2 onions, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, pureed , 2 green chilies, chopped , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons oil , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Sauté for 2 minutes. Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. Add cubed paneer and mix gently to coat with the masala. Cover and cook for 5-7 minutes on low heat, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with chopped cilantro leaves. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Kachori
description: Kachori is a crispy, deep-fried Indian pastry filled with a savory lentil mixture. The spiced filling, often made with moong dal (lentils), explodes with flavor when paired with the flaky, golden crust.
ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour , 1/4 cup semolina (optional, for extra crispiness) , 1/4 cup ghee or oil , 1/2 teaspoon salt , Water (for kneading dough) , 1 cup yellow split peas (soaked overnight) , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , Salt to taste , Oil for deep frying
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, semolina (if using), ghee or oil, and salt. Gradually add water and knead to form a smooth dough. Cover and let it rest for 15-20 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare the filling. Drain the soaked yellow split peas and blend them into a coarse paste without adding water. Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, and let them splutter. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Saute until fragrant. Add the split pea paste to the pan and cook for 5-7 minutes. Then add coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until the mixture thickens and the raw smell disappears. Remove from heat and let it cool. Divide the dough into equal-sized balls. Roll out each ball into a small circle, about 3-4 inches in diameter. Place a spoonful of the prepared filling in the center of each dough circle. Gather the edges of the dough to cover the filling completely and shape it into a ball. Flatten the filled dough balls slightly using your palms. Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat. Once the oil is hot, gently slide in the prepared kachoris and fry until golden brown and crispy on both sides. Remove the fried kachoris using a slotted spoon and drain excess oil on paper towels. Serve hot with chutney or sauce of your choice.

name: Karela Fry
description: Karela Fry is a crispy and flavorful Indian dish featuring bitter melon (karela) sauteed with aromatic spices.
ingredients: 4 medium-sized bitter gourds (karela) , 2 tablespoons vegetable oil , 1 teaspoon mustard seeds , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , 1 teaspoon amchur (dry mango powder) , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish (optional)
instruction: Wash the bitter gourds thoroughly and slice them into thin rounds. Remove the seeds if desired. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add the sliced bitter gourd to the pan and sauté for 5-7 minutes until they start to soften. Sprinkle turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and amchur over the bitter gourd slices. Mix well to coat evenly. Continue to cook the bitter gourd slices for another 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they turn crispy and golden brown. Once cooked, remove from heat and transfer to a serving dish. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves if desired. Serve hot with roti or rice as a main dish.

name: Aam Ka Murabba
description: Aam Ka Murabba is a sweet and tangy Indian preserve made with unripe mangoes. The mangoes are cooked in a sugar syrup infused with aromatic spices like cardamom and saffron, transforming them into a delicious treat.
ingredients: 1 kg raw mangoes, peeled and diced , 750 grams sugar , 1 tablespoon lemon juice , 1 teaspoon saffron strands , 1 teaspoon cardamom powder , 1/2 teaspoon cloves , 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon powder , 1 cup water
instruction: In a large pot, combine diced mangoes, sugar, lemon juice, saffron strands, cardamom powder, cloves, cinnamon powder, and water. Stir well to mix all the ingredients together. Place the pot over medium heat and bring the mixture to a boil. Once it starts boiling, reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 30-40 minutes or until the mangoes are tender and the syrup thickens. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking and burning. Once the murabba reaches the desired consistency and the mangoes are soft, remove the pot from the heat and let it cool completely. Transfer the cooled murabba into sterilized glass jars and store them in a cool, dry place. Serve the Aam Ka Murabba as a sweet and tangy accompaniment to your meals or as a delicious dessert.

name: Paneer Pulao
description: Paneer Pulao is a flavorful Indian rice dish featuring fluffy basmati rice cooked with savory spices, tender vegetables (often peas), and golden fried cubes of paneer (Indian cottage cheese) for a delightful textural contrast.
ingredients: 1 cup Basmati rice, washed and soaked for 30 minutes , 200g paneer (Indian cottage cheese), cubed , 1 onion, thinly sliced , 1 tomato, chopped , 1 green chili, slit lengthwise (adjust to taste) , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1-inch piece ginger, grated , 1/2 cup green peas (fresh or frozen) , 1/2 cup carrots, diced , 1/2 cup green beans, chopped , 2 tablespoons ghee or oil , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 2 bay leaves , 4-5 whole peppercorns , 2 green cardamom pods , 2 cloves , 1-inch cinnamon stick , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 2 cups water
instruction: Heat ghee or oil in a pan and add cumin seeds, bay leaves, whole peppercorns, green cardamom pods, cloves, and cinnamon stick. Saute for a minute until fragrant. Add sliced onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chili. Saute for another minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy. Now, add diced carrots, chopped green beans, and green peas. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes. Drain the soaked rice and add it to the pan. Stir gently to combine with the vegetables. Add turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt to taste. Mix well. Pour 2 cups of water into the pan and bring it to a boil. Once the water starts boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and let it simmer for about 15 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the water is absorbed. While the rice is cooking, shallow fry the paneer cubes until they turn golden brown from all sides. Once the rice is cooked, gently fluff it with a fork and add the fried paneer cubes on top. Cover the pan and let it sit for a few minutes before serving. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves, if desired. Serve hot with raita or any side dish of your choice.

name: Kathi Roll
description: Kathi roll is a flavorful Indian street food that combines spiced fillings with a flaky flatbread. Imagine tender, marinated meat or veggies grilled to perfection, wrapped up with creamy chutney, crunchy onions, and a squeeze of lime, all tucked inside a buttery paratha.
ingredients: 4 large tortillas or paratha bread , 250 grams boneless chicken (or paneer for vegetarian option), thinly sliced , 1 onion, thinly sliced , 1 capsicum (bell pepper), thinly sliced , 2 tablespoons oil , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves, chopped (for garnish) , Mint chutney and/or tamarind chutney (optional)
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute. Add the sliced onions and cook until they turn translucent. Add the sliced chicken (or paneer) to the pan. Cook until it's cooked through and lightly browned. Add the sliced capsicum and cook for another 2-3 minutes until it's slightly tender. Sprinkle cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well to coat the chicken and veggies evenly with the spices. Cook for another 2-3 minutes. Warm the tortillas or paratha bread in a separate pan or microwave. Place a portion of the cooked chicken (or paneer) and vegetable mixture in the center of each tortilla or paratha. Drizzle some mint chutney and/or tamarind chutney on top (optional). Roll the tortillas tightly, tucking in the sides as you go. Serve hot, garnished with fresh coriander leaves.

name: Masala Khichdi
description: Masala Khichdi is a flavorful Indian comfort food made with rice, lentils, and a warm mix of spices. It's a hearty dish often cooked with vegetables for added texture and nutrients.
ingredients: 1 cup rice , 1/2 cup split yellow lentils (moong dal) , 1 onion, finely chopped , 1 tomato, finely chopped , 1 carrot, diced , 1 potato, diced , 1/2 cup green peas , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , 1-inch piece of ginger, grated , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon mustard seeds , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons ghee (clarified butter) , 4 cups water , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish
instruction: Rinse the rice and lentils together until the water runs clear. Soak them in water for about 15-20 minutes. Drain and set aside. Heat ghee in a pressure cooker over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and mustard seeds. Let them splutter. Add chopped onions, green chilies, ginger, and garlic. Saute until onions turn golden brown. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy. Add diced carrots, potatoes, and green peas. Saute for a few minutes. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well. Add drained rice and lentils to the pressure cooker. Stir to combine with the masala mixture. Pour water into the pressure cooker and close the lid. Cook on high heat until one whistle, then reduce the heat to low and cook for another 10-12 minutes. Turn off the heat and let the pressure release naturally. Once the pressure is released, open the lid and give the khichdi a gentle stir. Serve hot garnished with fresh cilantro leaves.

name: Mushroom Tikka Masala
description: Mushroom Tikka Masala is a flavorful vegetarian twist on a classic Indian dish. Marinated mushrooms are cooked in a creamy tomato sauce infused with aromatic spices like garam masala and turmeric. The result is a rich and comforting curry perfect for serving over rice or with flatbread.
ingredients: 500g mushrooms, cleaned and sliced , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 2 cloves of garlic, minced , 1-inch piece of ginger, grated , 1/2 cup plain yogurt , 2 tablespoons vegetable oil , 1 tablespoon tomato paste , 1 teaspoon ground coriander , 1 teaspoon ground cumin , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon paprika , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish , For the marinade: , 1/2 cup plain yogurt , 1 tablespoon lemon juice , 1 teaspoon ground cumin , 1 teaspoon ground coriander , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon paprika , Salt to taste
instruction: In a bowl, mix together all the ingredients for the marinade. Add sliced mushrooms and coat them well. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes. Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent. Add minced garlic and grated ginger to the pan. Sauté for another minute. Add chopped tomatoes and tomato paste to the pan. Cook until the tomatoes soften and the mixture thickens. Add ground coriander, ground cumin, turmeric powder, paprika, garam masala, and salt to the pan. Stir well to combine the spices with the tomato mixture. Add marinated mushrooms along with any excess marinade to the pan. Cook for 8-10 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender. Stir in plain yogurt and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, ensuring not to let the yogurt boil. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or naan bread.

name: Masala Paratha
description: Masala paratha is a flavorful flatbread made with spiced dough. The dough is kneaded with a vibrant blend of spices like cumin, coriander, turmeric, and chili powder, giving it a warm and savory taste. It's often cooked with ghee or oil, resulting in a crispy and flaky flatbread with a hint of spice.
ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , 1/4 cup fresh coriander leaves, chopped , 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , Water as needed , Ghee or oil for cooking
instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, chopped onion, green chilies, coriander leaves, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Gradually add water to the mixture and knead into a smooth dough. Cover the dough and let it rest for about 10 minutes. Divide the dough into equal-sized balls. Roll out each ball into a circle of about 6-7 inches in diameter using a rolling pin and some dry flour for dusting. Heat a tawa or skillet over medium heat. Place a rolled-out paratha on the hot tawa and cook until bubbles start to appear on the surface. Flip the paratha and spread some ghee or oil on the cooked side. Cook until both sides are golden brown and cooked through, pressing gently with a spatula to ensure even cooking. Remove the cooked paratha from the tawa and place it on a plate. Repeat the process with the remaining dough balls. Serve hot Masala Parathas with yogurt, pickle, or any curry of your choice.

name: Mooli Ki Sabji
description: Mooli Ki Sabzi is a simple and flavorful Indian dish made with radishes (mooli). The radishes are typically stir-fried with spices like cumin, turmeric, and chili powder, for a warm and slightly spicy taste. Some variations might include onions, tomatoes, or even radish greens for added texture and depth.
ingredients: 2 medium-sized radishes (mooli), peeled and grated , 1 tablespoon vegetable oil , 1 teaspoon mustard seeds , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 green chili, finely chopped , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them crackle. Add chopped green chili and sauté for a few seconds. Add grated radish and mix well. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the radish softens. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well to combine. Cook for another 2-3 minutes until the spices are well incorporated and the sabji is cooked through. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with chapati or rice.

name: Amritsari Dal
description: Amritsari Dal is a rustic lentil stew from Amritsar, India. It features whole black gram (urad dal) for a creamy texture, simmered with minimal spices for a deep, savory flavor. The addition of tomatoes and a touch of cream creates a comforting and flavorful vegetarian dish.
ingredients: 1 cup whole black lentils (urad dal) , 1/4 cup kidney beans (rajma) , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 2 green chilies, slit , 1-inch ginger, grated , 3 cloves garlic, minced , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons ghee or butter , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Rinse the black lentils and kidney beans thoroughly. Soak them together in water for at least 4 hours or overnight. In a pressure cooker, add the soaked lentils and kidney beans with fresh water. Pressure cook for about 20-25 minutes until they are soft and cooked through. Heat ghee or butter in a separate pan. Add cumin seeds and let them crackle. Add chopped onions, green chilies, minced garlic, and grated ginger. Saute until onions turn golden brown. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Mix well and cook for a minute. Pour the cooked lentils and kidney beans into the pan. Add salt to taste. Let the dal simmer for about 10-15 minutes on low heat, stirring occasionally, until it reaches your desired consistency. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Methi Dal
description: Methi Dal is a flavorful lentil dish featuring fragrant fenugreek leaves (methi). Lentils are cooked until tender, then simmered with aromatic spices, onions, tomatoes, and the earthy goodness of fresh fenugreek leaves. This protein-packed dish is a delicious and healthy vegetarian option.
ingredients: 1 cup split yellow lentils (moong dal) , 1 bunch fresh fenugreek leaves (methi), chopped , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 2-3 green chilies, chopped , 1-inch piece of ginger, grated , 3-4 cloves of garlic, minced , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , Salt to taste , Water as needed , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish , 2 tablespoons oil or ghee
instruction: Wash the lentils thoroughly and soak them in water for about 30 minutes. Heat oil or ghee in a pressure cooker. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions, green chilies, ginger, and garlic. Saute until onions turn golden brown. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy. Now add chopped fenugreek leaves (methi) and cook for a few minutes until they wilt. Drain the soaked lentils and add them to the pressure cooker. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well. Pour enough water to cover the lentils and vegetables (about 2-3 cups). Close the pressure cooker lid and cook for 3-4 whistles or until the lentils are cooked and soft. Once the pressure releases naturally, open the lid and give the dal a good stir. Adjust the consistency of the dal by adding more water if needed. Simmer for a few minutes. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves and serve hot with steamed rice or roti.

name: Lobia
description: Lobia is a hearty and flavorful dish featuring black-eyed beans cooked in a spiced and tangy tomato gravy. This protein-packed curry is a Punjabi staple, known for its comforting warmth and delicious balance of savory and slightly sweet flavors.
ingredients: 1 cup dried lobia (black-eyed peas), soaked overnight , 2 tablespoons oil , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 2 green chilies, slit , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , Salt to taste , Chopped coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Rinse the soaked lobia and pressure cook with enough water and salt for 3-4 whistles or until soft. Drain excess water and set aside. Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté until the raw smell disappears. Add chopped tomatoes, green chilies, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until tomatoes are soft and oil separates. Add cooked lobia to the tomato mixture and mix well. Adjust consistency by adding water if required. Simmer for 5-7 minutes until flavors blend together. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Suji Ka Cheela
description: Suji Ka Cheela is a savory Indian pancake made with semolina (sooji or rava). It's a quick and healthy breakfast option that's typically enjoyed with chutneys or dips. Think of it as a savory version of a crepe, but made with the grainy texture of semolina.
ingredients: 1 cup semolina (suji) , 1/2 cup yogurt , 1/2 cup water , 1 onion, finely chopped , 1 tomato, finely chopped , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , 2 tablespoons chopped coriander leaves , 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds , Salt to taste , Oil for cooking
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine semolina, yogurt, and water to make a smooth batter. Let it rest for 10-15 minutes. Add chopped onion, tomato, green chilies, coriander leaves, cumin seeds, and salt to the batter. Mix well. Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat and grease it lightly with oil. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it in a circular motion to form a thin pancake (cheela). Drizzle a little oil around the edges of the cheela and cook until the bottom turns golden brown. Flip the cheela and cook the other side until it also turns golden brown and crisp. Repeat the process with the remaining batter. Serve hot with chutney or yogurt.

name: Baby Corn Masala
description: Baby Corn Masala is a delicious Indian side dish featuring bite-sized corncobs cooked in a rich and flavorful gravy. The gravy is typically made with onions, tomatoes, and a warming blend of spices, offering a delightful combination of savory and sometimes slightly sweet flavors. It pairs excellently with rotis, naan, or even rice for a satisfying vegetarian option.
ingredients: 200g baby corn, washed and chopped , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 2 green chilies, chopped , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , 1/4 cup fresh cilantro leaves, chopped , 2 tablespoons cooking oil , Salt to taste
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Sauté for another minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add chopped baby corn and mix until well coated with the masala mixture. Cover and cook for 8-10 minutes or until the baby corn is tender, stirring occasionally. Once the baby corn is cooked, sprinkle garam masala and fresh cilantro leaves. Mix well and cook for another 2 minutes. Serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Mango Lassi
description: Mango Lassi is a refreshing drink made with creamy yogurt, sweet mangoes, and a hint of cardamom spice. It's a delicious blend of sweet and tart, with a smooth and thick texture, perfect for a cool summer treat.
ingredients: 1 ripe mango, peeled and diced , 1 cup plain yogurt , 2 tablespoons sugar (adjust to taste) , 1/4 teaspoon ground cardamom , Ice cubes (optional) , Fresh mint leaves for garnish (optional)
instruction: In a blender, combine diced mango, plain yogurt, sugar, and ground cardamom. Blend until smooth and creamy. If desired, add a few ice cubes to the blender and blend again until well combined and frothy. Taste and adjust sweetness by adding more sugar if needed. Pour the Mango Lassi into glasses. Garnish with fresh mint leaves if desired. Serve chilled and enjoy the refreshing taste of Mango Lassi!

name: Lauki Ka Paratha
description: Lauki ka Paratha is a savory flatbread stuffed with grated bottle gourd (lauki) and seasoned with spices. It's a healthy and flavorful twist on the classic paratha, perfect for a satisfying breakfast or light meal.
ingredients: 1 cup grated bottle gourd (lauki) , 1 cup whole wheat flour , 1 green chili, finely chopped , 2 tablespoons chopped coriander leaves , 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds , Salt to taste , Ghee or oil for cooking
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine grated bottle gourd, whole wheat flour, chopped green chili, chopped coriander leaves, cumin seeds, and salt. Mix well to form a dough. Add water as needed to make a soft dough. Divide the dough into small equal-sized balls. Roll out each ball into a small disc using a rolling pin. Heat a griddle or tawa over medium heat. Place a rolled-out paratha on the hot griddle and cook until small bubbles start to appear on the surface. Flip the paratha and cook the other side until golden brown spots appear. Brush with ghee or oil on both sides while cooking. Repeat the process with the remaining dough balls. Serve hot Lauki Ka Paratha with yogurt, pickle, or any chutney of your choice.

name: Cheese Paratha
description: Cheese paratha is a delightful Indian flatbread with a savory twist. Flaky layers of whole wheat dough encase a melt-in-your-mouth filling of creamy cheese, often spiced with onions, chilies, and herbs. It's a popular breakfast or brunch option, bursting with cheesy goodness in every bite.
ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour , 1 cup grated cheese (cheddar or mozzarella) , 1/2 cup finely chopped coriander leaves , 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , Salt to taste , Water as needed , Ghee or butter for cooking
instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, grated cheese, chopped coriander leaves, cumin powder, red chili powder, and salt. Gradually add water and knead the mixture into a smooth dough. Let it rest for 10-15 minutes. Divide the dough into equal-sized balls and roll each ball into a small disc. Place a portion of the cheese mixture in the center of each disc and fold the edges to seal, shaping them back into balls. Roll out each stuffed ball into a flat circle, using a rolling pin and dusting with flour if needed. Heat a skillet or tawa over medium heat and cook each paratha with a little ghee or butter until golden brown on both sides, pressing gently with a spatula to cook evenly. Serve hot with yogurt, pickle, or any dipping sauce of your choice.

name: Paneer Khurchan
description: Paneer Khurchan is a flavorful North Indian dish featuring crumbled paneer (Indian cottage cheese) in a slightly spiced, semi-dry gravy. Imagine soft paneer tossed with juicy tomatoes, crisp bell peppers, and aromatic onions - a delicious vegetarian option!
ingredients: 250g paneer (cottage cheese), cut into thin strips , 2 onions, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 1 capsicum (bell pepper), thinly sliced , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons cooking oil , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them crackle. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and chopped green chilies. Cook for another minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become mushy. Now, add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add sliced capsicum and cook until they are slightly softened. Add paneer strips to the pan and gently mix with the masala. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the paneer is coated well with the masala and starts to brown slightly. Sprinkle garam masala on top and mix well. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with roti or naan.

name: Classic Indian Boondi Raita
description: Classic Boondi Raita is a cool and creamy Indian side dish. It features tangy yogurt swirled with tiny, softened balls of fried gram flour (boondi) for a delightful textural contrast. This flavorful dip is spiced with a touch of cumin, chili powder, and sometimes herbs for a refreshing accompaniment to any Indian meal.
ingredients: 1 cup plain yogurt , 1/2 cup boondi (small fried chickpea flour balls) , 1/4 teaspoon roasted cumin powder , 1/4 teaspoon chaat masala (optional) , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish , Water (as needed)
instruction: In a mixing bowl, whisk the plain yogurt until smooth. Add the boondi to the yogurt and let it soak for about 5 minutes. If the mixture is too thick, you can add a little water to achieve the desired consistency. Season the raita with roasted cumin powder, chaat masala (if using), and salt to taste. Mix well. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve chilled as a refreshing side dish with Indian meals.

name: Meethi Seviyan
description: Meethi Seviyan is a sweet Indian dessert made with thin vermicelli (seviyan) cooked in milk or water with sugar. It's flavored with cardamom and often includes nuts, raisins, and ghee for a rich and comforting treat.
ingredients: 1 cup vermicelli (seviyan) , 1/4 cup ghee (clarified butter) , 1/2 cup sugar , 2 cups water , 1/4 cup mixed dry fruits (almonds, cashews, raisins) , 1/2 teaspoon cardamom powder , Saffron strands (optional) , Silvered pistachios for garnish (optional)
instruction: Heat ghee in a pan over medium heat. Add the vermicelli and roast until golden brown, stirring constantly to prevent burning. In another saucepan, boil the water and add sugar. Stir until the sugar is completely dissolved. Pour the sugar syrup into the pan with roasted vermicelli. Be careful, as it may splatter. Add cardamom powder and saffron strands (if using). Mix well. Cover and cook on low heat until the vermicelli is soft and the liquid is absorbed, about 7-10 minutes. In a separate pan, dry roast the mixed dry fruits until lightly golden. Once the vermicelli is cooked, add the roasted dry fruits and mix gently. Garnish with silvered pistachios (if using). Serve hot or cold as desired.

name: Besan Ka Halwa
description: Besan ka Halwa is a rich Indian dessert made with roasted gram flour (besan), ghee, sugar, and often flavored with cardamom. It has a smooth, fudge-like texture and a warm, nutty aroma. The golden color and optional chopped nuts add a festive touch, making it a popular treat for celebrations and sweet cravings.
ingredients: 1 cup besan (gram flour) , 1/2 cup ghee (clarified butter) , 1 cup sugar , 2 cups water , 1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder , Chopped nuts for garnish (optional)
instruction: Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan over medium heat. Add besan to the pan and roast it until it turns golden brown and gives a nutty aroma. Keep stirring continuously to avoid burning. In a separate saucepan, bring water to a boil and dissolve sugar in it to make a sugar syrup. Slowly pour the sugar syrup into the roasted besan while stirring continuously to avoid lumps. Cook the mixture until it thickens and starts leaving the sides of the pan. Add cardamom powder and mix well. Garnish with chopped nuts if desired. Serve hot and enjoy your Besan Ka Halwa!

name: Carrot Paratha
description: Carrot paratha is a delightful flatbread stuffed with a savory mix of grated carrots, herbs, and spices. Wrapped in whole wheat dough and pan-fried to crispy perfection, it's a healthy and flavorful breakfast, lunch, or snack.
ingredients: 1 cup whole wheat flour , 1/2 cup grated carrots , 1 green chili, finely chopped (optional) , 2 tablespoons chopped coriander leaves , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder , Salt to taste , Water for kneading dough , Ghee or oil for cooking
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine whole wheat flour, grated carrots, green chili, coriander leaves, turmeric powder, cumin powder, and salt. Gradually add water and knead into a smooth dough. Let it rest for 15-20 minutes. Divide the dough into small lemon-sized balls. Take a dough ball and roll it out into a small circle using a rolling pin. Heat a tawa or griddle over medium heat and place the rolled-out dough circle on it. Cook for about a minute until small bubbles appear on the surface, then flip it over. Spread some ghee or oil on the cooked side and flip again. Cook until both sides are golden brown. Repeat the process with the remaining dough balls. Serve hot with yogurt, pickle, or any chutney of your choice.

name: Mughlai Biryani
