description: Mughlai Biryani is a luxurious rice dish layered with flavorful meat (or vegetables for a vegetarian option), aromatic spices, and sometimes nuts. Cooked in the "dum" style, which means sealing the pot for slow cooking, it boasts tender meat or veggies, fluffy rice infused with saffron and spices, and a richness that reflects its Mughal heritage.
ingredients: 2 cups basmati rice, soaked for 30 minutes and drained , 500 grams boneless chicken or mutton, cut into pieces , 1 cup yogurt , 1 large onion, thinly sliced , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 1/4 cup ghee or clarified butter , 2 tablespoons oil , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1/2 teaspoon saffron strands, soaked in 2 tablespoons warm milk , Salt to taste , Chopped fresh coriander leaves for garnish , Fried onions for garnish
instruction: Heat ghee and oil in a large pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Remove half of the fried onions and set aside for garnish. Add ginger-garlic paste to the remaining onions in the pan and sauté until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy. Add the chicken or mutton pieces to the pan and cook until they are browned. In a bowl, whisk yogurt with turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Add this yogurt mixture to the pan and mix well. Cover and cook the meat until it's tender and the gravy thickens. Meanwhile, boil water in a large pot and add soaked rice. Cook until the rice is 70% done. Drain and set aside. Once the meat is cooked, layer half of the cooked rice over the meat gravy in the pan. Sprinkle half of the saffron milk over the rice layer. Repeat the layering process with the remaining rice and saffron milk. Cover the pan with a lid and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together. Once done, garnish the biryani with fried onions and chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with raita or salan (curry) on the side.

name: Achari Paneer Tikka
description: Achari Paneer Tikka is a flavorful vegetarian appetizer featuring cubes of paneer cheese marinated in a tangy, spicy pickling masala. This marinade imbues the paneer with a vibrant, acidic kick, reminiscent of Indian pickles (achar). The paneer is then cooked until tender and slightly crispy, offering a delightful textural contrast.
ingredients: 250 grams paneer (cottage cheese), cut into cubes , 1 tablespoon mustard oil , 1 tablespoon lemon juice , 2 tablespoons yogurt , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 tablespoon achari masala (pickle spice mix) , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , Salt to taste , 1 onion, cut into chunks , 1 bell pepper, cut into chunks , 1 tomato, cut into chunks , Chaat masala, for garnish , Fresh coriander leaves, chopped, for garnish
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine mustard oil, lemon juice, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, achari masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well to form a marinade. Add paneer cubes to the marinade and coat them evenly. Let the paneer marinate for at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator. After marinating, thread the marinated paneer cubes onto skewers, alternating with onion, bell pepper, and tomato chunks. Heat a grill pan or grill over medium heat. Place the skewers on the grill and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until the paneer and vegetables are cooked through and have grill marks. Once cooked, remove the skewers from the grill and sprinkle chaat masala and chopped coriander leaves on top. Serve hot with mint chutney and lemon wedges.

name: Beetroot Halwa
description: Beetroot Halwa is a vibrantly colored Indian dessert featuring earthy beetroot simmered with creamy milk and sugar. This sweet treat is flavored with warming spices like cardamom and often finished with a rich nut and dried fruit garnish.
ingredients: 2 cups grated beetroot , 1 cup full-fat milk , 1/2 cup sugar (adjust to taste) , 2 tablespoons ghee (clarified butter) , 1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder , 2 tablespoons chopped nuts (almonds, cashews, pistachios) , A pinch of saffron strands (optional) , Additional ghee for frying nuts
instruction: Heat 1 tablespoon of ghee in a pan and fry the chopped nuts until golden brown. Remove and set aside. In the same pan, add another tablespoon of ghee and sauté the grated beetroot until it softens and reduces in volume. Add milk to the beetroot and cook on low heat, stirring occasionally, until the milk reduces and thickens. Once the milk has reduced to half, add sugar and cardamom powder. Mix well and continue cooking until the mixture thickens further. Add the fried nuts and saffron strands (if using). Mix everything well and cook for another 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat and serve the Beetroot Halwa warm or chilled, garnished with additional nuts if desired.

name: Pindi Chole
description: Pindi Chole is a unique chickpea dish from North India with a twist. Instead of the usual tomato and onion base, it gets its rich color and depth of flavor from slow-cooked spices, ginger, and sometimes black tea. It's a dryish curry, perfect with fluffy breads like poori or rice.
ingredients: 2 cups dried chickpeas (soaked overnight) , 2 tablespoons oil , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, pureed , 2 teaspoons ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , Salt to taste , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish
instruction: Drain the soaked chickpeas and rinse them under cold water. Set aside. Heat oil in a pressure cooker or a large pot over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Stir in ginger-garlic paste and cook for another minute until fragrant. Add tomato puree and cook until the oil starts to separate from the mixture. Mix in the coriander powder, garam masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the soaked chickpeas to the pot along with 3-4 cups of water. Close the pressure cooker lid and cook for 20-25 minutes or until the chickpeas are tender. If using a pot, cover and simmer for about 1-1.5 hours until chickpeas are cooked through, stirring occasionally. Once cooked, mash some of the chickpeas with the back of a spoon to thicken the gravy. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves and serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Paneer Amritsari
description: Paneer Amritsari is a delicious Punjabi dish featuring cubes of paneer (Indian cottage cheese) marinated in a flavorful spice mix, often containing gram flour (chickpea flour) for a crispy coating. It's a vegetarian delight offering a delightful balance of textures - crisp on the outside, tender and savory on the inside -  perfect with rotis, naan, or rice.
ingredients: 250g paneer, cut into cubes , 1/2 cup yogurt , 2 tablespoons gram flour (besan) , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , Salt to taste , Oil for frying , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish , For the Chutney: 1/2 cup mint leaves , 1/2 cup coriander leaves , 1 green chili , 1 tablespoon lemon juice , Salt to taste
instruction: In a bowl, mix yogurt, gram flour, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, garam masala, turmeric powder, and salt to form a smooth marinade. Add paneer cubes to the marinade and coat them evenly. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes. Heat oil in a pan for deep frying. Once the oil is hot, carefully add the marinated paneer cubes in batches and fry until golden brown and crispy. Drain on paper towels to remove excess oil. For the chutney, blend mint leaves, coriander leaves, green chili, lemon juice, and salt until smooth. Serve the crispy paneer cubes hot with the prepared chutney. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Peanut Chikki
description: Peanut chikki is a classic Indian sweet made with just two main ingredients: roasted peanuts and jaggery (unrefined cane sugar). The peanuts are caramelized in hot, molten jaggery, creating a crunchy and satisfying treat.
ingredients: 1 cup peanuts (raw or roasted) , 1 cup jaggery (grated) , 1 tablespoon ghee (clarified butter) , 1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder (optional)
instruction: Dry roast the peanuts in a pan over medium heat until they turn golden brown. Remove from heat and allow them to cool slightly. Once the peanuts are cool enough to handle, remove the skins by rubbing them between your palms or using a kitchen towel. Set aside. In the same pan, heat the ghee over low heat. Add the grated jaggery and stir continuously until it melts and forms a syrup-like consistency. To check if the jaggery syrup is ready, drop a small amount into a bowl of water. If it forms a soft ball, it's ready. Add the roasted peanuts and cardamom powder (if using) to the jaggery syrup. Mix well until the peanuts are evenly coated. Quickly transfer the mixture onto a greased plate or parchment paper. Use a greased rolling pin to flatten it into a uniform thickness. Allow the chikki to cool completely before cutting it into desired shapes using a sharp knife. Once cooled and set, store the Peanut Chikki in an airtight container.

name: Rice Cutlet
description: Rice cutlets are crispy fritters made from leftover cooked rice. They're a delicious way to transform leftover rice into a tasty snack or side dish. Mashed potato and spices bind the rice together, while a breadcrumb coating creates a satisfying crunch.
ingredients: 1 cup cooked rice , 1 medium potato, boiled and mashed , 1/2 cup bread crumbs , 1/4 cup finely chopped onions , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , 2 tablespoons chopped coriander leaves , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , Salt to taste , Oil for shallow frying
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine cooked rice, mashed potato, bread crumbs, chopped onions, green chilies, coriander leaves, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well to form a dough-like mixture. Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into flat round cutlets. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat for shallow frying. Once the oil is hot, carefully place the cutlets in the pan and fry until golden brown and crispy on both sides, turning occasionally. Once fried, remove the cutlets from the pan and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to absorb excess oil. Serve hot with mint chutney or ketchup.

name: Rajma Pulao
description: Rajma Pulao is a flavorful Indian rice dish featuring tender kidney beans (rajma) cooked with aromatic spices, fluffy basmati rice, and sometimes vegetables like onions and tomatoes. It's a hearty vegetarian option perfect for a comforting lunch or dinner.
ingredients: 1 cup Basmati rice , 1 cup cooked kidney beans (rajma) , 1 onion, thinly sliced , 1 tomato, chopped , 1 green chili, chopped , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1-inch ginger, grated , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon coriander powder , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons cooking oil , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Rinse the Basmati rice under running water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for about 20 minutes, then drain and set aside. Heat oil in a deep pan or pressure cooker. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add sliced onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chili. Sauté for another minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy. Add the cooked kidney beans (rajma) to the pan along with garam masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt to taste. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the soaked and drained Basmati rice to the pan. Mix gently with the masala and beans mixture. Add 2 cups of water and bring the mixture to a boil. Once it starts boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and let it simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and water is absorbed. Once the rice is cooked, fluff it gently with a fork. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot Rajma Pulao with yogurt, pickle, or raita.

name: Onion Pakoda
description: Onion pakoda is a crispy fritter made with thinly sliced onions dipped in a chickpea flour (gram flour) batter spiced with chilies, herbs, and sometimes rice flour for extra crispness. These golden bites are a popular Indian snack perfect for tea time or rainy days.
ingredients: 2 large onions, thinly sliced , 1 cup chickpea flour (besan) , 2-3 green chilies, finely chopped , 1 teaspoon ginger paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , Salt to taste , Oil for frying , Fresh coriander leaves, chopped (optional, for garnish)
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine the sliced onions, chickpea flour, green chilies, ginger paste, cumin seeds, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well until the onions are coated evenly with the flour and spices. Let it sit for 10-15 minutes. Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat. Once the oil is hot, take small portions of the onion mixture and drop them carefully into the oil using your fingers or a spoon. Fry the pakodas in batches, making sure not to overcrowd the pan. Fry the pakodas until they turn golden brown and crispy, stirring occasionally to ensure even cooking. Once done, remove the pakodas from the oil using a slotted spoon and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess oil. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves if desired. Serve hot with green chutney or ketchup.

name: Chana Dal Khichdi
description: Chana Dal Khichdi is a comforting Indian dish combining split chickpeas (chana dal) and rice cooked together with aromatic spices like cumin and turmeric. It's a simple, one-pot meal often seasoned with chilies for a touch of heat and garnished with fresh cilantro for a vibrant touch.
ingredients: 1 cup chana dal (split Bengal gram) , 1 cup rice , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 2 green chilies, chopped , 1-inch ginger, grated , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 tablespoon ghee (clarified butter) , Salt to taste , Water as needed , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Wash the chana dal and rice together and soak them in water for 30 minutes. Heat ghee in a pressure cooker. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions, green chilies, and grated ginger. Saute until onions turn translucent. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy. Drain the soaked chana dal and rice, and add them to the pressure cooker. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. Add 4 cups of water and stir everything together. Close the pressure cooker lid and cook for 3 whistles on medium heat. Once the pressure releases naturally, open the lid and give the khichdi a gentle stir. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Mango Chaat
description: Mango chaat is a delightful explosion of textures and flavors. It features chopped mangoes, either ripe or unripe, depending on the recipe, tossed with a mix of savory and tangy ingredients. Crunchy vegetables like onions and tomatoes add bite, while chopped peanuts or chickpeas bring a satisfying nuttiness. A squeeze of lime juice and a sprinkle of chaat masala (a blend of spices) tie everything together with a burst of citrus and warm spice.
ingredients: 2 ripe mangoes, peeled and diced , 1 small red onion, finely chopped , 1 small cucumber, peeled and diced , 1 small tomato, diced , 1 green chili, finely chopped (optional) , 1/4 cup fresh cilantro (coriander) leaves, chopped , 1 tablespoon fresh mint leaves, chopped , 1 teaspoon chaat masala , 1/2 teaspoon roasted cumin powder , Juice of 1 lemon , Salt to taste , Sev (crispy chickpea flour noodles), for garnish (optional)
instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine diced mangoes, red onion, cucumber, tomato, green chili (if using), cilantro, and mint leaves. Sprinkle chaat masala, roasted cumin powder, lemon juice, and salt over the mango mixture. Gently toss everything together until well combined. Taste and adjust seasoning if needed. Transfer the mango chaat to serving plates or bowls. Garnish with a sprinkle of sev (if using). Serve immediately and enjoy the refreshing and tangy flavors of mango chaat!

name: Chaas
description: Chaas is a refreshing Indian buttermilk drink made by blending yogurt, water, and spices. It's a creamy, tangy beverage often flavored with cumin, mint, and sometimes ginger for a touch of warmth.
ingredients: 2 cups yogurt , 2 cups water , 1/2 teaspoon roasted cumin powder , 1/4 teaspoon black salt , 1/4 teaspoon salt (adjust to taste) , 1 tablespoon chopped coriander leaves , 1 green chili, finely chopped (optional) , Ice cubes (optional)
instruction: In a large bowl, whisk together yogurt and water until smooth. Add roasted cumin powder, black salt, and regular salt. Mix well. Add chopped coriander leaves and green chili if using. Stir to combine. Chill the Chaas in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes. Before serving, give it a quick stir. Add ice cubes if desired. Serve cold as a refreshing drink or alongside meals.

name: Phirni
description: Phirni is a creamy and smooth Indian rice pudding. It's flavored with fragrant cardamom and often includes a touch of saffron for a luxurious taste. Nuts like pistachios or almonds can add a delightful crunch.
ingredients: 1/2 cup basmati rice , 4 cups milk , 1/2 cup sugar , 1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder , Saffron strands, a few (optional) , Chopped nuts for garnish (almonds, pistachios)
instruction: Wash the basmati rice thoroughly and soak it in water for about 30 minutes. Drain the water from the rice and grind it into a coarse paste. In a heavy-bottomed pan, bring the milk to a boil. Add the ground rice paste to the boiling milk, stirring continuously to avoid lumps. Cook the mixture on low heat, stirring frequently until it thickens to a pudding-like consistency. Add sugar, cardamom powder, and saffron strands (if using), and continue to cook for another 5-10 minutes. Remove from heat and let it cool slightly. Pour the Phirni into serving bowls or earthenware pots. Garnish with chopped nuts and refrigerate for a few hours until chilled. Serve cold and enjoy the creamy, delicious Phirni!

name: Tandoori Aloo
description: Tandoori Aloo is a flavorful appetizer or side dish featuring tender potatoes marinated in a yogurt-based sauce bursting with warming spices like coriander, garam masala, and smoky red chili powder. The marinated potatoes are then cooked until crispy and charred, offering a delightful textural contrast.
ingredients: 500g baby potatoes , 1 cup yogurt , 2 tablespoons tandoori masala , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 tablespoon lemon juice , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , Salt to taste , Chopped coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Boil the baby potatoes until they are tender. Drain and let them cool. In a bowl, mix yogurt, tandoori masala, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Peel the boiled potatoes and prick them with a fork. Coat the potatoes evenly with the yogurt mixture and let them marinate for at least 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 200°C (390°F). Arrange the marinated potatoes on a baking tray lined with parchment paper. Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until the potatoes are crispy and cooked through. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves before serving.

name: Masala Idli
description: Masala Idli is a delicious twist on the classic South Indian breakfast dish. It features fluffy steamed idlis tossed in a flavorful and aromatic masala. Imagine soft, savory idli pieces coated in a spicy, onion-tomato gravy with a touch of fresh coriander. It's a quick and comforting meal that's perfect for using leftover idlis.
ingredients: 10-12 idlis (steamed rice cakes), cut into cubes , 1 onion, finely chopped , 1 tomato, finely chopped , 1 green chili, finely chopped , 1/2 inch ginger, grated , 2-3 cloves garlic, minced , 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds , 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1/4 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons oil , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent. Add grated ginger and minced garlic. Sauté for another minute. Add chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until tomatoes turn soft and mushy. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes. Now, add the idli cubes to the pan. Gently toss them with the masala until well-coated. Sprinkle garam masala over the idlis and mix again. Cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the idlis are heated through and the masala is well-incorporated. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot masala idlis with coconut chutney or tomato chutney.

name: Moong Dal Chilla
description: Moong Dal Chilla is a savory Indian pancake made from a batter of ground mung lentils (moong dal). It's spiced with aromatics like cumin and ginger, often featuring a touch of green chilies for a kick. The batter is cooked on a griddle or pan with a drizzle of oil, resulting in a crispy and protein-packed breakfast or light meal.
ingredients: 1 cup split yellow moong dal (skinned and split green gram) , 1 small onion, finely chopped , 1 small tomato, finely chopped , 2-3 green chilies, finely chopped , 2 tablespoons chopped coriander leaves , 1 teaspoon grated ginger , Salt to taste , 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1/4 teaspoon turmeric powder , Oil for cooking
instruction: Wash and soak the moong dal in water for about 4-6 hours or overnight. Drain the water and blend the soaked moong dal into a smooth paste using a blender. Add a little water if needed to make a smooth batter. Transfer the batter into a mixing bowl and add chopped onions, tomatoes, green chilies, coriander leaves, grated ginger, cumin seeds, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well to combine. Heat a non-stick pan or tawa over medium heat and lightly grease it with oil. Pour a ladleful of the moong dal batter onto the center of the hot pan and spread it in a circular motion to form a thin pancake or chilla. Drizzle a little oil around the edges of the chilla and cook for 2-3 minutes until the bottom side turns golden brown. Flip the chilla using a spatula and cook the other side for another 2-3 minutes until golden brown and crispy. Remove the cooked chilla from the pan and serve hot with green chutney or yogurt.

name: Samak Rice Pulao
description: Samak Rice Pulao is a flavorful Indian dish made with barnyard millet (samak rice), aromatic spices, and vegetables. It's a healthy twist on classic pulao, offering a nutty flavor and a light, fluffy texture.
ingredients: 1 cup samak rice (also known as barnyard millet) , 1 tablespoon ghee (clarified butter) or oil , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 small onion, finely chopped , 1 small carrot, diced , 1 small potato, diced , 1/4 cup green peas , 1 green chili, chopped (optional) , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 2 cups water or vegetable broth , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Rinse the samak rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Drain and set aside. Heat ghee or oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onion and sauté until translucent. Stir in ginger-garlic paste and chopped green chili (if using). Cook for another minute. Add diced carrots, potatoes, and green peas to the pan. Sauté for 2-3 minutes. Add rinsed samak rice to the pan and mix well with the vegetables. Pour in water or vegetable broth and season with salt according to taste. Bring to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and let it simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed. Once cooked, fluff the pulao with a fork and garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot as a main dish or side dish with yogurt or any curry of your choice.

name: Kada Prasad
description: Kada Prasad is a traditional Punjabi sweet made with wheat flour, sugar, and ghee.
ingredients: 1 cup whole wheat flour (atta) , 1 cup sugar , 1 cup ghee (clarified butter) , 2 cups water , 1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder , Almonds or cashews for garnish (optional)
instruction: Heat a heavy-bottomed pan or kadhai over medium heat. Add ghee to the pan and let it melt. Once the ghee is hot, add the whole wheat flour (atta) to the pan. Roast the flour in ghee continuously, stirring constantly to avoid burning, until it turns golden brown and aromatic. This should take around 15-20 minutes on medium-low heat. In a separate saucepan, heat the water and sugar together until the sugar dissolves completely, creating a sugar syrup. Slowly pour the sugar syrup into the roasted flour mixture while stirring continuously to prevent lumps from forming. Keep stirring the mixture until it thickens and starts to leave the sides of the pan. This should take around 5-7 minutes. Add cardamom powder to the mixture and mix well. Turn off the heat and transfer the Kada Prasad to a serving bowl. Garnish with chopped almonds or cashews if desired. Serve the warm Kada Prasad as prasad or enjoy it as a delicious sweet treat.

name: Veg Kabab
description: Veg kabab is a savory and colorful appetizer or snack made with a delicious blend of mashed vegetables, fragrant spices, and sometimes breadcrumbs or gram flour for binding. They can be pan-fried, grilled, baked, or even air-fried for a healthier option. Enjoy them with a tangy chutney or creamy yogurt dip!
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (such as carrots, peas, potatoes, cauliflower), boiled and mashed , 1 cup bread crumbs , 1 small onion, finely chopped , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , 1/4 cup coriander leaves, chopped , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1 teaspoon cumin powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , Salt to taste , Oil for shallow frying
instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine the mashed vegetables, bread crumbs, chopped onion, green chilies, coriander leaves, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well to form a smooth mixture. Divide the mixture into equal-sized portions and shape them into round or cylindrical kababs. Heat oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Place the kababs in the pan and shallow fry until golden brown and crispy on all sides, turning occasionally to ensure even cooking. Once cooked, transfer the kababs to a plate lined with paper towels to absorb excess oil. Serve hot with mint chutney or your favorite dipping sauce.

name: Badam Laddu
description: Badam Laddu is a delightful Indian sweet made by combining ground almonds (badam) with a sweetener like sugar or jaggery, and fragrant spices like cardamom. These rich, melt-in-your-mouth balls are a delicious treat enjoyed on festivals and special occasions.
ingredients: 1 cup almonds (badam), blanched and peeled , 1/2 cup granulated sugar or jaggery , 1/4 cup ghee (clarified butter) , 1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder
instruction: Grind the blanched and peeled almonds in a food processor until you get a fine powder-like consistency. In a non-stick pan, heat ghee over medium heat. Add the almond powder to the pan and roast it gently for about 5-7 minutes until it turns light golden brown and emits a nutty aroma. Add the sugar or jaggery to the pan and mix well with the roasted almond powder. Cook the mixture for another 3-4 minutes, stirring continuously, until the sugar melts and combines well with the almond mixture. Turn off the heat and let the mixture cool down slightly. Once the mixture is cool enough to handle, shape it into small laddus (round balls) using your hands. Roll each laddu in some additional almond powder or desiccated coconut for garnish (optional). Allow the laddus to cool completely before serving.

name: Jaggery Rice
description: Jaggery Rice is a sweet and flavorful Indian rice dish made with fragrant basmati rice cooked with jaggery (unrefined cane sugar) for natural sweetness. It's often spiced with cardamom and cloves, and can include nuts, raisins, or other dried fruits for added texture and taste.
ingredients: 1 cup Basmati rice , 1/2 cup grated jaggery (or to taste) , 3 cups water , 1/4 cup ghee (clarified butter) , 1/4 cup mixed nuts (cashews, almonds, raisins) , 4-5 cardamom pods, crushed , A pinch of saffron strands (optional) , A pinch of salt
instruction: Wash the rice thoroughly and soak it in water for about 30 minutes. Drain and set aside. In a deep pan or pot, bring water to a boil. Add a pinch of salt and soaked rice. Cook until the rice is 90% done. Drain any excess water and set the rice aside. In another pan, heat ghee over medium heat. Add mixed nuts and sauté until golden brown. Remove the nuts and set them aside. In the same pan, add grated jaggery and a little water. Cook until the jaggery melts completely and forms a syrup-like consistency. Add the cooked rice to the jaggery syrup. Mix gently until the rice is well coated. Add crushed cardamom pods and saffron strands (if using). Mix well. Cover and cook the jaggery rice on low heat for about 5-7 minutes, allowing the flavors to blend. Once done, remove from heat and let it sit for a few minutes. Garnish with the sautéed nuts and serve warm.

name: Palak Chole
description: Palak Chole is a hearty Indian curry that combines savory chickpeas (chole) with a vibrant spinach (palak) puree. This flavorful dish features a warm spice base simmered with onions, tomatoes, and fragrant aromatics, creating a delicious vegetarian option.
ingredients: 1 cup dried chickpeas (or 2 cans of chickpeas, drained and rinsed) , 2 cups fresh spinach leaves, washed and chopped , 1 large onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1-inch ginger, grated , 2 green chilies, finely chopped (optional, adjust to taste) , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1 teaspoon ground coriander , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons oil or ghee , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish , Lemon wedges for serving
instruction: If using dried chickpeas, soak them overnight in water. Drain the water and rinse the chickpeas before cooking. If using canned chickpeas, skip this step. In a pressure cooker, cook the chickpeas with enough water and a pinch of salt until they are soft and cooked through. If using a stovetop pot, it may take around 30-40 minutes. If using a pressure cooker, it may take around 10-15 minutes. In a separate pan, heat oil or ghee over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chilies (if using). Sauté for a minute until the raw smell disappears. Add finely chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy and oil separates from the masala. Now, add the chopped spinach leaves and cook until they wilt down and blend well with the masala. Add garam masala, ground coriander, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt to taste. Mix well and cook for another couple of minutes. Add the cooked chickpeas along with any remaining water to the spinach mixture. Stir well and simmer for 5-10 minutes until the flavors meld together and the gravy thickens to your desired consistency. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves and serve hot with rice, naan, or roti. Squeeze some lemon juice on top before serving for an extra burst of flavor.

name: Makki Ki Roti
description: Makki Ki Roti is a North Indian flatbread made with a unique twist. It's a rustic bread crafted from coarse corn flour (makki ka atta) instead of the usual wheat flour. This golden flatbread is traditionally cooked on a griddle and often enjoyed with rich, seasonal greens or creamy dals.
ingredients: 2 cups maize flour (makki ka atta) , Water, as needed , Salt, to taste , Ghee or butter, for cooking
instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine maize flour and salt. Gradually add water and knead the mixture to form a smooth dough. Divide the dough into small portions and shape them into balls. Place a ball of dough between two sheets of plastic wrap or parchment paper. Using a rolling pin, flatten the dough ball into a thin roti. Carefully transfer the roti onto a heated skillet or tawa. Cook each side until golden brown spots appear, brushing with ghee or butter as needed. Repeat the process with the remaining dough ball

name: Aloo Tikki Chole
description: Aloo Tikki Chole is a delightful North Indian combination of crispy potato patties (Aloo Tikki) dunked in a rich chickpea curry (Chole). The tikkis are a blend of mashed potatoes spiced with aromatics, while the chole is a simmered delight of chickpeas, tomatoes, and warm spices.
ingredients: 4 medium potatoes, boiled and mashed , 1/2 cup bread crumbs , 1/4 cup chopped coriander leaves , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1 teaspoon chaat masala , Salt to taste , Oil for frying , For Chole: 1 cup chickpeas, boiled , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon amchur (dry mango powder) , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Prepare Aloo Tikki: In a mixing bowl, combine mashed potatoes, bread crumbs, chopped coriander leaves, red chili powder, garam masala, chaat masala, and salt. Mix well to form a dough-like consistency. Divide the mixture into equal-sized balls and flatten them to form tikkis. Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the tikkis until golden brown on both sides. Drain excess oil on paper towels. Prepare Chole: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Once the seeds crackle, add chopped onions and green chilies. Saute until onions turn translucent. Add ginger-garlic paste and saute for another minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy. Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, amchur, and salt. Mix well. Add boiled chickpeas and cook for 5-7 minutes, allowing the flavors to blend together. Assemble: Place the prepared aloo tikkis on a serving plate. Pour the hot chole over the tikkis. Garnish with freshly chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious Aloo Tikki Chole!

name: Baby Corn Jalfrezi
description: Spicy Baby Corn Stir-fry: Crisp baby corn florets are stir-fried with bell peppers, onions, and aromatic spices in a vibrant and flavorful tomato gravy. This quick and delicious vegetarian dish is perfect served with rice or flatbreads.
ingredients: 200g baby corn, cut into bite-sized pieces , 1 onion, thinly sliced , 1 capsicum (bell pepper), thinly sliced , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 2 green chilies, slit lengthwise , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons oil , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add sliced onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Sauté for another minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy. Stir in coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. Add sliced capsicum and baby corn. Cook for 5-7 minutes until the vegetables are slightly tender. Sprinkle garam masala and mix everything together. Cook for another 2-3 minutes until the vegetables are cooked through but still retain their crunch. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Gobi Pakora
description: Gobi Pakora is a crispy fritter dish featuring tender cauliflower florets dipped in a spiced gram flour batter. These golden morsels are deep-fried until light and fluffy on the inside, with a satisfying crunch on the outside. They're typically served hot with a cooling chutney for a delightful Indian snack.
ingredients: 1 small cauliflower (gobi), cut into florets , 1 cup chickpea flour (besan) , 2 tablespoons rice flour , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , Salt to taste , Water as needed , Oil for deep frying , Fresh coriander leaves, chopped (optional, for garnish)
instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine chickpea flour, rice flour, cumin seeds, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. Gradually add water to the dry ingredients, whisking continuously until you get a smooth, thick batter consistency. Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat. Dip each cauliflower floret into the batter, ensuring it's well coated. Carefully drop the battered cauliflower into the hot oil, frying in batches to avoid overcrowding. Fry the pakoras until they turn golden brown and crispy, about 4-5 minutes per batch. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the fried pakoras to a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess oil. Repeat the frying process with the remaining cauliflower florets. Serve the Gobi Pakoras hot, garnished with chopped coriander leaves if desired, and accompanied by your favorite dipping sauce or chutney.

name: Rajgira Puri
description: Rajgira Puri is a crispy flatbread made with a unique combination of amaranth flour (rajgira) and mashed potatoes. This protein-packed poori is often enjoyed during fasting periods (vrat) or as a healthy alternative to wheat flour puris.
ingredients: 1 cup rajgira flour (amaranth flour) , 1 small boiled and mashed potato , 1 green chili, finely chopped (optional) , Rock salt to taste , Water as needed , Oil for frying
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine rajgira flour, mashed potato, chopped green chili, and rock salt. Gradually add water and knead into a smooth dough. The dough should be soft but not sticky. Divide the dough into small equal-sized portions and roll them into balls. Place a ball of dough on a flat surface and gently roll it into a small puri using a rolling pin. Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat. Once the oil is hot, carefully slide the puri into the oil and fry until it puffs up and turns golden brown on both sides. Repeat with the remaining dough balls. Remove the puris from the oil using a slotted spoon and drain excess oil on paper towels. Serve hot with yogurt, chutney, or any side dish of your choice.

name: Beetroot Poori
description: Beetroot Poori is a delightful twist on the classic poori, incorporating vibrant beetroot for a touch of sweetness and a beautiful pink hue. The dough is kneaded with pureed beetroot, resulting in fluffy and flavorful puffed bread perfect for dipping in curries or enjoying on its own.
ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour , 1 cup beetroot puree (cooked and blended beetroot) , 1 teaspoon salt , 1 teaspoon oil , Oil for deep frying
instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, beetroot puree, salt, and 1 teaspoon of oil. Mix well to form a smooth dough. Add more flour if the dough is too sticky or more beetroot puree if it's too dry. Once the dough comes together, cover it with a damp cloth and let it rest for 10-15 minutes. After resting, divide the dough into small lemon-sized balls. Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat. Roll out each dough ball into a small circle using a rolling pin. Carefully slide the rolled out poori into the hot oil. Fry the poori until they puff up and turn golden brown on both sides, flipping them once during frying. Once done, remove the pooris from the oil and drain excess oil on paper towels. Serve hot with your favorite curry or chutney.

name: Kaddu Ki Kheer
description: Kaddu Ki Kheer is a creamy Indian pudding made with grated or cubed pumpkin (kaddu) simmered in milk until tender. It's flavored with cardamom, nuts, and often a touch of sweetness for a comforting and delicious dessert, enjoyed warm or chilled.
ingredients: 500g pumpkin (peeled and diced) , 1 liter milk , 1/2 cup sugar (adjust to taste) , 1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder , A handful of chopped nuts (almonds, pistachios, cashews) for garnish , Saffron strands (optional) for garnish
instruction: In a large pan, boil the diced pumpkin in water until it becomes soft and tender. Once the pumpkin is cooked, drain the water and mash the pumpkin into a smooth puree. In another pan, heat the milk and let it come to a gentle boil. Add the pumpkin puree to the boiling milk and stir well. Let the mixture simmer on low heat for about 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add sugar and cardamom powder to the kheer and mix well until the sugar dissolves completely. Continue to simmer the kheer until it thickens to your desired consistency. Once the kheer reaches the desired consistency, remove it from heat and let it cool. Garnish the kheer with chopped nuts and saffron strands. Serve the kaddu ki kheer warm or chilled as per preference.

name: Potato Sandwich
description: A potato sandwich is a simple yet satisfying vegetarian option. Mashed or spiced potatoes are layered between buttered bread slices, creating a warm, comforting meal.  It can be enjoyed plain or dressed up with cheese, chutney, or other fillings.
ingredients: 4 large potatoes, boiled and mashed , 8 slices of bread (white or whole wheat) , 1 onion, finely chopped , 1 green chili, finely chopped (optional) , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons cooking oil or butter , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish , Tomato ketchup or chutney (optional)
instruction: Heat oil or butter in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and green chili (if using). Saute until onions turn translucent. Add turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well. Add mashed potatoes to the pan and mix with the spice mixture. Cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the potatoes are heated through and well combined with the spices. Toast the bread slices lightly until they are golden brown and crisp. Spread a generous amount of the potato mixture onto one slice of bread. Optionally, drizzle some tomato ketchup or chutney over the potato mixture. Place another slice of bread on top to form a sandwich. Repeat with the remaining bread slices and potato mixture to make more sandwiches. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve the potato sandwiches hot with additional ketchup or chutney on the side, if desired.

name: Pineapple Raita
description: Pineapple Raita is a refreshing yogurt-based condiment with sweet and tangy bursts of pineapple chunks. It's a cool and creamy side dish perfect for complementing spicy curries or rich meals.
ingredients: 1 cup plain yogurt , 1 cup diced pineapple , 1/2 cucumber, grated , 1/4 teaspoon roasted cumin powder , 1/4 teaspoon salt , 1 tablespoon chopped cilantro (optional) , 1/4 teaspoon black pepper , 1/4 teaspoon chaat masala (optional)
instruction: In a mixing bowl, whisk the yogurt until smooth. Add diced pineapple and grated cucumber to the yogurt. Sprinkle roasted cumin powder, salt, black pepper, and chaat masala (if using) over the mixture. Stir well until all ingredients are evenly combined. Garnish with chopped cilantro if desired. Chill the raita in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving. Serve cold as a refreshing side dish with your favorite Indian meals.

name: Aloo Bhujia
description: Aloo Bhujia is a delightful explosion of textures and flavors in one addictive Indian snack.  Imagine thin slivers of potato, spiced with turmeric, cumin, and a hint of chili, transformed into a golden, crispy delight. This delightful treat can be enjoyed on its own for a satisfying teatime nibble, or alongside rice and dal for a flavorful and textural complement to your meal.
ingredients: 2 large potatoes, peeled and grated , 2 tablespoons oil , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves, chopped (for garnish) , Lemon wedges (for serving)
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add grated potatoes to the pan and mix well. Cook the potatoes for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they are partially cooked. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt to the potatoes. Mix until well combined. Continue cooking the potatoes for another 5-7 minutes or until they are crispy and golden brown, stirring occasionally. Once done, transfer the Aloo Bhujia to a serving dish. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with lemon wedges on the side.

name: Kaju Katli
description: Kaju Katli is a traditional Indian sweet made with cashew nuts, sugar, and ghee. It's known for its smooth and melt-in-your-mouth texture, with a subtle nutty flavor. The cashew nut paste is cooked with sugar syrup until it forms a dough-like consistency, which is then flattened and cut into diamond-shaped pieces. Kaju Katli is often garnished with edible silver foil and enjoyed during festivals and celebrations as a delightful treat.
ingredients: 2 cups cashew nuts (kaju) , 1 cup sugar , 1/2 cup water , 1 tablespoon ghee (clarified butter) , Silver edible foil (optional) for garnish.
instruction: Grind the cashew nuts into a fine powder using a food processor or blender. In a non-stick pan, combine sugar and water. Cook over low heat, stirring continuously, until the sugar dissolves completely and forms a thick syrup. Add the ground cashew nut powder to the sugar syrup and mix well to form a smooth dough-like consistency. Add ghee to the mixture and continue cooking, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and starts leaving the sides of the pan. Transfer the mixture to a greased plate or tray and spread it evenly using a spatula. Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes, then place a silver edible foil over the surface (if using) and gently press it down. Once the mixture cools completely, cut it into diamond-shaped pieces using a sharp knife. Serve the Kaju Katli pieces and store any leftovers in an airtight container.

name: Kadai Mushroom
description: Kadai Mushroom is a flavorful and aromatic Indian dish made with mushrooms, onions, tomatoes, and bell peppers cooked in a kadai (wok) with a blend of spices. This vegetarian delicacy offers a perfect balance of savory and spicy flavors, enhanced by the earthiness of mushrooms and the sweetness of bell peppers. It's a quick and easy dish to prepare, making it ideal for both weekday dinners and special occasions. Enjoy Kadai Mushroom with rice or bread for a satisfying and wholesome meal.
ingredients: 500g mushrooms, cleaned and sliced , 2 onions, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 2 green bell peppers (capsicum), diced , 2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste , 2 green chilies, slit , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 tablespoon coriander seeds , 1 tablespoon kasuri methi (dried fenugreek leaves) , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons oil , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Dry roast the coriander seeds and cumin seeds in a pan until fragrant. Grind them to a coarse powder using a mortar and pestle or a spice grinder. Heat oil in a kadai (wok) or a large pan over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and slit green chilies. Sauté for a minute until the raw aroma disappears. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy. Stir in the ground coriander-cumin powder, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for a couple of minutes. Add the sliced mushrooms and diced bell peppers. Mix until well combined with the masala. Cover and cook for 8-10 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender and cooked through. Crush the kasuri methi between your palms and sprinkle it over the kadai mushroom. Also, add garam masala and mix well. Cook for another 2-3 minutes, allowing the flavors to blend together. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with naan, roti, or rice.

name: Paneer Lababdar
description: Paneer Lababdar is a rich and creamy North Indian dish made with paneer (Indian cottage cheese) cooked in a flavorful tomato-based gravy. It's characterized by its vibrant color, creamy texture, and aromatic spices. The dish typically includes onions, tomatoes, bell peppers, and a blend of spices such as cumin, chili powder, and garam masala. Paneer Lababdar is a delicious and indulgent vegetarian dish that pairs well with naan or rice for a satisfying meal.
ingredients: 250g paneer (Indian cottage cheese), cut into cubes , 2 onions, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, pureed , 1 green bell pepper, diced , 1 red bell pepper, diced , 2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1/2 cup heavy cream , 2 tablespoons cooking oil or ghee , Salt to taste , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish.

name: Tomato Soup
description: Tomato Soup is a classic comfort food known for its rich and savory flavor. Made with ripe tomatoes, onions, garlic, and aromatic herbs, this soup is both comforting and satisfying. It's a perfect choice for a cozy meal on a chilly day or as a quick and easy appetizer. Enjoy it garnished with a drizzle of cream or a sprinkle of fresh herbs for added flavor.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 2 (14.5 oz) cans diced tomatoes , 2 cups vegetable broth , 1 teaspoon dried basil , 1 teaspoon dried oregano , Salt and pepper to taste , Optional toppings: fresh basil leaves, cream, croutons.
instruction: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add chopped onions and cook until translucent. Add minced garlic to the pot and cook for an additional minute. Add diced tomatoes (with their juices) to the pot, along with vegetable broth, dried basil, and dried oregano. Stir to combine. Bring the mixture to a simmer and let it cook for about 15-20 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together. Once the soup has cooked and the flavors have developed, use an immersion blender or transfer the soup to a blender in batches to puree until smooth. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste. Adjust the seasoning as needed. Serve the tomato soup hot, garnished with fresh basil leaves, a swirl of cream, or croutons if desired.

name: Lauki Kofta
description: Lauki Kofta is a popular North Indian dish made from grated bottle gourd mixed with spices, shaped into balls, and fried until golden brown. These koftas are then simmered in a flavorful tomato-based gravy until they soak up all the delicious flavors. It's a delicious and nutritious vegetarian dish that's perfect for lunch or dinner, served with rice or Indian bread.
ingredients: 1 medium-sized bottle gourd (lauki) , 2 medium-sized potatoes, boiled and mashed , 1/2 cup gram flour (besan) , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , Salt to taste , Oil for frying , For Gravy: 2 onions, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, pureed , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , 2 tablespoons oil , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Peel the bottle gourd and grate it. Squeeze out the excess water from the grated bottle gourd. In a mixing bowl, combine grated bottle gourd, mashed potatoes, gram flour, ginger-garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well to form a dough. Divide the dough into small portions and shape them into round koftas. Heat oil in a pan and deep fry the koftas until they turn golden brown. Drain them on a paper towel to remove excess oil. In another pan, heat oil and add cumin seeds. Once they splutter, add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute. Then, add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, garam masala, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for a few minutes. Add water to adjust the consistency of the gravy and bring it to a simmer. Gently place the fried koftas into the gravy and simmer for 5-7 minutes. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Bhatura
description: Bhatura is a popular North Indian fried bread made from a dough of all-purpose flour, yogurt, sugar, and leavening agents. The dough is rested, rolled into small discs, and deep-fried until puffed and golden brown. Bhaturas are soft, fluffy, and have a slightly crispy exterior, making them a perfect accompaniment to spicy curries or chole. Enjoyed hot and fresh, Bhaturas are a delicious and indulgent treat loved by many.
ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour , 1/2 cup plain yogurt , 1 teaspoon sugar , 1/2 teaspoon baking powder , 1/4 teaspoon baking soda , Salt to taste , Water (as needed for kneading) , Oil (for deep frying).
instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Add plain yogurt to the dry ingredients and mix well. Gradually add water and knead the mixture into a soft and smooth dough. Cover the dough and let it rest for about 2 hours. After resting, divide the dough into small equal-sized balls. Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat. Roll out each ball into a thin circle or oval shape using a rolling pin. Carefully slide the rolled dough into the hot oil and fry until golden brown and puffed up, flipping once to ensure even cooking. Remove the fried Bhatura from the oil using a slotted spoon and drain excess oil on paper towels. Serve hot with your favorite curry or side dish.

name: Besan Ke Laddu
description: Besan Ke Laddu is a traditional Indian sweet made from roasted gram flour (besan), ghee (clarified butter), sugar, and flavored with cardamom. The besan is roasted in ghee until golden brown, then mixed with powdered sugar and shaped into round laddus. These laddus are aromatic, rich, and melt-in-your-mouth delicious, making them a popular choice for festivals and celebrations.
ingredients: 2 cups besan (gram flour) , 3/4 cup ghee (clarified butter) , 1 cup powdered sugar , 1/2 teaspoon cardamom powder , 2 tablespoons chopped nuts (almonds, cashews, pistachios), optional.
instruction: Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan over medium heat. Add besan to the melted ghee and roast it on low to medium heat, stirring continuously to prevent burning. Roast until besan turns golden brown and aromatic. This usually takes about 12-15 minutes. Turn off the heat and let the roasted besan cool down slightly. Add powdered sugar, cardamom powder, and chopped nuts to the roasted besan. Mix well until all the ingredients are combined. Allow the mixture to cool down to a temperature where it can be handled comfortably. Take small portions of the mixture and shape them into round laddus by rolling between your palms. Repeat the process until all the mixture is used up and laddus are formed. Let the laddus set at room temperature for about 1-2 hours before serving.

name: Tawa Paneer
description: Tawa Paneer is a flavorful Indian dish made with paneer (Indian cottage cheese), spices, and vegetables cooked on a tawa (griddle). The dish is quick and easy to prepare, featuring a delicious blend of tangy tomatoes, aromatic spices, and creamy paneer. Served hot and garnished with fresh cilantro leaves, Tawa Paneer is a popular vegetarian option that pairs well with rice, roti, or naan. It's a satisfying dish that's perfect for lunch, dinner, or any special occasion.
ingredients: 250g paneer (Indian cottage cheese), cut into cubes , 2 tablespoons vegetable oil , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 1 green bell pepper, sliced , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 green chili, finely chopped (optional) , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish.
instruction: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or tawa (griddle) over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Stir in ginger-garlic paste and chopped green chili (if using), and cook for another minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and oil starts to separate. Add sliced green bell pepper and cook for a few minutes until they are slightly tender. Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well. Gently add the paneer cubes to the skillet and stir to coat them with the masala. Cook for a few more minutes until the paneer is heated through and well coated with the masala. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Paneer Makhanwala
description: Paneer Makhanwala is a creamy and indulgent Indian dish featuring cubes of paneer (Indian cottage cheese) cooked in a rich and flavorful tomato-based gravy. The gravy is made with onions, tomatoes, and a blend of aromatic spices, giving it a luscious texture and a burst of delicious flavors. Finished with a touch of cream and garnished with fresh cilantro, Paneer Makhanwala is a comforting and satisfying dish that pairs perfectly with rice or naan.
ingredients: 250g paneer (Indian cottage cheese), cubed , 2 tablespoons butter , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, pureed , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1/2 cup heavy cream , Salt to taste , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish.
instruction: Heat butter in a pan over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute until the raw smell disappears. Stir in the tomato puree and cook until the oil starts to separate from the masala. Add red chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for another minute. Add the cubed paneer to the masala and mix gently to coat the paneer pieces with the sauce. Pour in the heavy cream and mix until well combined. Let it simmer for a few minutes until the gravy thickens. Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with fresh cilantro leaves. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Chana Dal (Split Chickpeas)
description: Chana Dal, also known as split chickpeas, is a popular Indian dish made from dried split chickpeas. It's a nutritious and flavorful dish that's easy to prepare. The dal is cooked until tender and then tempered with aromatic spices like cumin seeds, ginger, garlic, and chili peppers. The result is a hearty and comforting dish that pairs well with rice or bread. Chana Dal is not only delicious but also packed with protein, making it a healthy choice for vegetarians and vegans.
ingredients: 1 cup chana dal (split chickpeas) , 3 cups water , 1 tablespoon oil or ghee , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 2 green chilies, chopped (adjust according to taste) , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust according to taste) , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , Salt to taste , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish.
instruction: Rinse the chana dal under cold water until the water runs clear. In a pressure cooker or pot, add the rinsed chana dal and water. Cook until the dal is tender and cooked through. This may take about 15-20 minutes in a pressure cooker or around 40 minutes in a pot. In a separate pan, heat oil or ghee over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent. Stir in chopped tomatoes, green chilies, and ginger-garlic paste. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and mashed. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for a couple of minutes. Once the chana dal is cooked, add it to the pan with the onion-tomato mixture. Mix everything well and let it simmer for a few minutes to blend the flavors. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Sarson Ka Saag
description: Sarson Ka Saag is a traditional Punjabi dish made with mustard greens and spices. It's a flavorful and nutritious dish that's popular in North Indian cuisine. The greens are cooked until tender and then mashed with aromatic spices like ginger, garlic, and chili. Served hot with cornmeal flatbread (makki di roti), it's a comforting and wholesome meal, perfect for cold winter days.
ingredients: 500 grams mustard greens (sarson) , 250 grams spinach leaves , 2 green chilies, chopped , 1 onion, chopped , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 4 cloves garlic, minced , 1-inch ginger, grated , 2 tablespoons ghee or butter , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , Salt to taste , Water as needed.
instruction: Clean and wash mustard greens and spinach leaves thoroughly. Chop them finely. In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add chopped mustard greens and spinach. Cook until tender, then drain and set aside. Heat ghee or butter in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them crackle. Add chopped onions, green chilies, minced garlic, and grated ginger. Sauté until onions are translucent. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy. Add cooked mustard greens and spinach to the pan. Mix well. Add red chili powder and salt to taste. Cook for 10-15 minutes on low heat, stirring occasionally. Using a hand blender or potato masher, roughly mash the mixture to your desired consistency. Cook for an additional 5-10 minutes until the flavors are well combined. Serve hot with makki di roti (cornmeal flatbread) or any other flatbread of your choice.

name: Moong Dal Khichdi
description: Moong Dal Khichdi is a comforting and nutritious one-pot meal made with rice and split moong dal (yellow lentils). It's seasoned with aromatic spices like cumin seeds, ginger, and turmeric, and can be customized with green chilies for heat. This simple and hearty dish is easy to prepare and is perfect for a wholesome meal any time of the day. Garnish with fresh cilantro for added flavor and serve hot for a satisfying and comforting experience.
ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice , 1/2 cup split moong dal (yellow lentils) , 3 cups water , 1 tablespoon ghee or oil , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon grated ginger , 1-2 green chilies, chopped (optional) , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , Salt to taste , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish.
instruction: Rinse the basmati rice and moong dal under cold water until the water runs clear. Drain and set aside. In a large pot or pressure cooker, heat ghee or oil over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add grated ginger and chopped green chilies (if using) to the pot. Sauté for a minute until fragrant. Add the drained rice and moong dal to the pot. Stir well to coat the grains with the spices. Pour in water and add turmeric powder and salt. Stir to combine. If using a pressure cooker, close the lid and cook on medium heat for 3-4 whistles. If using a pot, bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the rice and dal are cooked and the khichdi is thick and creamy. Once cooked, let the pressure release naturally (if using a pressure cooker) or allow the khichdi to rest for a few minutes. Serve hot garnished with fresh cilantro leaves.

name: Moong Dal Halwa
description: Moong Dal Halwa is a rich and indulgent Indian dessert made from ground yellow lentils, sugar, and ghee (clarified butter). The lentils are cooked until golden brown, then simmered with sugar until the mixture thickens into a luxurious, sweet halwa. Flavored with cardamom and garnished with nuts, this dessert is a delightful treat often served during special occasions and festivals. Its creamy texture and aromatic flavor make it a beloved favorite among dessert lovers.
ingredients: 1 cup split yellow moong dal (skinless) , 1 cup ghee (clarified butter) , 1 cup sugar , 4 cups water , 1/2 teaspoon cardamom powder , Saffron strands (optional) , Chopped nuts for garnish (such as almonds, cashews, pistachios).
instruction: Rinse the moong dal under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the dal in water for 4-5 hours or overnight. Drain the soaked dal and grind it into a coarse paste using a food processor or grinder. Add a little water if needed. Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan or kadhai over medium heat. Add the ground moong dal paste to the hot ghee and sauté, stirring continuously, until it turns golden brown and aromatic. This may take around 20-25 minutes. Meanwhile, in a separate saucepan, boil 4 cups of water. Once the moong dal turns golden brown, carefully add the boiling water to it. Be cautious as it may splutter. Cook the mixture, stirring continuously, until the water is absorbed and the dal is cooked through. This may take about 10-15 minutes. Add sugar to the cooked dal and continue to cook, stirring frequently, until the sugar is dissolved and the mixture thickens. Add cardamom powder and saffron strands (if using), and mix well. Garnish the halwa with chopped nuts. Serve hot or warm. Enjoy the delicious Moong Dal Halwa!

name: Gulab Jamun
description: Gulab Jamun is a popular Indian dessert made from milk solids, flour, and sugar syrup. Soft, melt-in-your-mouth dough balls are deep-fried until golden brown and then soaked in a fragrant sugar syrup flavored with cardamom and saffron. This sweet treat is enjoyed warm or cold and is often served at festivals, celebrations, and special occasions.
ingredients: 1 cup milk powder , 1/4 cup all-purpose flour , 1/4 teaspoon baking soda , 2 tablespoons ghee (clarified butter) , 3 tablespoons milk , Oil for frying , 1 cup sugar , 1 cup water , 1/2 teaspoon cardamom powder , Saffron strands (optional) , Chopped pistachios or almonds for garnish (optional).
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine milk powder, all-purpose flour, and baking soda. Add ghee to the dry ingredients and mix well. Gradually add milk and knead the mixture into a soft dough. If the dough is too dry, add a little more milk. Divide the dough into small equal-sized portions and roll them into smooth balls without any cracks. Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat. Once the oil is hot, reduce the heat to low. Gently slide the prepared dough balls into the hot oil and fry them on low heat until they turn golden brown, stirring occasionally for even cooking. It may take about 8-10 minutes. Remove the fried gulab jamuns from the oil and drain them on paper towels to remove excess oil. In a separate saucepan, combine sugar and water to make the sugar syrup. Bring it to a boil, stirring until the sugar dissolves completely. Add cardamom powder and saffron strands to the sugar syrup and simmer for a few minutes until it slightly thickens. Turn off the heat and gently drop the fried gulab jamuns into the warm sugar syrup. Let them soak for at least 30 minutes. Garnish with chopped pistachios or almonds before serving.

name: Ladies Finger Curry
description: Ladies Finger Curry is a flavorful dish featuring tender okra cooked in a fragrant and spicy tomato-based sauce. This vegetarian curry is infused with aromatic spices like turmeric, coriander, and cumin, creating a delicious and satisfying meal. Served hot with rice or roti, it's a comforting and wholesome dish that's perfect for any occasion. Enjoy the unique taste and texture of this classic Indian curry!
ingredients: 250g ladies finger (okra), washed and trimmed , 2 tablespoons vegetable oil , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1-inch piece of ginger, grated , 1 green chili, chopped (optional) , 1 teaspoon ground turmeric , 1 teaspoon ground coriander , 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin , 1/2 teaspoon chili powder (adjust to taste) , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chili (if using). Sauté for another minute until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes to the pan and cook until they soften and break down. Stir in ground turmeric, ground coriander, ground cumin, and chili powder. Cook the spices for a minute to release their flavors. Add the washed and trimmed ladies finger (okra) to the pan. Mix well to coat the okra with the spices. Cover the pan and cook the curry over medium-low heat for about 10-15 minutes or until the okra is tender, stirring occasionally. Once the okra is cooked, season with salt to taste and garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Moong Dal
description: Moong Dal is a popular Indian dish made from split yellow mung beans. It's a comforting and nutritious dish that is easy to prepare and versatile. The dal is cooked until soft and creamy, then tempered with aromatic spices like cumin, ginger, and garlic. It's typically served with rice or roti and garnished with fresh cilantro. Moong Dal is not only delicious but also rich in protein, making it a healthy and satisfying meal option for vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike.
ingredients: 1 cup split yellow moong dal (skinless) , 3 cups water , 1 tablespoon ghee or oil , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon minced ginger , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 1 green chili, finely chopped (adjust to taste) , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder , Salt to taste , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish , Lemon wedges for serving (optional).
instruction: Rinse the moong dal under cold water until the water runs clear. Drain and set aside. In a pressure cooker or large pot, add the rinsed moong dal and water. Cook until soft and mushy. If using a pressure cooker, cook for about 3-4 whistles. In a separate pan, heat ghee or oil over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add minced ginger and garlic, and sauté for a minute until fragrant. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Stir in chopped tomatoes and green chili. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and mushy. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for another minute. Add the cooked moong dal to the pan and mix everything together. If the dal is too thick, add some water to adjust the consistency. Let the dal simmer for a few minutes to allow the flavors to meld together. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves and serve hot with rice or roti. You can also squeeze some lemon juice on top before serving for extra freshness (optional).

name: Aloo Kofta
description: Aloo Kofta is a classic Indian dish consisting of potato and paneer (cottage cheese) balls cooked in a flavorful tomato-based gravy. The potato and paneer balls are spiced with aromatic Indian spices, deep-fried until golden, and then simmered in a rich and creamy gravy. This dish is hearty, comforting, and bursting with flavors, making it a popular choice for vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike. Serve Aloo Kofta with rice or Indian bread for a satisfying meal.
ingredients: 4 medium-sized potatoes, boiled and mashed , 1/2 cup paneer (Indian cottage cheese), grated , 2 tablespoons corn flour or besan (gram flour) , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , Oil for deep frying , For Gravy: 2 onions, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, pureed , 1-inch ginger, grated , 3-4 garlic cloves, minced , 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine mashed potatoes, grated paneer, corn flour (or besan), red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well to form a smooth dough. Divide the mixture into small equal-sized portions and shape them into round balls (koftas). Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat. Once the oil is hot, carefully add the koftas in batches and fry until golden brown and crispy. Remove from the oil and drain excess oil on paper towels. In a separate pan, heat some oil. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add grated ginger and minced garlic. Sauté for a minute until fragrant. Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates from the masala. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well and cook for a few minutes. Add water to adjust the consistency of the gravy and bring it to a gentle boil. Gently add the fried koftas into the gravy and simmer for a few minutes, allowing the koftas to absorb the flavors of the gravy. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Achari Paneer
description: Achari Paneer is a flavorful North Indian dish made with paneer (Indian cottage cheese) cooked in a tangy and aromatic masala infused with pickling spices. This vegetarian delicacy combines the creamy texture of paneer with the bold flavors of cumin, fennel, mustard, fenugreek, and nigella seeds. The dish is mildly spicy, tangy, and pairs well with Indian breads like roti or naan. Achari Paneer is a delightful addition to any meal and is sure to tantalize your taste buds with its unique blend of spices.
ingredients: 250g paneer, cubed , 2 tablespoons oil , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon fennel seeds , 1 teaspoon mustard seeds , 1 teaspoon fenugreek seeds , 1 teaspoon nigella seeds (kalonji) , 1 onion, finely chopped , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 2 tomatoes, pureed , 1 tablespoon achari masala (pickle spice mix) , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds, fennel seeds, mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, and nigella seeds. Sauté until they crackle. Add finely chopped onion and sauté until it turns golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté until the raw smell disappears. Add tomato puree, achari masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until the oil separates from the masala. Add paneer cubes and mix gently to coat them with the masala. Cook for another 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Butter Naan
description: Butter Naan is a popular Indian flatbread made with flour, yeast, yogurt, and butter. It's soft, fluffy, and slightly chewy, with a delicious buttery flavor. Traditionally cooked in a tandoor (clay oven), it can also be made on a stovetop skillet or tawa. Perfect for scooping up curries or enjoying on its own, Butter Naan is a favorite accompaniment to Indian meals.
ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour , 1 teaspoon active dry yeast , 1 teaspoon sugar , 1/2 teaspoon salt , 2 tablespoons plain yogurt , 2 tablespoons melted butter , 3/4 cup lukewarm water , Extra flour for dusting , Melted butter for brushing (optional).
instruction: In a small bowl, combine the lukewarm water, sugar, and active dry yeast. Let it sit for 5-10 minutes until frothy. In a large mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour and salt. Make a well in the center and add the activated yeast mixture, plain yogurt, and melted butter. Mix everything together to form a soft dough. If the dough is too sticky, add a little more flour. Knead the dough on a lightly floured surface for about 5-7 minutes until smooth and elastic. Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover it with a damp cloth, and let it rest in a warm place for about 1-2 hours until it doubles in size. Once the dough has risen, punch it down and divide it into small equal-sized balls. Roll out each ball into a thin oval or round shape, about 1/4 inch thick. Heat a skillet or tawa over medium-high heat. Place the rolled-out naan on the hot skillet and cook for about 1-2 minutes until bubbles form on the surface. Flip the naan and cook for another 1-2 minutes until lightly browned and cooked through. If desired, brush the cooked naan with melted butter. Repeat the process with the remaining dough balls. Serve the Butter Naan hot with your favorite curry or dish.

name: Mango Pickle
description: Mango Pickle is a tangy and spicy condiment made from raw mangoes, spices, and oil. The diced mangoes are mixed with a blend of mustard oil, mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, turmeric, red chili powder, salt, and other spices. This mixture is then stored in a jar and left to marinate for a few days to allow the flavors to meld together. The result is a delicious and versatile pickle that pairs well with various Indian dishes, adding a burst of flavor to every bite.
ingredients: 2 large raw mangoes, peeled and diced , 3 tablespoons mustard oil , 2 teaspoons mustard seeds , 1 teaspoon fenugreek seeds , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 2 teaspoons red chili powder (adjust according to spice preference) , 1 tablespoon salt , 1 teaspoon asafoetida (hing) , 1 tablespoon vinegar , 2 tablespoons jaggery (optional, for sweetness) , Fresh curry leaves (optional, for flavor).
instruction: Heat mustard oil in a pan over medium heat. Allow it to cool slightly. In a separate pan, dry roast mustard seeds and fenugreek seeds until fragrant. Grind them into a fine powder using a mortar and pestle. In a mixing bowl, combine diced mangoes with turmeric powder, red chili powder, salt, and asafoetida. Add the ground mustard-fenugreek powder to the mango mixture. Mix well. Pour the cooled mustard oil over the mango mixture. Add vinegar and jaggery (if using). Mix thoroughly. Transfer the mango pickle mixture to a clean, sterilized jar. Allow the pickle to marinate for at least 24 hours before consuming. It can be stored in the refrigerator for up to a month.

name: Kheer
description: Kheer is a creamy and aromatic Indian rice pudding made with basmati rice, milk, sugar, and flavored with cardamom. It's often garnished with chopped nuts and dried fruits, creating a rich and indulgent dessert. This beloved dish is enjoyed on various occasions and festivals, serving as a comforting and satisfying sweet treat.
ingredients: 1/2 cup basmati rice , 4 cups whole milk , 1/2 cup sugar (adjust to taste) , 1/4 cup chopped nuts (almonds, pistachios, cashews) , 1/4 teaspoon ground cardamom , Saffron strands (optional) , Rose water or kewra water (optional) , Dried fruits for garnish (raisins, chopped dates).
instruction: Rinse the basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Drain and set aside. In a large heavy-bottomed saucepan, bring the whole milk to a boil over medium heat. Add the rinsed rice to the boiling milk and reduce the heat to low. Simmer gently, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking, until the rice is cooked and the mixture thickens, about 30-40 minutes.
