Add sugar, chopped nuts, ground cardamom, and saffron strands (if using). Stir well to combine. Continue to simmer for another 10-15 minutes until the kheer thickens further to your desired consistency. Remove the kheer from heat and stir in a few drops of rose water or kewra water for added fragrance (if using). Let the kheer cool to room temperature before serving. Garnish with dried fruits before serving.

name: Amritsari Chole
description: Amritsari Chole is a popular North Indian dish featuring tender chickpeas cooked in a flavorful and aromatic gravy. This dish originates from the city of Amritsar and is known for its rich and hearty flavors. The chickpeas are simmered with a blend of spices, including cumin, coriander, turmeric, and garam masala, creating a robust and savory curry. Served with rice or naan bread, Amritsari Chole is a comforting and satisfying meal that's perfect for any occasion.
ingredients: 2 cups dried chickpeas (or 2 cans of chickpeas, drained and rinsed) , 2 tablespoons cooking oil , 1 large onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1-inch piece of ginger, minced , 2 green chilies, chopped (adjust according to spice preference) , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1 teaspoon dried mango powder (amchur) , Salt to taste , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish.
instruction: If using dried chickpeas, soak them in water overnight. Cook the soaked chickpeas in a pressure cooker with water until tender. If using canned chickpeas, rinse them under cold water and set aside. Heat cooking oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Stir in minced garlic, ginger, and green chilies. Cook for a couple of minutes until fragrant. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy and oil starts to separate. Mix in coriander powder, turmeric powder, and garam masala. Cook for another minute. Add cooked chickpeas to the pan along with some water (if required) to adjust the consistency. Season with salt and dried mango powder (amchur). Mix well and let it simmer for 10-15 minutes to allow the flavors to blend. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Kulfi
description: Kulfi is a traditional Indian frozen dessert made with milk, sugar, and flavorings like cardamom and saffron. It's similar to ice cream but denser and creamier. The mixture is simmered to reduce and thicken before being poured into molds and frozen until solid. Kulfi is often garnished with chopped nuts and enjoyed as a refreshing treat on hot days or as a sweet ending to a meal.
ingredients: 4 cups whole milk , 1/2 cup sweetened condensed milk , 1/4 cup sugar (adjust to taste) , 1/4 cup chopped nuts (such as almonds, pistachios) , 1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder , A pinch of saffron strands (optional).
instruction: In a heavy-bottomed saucepan, bring the whole milk to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally to prevent burning. Once the milk comes to a boil, reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 30-40 minutes, stirring frequently, until the milk reduces to about half its original volume. Add the sweetened condensed milk, sugar, chopped nuts, cardamom powder, and saffron strands (if using). Stir well to combine. Continue to simmer the mixture for another 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it thickens to a custard-like consistency. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the mixture cool slightly. Pour the kulfi mixture into individual molds or popsicle molds. Alternatively, you can use small cups or bowls. Insert wooden sticks into each mold and freeze the kulfi for at least 6-8 hours or until completely set. Once the kulfi is firm and frozen, remove it from the molds by running them under warm water for a few seconds. Serve immediately or store in the freezer until ready to serve.

name: Paneer Makhani
description: Paneer Makhani is a classic North Indian dish featuring paneer (Indian cottage cheese) cooked in a rich and creamy tomato-based gravy. This dish is flavored with aromatic spices like garam masala, ginger, and garlic, creating a flavorful and indulgent curry. Served hot with rice or naan, Paneer Makhani is a popular vegetarian dish loved for its creamy texture and delicious taste.
ingredients: 250g paneer (Indian cottage cheese), cubed , 2 tablespoons butter , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, pureed , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin , 1/2 cup heavy cream , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Heat butter in a pan over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Stir in ginger-garlic paste and cook for another minute. Add tomato puree and cook until the mixture thickens and the oil separates from the sides of the pan. Add red chili powder, garam masala, turmeric powder, ground cumin, and salt. Mix well. Pour in heavy cream and simmer for 2-3 minutes. Add cubed paneer to the sauce and gently mix until the paneer is coated with the sauce. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the paneer is heated through. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Paneer Pasanda
description: Paneer Pasanda is a popular North Indian dish featuring thick slices of paneer (Indian cottage cheese) marinated in a yogurt-spice mixture, then pan-fried until golden. These paneer slices are then simmered in a rich and creamy gravy made from onions, tomatoes, cashew nuts, and cream. The dish is garnished with fresh cilantro leaves and is known for its rich, creamy texture and aromatic flavors. It's a favorite among vegetarians and is often served with naan or rice for a satisfying meal.
ingredients: 250 grams paneer (Indian cottage cheese), sliced into thick pieces , 1 cup yogurt , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons oil or ghee (clarified butter) , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, pureed , 1/2 cup cream , 1/4 cup cashew nuts, ground into a paste , Fresh cilantro (coriander) leaves for garnish.
instruction: In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt to make the marinade. Marinate the paneer slices in this mixture for about 30 minutes. Heat oil or ghee in a pan and fry the marinated paneer slices until golden brown. Remove and set aside. In the same pan, add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates from the mixture. Stir in the cashew nut paste and cook for a few minutes. Add cream and mix well. Cook for another couple of minutes. Place the fried paneer slices in the gravy and simmer for 5-7 minutes. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Paneer Tikka Masala
description: Paneer Tikka Masala is a popular Indian dish featuring marinated paneer cubes cooked in a creamy and flavorful tomato-based gravy. The paneer is first marinated in yogurt and spices, then grilled or sautéed until golden and tender. It's then simmered in a rich and aromatic sauce made from tomatoes, onions, garlic, and various spices like chili, turmeric, and garam masala. Cream is added for richness, resulting in a creamy and indulgent dish that pairs perfectly with rice or naan. Paneer Tikka Masala is loved for its delicious taste and comforting flavors, making it a favorite in Indian cuisine.
ingredients: For Paneer Tikka: 250g paneer, cut into cubes , 1/2 cup yogurt , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1 tablespoon lemon juice , Salt to taste , 1 tablespoon oil , For Gravy: 2 tablespoons oil , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, pureed , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , 1/2 cup heavy cream , Salt to taste , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish.
instruction: In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt to make a marinade. Add paneer cubes to the marinade and coat them well. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes. Heat oil in a pan and sauté the marinated paneer cubes until they turn golden brown. Set aside. In the same pan, heat 2 tablespoons of oil and sauté chopped onions until they turn translucent. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until the raw smell disappears. Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates from the mixture. Add red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook for a few minutes. Add heavy cream and mix well. Cook for another 2-3 minutes. Add the sautéed paneer cubes to the gravy and mix gently. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves and serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Maa Ki Dal
description: Maa Ki Dal is a hearty and comforting Punjabi dish made from whole black lentils (urad dal) and red kidney beans (rajma). These lentils are cooked until creamy and infused with aromatic spices like cumin, turmeric, and garam masala. The dish is finished with a tempering of onions, tomatoes, garlic, and ginger, creating a rich and flavorful gravy. Maa Ki Dal is often enjoyed with rice or roti and is a staple in many Indian households. It's a wholesome and nutritious dish that is sure to satisfy your taste buds.
ingredients: 1 cup whole black lentils (urad dal) , 1/4 cup red kidney beans (rajma) , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1-inch piece of ginger, grated , 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons ghee or butter , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish.
instruction: Rinse the black lentils and kidney beans under cold water. Soak them together in water for at least 4 hours or overnight. In a pressure cooker, add the soaked lentils and kidney beans along with fresh water. Cook for about 4-5 whistles or until they are soft and fully cooked. Heat ghee or butter in a separate pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for another 2-3 minutes. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and mushy. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for a few more minutes. Once the lentils and beans are cooked, add them to the pan along with any remaining water from the pressure cooker. Mash the lentils and beans slightly with the back of a spoon to thicken the dal. Add garam masala and mix well. Let the dal simmer for 10-15 minutes on low heat, stirring occasionally. Adjust the consistency of the dal by adding more water if needed. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Kashmiri Dum Aloo
description: Kashmiri Dum Aloo is a traditional Indian dish featuring baby potatoes cooked in a rich and aromatic gravy. The potatoes are first boiled, then simmered in a flavorful blend of spices, including ginger, garlic, turmeric, and chili powder. The dish is finished with a creamy yogurt sauce, adding a touch of tanginess to the hearty flavors. Garnished with fresh coriander, Kashmiri Dum Aloo is a comforting and satisfying dish that pairs perfectly with rice or bread.
ingredients: 500g baby potatoes , 2 tablespoons vegetable oil , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, pureed , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon ground fennel seeds , 1 teaspoon ground dry ginger powder , 1/2 cup yogurt , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Boil the baby potatoes until they are just tender. Peel and prick the potatoes with a fork. Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Stir in ginger-garlic paste and cook for another minute. Add tomato puree, turmeric powder, red chili powder, ground fennel seeds, and ground dry ginger powder. Cook until the oil separates from the masala. Whisk the yogurt and add it to the masala. Stir well to combine. Add the boiled potatoes to the masala and coat them evenly. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally. Cover the pan with a lid and let the potatoes simmer on low heat for about 15-20 minutes until they are cooked through and the flavors are well infused. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Gobi Masala
description: Gobi Masala is a flavorful Indian dish made with cauliflower (gobi) cooked in a spiced tomato-based gravy. The cauliflower is gently simmered in a blend of aromatic spices, including ginger, garlic, cumin, turmeric, and chili powder, creating a rich and satisfying vegetarian curry. Garnished with fresh coriander leaves, this dish is both nutritious and delicious, perfect for serving with rice or flatbread for a hearty meal.
ingredients: 1 medium cauliflower (gobi), cut into florets , 2 tablespoons oil , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, pureed , 2 teaspoons ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for another minute until the raw smell disappears. Add pureed tomatoes and cook until the oil separates from the masala. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well. Add cauliflower florets and stir to coat them with the masala mixture. Cover and cook on low heat for about 15-20 minutes or until the cauliflower is tender, stirring occasionally. Once the cauliflower is cooked, garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with roti, naan, or rice.

name: Matar Kachori
description: Matar Kachori is a popular Indian snack made with a crispy, flaky outer crust filled with a flavorful mixture of spiced green peas. These deep-fried pastries are seasoned with aromatic spices like cumin, ginger, garlic, and green chili, making them a delicious and satisfying treat. Enjoyed as a snack or appetizer, Matar Kachori is best served hot with tangy chutneys or sauces for dipping.
ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour , 1/4 cup vegetable oil , 1 cup green peas (fresh or frozen) , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon ginger paste , 1 teaspoon garlic paste , 1 green chili, finely chopped , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , Vegetable oil for frying.
instruction: Prepare the Dough: In a large mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, vegetable oil, and a pinch of salt. Gradually add water and knead the mixture to form a smooth dough. Cover the dough and let it rest for 15-20 minutes. Prepare the Filling: Heat a tablespoon of vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add ginger paste, garlic paste, and green chili. Saute for a minute. Add green peas, turmeric powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook until the peas are tender. Mash the peas slightly while cooking. Let the filling cool down. Assemble the Kachoris: Divide the dough into equal-sized balls. Roll out each ball into a small circle. Place a spoonful of the prepared filling in the center of each circle. Bring the edges together and pinch to seal, forming a stuffed ball. Flatten the ball slightly. Fry the Kachoris: Heat vegetable oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat. Once the oil is hot, carefully slide in the stuffed kachoris, a few at a time. Fry until they turn golden brown and crispy on both sides. Remove the kachoris from the oil and drain excess oil on paper towels. Serve: Serve the hot and crispy Matar Kachoris with your favorite chutney or sauce.

name: Stuffed Capsicum
description: Stuffed Capsicum is a delicious dish where bell peppers are filled with a flavorful mixture of cooked quinoa or rice, beans, corn, onions, garlic, and spices. Topped with cheese and baked until tender, these stuffed peppers are hearty, nutritious, and bursting with flavor. Perfect for a satisfying vegetarian meal or as a colorful side dish, Stuffed Capsicum is sure to be a hit at any dinner table.
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers (any color) , 1 cup cooked quinoa or rice , 1 cup cooked black beans (or any beans of your choice) , 1 cup corn kernels , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1 teaspoon ground cumin , 1 teaspoon chili powder , Salt and pepper to taste , 1 cup grated cheese (cheddar or mozzarella) , Fresh cilantro or parsley for garnish.
instruction: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes from the insides. In a large skillet, heat some olive oil over medium heat. Add chopped onions and minced garlic and sauté until softened. Add cooked quinoa or rice, black beans, corn kernels, ground cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Stir well to combine and cook for a few minutes until heated through. Stuff the bell peppers with the quinoa/bean mixture and place them in a baking dish. Sprinkle grated cheese over the stuffed bell peppers. Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes or until the peppers are tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly. Remove the foil and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes to brown the cheese slightly. Garnish with fresh cilantro or parsley before serving.

name: Dal Bukhara
description: Dal Bukhara is a rich and creamy Indian dish made primarily with whole black lentils (urad dal), kidney beans (rajma), butter, cream, and various aromatic spices. The lentils and beans are simmered for hours until they become soft and creamy, then blended together to create a thick texture. The dish is flavored with spices like cumin, coriander, ginger, garlic, and sometimes fenugreek leaves. It's typically served hot with naan bread or rice and garnished with a dollop of butter or cream.
ingredients: 1 cup whole black lentils (urad dal) , 1/2 cup kidney beans (rajma) , 3 cups water (for soaking) , 4 cups water (for cooking) , 2 tablespoons ghee or butter , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 2 teaspoons ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , Salt to taste , 1/4 cup cream (optional) , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Rinse the lentils and kidney beans under cold water. Soak them in 3 cups of water overnight or for at least 8 hours. After soaking, drain the water and rinse the lentils and beans again. Transfer them to a pressure cooker or a large pot. Add 4 cups of water to the lentils and beans along with some salt. Pressure cook for about 20-25 minutes on medium heat, or until they are soft and cooked through. If using a pot, it may take longer, around 45-60 minutes. Once cooked, mash some of the lentils and beans using the back of a spoon or a masher to thicken the mixture. In a separate pan, heat ghee or butter. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute until the raw smell disappears. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy and oil starts to separate. Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder. Mix well and cook for another minute. Transfer this mixture to the cooked lentils and beans. Stir well to combine. Simmer the dal for another 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, allowing the flavors to meld together. If using cream, stir it in now and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with naan bread or rice.

name: Aloo Kulcha
description: Aloo Kulcha is a popular Indian bread stuffed with a spiced potato filling. To make it, prepare a dough with flour, baking powder, yogurt, and oil. Stuff it with a mixture of mashed potatoes, onions, spices, and herbs. Roll out the stuffed dough and cook it on a griddle with butter or ghee until golden brown. Serve hot with yogurt or chutney.
ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour , 1 teaspoon baking powder , 1/2 teaspoon salt , 1/2 cup yogurt , 1 tablespoon oil , Water, as needed , 2 large potatoes, boiled and mashed , 1 small onion, finely chopped , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , 1 teaspoon ginger paste , 1 teaspoon garlic paste , 1 teaspoon chaat masala , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt, to taste , Fresh coriander leaves, chopped , Butter or ghee, for cooking.
instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, baking powder, salt, yogurt, and oil. Mix well. Gradually add water and knead the mixture into a soft dough. Cover with a damp cloth and let it rest for 2 hours. In another bowl, mix together the mashed potatoes, chopped onion, green chilies, ginger paste, garlic paste, chaat masala, red chili powder, garam masala, salt, and fresh coriander leaves. Mix until well combined. Divide the dough and potato mixture into equal portions, shaping them into balls. Roll out each dough ball into a small circle. Place a portion of the potato mixture in the center and seal the edges, shaping it back into a ball. Flatten the stuffed dough ball gently using a rolling pin, ensuring the stuffing spreads evenly. Heat a griddle or tawa over medium heat. Place the stuffed kulcha on the hot griddle and cook until golden brown spots appear on both sides, applying butter or ghee as needed. Serve hot with yogurt, pickle, or chutney.

name: Easy Hara Bhara Kabab
description: Hara Bhara Kabab is a flavorful Indian appetizer made with spinach, peas, potatoes, and aromatic spices. The ingredients are blended to form a smooth mixture, shaped into patties, and shallow-fried until golden brown. These kababs are crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, making them a delicious and healthy snack or starter. Serve them hot with mint chutney for a delightful treat.
ingredients: 2 cups spinach leaves, washed and chopped , 1 cup green peas, boiled , 2 large potatoes, boiled and mashed , 2 green chilies, chopped , 1-inch piece of ginger, grated , 3 cloves of garlic, minced , 1/2 cup fresh coriander leaves, chopped , 1 teaspoon cumin powder , 1 teaspoon chaat masala , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , Bread crumbs (optional, for coating) , Oil for frying.
instruction: Steam or boil spinach leaves until wilted. Drain excess water and let them cool. In a food processor, combine spinach, green peas, green chilies, ginger, garlic, and coriander leaves. Blend until smooth. Transfer the mixture to a mixing bowl. Add mashed potatoes, cumin powder, chaat masala, garam masala, and salt. Mix well to form a smooth dough-like mixture. Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into small patties or kababs. If desired, roll the kababs in bread crumbs for an extra crispy texture. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Once the oil is hot, shallow fry the kababs until golden brown on both sides. Remove the kababs from the pan and place them on a paper towel to drain excess oil. Serve hot with mint chutney or sauce of your choice.

name: Motichur Laddu
description: Motichur Laddu is a traditional Indian sweet made from tiny, deep-fried chickpea flour droplets (boondi), mixed with sugar syrup, cardamom, saffron, and nuts. After shaping the mixture into small balls, it's typically garnished with edible silver foil. It's a beloved treat enjoyed during festivals and special occasions.
ingredients: 1 cup besan (gram flour) , 1 cup sugar , 1/2 cup water , Ghee or oil for frying , Assorted nuts (cashews, almonds, pistachios) - optional , Cardamom powder , Saffron strands (optional) , Edible silver foil (varak) - optional.
instruction: Heat ghee or oil in a deep frying pan. Meanwhile, mix besan with water to make a smooth, thick batter. Once the ghee is hot, pour a small amount of batter through a perforated ladle or a slotted spoon into the hot ghee, allowing droplets to fall and form tiny boondis (small chickpea flour droplets). Fry until golden brown, then remove and drain excess oil on paper towels. Repeat until all the batter is used. In a separate pan, prepare sugar syrup by dissolving sugar in water over medium heat. Stir until the sugar completely dissolves, then cook until it reaches one-string consistency (when a drop of syrup between your thumb and index finger forms a single thread). Add the fried boondis to the sugar syrup along with cardamom powder, saffron strands, and assorted nuts if desired. Mix well until everything is evenly coated. Allow the mixture to cool slightly until it can be handled comfortably. Take small portions of the mixture and shape them into round laddus (balls) by gently pressing and rolling between your palms. Optionally, decorate each laddu with edible silver foil (varak). Allow the laddus to cool completely before storing them in an airtight container.

name: Suji Ka Halwa
description: Suji Ka Halwa is a traditional Indian sweet dish made with semolina (suji), ghee (clarified butter), sugar, and flavored with cardamom. It's quick and easy to prepare, perfect for satisfying your sweet cravings. Garnished with chopped nuts, it's a delightful dessert or snack enjoyed across India.
ingredients: 1 cup semolina (suji) , 1/2 cup ghee (clarified butter) , 1 cup sugar , 2 cups water , 1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder , Assorted nuts (such as almonds, cashews, pistachios), chopped , Raisins (optional) , Saffron strands (optional).
instruction: Heat ghee in a pan over medium heat. Add semolina and roast it until it turns golden brown and aromatic. Keep stirring continuously to avoid burning. In another pot, heat water and sugar until the sugar dissolves completely to make a syrup. Slowly add the sugar syrup to the roasted semolina while continuously stirring to avoid lumps. Cook the mixture until the semolina absorbs the syrup and becomes thickened. Add cardamom powder and mix well. Optionally, add saffron strands soaked in a little warm milk for enhanced flavor and color. Garnish with chopped nuts and raisins. Serve hot.

name: Methi Mushroom Curry
description: Methi Mushroom Curry is a flavorful Indian dish combining mushrooms and fenugreek leaves in a rich, aromatic gravy. The mushrooms and methi leaves are cooked with onions, tomatoes, and spices to create a delicious and nutritious curry. It's a simple yet satisfying vegetarian dish that pairs well with rice or bread.
ingredients: 200g mushrooms, sliced , 1 cup fresh fenugreek leaves (methi), washed and chopped , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1-inch ginger, minced , 1 green chili, finely chopped (adjust to taste) , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons oil , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add minced garlic, ginger, and green chili. Sauté for another minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add sliced mushrooms and chopped fenugreek leaves. Mix well. Cover and cook for about 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the mushrooms are cooked and the methi leaves are wilted. Add garam masala and mix well. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Veg Makhanwala
description: Veg Makhanwala is a flavorful Indian dish made with mixed vegetables cooked in a creamy tomato-based sauce. The vegetables are simmered with aromatic spices, ginger-garlic paste, and tomato puree, then finished with cream to create a rich and indulgent gravy. It's a delicious and satisfying vegetarian option that pairs well with rice or naan bread.
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (such as carrots, peas, cauliflower, bell peppers) , 2 tablespoons butter or oil , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, pureed , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1/2 cup cream , Salt, to taste , Fresh coriander leaves, for garnish.
instruction: Heat butter or oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute until the raw smell disappears. Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates from the masala. Add red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well. Add mixed vegetables and cook until they are partially cooked yet firm. Pour in the cream and garam masala. Mix until well combined. Cover the pan and simmer the vegetables until they are fully cooked and the flavors are well blended. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Bhindi Fry
description: Bhindi Fry is a simple and flavorful Indian dish made with okra (bhindi), spices, and oil. The okra is sautéed until crispy and tender, then seasoned with a blend of aromatic spices like cumin, turmeric, coriander, red chili, and amchur (dry mango) powder for tanginess. It's a quick and delicious side dish that pairs well with rice or roti.
ingredients: 500g okra (bhindi), washed and dried 2 tablespoons oil (preferably mustard oil) 1 teaspoon cumin seeds 1 teaspoon turmeric powder 1 teaspoon coriander powder 1 teaspoon red chili powder 1 teaspoon amchur (dry mango) powder Salt to taste Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Trim the ends of the okra and cut them into 1-inch pieces. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add the okra pieces to the pan and sauté for 5-7 minutes until they are partially cooked. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, amchur powder, and salt to the okra. Mix well to coat the okra evenly with the spices. Continue to cook the okra for another 10-12 minutes until they are fully cooked and slightly crispy. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Kalakand
description: Kalakand is a traditional Indian sweet made with milk and sugar. It's rich, creamy, and slightly grainy in texture, with a hint of cardamom flavor. To prepare, milk is boiled until it thickens, then sugar and cardamom are added. The mixture is cooked until it reaches a fudge-like consistency, then poured into a tray, cooled, and cut into pieces. It's a delightful dessert often enjoyed during festivals and celebrations.
ingredients: 1 liter full-fat milk 1/4 cup lemon juice or vinegar 1/2 cup sugar (adjust to taste) 1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder 2 tablespoons chopped nuts (optional, for garnish).
instruction: Heat the milk in a heavy-bottomed pan over medium heat until it comes to a boil. Once the milk starts boiling, reduce the heat to low and add lemon juice or vinegar gradually while stirring continuously. The milk will begin to curdle. Continue stirring until the whey (yellowish liquid) separates completely from the curdled milk solids (chena). Turn off the heat and strain the mixture through a muslin cloth or fine sieve to separate the whey. Rinse the chena under cold water to remove any lemony flavor. Place the chena back in the pan and cook it over low heat, stirring constantly, until it thickens and starts leaving the sides of the pan. This may take about 15-20 minutes. Add sugar and cardamom powder to the thickened chena and mix well. Cook for another 5-10 minutes until the mixture thickens further. Transfer the mixture to a greased plate or tray and spread it evenly using a spatula. Garnish with chopped nuts if desired, and press them lightly into the mixture. Allow the kalakand to cool and set at room temperature for a few hours. Once set, cut the kalakand into squares or diamonds and serve.

name: Paneer Biryani
description: Paneer Biryani is a delectable Indian rice dish packed with the rich flavors of spices and paneer (Indian cottage cheese). To prepare this aromatic delicacy, basmati rice is cooked with succulent cubes of paneer, fragrant spices like cloves, cardamom, and cinnamon, along with a medley of onions, tomatoes, and yogurt blended with ginger-garlic paste. The dish is layered with partially cooked rice and the flavorful paneer mixture, then steamed until the rice is perfectly cooked and infused with all the savory flavors. Garnished with saffron-infused milk, fresh coriander leaves, and optionally fried onions, this Paneer Biryani is a delightful fusion of textures and tastes, making it a favorite among vegetarians and biryani lovers alike.
ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice , 200g paneer (Indian cottage cheese), cubed , 1 onion, thinly sliced , 1 tomato, chopped , 1/2 cup yogurt , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon biryani masala , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , 1/4 teaspoon saffron strands (optional) , 2 tablespoons milk (if using saffron) , 2 tablespoons ghee (clarified butter) or oil , 1 bay leaf , 2-3 cloves , 2-3 green cardamom pods , 1 cinnamon stick , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish , Fried onions for garnish (optional).
instruction: Wash the basmati rice thoroughly and soak it in water for about 30 minutes. Drain and set aside. Heat ghee or oil in a pan. Add bay leaf, cloves, cardamom pods, and cinnamon stick. Sauté for a minute until fragrant. Add thinly sliced onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté until the raw smell disappears. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy. Add biryani masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Mix well and cook for a couple of minutes. Add cubed paneer and yogurt. Mix gently to coat the paneer with the masala. Cook for another 5 minutes on low heat. Meanwhile, in a separate pot, bring water to a boil. Add soaked and drained basmati rice along with salt. Cook until the rice is 70% cooked. Drain and set aside. If using saffron, soak saffron strands in warm milk and set aside for 5 minutes. In a large heavy-bottomed pot, layer half of the cooked rice at the bottom. Sprinkle some saffron milk (if using) and a few chopped coriander leaves. Layer the paneer masala on top of the rice. Add the remaining rice on top of the paneer masala. Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid. Cook on low heat for about 15-20 minutes or until the rice is fully cooked and aromatic. Once done, gently fluff the biryani with a fork. Garnish with fried onions (if using) and fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with raita or your favorite side dish.

name: Aloo Rasedar
description: Aloo Rasedar is a flavorful North Indian potato curry dish that features diced potatoes cooked in a rich and aromatic tomato-based gravy. To prepare it, diced potatoes are sautéed with cumin seeds in oil until golden brown. Onions, tomatoes, and a blend of spices including turmeric, coriander, and red chili powder are added, creating a fragrant base. The dish is simmered until the potatoes are tender and the gravy thickens, allowing the flavors to meld. Aloo Rasedar is typically garnished with fresh coriander leaves and served hot with rice or roti for a satisfying vegetarian meal.
ingredients: 4 medium potatoes, peeled and diced , 2 tablespoons vegetable oil , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 1 green chili, finely chopped (optional) , 1 teaspoon ginger paste , 1 teaspoon garlic paste , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , Salt to taste , 1 cup water , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Stir in ginger paste, garlic paste, and green chili (if using). Cook for another minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and mushy. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add diced potatoes and mix until they are well coated with the spice mixture. Pour in water and bring to a boil. Then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer until the potatoes are cooked through and the gravy thickens to your desired consistency (approximately 15-20 minutes). Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving. Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Masoor Dal
description: Masoor Dal is a simple yet flavorful Indian lentil dish. To prepare, red lentils are simmered until tender. In a separate pan, onions, garlic, ginger, and tomatoes are sautéed with aromatic spices like cumin, coriander, and turmeric until fragrant. The cooked lentils are then added to the onion-tomato mixture and simmered until the flavors meld together. Garnished with fresh coriander leaves and served hot, Masoor Dal pairs perfectly with rice or roti for a satisfying meal.
ingredients: 1 cup masoor dal (red lentils), rinsed , 3 cups water , 1 tablespoon oil or ghee , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1-inch piece of ginger, grated , 1 green chili, finely chopped (optional) , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon ground coriander , 1 teaspoon ground cumin , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , Salt, to taste , Fresh coriander leaves, chopped, for garnish , Lemon wedges, for serving.
instruction: In a large pot, combine the rinsed masoor dal and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer until the lentils are soft and cooked through, about 20-25 minutes. You may need to skim off any foam that forms on the surface. In a separate pan, heat oil or ghee over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chili (if using). Cook for another minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they are soft and pulpy. Add turmeric powder, ground coriander, ground cumin, and red chili powder. Mix well and cook for a couple of minutes until the spices are fragrant. Transfer the cooked dal into the pan with the onion-tomato mixture. Stir to combine. Add salt to taste and simmer for another 5-10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or roti. Squeeze some lemon juice over the dal before serving for extra flavor.

name: Seviyan Kheer
description: Seviyan Kheer is a delightful Indian dessert made with roasted vermicelli cooked in milk and sugar, infused with aromatic cardamom and garnished with assorted dry fruits. To prepare, the vermicelli is lightly fried in ghee until golden brown, imparting a rich flavor and texture. Then, it's simmered in milk until soft and creamy, while sugar is added for sweetness. Cardamom powder enhances the flavor profile, while saffron strands add a subtle yet luxurious touch. Finally, a handful of mixed dry fruits like almonds, cashews, and raisins are stirred in for added texture and flavor. Seviyan Kheer can be enjoyed warm or chilled, making it a perfect ending to any meal or festive occasion.
ingredients: 1 cup vermicelli (seviyan) , 4 cups milk , 1/2 cup sugar (adjust to taste) , 1/4 cup mixed dry fruits (such as almonds, cashews, raisins) , 1/2 teaspoon cardamom powder , A pinch of saffron strands (optional) , Ghee or clarified butter, for frying the vermicelli , Water, as needed.
instruction: Heat ghee in a pan and fry the vermicelli until it turns golden brown. Keep stirring to ensure even browning. Remove from heat and set aside. In a separate pot, bring the milk to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and let it simmer. Add the fried vermicelli to the simmering milk and cook until the vermicelli becomes soft and the milk thickens, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking. Stir in the sugar, cardamom powder, and saffron strands (if using). Mix well until the sugar dissolves completely. Add the mixed dry fruits and continue to cook for another 5-7 minutes, or until the kheer reaches the desired consistency. Remove from heat and let it cool slightly before serving. Serve warm or chilled, garnished with additional dry fruits if desired.

name: Dahi Bhindi
description: Dahi Bhindi is a delectable Indian dish where tender okra pieces are simmered in a creamy yogurt-based sauce. To prepare, okra is sautéed until partially cooked and set aside. In a pan, onions are caramelized and spices like turmeric, coriander, cumin, and chili powder are added along with ginger-garlic paste and green chilies for flavor. Chopped tomatoes are then cooked down until they form a rich base. Whisked yogurt is added to the mixture, creating a luscious sauce. The partially cooked okra is returned to the pan and simmered until fully cooked and infused with the flavors of the sauce. Garam masala is sprinkled on top for a final touch of aromatic warmth. This dish is best served hot with roti or rice, offering a delightful combination of tangy yogurt and tender okra, perfect for a comforting meal.
ingredients: 250g okra (bhindi), washed and dried , 1 cup plain yogurt (dahi) , 1 medium onion, finely chopped , 1 tomato, finely chopped , 2 green chilies, slit lengthwise , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons oil , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Trim the ends of the okra and slice them into thin pieces. Heat oil in a pan and sauté the okra until they are partially cooked and turn slightly brown. Remove from the pan and set aside. In the same pan, add a little more oil if needed and sauté the chopped onions until they turn golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, and sauté for a minute. Stir in the chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy. Lower the heat and add turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook the spices for a couple of minutes. Whisk the yogurt well and add it to the pan. Stir continuously to avoid curdling. Once the yogurt is well incorporated, add the partially cooked okra to the pan and mix gently. Cover the pan and simmer for about 10-12 minutes, or until the okra is fully cooked and the flavors are well blended. Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving. Serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Bread Upma
description: Bread Upma is a quick and flavorful South Indian dish made from bread cubes sautéed with a medley of vegetables and spices. In this recipe, bread slices are cut into cubes and toasted until golden brown, then tossed in a fragrant mixture of mustard seeds, cumin seeds, onions, green chilies, ginger, tomatoes, carrots, and green peas. The spices like turmeric powder and salt add depth of flavor, while a dash of lemon juice adds a refreshing tang. Garnished with fresh coriander leaves, this dish is ready to serve as a delicious breakfast or snack option, perfect for using up leftover bread slices.
ingredients: 6 slices of bread, preferably whole wheat , 2 tablespoons oil , 1 teaspoon mustard seeds , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 onion, finely chopped , 1 green chili, finely chopped (optional) , 1/2 inch ginger, finely chopped , 1 carrot, finely chopped , 1 tomato, finely chopped , 1/2 cup green peas (fresh or frozen) , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , Salt, to taste , 1 tablespoon lemon juice , Fresh coriander leaves, chopped (for garnish).
instruction: Trim the edges of the bread slices and cut them into small cubes. Set aside. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Allow them to crackle. Add chopped onions, green chilies, and ginger. Sauté until onions turn translucent. Add chopped carrots and green peas. Cook for a few minutes until they are slightly tender. Now, add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook until tomatoes are soft and mushy. Add the bread cubes to the pan. Mix well until the bread is coated with the masala mixture. Cover and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the bread is heated through. Turn off the heat and add lemon juice. Mix well. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves before serving.

name: Matar Mushroom
description: Matar Mushroom is a delicious vegetarian dish combining mushrooms and green peas in a flavorful curry. To prepare, onions are sautéed until golden, then mixed with garlic, ginger, and green chilies for added depth. Tomatoes are added next, cooked until soft, and seasoned with turmeric, coriander, red chili powder, and salt. Sliced mushrooms and green peas are then added to the mixture, simmered until tender, and finished with a sprinkle of garam masala for aromatic flair. Garnished with fresh coriander leaves, this hearty dish is best enjoyed hot with rice or roti for a satisfying meal.
ingredients: 200g mushrooms, cleaned and sliced , 1 cup green peas (fresh or frozen) , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1-inch piece of ginger, grated , 2 green chilies, finely chopped (adjust according to spice preference) , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish , Cooking oil.
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for another minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add sliced mushrooms and green peas to the pan. Mix well, cover, and cook for 8-10 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender and peas are cooked. Sprinkle garam masala and mix gently. Cook for another 2 minutes. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Rabdi
description: Rabdi, a decadent Indian dessert, is crafted by simmering full-fat milk until it reduces to a rich, creamy consistency. The milk is infused with flavors of cardamom and saffron, imparting a delightful aroma and taste. Sweetness is added with sugar, enhancing the dessert's richness. Chopped nuts like almonds, pistachios, and cashews provide texture and nuttiness, while rose water adds a fragrant touch. Rabdi is simmered patiently to achieve its desired thickness, resulting in a luscious, velvety treat that can be enjoyed warm or chilled, making it a perfect finale to any meal or festive occasion.
ingredients: 1 liter full-fat milk , 1/2 cup sugar (adjust to taste) , 1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder , A pinch of saffron strands , 2 tablespoons chopped nuts (almonds, pistachios, cashews) , 1 tablespoon rose water (optional) , 1 tablespoon chopped dried fruits (optional).
instruction: Pour the milk into a heavy-bottomed pan and bring it to a boil over medium heat. Once the milk starts boiling, reduce the heat to low and let it simmer. Stir occasionally to prevent the milk from sticking to the bottom of the pan. As the milk simmers, a layer of cream will form on top. Gently collect this cream layer and mix it back into the milk. Repeat this process until the milk reduces to about half its original quantity. Add sugar, cardamom powder, saffron strands, chopped nuts, and dried fruits to the milk. Stir well to combine. Continue simmering the milk until it thickens to a creamy consistency, stirring occasionally. Once the rabdi reaches the desired consistency, remove it from the heat and let it cool slightly. Stir in rose water if using. Transfer the rabdi to a serving bowl or individual serving bowls. Garnish with more chopped nuts and saffron strands if desired. Serve warm or chilled.

name: Green Peas Masala
description: Green Peas Masala is a delightful Indian dish where fresh or frozen green peas are simmered in a flavorful tomato-based gravy. To prepare, onions, tomatoes, green chilies, ginger, and garlic are sautéed with aromatic spices like cumin, turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala until fragrant. The peas are then added to this mixture along with water, simmered until tender, and garnished with fresh coriander leaves. This comforting dish pairs well with rice, roti, or naan and is perfect for a satisfying vegetarian meal.
ingredients: 2 cups green peas (fresh or frozen) , 2 medium-sized onions, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 2 green chilies, slit , 1-inch piece of ginger, grated , 3-4 cloves of garlic, minced , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons cooking oil , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Sauté for a couple of minutes until the raw aroma disappears. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and mushy. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for another 2-3 minutes. Add green peas to the masala mixture and mix until well coated. Pour in about 1/2 to 1 cup of water, depending on how thick you want the gravy. Stir well, cover, and let it simmer for 8-10 minutes or until the peas are cooked through. Once the peas are cooked, sprinkle garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with roti, naan, or rice.

name: Aloo Palak
description: Aloo Palak is a popular Indian dish combining tender spinach leaves with diced potatoes, creating a hearty and nutritious curry. In its preparation, chopped spinach is sautéed with onions, tomatoes, and a blend of aromatic spices including cumin, turmeric, coriander, and red chili powder, lending it a flavorful profile. Diced potatoes are then added to the mix, simmered until tender and infused with the rich, earthy flavors of the spinach and spices. This wholesome dish is perfect served hot alongside rice or roti, offering a delicious and satisfying meal that's both comforting and nutritious.
ingredients: 2 cups spinach leaves, washed and chopped , 2 medium-sized potatoes, peeled and diced , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 2 green chilies, chopped , 1-inch piece of ginger, grated , 3-4 cloves of garlic, minced , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , Salt, to taste , 2 tablespoons oil or ghee , Water, as needed.
instruction: Heat oil or ghee in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent. Add grated ginger and minced garlic. Sauté for a minute until the raw smell disappears. Add chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until tomatoes are soft and mushy. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. Add chopped spinach leaves and diced potatoes. Mix everything together. Pour in a little water (about 1/2 cup) to create some steam, cover the pan, and let it cook for about 15-20 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Once the potatoes are cooked through, uncover the pan and cook for a few more minutes until the excess moisture evaporates and the curry thickens slightly. Adjust the seasoning if needed and remove from heat. Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Gobi Paratha
description: Gobi Paratha is a delicious Indian flatbread stuffed with spiced cauliflower filling. To make it, a dough of whole wheat flour is prepared and rested, then rolled out and filled with a mixture of grated cauliflower, chopped onion, green chilies, ginger and garlic paste, and a blend of aromatic spices like turmeric, coriander, cumin, and optional red chili powder. The filled dough is rolled out again and cooked on a hot griddle until golden brown and crispy, with ghee or oil added for extra flavor. Gobi Paratha is typically served hot with yogurt, pickle, or chutney, making it a wholesome and satisfying meal or snack option.
ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour , Water, as needed , Salt, to taste , 2 cups grated cauliflower (gobi) , 1 small onion, finely chopped , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , 1 teaspoon ginger paste , 1 teaspoon garlic paste , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon cumin powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (optional) , 1 tablespoon fresh coriander leaves, chopped , Ghee or oil, for cooking.
instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, salt, and enough water to knead into a soft dough. Cover and let it rest for 15-20 minutes. In another bowl, mix together the grated cauliflower, chopped onion, green chilies, ginger paste, garlic paste, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, red chili powder (if using), and fresh coriander leaves. Mix until well combined. Divide the dough and cauliflower mixture into equal portions. Take a portion of the dough and roll it into a small ball. Flatten it slightly and place a portion of the cauliflower mixture in the center. Bring the edges of the dough together to seal the filling inside and shape it into a ball again. Roll out the stuffed dough ball gently into a paratha, dusting with flour as needed to prevent sticking. Heat a tawa or griddle over medium heat. Place the rolled paratha on the hot griddle and cook until golden brown spots appear on both sides, applying ghee or oil as needed. Repeat the process with the remaining dough and cauliflower mixture to make more parathas. Serve hot with yogurt, pickle, or chutney.

name: Dal Palak
description: Dal Palak is a nutritious and flavorful Indian dish made with split yellow lentils (moong dal) and spinach (palak). It's a comforting dish packed with protein and vitamins. Lentils and spinach are cooked together with aromatic spices like cumin, turmeric, and garam masala to create a hearty and wholesome meal. Serve it with rice or chapati for a delicious and satisfying vegetarian meal.
ingredients: 1 cup split yellow lentils (moong dal) , 2 cups chopped spinach leaves (palak) , 1 medium-sized onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 2 green chilies, slit , 1-inch piece of ginger, grated , 3-4 garlic cloves, minced , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , 1 teaspoon garam masala powder , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons cooking oil , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish.
instruction: Rinse the split yellow lentils (moong dal) thoroughly under running water until the water runs clear. Soak the lentils in water for about 30 minutes. After soaking, drain the water from the lentils and transfer them to a pressure cooker. Add 3 cups of water, chopped spinach leaves, chopped tomatoes, green chilies, grated ginger, minced garlic, turmeric powder, and salt to taste. Mix well. Close the pressure cooker with its lid and pressure cook the mixture for about 3-4 whistles or until the lentils are soft and cooked through. Once the pressure releases naturally, open the lid of the pressure cooker and mash the cooked lentils and spinach mixture using a ladle or spoon. Adjust the consistency by adding more water if necessary. Heat cooking oil in a separate pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add finely chopped onions to the pan and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add red chili powder and garam masala powder to the pan. Stir well and cook for a minute. Pour the prepared lentil and spinach mixture into the pan. Mix everything well and let it simmer for 5-7 minutes on low heat. Adjust the seasoning according to taste. If the dal is too thick, add more water to reach the desired consistency. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves and serve hot with steamed rice or chapati.

name: Kaddu Ki Sabji
description: Kaddu Ki Sabji, or Pumpkin Curry, is a flavorful and nutritious Indian dish made with diced pumpkin cooked in a fragrant blend of spices. This vegetarian delicacy features tender pumpkin pieces infused with the richness of cumin seeds, ginger-garlic paste, and a medley of aromatic spices like turmeric, chili powder, and coriander powder. The dish is rounded off with the sweetness of caramelized onions and the tanginess of fresh tomatoes, creating a harmonious balance of flavors. Garnished with fresh coriander leaves, this comforting curry is perfect to enjoy with roti or rice, offering a delightful culinary experience that satisfies both the palate and the soul.
ingredients: 500g pumpkin (kaddu), peeled and diced , 2 tablespoons oil , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 2 green chilies, slit lengthwise , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves for garnishing.
instruction: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Sauté for a minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and oil starts to separate. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well. Add diced pumpkin and mix until the spices coat the pumpkin evenly. Cover and cook on low heat until the pumpkin is tender, stirring occasionally. It may take about 15-20 minutes. Once the pumpkin is cooked, garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Instant Pot Dal Makhani
description: Indulge in the rich flavors of Instant Pot Dal Makhani, a classic Indian dish made effortlessly in the Instant Pot. Whole black lentils and red kidney beans are soaked, then cooked with aromatic spices and creamy tomato gravy until tender and flavorful. This hearty dish is perfect for a comforting meal, whether served with rice or naan. With the convenience of the Instant Pot, you can enjoy this traditional delicacy in a fraction of the time without compromising on taste.
ingredients: 1 cup whole black lentils (urad dal) , 1/4 cup red kidney beans (rajma) , 4 cups water (for soaking) , 3 tablespoons ghee or butter , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, pureed , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 green chili, slit lengthwise (optional) , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , Salt to taste , 1/4 cup fresh cream , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Wash and soak the whole black lentils and red kidney beans in water for at least 4 hours or overnight. Drain the soaked lentils and beans and rinse them under running water. Set the Instant Pot to "Saute" mode and heat ghee or butter. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Stir in ginger-garlic paste and green chili, and sauté for another minute. Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates from the masala. Add red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well. Add soaked lentils and beans along with 4 cups of water. Close the Instant Pot with the lid and set it to "Manual" mode for 30 minutes on high pressure. Once the cooking is done, let the pressure release naturally for 10 minutes, then manually release any remaining pressure. Open the lid carefully and stir in fresh cream. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Malpua
description: Indulge in the delightful flavors of Malpua, a traditional Indian sweet treat enjoyed during festivals and special occasions. Made from a simple batter of all-purpose flour, semolina, sugar, and aromatic spices like fennel and cardamom, Malpua is fried to golden perfection in ghee or oil. The result is a crispy yet tender pancake-like dessert, perfect for satisfying your sweet cravings. Garnish with chopped nuts for an extra touch of flavor and crunch. With its irresistible taste and easy preparation, Malpua is sure to become a favorite in your repertoire of homemade desserts.
ingredients: 1 cup all-purpose flour , 1/2 cup semolina (sooji) , 1/2 cup sugar , 1/2 teaspoon fennel seeds , 1/2 teaspoon crushed cardamom seeds , 1 cup milk , Ghee or oil for frying , Chopped nuts for garnish (optional).
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, semolina, sugar, fennel seeds, and crushed cardamom seeds. Gradually add milk and mix well until a smooth batter is formed. The consistency should be similar to pancake batter. Let the batter rest for about 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld. Heat ghee or oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Pour a ladleful of batter into the hot ghee/oil and spread it slightly to form a small pancake. Fry the Malpua until golden brown on both sides, flipping once during cooking. Remove from the pan and drain excess oil on paper towels. Garnish with chopped nuts if desired. Serve warm.

name: Instant Pot Aloo Gobi
description: Instant Pot Aloo Gobi is a flavorful Indian dish made with cauliflower, potatoes, and a blend of aromatic spices. In this quick and easy recipe, cauliflower and potatoes are cooked in a savory tomato-based sauce infused with ginger, garlic, and traditional Indian spices like cumin, turmeric, and coriander. This dish comes together effortlessly in the Instant Pot, resulting in tender vegetables with vibrant flavors. Perfect for a satisfying weeknight dinner or a delicious side dish for any occasion.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons oil , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 onion, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 1 teaspoon ginger paste , 1 teaspoon garlic paste , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon cumin powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , Salt to taste , 1 medium-sized cauliflower, cut into florets , 2 medium-sized potatoes, peeled and cubed , 1/2 cup water , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish.
instruction: Turn on the Instant Pot and select the sauté mode. Heat oil and add cumin seeds. Let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add ginger paste and garlic paste. Sauté for a minute. Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until tomatoes are soft and oil starts separating. Add cauliflower florets and cubed potatoes. Mix well with the masala. Add water and stir everything together. Close the Instant Pot with the lid and set the vent to sealing position. Pressure cook on high for 4 minutes. Once the cooking cycle is complete, let the pressure release naturally for 5 minutes, then manually release the remaining pressure. Open the lid carefully. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves. Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Karela Curry
description: Karela Curry, a traditional Indian dish, is a flavorful and nutritious recipe made from bitter gourds, onions, tomatoes, and aromatic spices. The bitter gourds are sliced and sautéed until slightly browned, then combined with a rich masala gravy prepared from onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, and a blend of spices. The dish is cooked until the flavors meld together, resulting in a deliciously savory curry with a hint of bitterness from the gourds. Karela Curry is a perfect accompaniment to rice or roti, providing a satisfying and wholesome meal that delights the taste buds.
ingredients: 4 medium-sized bitter gourds (karela) , 2 onions, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, chopped , 2 green chilies, slit lengthwise , 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala powder , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons oil , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Wash the bitter gourds thoroughly. Cut them lengthwise and remove the seeds. Then, slice them into thin pieces. Heat oil in a pan and add the chopped bitter gourds. Saute them on medium heat until they turn slightly brown. Remove them from the pan and set aside. In the same pan, add a little more oil if needed. Add the chopped onions and saute until they turn golden brown. Add the ginger-garlic paste and slit green chilies. Saute for a minute until the raw smell disappears. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy and the oil starts to separate. Now, add the turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala powder, and salt. Mix well. Add the sauteed bitter gourds to the pan and mix everything together. Cook for another 5-7 minutes on low heat. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with roti or rice.

name: Kulcha
description: Indulge in the delightful flavors of homemade Kulchas, a popular Indian flatbread that pairs perfectly with a variety of curries and chutneys. Made from a simple dough of all-purpose flour, yogurt, and leavening agents, Kulchas are soft, fluffy, and infused with subtle tanginess. After a brief rest, the dough is divided into balls, rolled into discs, and cooked on a hot griddle until golden brown and slightly crisp. Brushed with butter or ghee for added richness, these Kulchas are a comforting treat for any mealtime, offering a taste of authentic Indian cuisine in every bite.
ingredients: 2 cups all-purpose flour (maida) , 1/2 cup yogurt (dahi) , 1 teaspoon baking powder , 1/2 teaspoon baking soda , 1 teaspoon sugar , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons oil , Water, as needed , Butter or ghee, for brushing (optional).
instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, yogurt, baking powder, baking soda, sugar, salt, and oil. Gradually add water as needed and knead the mixture into a soft and smooth dough. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rest for about 1 hour. After resting, divide the dough into equal-sized balls. Roll each ball into a small disc or oval shape, about 1/4 inch thick. Heat a tawa (griddle) or a non-stick pan over medium heat. Place the rolled kulcha on the hot tawa and cook for about 1-2 minutes on one side until bubbles start to appear. Flip the kulcha and cook on the other side for another 1-2 minutes until golden brown spots appear. If desired, brush the cooked kulcha with butter or ghee for added flavor. Serve hot with your favorite curry, chutney, or yogurt dip.

name: Kala Chana Curry
description: Kala Chana Curry is a hearty and flavorful Indian dish made with black chickpeas cooked in a rich and aromatic gravy. The soaked chickpeas are simmered with a blend of onions, tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, and a mix of traditional spices until tender and infused with delicious flavors. This protein-packed curry is a popular choice for both everyday meals and special occasions, serving as a satisfying accompaniment to rice, roti, or naan. With its enticing aroma and comforting taste, Kala Chana Curry is sure to become a favorite in any household.
ingredients: 1 cup dried kala chana (black chickpeas), soaked overnight , 2 medium onions, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, finely chopped , 2 green chilies, slit lengthwise , 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon garam masala , Salt to taste , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish , 2 tablespoons cooking oil , Water as needed.
instruction: Drain the soaked kala chana and rinse them under cold water. Heat oil in a pressure cooker or a heavy-bottomed pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and slit green chilies. Sauté for a minute. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and oil starts separating from the masala. Now add all the dry spices - coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for another minute. Add soaked kala chana to the masala and mix until well combined. Pour enough water to cover the chana and close the pressure cooker lid. Cook for about 15-20 minutes or until the chana is soft and cooked through. Once cooked, open the lid and add garam masala. Mix well and simmer for a few more minutes. Garnish with freshly chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with steamed rice, roti, or naan.

name: Kaju Curry
description: Indulge in the creamy delight of Kaju Curry, a rich and flavorful Indian dish that tantalizes the taste buds with its luxurious blend of cashew nuts, aromatic spices, and velvety cream. This vegetarian delicacy features a luscious gravy made from finely chopped onions, tangy tomato puree, and a medley of spices that infuse each bite with warmth and depth of flavor. Perfectly complemented by the nutty crunch of cashews, this dish is a delightful addition to any meal, promising a culinary journey that is both comforting and indulgent. Enjoy Kaju Curry with rice or naan for a satisfying dining experience that's sure to leave you craving more.
ingredients: 1 cup cashew nuts (kaju) , 2 onions, finely chopped , 2 tomatoes, pureed , 2 green chilies, chopped , 1-inch ginger, grated , 3-4 garlic cloves, minced , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1/2 cup fresh cream , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons oil , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add grated ginger and minced garlic. Sauté for a minute. Add chopped green chilies and sauté for another minute. Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates from the masala. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add cashew nuts to the masala and mix until they are well coated. Add water as needed to adjust the consistency of the curry. Add salt to taste and simmer for 5-7 minutes. Finally, add fresh cream and mix well. Cook for another 2-3 minutes. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Roti
description: Roti, a staple in Indian cuisine, is a simple yet essential flatbread made from whole wheat flour. Mixing flour with water and a pinch of salt, kneading it into a soft dough, and then rolling it into thin circles, rotis are cooked on a hot skillet until they puff up and develop golden brown spots. With a preparation time of just 15 minutes and cooking time of 20 minutes, this recipe yields approximately 10-12 servings, each providing around 70-80 calories. Enjoy these versatile and nutritious rotis with your favorite curry or condiments for a satisfying meal!
ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour , Water (as needed) , Salt (optional).
instruction: In a mixing bowl, add the whole wheat flour and salt (if using). Mix well. Gradually add water to the flour and knead it into a soft and pliable dough. The dough should be neither too stiff nor too soft. Once the dough is ready, cover it with a damp cloth and let it rest for about 15-20 minutes. After resting, divide the dough into equal-sized balls. Take one dough ball and flatten it slightly with your palm. Roll out the dough ball into a thin circle using a rolling pin and some dry flour for dusting. Heat a tawa (flat skillet) over medium heat. Once the tawa is hot, place the rolled-out roti on it. Cook for about 30 seconds to 1 minute on one side until bubbles start to appear. Flip the roti and cook for another 30 seconds to 1 minute on the other side until golden brown spots appear. Remove the roti from the tawa and place it on a plate. Repeat the process with the remaining dough balls. Serve hot with your favorite curry, vegetables, or condiments.

name: Mushroom Masala Curry
description: Indulge in the flavors of this aromatic Mushroom Masala Curry, a delightful vegetarian dish that tantalizes the taste buds with its rich blend of spices and tender mushrooms. Sautéed with onions, tomatoes, and a medley of aromatic spices, this curry is a perfect balance of heat and flavor. Whether paired with steamed rice or warm naan, this dish is sure to satisfy your craving for a comforting and satisfying meal.
ingredients: 500g mushrooms, sliced , 2 onions, finely chopped , 3 tomatoes, pureed , 2 green chilies, finely chopped , 1-inch piece of ginger, grated , 3 cloves of garlic, minced , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon coriander powder , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste) , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons oil , Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish.
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté for another 2 minutes. Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, and red chili powder. Mix well and cook for 1 minute. Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates from the masala. Now add sliced mushrooms and mix well with the masala. Cook for 5-7 minutes until the mushrooms are cooked through. Add garam masala and salt to taste. Stir well and cook for another 2 minutes. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves and serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Paneer Kheer
description: Indulge in the creamy goodness of Paneer Kheer, a delectable Indian dessert that combines the richness of paneer (Indian cottage cheese) with the sweetness of milk and sugar. This easy-to-make dessert is infused with aromatic cardamom and adorned with a sprinkle of nuts and raisins for added crunch and flavor. Perfect for any occasion, this Paneer Kheer promises to delight your taste buds with its irresistible taste and creamy texture.
ingredients: 1 liter full-fat milk , 200 grams paneer (Indian cottage cheese), grated or crumbled , 1/2 cup sugar (adjust to taste) , 1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder , A few saffron strands (optional) , 2 tablespoons chopped nuts (almonds, pistachios, cashews) , 1 tablespoon raisins.
instruction: In a heavy-bottomed pan, heat the milk over medium heat until it comes to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and let the milk simmer, stirring occasionally, until it reduces to about 3/4th of its original quantity. This may take approximately 30-40 minutes. Add the grated or crumbled paneer to the milk and mix well. Continue to cook the mixture on low heat for another 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add sugar, cardamom powder, saffron strands (if using), chopped nuts, and raisins to the pan. Mix well. Cook for another 5-10 minutes until the kheer thickens to your desired consistency. Turn off the heat and let the kheer cool down to room temperature. Serve the Paneer Kheer chilled or at room temperature, garnished with more chopped nuts if desired.

name: Bread Pakora
description: Crispy and flavorful, Bread Pakoras are a popular Indian snack made with bread slices coated in a spiced chickpea flour batter and deep-fried until golden brown. These delicious fritters are perfect for tea-time or as a party appetizer. Enjoy the crunchy exterior and soft, potato-filled interior with your favorite chutney or sauce.
ingredients: 6 slices of bread , 2 medium-sized potatoes, boiled and mashed , 1 cup chickpea flour (besan) , 1 teaspoon red chili powder , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , Salt to taste , Water as needed , Oil for deep frying , Fresh coriander leaves, chopped (for garnish, optional).
instruction: Trim the edges of the bread slices. In a mixing bowl, combine the mashed potatoes, chickpea flour, red chili powder, turmeric powder, cumin seeds, and salt. Mix well to form a smooth batter. Add water gradually to achieve the desired consistency (thick enough to coat the bread slices). Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat. Dip each bread slice into the prepared batter, ensuring it is evenly coated. Carefully place the coated bread slices into the hot oil and fry until they turn golden brown and crisp on both sides. Fry in batches to avoid overcrowding the pan. Once done, remove the bread pakoras from the oil using a slotted spoon and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess oil. Serve hot with green chutney or ketchup, garnished with fresh coriander leaves if desired.

name: Corn Pulao
description: Corn Pulao is a delightful and aromatic rice dish that combines the sweetness of corn with fragrant spices. In this recipe, basmati rice is cooked with sweet corn kernels, onions, tomatoes, and a blend of spices to create a flavorful and wholesome meal. It's a perfect balance of flavors and textures, making it a favorite among both kids and adults alike. Enjoy this Corn Pulao as a standalone dish or pair it with your favorite side for a satisfying meal.
ingredients: 1 cup basmati rice , 1 cup sweet corn kernels , 1 onion, thinly sliced , 1 tomato, chopped , 2 green chilies, slit , 1-inch ginger, grated , 2 cloves garlic, minced , 1 teaspoon cumin seeds , 1 teaspoon garam masala , 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder , 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder , Salt to taste , 2 tablespoons oil , 2 cups water , Fresh coriander leaves for garnish.
instruction: Rinse the basmati rice under running water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for about 20-30 minutes, then drain and set aside. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add sliced onions and sauté until they turn golden brown. Add grated ginger, minced garlic, and slit green chilies. Sauté for a minute until the raw aroma disappears. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy. Add sweet corn kernels and cook for another 2-3 minutes. Now, add soaked and drained basmati rice to the pan. Stir gently to mix with the other ingredients. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt to taste. Mix well to coat the rice evenly with the spices. Pour 2 cups of water into the pan and give everything a good stir. Bring the mixture to a boil. Once it starts boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover the pan with a lid, and let the rice cook for about 15-20 minutes or until all the water is absorbed and the rice is cooked through. Once the rice is cooked, turn off the heat and let it sit covered for another 5 minutes. Fluff the rice gently with a fork. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with raita or any side dish of your choice.

name: Aloo Gobi Matar
description: This classic Indian dish brings together tender potatoes, cauliflower florets, and green peas in a flavorful curry. Sautéed with aromatic spices like cumin, turmeric, and coriander, it's a comforting and wholesome dish perfect for any meal. Serve it with warm roti or steamed rice for a satisfying culinary experience that's both delicious and nourishing.
