instruction: Bassmity riec,gaelic whole,ginger fresh,TOMATO .cucumber.peppers ketchmber salad,CORIENDER FRESH,yougert mint raita,casloymety,cream cheese,tuermeric,eggs,caredmoon,tomato red,chicken breast boneless.leg cut cubed,CORIANDER POWDER,PAPRIKA NORMAL,SALT TABLE,GRAMA MASAL,TANDORY MASALA,OIL CORN CRYSTAL,drey GHLLI,SUGAR NORMAL,onion pickles,w/pepper

name: Rogan Josh (Kashmiri Lamb Curry)
description: Rogan Josh is a traditional Kashmiri dish, known for its rich and aromatic flavors. This lamb curry features tender pieces of meat cooked in a spicy gravy, infused with a blend of aromatic spices. It's a staple in Kashmiri cuisine, beloved for its robust taste and vibrant color.
ingredients: 500g lamb,diced,2 onions, finely chopped,3 tomatoes, pureed,4 cloves of garlic, minced,1-inch piece of ginger, grated,2-3 green chilies, slit,1/2 cup yogurt,2 tablespoons vegetable oil,2 teaspoons ground cumin,2 teaspoons ground coriander,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 tea,poon paprika or Kashmiri red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon,1/2 teaspoon ground cardamom,Salt to taste,Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add chopped onions and cook until golden brown.Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Sauté for a few minutes until fragrant.Add diced lamb pieces to the pan and brown them evenly.Stir in the ground spices: cumin, coriander, turmeric, paprika, cinnamon, and cardamom. Cook for a couple of minutes to release their flavors.Pour in the tomato puree and cook until the oil starts to separate from the gravy.Whisk the yogurt until smooth and add it to the pan, stirring continuously.Season with salt according to taste and simmer the curry on low heat until the lamb is tender and the gravy is thickened, about 45 minutes to 1 hour.Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Hyderabadi Dum Mutton Biryani
description: Hyderabadi Dum Mutton Biryani is a flavorful rice dish where marinated mutton is layered with fragrant basmati rice and slow-cooked to perfection. It's characterized by its aromatic spices, tender meat, and the unique cooking technique called "dum," which involves sealing the pot to trap the steam and flavors.
ingredients: 1 1/2 Kg Bone/Boneless Mutton / Lamb shanks,4 Cups Basmati Rice,3 large- sliced Onion,2 Cup Canola Oil,For the Marinading Mutton,11/2 cup Yoghurt,2 tbsp Meat Tenderizer Powder ( or you can use raw papaya grind it and mix 4 tbsp into the meat),1 1/2 tbsp Ginger garlic paste,1 tbsp Red chilli powder,1 tbsp Turmeric powder,1 tsp Garam Masala powder,1 big pinch Saffron threads,4 tbsp Lemon,4 Green Chillies,Coriander (finely Chopped),Mint ( finely chopped),Salt to taste,For Preparing Basmati Rice,1 tbsp Caraway seeds (Shah Zeera),4 Black Peppercorns,4 Green Cardamoms,2 Cinnamon sticks,2 Cloves,Salt to taste,For Garnish,2 tbspGhee,3 tbsp Coriander (finely chopped),3 tbsp Mint ( finely chopped),Yellow colour,2 boil Eggs (optional),2 tbsp Toasted sliced Almonds (Optional),Fry Onions
instruction:
In a large bowl ,Add the Mutton marinate with meat tenderizer, yoghurt ginger garlic paste, Red chilli powder, Turmeric powder, Garam Masala powder, Saffron, Lemon, Fried Onions, Green Chillies, Coriander (finely Chopped), Mint ( finely chopped),Salt to taste and oil mix well,Cover and leave in the fridge for overnight.Wash the rice and soak it in surplus water for about 1/2 hour.In a large saucepan at medium heat, add 2 cup oil.Add onions and fry to golden brown,take out few fry onions(these are used for garnishing).In a large cooking pot pour in water along with cloves, cardamom, cinnamon, caraway seeds and salt.let it come to a boil,add the drained rice Give it a stir and let the rice cook until it is half done, 2-3 minutes. Drain the rice.Then Take a large vessel/non stick vessel,Add the Marinade Raw Mutton and oil in the vessel,Then Spread the drained half cooked rice over.Spread evenly the chopped coriander, mint, fried onions,Toasted sliced Almonds, yellow colour &Ghee.Then Cover the vessel properly h aluminium foil or cover with cotton cloth or seal with wheat dough,then place a heavy weight over the lid ,so that no steams can escape so the nice steam can formed inside.
Place the Biryani vessel on the iron Tawa and cook on low flame.
Allow to cook in very low heat for 1 1/2 hours, close the heat, but leave the saucepan on the hot stove so that a nice steam forms. Let the dish rest for 15-30 minutes.
Serving Biryani with Dahi ki chutney,Baghare Baingan, kachumber (diced cucumber, tomato and onion salsa),mircha-ka-salan.

name: Prawn Curry
description: Prawn Curry is a flavorful dish made with succulent prawns cooked in a rich and aromatic curry sauce, typically infused with a blend of spices and coconut milk.
ingredients: 1 or 2 cups prawn shells or/and heads,1/2 liter water,1 tbsp dried red chili paste,1 tbsp fish curry powder - mix with water for a thick paste,1 tbsp onion paste,1/2 tbsp garlic paste,1/2inch belacan/shrimp paste,1 cup thick coconut milk,Noodles (any type you prefer) - blanched to soften,Fresh prawns - cleaned and de-veined - blanched in the broth,Spring onions - sliced,Red chilies - sliced,Green Chilies - sliced,Lime wedges,3 tbsp oil,salt for taste
instruction: Simmer prawn shells/heads in water to extract broth (will take about 1/2 hour).Drain and keep aside.Fry onion, garlic and shrimp paste in oil for about 2-3mins.Add chili paste and curry powder.Continue frying till oil splits.Pour broth and season with salt.When broth reduces to three quarter or half, pour in coconut milk.Meanwhile, assemble noodles and prawns.Pour broth over and garnish with spring onions, red and green chilies.Serve with lime while piping hot.

name: Chilli Chicken 65
description: Chilli Chicken 65 is a tantalizing dish that combines the succulence of tender chicken pieces with the heat of chili peppers and the tanginess of various spices. It's a delightful fusion of Indian and Chinese flavors, perfect for those who love bold and spicy dishes.
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces,2 tablespoons corn flour,2 tablespoons all-purpose flour,1 egg,2 teaspoons ginger-garlic paste,2 green chilies, chopped,1 onion, diced,1 capsicum, diced,2 tablespoons soy sauce,1 tablespoon vinegar,1 tablespoon red chili sauce,1 tablespoon tomato ketchup,Salt to taste,Oil for deep frying,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Marinate the chicken pieces with corn flour, all-purpose flour, egg, ginger-garlic paste, and salt. Let it sit for 30 minutes.Heat oil in a deep frying pan. Fry the marinated chicken until golden brown and crispy. Drain excess oil on paper towels and set aside.In a separate pan, heat a tablespoon of oil. Add chopped green chilies, diced onion, and capsicum. Saute until the vegetables are slightly tender.Add soy sauce, vinegar, red chili sauce, and tomato ketchup to the pan. Mix well.Toss in the fried chicken pieces and coat them evenly with the sauce.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Chicken Manchurian
description: Chicken Manchurian is a popular Indo-Chinese dish that features tender pieces of chicken tossed in a tangy and flavorful sauce, typically served as a starter or main course in many Asian restaurants.
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces,2 tablespoons cornflour,2 tablespoons all-purpose flour,1 egg,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons oil,1 onion, chopped,1 bell pepper (capsicum), chopped,2-3 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch piece ginger, minced,2 green chilies, chopped (optional),2 tablespoons soy sauce,1 tablespoon chili sauce,1 tablespoon tomato ketchup,1 tablespoon vinegar,1 teaspoon sugar
instruction: In a bowl, mix the chicken pieces with cornflour, all-purpose flour, egg, and salt until well-coated. Set aside for 15-20 minutes.Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Fry the coated chicken pieces until golden brown and cooked through. Remove and set aside.In the same pan, add a little more oil if needed. Sauté onions, garlic, ginger, and green chilies until fragrant.Add chopped bell peppers and cook for another 2-3 minutes until slightly softened.In a small bowl, mix together soy sauce, chili sauce, tomato ketchup, vinegar, and sugar. Pour this sauce mixture into the pan.Stir well and let the sauce simmer for a minute.Add the fried chicken pieces to the sauce and toss until they are evenly coated.Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.Garnish with chopped spring onions if desired.Serve hot as a starter or with steamed rice/noodles as a main course.

name: Tawa Chicken Fry
description: Tawa Chicken Fry is a delicious Indian dish that is popular for its rich flavors and simple cooking method. "Tawa" refers to a flat, round griddle commonly used in Indian cooking. This recipe involves marinating chicken pieces with aromatic spices and then frying them on a tawa until they are perfectly cooked and golden brown.
ingredients: Chicken – 500 gms,Gram Flour – small handful,Juice of1 Lemon,Ginger Garlic Paste – 2 tblsp,Turmeric Powder – 1/3 tsp,Coriander Powder – 1/3 tsp,Curry Leaves – few,Red Chilli Paste – 3 tsp,Saunf – 1/2 tsp,Cumin Seeds – 1/2 tsp,Salt as per taste,Oil as required
instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, coriander powder, lemon juice, and salt. Mix well to form a smooth marinade.Add the chicken pieces to the marinade and coat them evenly. Cover the bowl and let the chicken marinate for at least 1 hour in the refrigerator. For best results, marinate overnight.Heat oil on a tawa (flat griddle) over medium-high heat.Once the oil is hot, add the marinated chicken pieces to the tawa in a single layer. Be careful not to overcrowd the tawa; cook in batches if necessary.Cook the chicken pieces for about 5-6 minutes on one side or until they are golden brown and cooked through.Flip the chicken pieces and cook for another 5-6 minutes on the other side, or until they are fully cooked and browned.Once the chicken is cooked, remove it from the tawa and transfer it to a serving plate.Garnish with chopped coriander leaves if desired.

name: Chicken curry creamy and cashew paste
description: This chicken curry might look complicated with the numerous steps but trust me it is not, once you know how to make it, it all works smoothly. Using most of the cupboard ingredients, you can impress your guests or family with this absolutely gorgeous tasting chicken curry which tastes nothing less than a restaurant one.
ingredients: Chicken (Bone in) - 2lbs ( cut into small bite sized pieces),Red Onions - 1 large / 2 medium sized ( thinly sliced),Green chillies - 3-4nos ( slit lengthwise),Ginger-Garlic paste - 1.5 tblsp,Roma Tomatoes - 2-3 large,Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp,Red Chilli powder - 1 - 2 tsp,Corriander powder - 1.5 tblsp,Garam masala - 1 tsp,Pepper - 1 tsp,Yoghurt (low fat or full fat) - 1/2 cup,Cashew nuts - 8-10 nos.Mustard seeds - 1tsp,Dry Red chilli - 2-3,Curry leaves - 1sprig or 5-6 leaves,Oil (Canola or vegetable oil) - 2tbsp,Salt - to taste
instruction:
Wash and clean the chicken pieces.Using a grinder or food processor puree the tomatoes and keep aside.In a deep non-stick pan or skillet, heat the Oil, and then crack mustard seeds and add the dry red chillies and curry leaves.Add the thinly sliced onions, green chillies, Ginger-Garlic paste and little salt and saute the mixture until the onions turns nice and pink and soft. (Adding salt will help saute the onions faster)Add the dry spice mix - turmeric powder, red chilli powder, corriander powder, garam masala and pepper and stir fry again for 2 mins. (Make sure to not burn the spice mix so keep on medium heat)Now add the tomato puree and mix well and cover and cook for another 1min.Add the chicken pieces and little more salt , mix well again and cover and cook on medium heat for 15-20mins(or until the chicken is cooked well) , keep stirring in between to make sure the gravy does not stick to the bottom of the pan.Now in the food processor / grinder , add the cashewnuts and grind it using little water into ine paste.Also add the yoghurt and beat it well in the grinder.Once the chicken is fully cooked , reduce the heat to low , and add this yoghurt and cashew paste.Stir well and cook for another 1-2 mins on low heat.Serve hot with Roti , Naan or Rice...Enjoy!
.

name: Chicken lollipop
description: Chicken lollipop is a popular Indo-Chinese appetizer made from chicken wings or drumettes, where the meat is pushed down to form a lollipop-like appearance. Here's a detailed description of the recipe along with preparation and cooking time:
ingredients: 6-8 pieces of chicken wings.,1/2 teaspoon red chilly sauce.,1/2 teaspoon schezwan sauce.,1/2 teaspoon red chilly paste,1/2 teaspoon chopped garlic,1/2 teaspoon chopped ginger,1 teaspoon chopped celery,1/2 teaspoon green chilly paste,1/2 cup corn flour,1/4 cup Maida,1 egg beate,1/2 teaspoon salt,1/2 teaspoon white pepper powder,1/2 teaspoon lemon juice
instruction: Take corn flour and all purpose flour in a mixing bowl and mix the chopped ginger, chopped garlic, red chilly paste, red chilly sauce, schezwan sauce, green chilli paste and chopped celery.Then add salt, white pepper powder, lemon juice and beaten egg.Give everything a fine mix to make a smooth batter. If required add little amount of water.Make chicken lollipop dryWash and clean the lollipop pieces and pat them dry completely.Mix these lollipops with the batter evenly so that all parts are covered with the batter.Let them marinate for 2 to 4 hours or overnight.Heat oil in a deep vessel pan or kadai in medium flame.Bring the marinated lollipops and remove excess marinate from them.Pour then into the oil one by one carefully. Keep the heat flame to low.Fry the lollipops for 7 to 8 minutes in slow flame till crisp golden.Remove them in an absorbent paper to absorb any excess oil from them.Garnish a plate and serve the chicken lollipop dry with schezwan sauce.

name: Mutton Paya Curry
description: Mutton Paya Curry is known for its rich and hearty flavors. The trotters are cooked with aromatic spices and herbs, resulting in a thick and flavorful gravy that coats the tender pieces of meat. The slow cooking process allows the collagen and connective tissues in the trotters to break down, resulting in a velvety texture and deep flavor.
ingredients: Mutton trotters (paya),Onions, finely chopped,Tomatoes, chopped,Ginger-garlic paste,Yogurt,Green chilies, slit,Red chili powder,Turmeric powder,Coriander powder,Garam masala powder,Salt,to taste,Oil or ghee,Fresh coriander leaves, for garnish
instruction: Clean the mutton trotters thoroughly under running water. You may need to blanch them in boiling water for a few minutes to remove any impurities.Heat oil or ghee in a large pot or pressure cooker. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté until the raw smell disappears.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and pulpy.Now add the cleaned mutton trotters to the pot along with yogurt, red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well to coat the trotters with the spices.Add enough water to cover the trotters and bring the mixture to a boil.Once it starts boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer gently for 2 to 3 hours, or until the trotters are tender and the gravy has thickened.Check the seasoning and adjust according to your taste preferences.Sprinkle garam masala powder and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.Serve hot with steamed rice, naan, or crusty bread.

name: Chicken and Noodle Soup
description: Chicken and Noodle Soup is a comforting and nutritious dish that combines tender pieces of chicken, vegetables, noodles, and flavorful broth. This soup is perfect for warming up on cold days or when you're feeling under the weather. It's hearty, satisfying, and easy to customize with your favorite ingredients.
ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds boneless or bone-in chicken pieces,8 cups water1,1/2 cups sliced carrots (about),2-3 celery stalks, diced,1 onion, diced (about 1 1/2 cups),1 or 2 cloves garlic, minced,about 1/2 cup frozen peas,12 ounce package frozen Reames noodles,salt and pepper to taste,2 tablespoons fresh, chopped parsley,2 teaspoons fresh thyme
instruction: In a large pot, heat a bit of oil over medium heat. Add diced onions, carrots, and celery. Sauté until vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes.Add minced garlic, dried thyme, bay leaf, salt, and pepper. Cook for another minute until fragrant.Pour in chicken broth and bring to a simmer.Add chicken breasts to the pot and simmer until cooked through, about 15-20 minutes. If using cooked chicken, add it later in the cooking process to prevent overcooking.Once the chicken is cooked, remove it from the pot and shred it using two forks. Return the shredded chicken to the pot.Add uncooked egg noodles to the pot and cook according to package instructions until tender.Taste the soup and adjust seasoning if necessary. Remove the bay leaf.erve hot, garnished with chopped parsley.

name: Chicken Handi
description: Chicken Handi is a popular Pakistani and North Indian dish known for its rich and creamy gravy cooked in a traditional clay pot called a "handi." It typically consists of tender pieces of chicken cooked with aromatic spices, tomatoes, onions, yogurt, and cream, resulting in a flavorful and indulgent curry.
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces,2 tablespoons oil or ghee (clarified butter),2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, pureed,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust according to spice preference),1/2 cup yogurt,1/4 cup cream,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,Sliced green chilies for garnish (optional)
instruction: Heat oil or ghee in a handi or deep skillet over medium heat.Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until the raw aroma disappears.Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates from the mixture.Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.Add chicken pieces and coat them evenly with the spice mixture.Cook the chicken until it changes color and is partially cooked.Reduce the heat and add yogurt. Mix well to combine.Cover and simmer until the chicken is tender and fully cooked, stirring occasionally.Once the chicken is cooked, add cream and stir gently.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and sliced green chilies, if desired.

name: Chicken Bhuna
description: Chicken Bhuna is a dry curry dish made with bone-in chicken pieces that are marinated and then cooked with a blend of spices until the sauce thickens and coats the chicken. It typically features a base of onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, and a variety of aromatic spices such as cumin, coriander, turmeric, and garam masala. The dish has a deep, complex flavor with a balance of heat and tanginess.
ingredients: 500g bone-in chicken pieces (such as thighs or drumsticks),2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, finely chopped,3-4 cloves of garlic, minced,1-inch piece of ginger, grated,2 green chilies, slit (optional, adjust according to spice preference),2 tablespoons vegetable oil or ghee,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon garam masal,Salt to taste
instruction: Marinate the chicken pieces with salt, turmeric powder, and half of the ginger and garlic paste. Let it sit for at least 30 minutes or refrigerate for a few hours for better flavor absorption.Heat oil or ghee in a large pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.Add the remaining ginger and garlic paste, and green chilies. Sauté for another 2-3 minutes until the raw smell disappears.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy, stirring occasionally.Now add the marinated chicken pieces to the pan. Cook on medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and the liquid released from the tomatoes evaporates.Add coriander powder, garam masala, and adjust salt according to taste. Stir well to combine.Cook for another 5-7 minutes until the chicken is nicely coated with the spices and the sauce thickens.

name: Kadai Chicken
description: Kadai Chicken is a popular North Indian dish known for its rich and robust flavor. It's prepared with bone-in chicken pieces cooked in a thick, spicy gravy along with bell peppers (capsicum) and onions. The dish gets its name from the utensil it's traditionally cooked in - a 'kadai' or Indian wok.
ingredients: Chicken – 1 kg, finely chopped, skinless,Onions – 1, finely chopped,Capsicum – 2 cups, chopped,Tomato – 1, finely chopped,Ginger Garlic Paste – 3 to 4 tblsp,Red Chilli Powder – 2 tsp,Turmeric Powder – 1/4 tsp,Coriander Powder – 1 tsp,Cumin Powder – 1/2 tsp,Garam Masala Powder – 1 tsp,Kadai Gravy – 1/4 cup + 2 tblsp,Salt as per taste,For the Gravy:,Oil – 100 ml,Onions – 10, finely chopped,Tomatoes – 10, finely chopped, pureed,Red Chilli Powder – 3 to 4 tblsp (adjust as desired),Coriander Powder – 1/3 to 1/2 cup,Turmeric Powder – 1 tsp,Cumin Powder – 2 tsp,Salt as per taste,For Tempering:,Oil – 3 to 4 tblsp,Cinnamon – 2 inch piece,Cloves – 4,Cardamoms – 4,Cumin Seeds – little,Green Chillies – 2, finely chopped,For the Masala Powder:,Coriander Seeds – 100 gms,Dry Red Chillies – 8 to 10 (adjust as desired),Cumin Seeds – 2 tblsp
instruction: Heat oil in a kadai or deep pan. Add cumin seeds and coriander seeds, and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Add minced garlic and grated ginger, and cook until the raw aroma disappears.Add chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until tomatoes turn soft and oil starts separating from the masala.Add diced capsicum and cook for a few minutes until it softens slightly.Now add the chicken pieces to the masala and mix well.Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix until chicken is coated evenly with the spices.Cover the kadai and cook on medium heat until the chicken is tender and cooked through, stirring occasionally. If needed, sprinkle a little water to prevent sticking.Once the chicken is cooked, sprinkle garam masala and mix well.Garnish with freshly chopped coriander leaves.

name: Chicken Chettinad Pepper Masala
description: Chicken Chettinad Pepper Masala is a spicy and flavorful dish from the Chettinad region of Tamil Nadu, India. It's known for its rich blend of spices, particularly black pepper, and is a favorite among those who enjoy bold flavors.
ingredients: 500 gram chicken cut into curry size pieces,one 2 inch piece of cinnamon,2 green cardamom pods crushed,2 large-size onion fine chopped,2 large size tomato pureed,salt to taste,4 tbsp cooking oil,3 - 4 curry leaves,To be ground into paste,1 tsp fennel seeds,2 tsp black peppercorns,1 tsp cumin seeds,4 dried red chilies (esp goondu milagai variety),1 tsp coriander seeds,½ tsp turmeric powder,2 tsp ginger garlic paste
instruction: To prepare Chettinad Chicken, first clean, wash and pat dry the chicken pieces with a kitchen towel. Keep aside covered in a bowl.Dry roast fennel seeds, black pepper, cumin, red chilies, coriander seeds till fragrant and slightly darkened. Grind them in a mixer to a smooth paste using little water.Add turmeric and ginger - garlic paste to the freshly grind spice mix. Stir to combine and set aside in a bowl.Heat oil in a large kadhai (Buy it here) over medium heat. Add the cinnamon, cardamom pods, curry leaves and saute for few seconds till fragrant. Add the chopped onion and saute over low heat till onion is light brown in color.Next add the tomato puree and fry the masala for 10 minutes or so over low heat. The indication of masala being ready is oil starts separating from it.Now add the fresh spice paste to the kadhai and stir to combine. Continue to saute the masala scraping the bottom of the kadhai, till the masala takes deep brown color and nicely roasted.At this stage add the chicken pieces, salt and ir coat the chicken pieces with the spice mixture. Add 1 - 2 cups of warm water, stir to combine and bring to a boil on high heat. Turn the heat to low and cook the chicken chettinad curry covered for 15 - 20 minutes, stirring occasionally in between.Once chicken is cooked, remove the lid and let the chicken simmer over medium heat to thicken the gravy and for sauce to coat the chicken pieces.Turn off the heat. Serve Chicken Chettinad Curry with steamed rice, Tomato and Garlic Rasam (see recipe here) or lachha paratha.

name: Chicken Keema Curry
description: Chicken Keema Curry is a delicious and aromatic Indian dish made with minced chicken cooked in a flavorful blend of spices and aromatics. It's a popular dish enjoyed across India, often served with rice or Indian breads like roti or naan.
ingredients: 500g minced chicke,2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, chopped,2 green chilies, chopped,2 teaspoons ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons oil
instruction: Heat oil in a pan or skillet over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and green chilies. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute until the raw smell disappears.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy.Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.Add minced chicken to the pan. Break up any lumps and mix well with the masala.Cook the chicken keema on medium heat until it's fully cooked and the moisture evaporates, stirring occasionally. This usually takes around 15-20 minutes.Once the chicken keema is cooked and the oil starts to separate, add garam masala and mix well.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.Serve hot with rice or Indian breads.

name: Indian Kofta Curry (Meatball Curry)
description: Kofta curry is a popular dish in Indian cuisine, known for its rich flavors and aromatic spices. The koftas are typically made from ground meat mixed with spices, herbs, and sometimes nuts, then shaped into balls and fried until golden brown. These meatballs are then simmered in a creamy and flavorful curry sauce, resulting in a hearty and satisfying dish.
ingredients:
For the Koftas:500g minced meat (chicken, lamb, or beef),1 onion, finely chopped,2 cloves of garlic, minced,1-inch piece of ginger, grated,2 green chilies, finely chopped,1/4 cup fresh coriander leaves, chopped,1/4 cup bread crumbs,1 teaspoon ground cumin,1 teaspoon ground coriander,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,Salt to taste,Oil for frying
For the Curry:2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, pureed,2 cloves of garlic, minced,1-inch piece of ginger, grated,1 teaspoon ground cumin,1 teaspoon ground coriander,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,1/2 cup yogurt,2 tablespoons cooking oil,Salt to taste
instruction: In a large bowl, combine all the ingredients for the koftas, except for the oil. Mix well to form a smooth mixture.Shape the mixture into small balls (koftas) using your hands.Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Fry the koftas in batches until golden brown on all sides. Remove and set aside.In another pan, heat oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Add the minced garlic and grated ginger. Cook for another minute.Add the ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Stir well and cook for a couple of minutes.Add the tomato puree and cook until the oil separates from the masala.Whisk the yogurt and add it to the masala. Cook for a few minutes until the yogurt is well incorporated.Add water to achieve the desired consistency for the curry. Bring it to a simmer.Gently add the fried koftas to the curry. Cover and cook for 10-15 minutes on low heat, allowing the flavors to meld together.Sprinkle garam masala and fresh coriander leaves on top before serving.

name: Chicken Malai Tikka
description: Chicken Malai Tikka is a succulent and creamy chicken dish with a mildly spiced flavor. The marinade, enriched with cream and yogurt, tenderizes the chicken while imparting a rich and luscious taste. The tikka is traditionally cooked in a tandoor (clay oven), but it can also be grilled or baked in a regular oven for equally delicious results.
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken breast or thigh, cut into bite-sized pieces,1/2 cup fresh cream,1/4 cup thick yogurt (Greek yogurt or hung curd),2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1 tablespoon lemon juice,2 tablespoons grated cheese (optional),1 teaspoon garam masala,1 teaspoon ground coriander,1 teaspoon ground cumin,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste),Salt to taste,2 tablespoons vegetable oil,Skewers, soaked in water if using wooden skewers
instruction: In a large bowl, combine cream, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, grated cheese (if using), garam masala, ground coriander, ground cumin, turmeric powder, red chili powder, salt, and vegetable oil. Mix well to form a smooth marinade.Add the chicken pieces to the marinade and coat them evenly. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or preferably overnight to allow the flavors to meld.Preheat the grill or oven to medium-high heat.Thread the marinated chicken pieces onto skewers, leaving a little space between each piece.Grill the skewers for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, or until the chicken is cooked through and lightly charred on the edges. If using an oven, place the skewers on a baking tray lined with aluminum foil and bake for 15-20 minutes at 200°C (400°F), turning once halfway through.Once cooked, remove the skewers from the grill or oven and let them rest for a few minutes.Serve hot with mint chutney, onion rings, and lemon wedges.

name: Grilled Chicken Tikka
description: Grilled Chicken Tikka is a popular Indian dish made with marinated chicken pieces that are skewered and grilled to perfection. Here's a detailed description of the dish along with its preparation, cooking time, approximate calories, and serving suggestions:
ingredients: 10 chicken thighs (or mix of thighs and legs),Kosher salt,1/2 tsp ground cardamom (or 3 cardamom pods ground),3 cloves garlic finely chopped,3 Tbsp fresh ginger finely chopped,1 cup plain whole milk yogurt,2 1/2 Tbsp lemon juice,1 tsp freshly ground black pepper,1/2 tsp cayenne (up to 1 tsp if you want extra spicy),1/2 tsp paprika,1/2 tsp cumin,1/2 tsp turmeric,2 drops orange or red food coloring (optional)
instruction: Rinse the chicken pieces, discard the skin, dry with a paper towel, and sprinkle generously with Kosher salt.Meanwhile, combine the cardamom, garlic and ginger and pound to a coarse paste with a pestle or in a mini chopper or spice grinder. Transfer to a bowl and stir in the yogurt, lemon juice, black pepper, cayenne, paprika, cumin, turmeric, food coloring, and salt to taste (about 1 tsp). Pour the marinade over the chicken and turn to coat all over. Marinate in the refrigerator for 2 to 12 hours.Preheat the grill to high and oil the grate. Turn the grill down to medium and arrange the pieces on the grate. Grill them about 10 minutes per side, dipping in or brushing with any remainingl marinade when you turn. Transfer to a serving plate and let sit for 3-5 minutes before serving.We served with basmati rice and a caesar salad. We made two pieces with half as much cayenne for our youngest child.

name: Chicken Reshmi Kabab
description: Chicken Reshmi Kabab is a popular Indian appetizer made with minced chicken blended with various spices and herbs. The word "Reshmi" means silky, indicating the smooth and velvety texture of these kababs. They are traditionally cooked on skewers and are known for their tenderness and mild flavors.
ingredients: 500 grams minced chicken,2 tablespoons fresh cream,2 tablespoons grated paneer (optional, for added richness),1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon green chili paste (adjust according to spice preference),1 teaspoon garam masala,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon cumin powder,1/2 teaspoon black pepper powder,1/4 teaspoon turmeric powder,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons chopped coriander leaves,2 tablespoons chopped mint leaves,1 tablespoon lemon juice,Butter or oil for basting
instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine minced chicken, fresh cream, grated paneer (if using), ginger-garlic paste, green chili paste, garam masala, coriander powder, cumin powder, black pepper powder, turmeric powder, salt, chopped coriander leaves, chopped mint leaves, and lemon juice.Mix all the ingredients together until well combined and the mixture becomes smooth.Cover the bowl and refrigerate the mixture for at least 30 minutes to marinate.Preheat your grill or barbecue to medium-high heat. If you don't have a grill, you can also use a grill pan or oven broiler.Thread the marinated chicken mixture onto skewers, shaping them into kababs.Place the skewers on the preheated grill and cook for about 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally, until the kababs are cooked through and golden brown on the outside.You can also baste the kababs with butter or oil while grilling to keep them moist and flavorful.Once cooked, remove the kababs from the grill and serve hot with mint chutney, sliced onions, and lemon wedges.

name: chicken spring roll
description: Chicken spring rolls are a popular appetizer in many Asian cuisines, including Chinese and Thai. They consist of a savory filling wrapped in a thin spring roll wrapper and deep-fried until crispy. Here's a detailed description of how to make chicken spring rolls:
ingredients: 200g boneless chicken breast, finely chopped or minced,1 tablespoon vegetable oil,2 cloves garlic, minced,1 small onion, finely chopped,1 carrot, julienned,1 cup shredded cabbage,2-3 spring onions, finely chopped,2 tablespoons soy sauce,1 tablespoon oyster sauce,1 teaspoon sesame oil,Salt and pepper to taste,Spring roll wrappers (available in Asian grocery stores),Oil for deep-frying
instruction: Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. Add minced garlic and chopped onions, sauté until fragrant.Add the chopped chicken to the pan and cook until it turns white and is no longer pink.Stir in the julienned carrot, shredded cabbage, and chopped spring onions. Cook for a few minutes until the vegetables are slightly softened.Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, salt, and pepper to the chicken mixture. Stir well to combine and cook for another minute. Remove from heat and let the filling cool completely.Take one spring roll wrapper and place it on a clean, dry surface with one corner pointing towards you (diamond shape).Place about 2 tablespoons of the chicken filling in the center of the wrapper.Fold the bottom corner over the filling, then fold in the sides and roll tightly towards the top corner, sealing the edge with a little water.Repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling.

name: Cheese Chicken Momos
description: Cheese chicken momos are a delicious variation of the traditional Tibetan dumplings, filled with a mixture of minced chicken and cheese, wrapped in a thin dough, and then steamed to perfection. The combination of tender chicken, gooey melted cheese, and aromatic spices makes these momos incredibly flavorful and satisfying.
ingredients:
For the dough:1 cup all-purpose flour,Water, as needed
For the filling:200g minced chicken,1 cup grated cheese (such as mozzarella or cheddar),1 small onion, finely chopped,2-3 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch piece of ginger, minced,1 green chili, finely chopped (optional),Salt and pepper to taste,1 tablespoon vegetable oil
For serving:Soy sauce,Chili sauce,Chopped spring onions (optional)
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour with water gradually until you form a smooth and elastic dough. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rest for about 30 minutes.In another bowl, mix together the minced chicken, grated cheese, chopped onion, garlic, ginger, green chili (if using), salt, and pepper.Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the chicken-cheese mixture and cook until the chicken is cooked through and the cheese is melted. Remove from heat and let it cool slightly.Divide the dough into small equal-sized portions and roll each portion into a thin circle.Place a spoonful of the chicken-cheese filling in the center of each dough circle.Fold the edges of the dough circle over the filling, pleating and sealing to form a crescent-shaped momo.Repeat the process with the remaining dough and filling.

name: Chicken Maharaja
description: Chicken Maharaja is known for its royal flavors and creamy texture. It often incorporates a blend of spices, cream, yogurt, and sometimes nuts to create a decadent sauce that coats the chicken pieces. The dish is typically served with naan bread or rice to soak up the delicious sauce.
ingredients: 500 grams of boneless chicken, cut into cubes,1 cup of yogurt,1 onion, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, pureed,2 tablespoons of ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon of cumin powder,1 teaspoon of coriander powder,1 teaspoon of garam masala,1/2 teaspoon of turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon of red chili powder (adjust to taste),1/2 cup of cream,2 tablespoons of ghee or oil,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Marinate the chicken pieces with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, and salt. Allow it to marinate for at least 1 hour in the refrigerator.Heat ghee or oil in a pan. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Add the tomato puree and cook until the oil separates.Add cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and red chili powder. Cook for a few minutes until the spices are fragrant.Add the marinated chicken pieces and cook until they are cooked through and the sauce thickens.Stir in the cream and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and, if desired, cashews, almonds, or a swirl of cream.

name: Chicken - Do - Pyaza
description: Chicken Do Pyaza features tender pieces of chicken cooked with a variety of aromatic spices and plenty of onions, resulting in a luscious gravy. The dish has a perfect balance of flavors, with the sweetness of onions complementing the spiciness of the masala.
ingredients:
For marinating chicken:1 kg chicken with bone,2 ½ tbsp ginger - garlic paste,2 Tbsp red chilli powder,Salt, as per taste
For the curry:1 large onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, blanched and pureed,2 1/2 tsp garlic and ginger paste,¼ cup curd,1 - 2 bay leaf,2 tsp red chili powder,1 tbsp turmeric powder,1 tbsp coriander powder,1 tbsp cumin powder,Salt, as per taste,2 tbsp garam masala,⅓ Cup sambhar onions or 1 large onion, cut into chunks,½ Cup water or as per requirement,2 - 3 tbsp ghee (clarified butter)
For garnish:A fistful of coriander leaves, chopped,2 green chilies, slit in between
instruction: Clean, wash and pat dry chicken. Marinate with ginger garlic paste, salt and red chilli powder. Rub the marinade nicely over chicken pieces and let it rest in fridge for minimum 3 - 4 hours.Heat desi ghee in a deep saucepan and add bay leaf. Keep the gas flame low to medium. Add garlic - ginger paste. When it turns brown, add chopped onions and cook over low flame till it turns golden brown. Now add tomato puree and salt.Keep on sauteing masala until oil gets separated from it.Take some yoghurt in a bowl, add turmeric and red chilli powder, whisk it nicely. Add this mixture to the masala and cook for another 5 - 10 minutes.Add coriander powder, cumin powder, the marinated chicken, sambhar onion, water and garam masala.Mix nicely, cover the pan with a lid and let the chicken simmer over low heat until chicken is cooked through and the liquid is reduced a little bit. This takes around 15 minutes depending upon the chicken quality.Open the lid of open and check the chicken for doneness. Once chicken is done garish with chopped coriander leaves and green chilies.Serve hot with rice or bread.

name: chicken pahadi
description: Chicken Pahadi is a dish where boneless chicken pieces are marinated in a mixture of fresh coriander (cilantro), mint leaves, green chilies, ginger, garlic, yogurt, and various spices. The marinated chicken is then grilled or cooked on a stovetop until tender and infused with the flavors of the marinade. The result is a succulent and aromatic chicken dish with a vibrant green color and a refreshing taste.
ingredients: 500 grams boneless chicken, cut into cubes,1 cup fresh coriander (cilantro) leaves,½ cup fresh mint leaves,2-3 green chilies, chopped,1-inch piece of ginger,chopped,4-5 garlic cloves,½ cup yogurt,1 teaspoon cumin powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,½ teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon garam masala powder,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons oil
instruction: In a blender or food processor, combine fresh coriander leaves, mint leaves, green chilies, ginger, garlic, yogurt, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, and salt. Blend until you get a smooth marinade.Transfer the marinade to a bowl and add the chicken pieces. Mix well, ensuring the chicken is evenly coated with the marinade. Cover the bowl and let the chicken marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour, or preferably overnight for the best flavor.After marinating, remove the chicken from the refrigerator and let it come to room temperature.Heat oil in a grill pan or skillet over medium heat. Once the oil is hot, add the marinated chicken pieces, shaking off any excess marinade. Cook the chicken for about 8-10 minutes on each side, or until cooked through and charred on the outside.Once the chicken is cooked, remove it from the pan and transfer it to a serving plate.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice, naan, or roti.

name: Chicken Angara Masala
description: Chicken Angara Masala features tender pieces of chicken cooked in a spicy gravy enriched with aromatic spices and a smoky undertone. The name "Angara" translates to "fiery" or "burning," indicating the dish's intense spiciness. It's a popular dish in Indian restaurants and is often served with naan, roti, or rice.
ingredients: 500 grams chicken (boneless or with bones, as per preference),2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, pureed,2-3 green chilies, slit,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,1/2 cup yogurt (curd),1 teaspoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon garam masala,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1 teaspoon cumin powder,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons oil,Fresh coriander leaves for garnishing,Lemon wedges for serving
instruction:
In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, coriander powder, cumin powder, and salt.Add the chicken pieces to the marinade and coat them well. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes, preferably longer for better flavor.
Cooking:Heat oil in a pan or kadhai over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Add the tomato puree and cook until the oil separates from the mixture.Now, add the marinated chicken along with slit green chilies. Cook on high heat for a few minutes.Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and let the chicken cook until tender, stirring occasionally.Once the chicken is cooked through and the gravy thickens, remove the lid and cook for a few more minutes to achieve the desired consistency.Optionally, you can give the dish a smoky flavor by placing a piece of charcoal on direct flame until red hot, placing it in a small bowl inside the chicken mixture, adding a few drops of oil on the hot charcoal, and immediately covering the pan for a couple of minutes to infuse the smoky flavor.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with naan, roti, or rice. Accompany with lemon wedges for extra tanginess.

name: Chicken Lazeez
description: Chicken Lazeez typically consists of tender chicken pieces cooked in a creamy and aromatic sauce made from a blend of spices, yogurt, cream, and sometimes nuts. The dish is known for its velvety texture and mild yet robust flavor profile. It's often served with naan, rice, or roti (Indian flatbread).
ingredients: 500 grams boneless chicken, cut into cubes,1 cup yogurt,1/2 cup cream,2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, pureed,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1 tablespoon cashew nuts, soaked and ground into a paste (optional),2 tablespoons oil or ghee (clarified butter),1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon garam masala powder,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Marinate the chicken pieces in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes to an hour.Heat oil or ghee in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Add the marinated chicken pieces and cook until they are partially cooked and browned on the edges.Add tomato puree and cook until the raw smell disappears and oil starts to separate from the mixture.Stir in the cashew nut paste (if using) and cook for a few more minutes.Add cream and garam masala powder. Stir well to combine.Cover the pan and simmer the chicken lazeez on low heat until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce thickens to your desired consistency.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Chicken green masala
description: Chicken green masala is a flavorful Indian dish made with tender chicken pieces cooked in a vibrant green gravy enriched with aromatic spices and fresh herbs. It's a popular dish in Indian cuisine, known for its rich taste and vibrant color.
ingredients:
For the green masala paste:Fresh coriander leaves (cilantro),Mint leaves,Green chilies,Ginger,Garlic,Onion,Tomato
For the chicken:,Chicken pieces (bone-in or boneless),Yogurt,Cooking oil or ghee,Whole spices (such as cloves, cardamom, cinnamon),Ground spices (such as turmeric, cumin, coriander),Salt to taste,Water
instruction:
Prepare the green masala paste by blending together fresh coriander leaves, mint leaves, green chilies, ginger, garlic, onion, and tomato until you get a smooth paste.Marinate the chicken pieces with yogurt, a portion of the green masala paste, and salt. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to penetrate the chicken.
Cooking:Heat oil or ghee in a pan or pressure cooker. Add whole spices like cloves, cardamom, and cinnamon and sauté until fragrant.Add the remaining green masala paste and cook until the raw smell disappears and the oil starts to separate from the masala.Add the marinated chicken pieces to the masala and cook on medium heat until the chicken is partially cooked.Add ground spices such as turmeric, cumin, and coriander. Adjust the seasoning according to your taste.Pour in some water to adjust the consistency of the gravy, cover, and let it simmer until the chicken is fully cooked and tender.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice, naan, or roti.

name: Chicken rara
description: Chicken Rara is made by cooking marinated chicken pieces in a thick, tomato-based gravy along with minced meat (usually mutton or lamb) and a medley of spices. The dish is characterized by its deep red color and robust flavors. It's typically served hot with naan, roti, or steamed rice.
ingredients: 500 grams chicken, cut into pieces,,100 grams minced mutton or lamb,2 onions, finely choppe,2 tomatoes, pureed,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 tablespoon red chili powder (adjust according to taste),1 tablespoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala powder,Salt to taste,Cooking oil or ghee,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Marinate the chicken pieces with ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, and salt for about 30 minutes.Heat oil or ghee in a pan and add cumin seeds. Let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until the raw smell disappears.Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates from the masala.Add red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.Add the marinated chicken pieces and minced meat. Cook until the chicken is tender and the meat is cooked through.Sprinkle garam masala powder and mix well.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot

name: Mutton dal ghosh
description: Mutton Dal Ghosht is a popular dish in Indian cuisine, particularly in regions like Punjab, Uttar Pradesh, and Hyderabad. It's known for its rich and aromatic flavors derived from a blend of spices and slow cooking. The mutton becomes incredibly tender, and the lentils add depth and texture to the dish.
ingredients: 500 grams of mutton pieces (with bones for added flavor),1 cup of lentils (usually split yellow lentils or masoor dal),2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, chopped,2-3 green chilies, slit lengthwise,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon garam masala powder,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,Cooking oil or ghee (clarified butter)
instruction: Rinse the lentils thoroughly and soak them in water for about 30 minutes. Heat oil or ghee in a pressure cooker or a heavy-bottomed pot.Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Sauté for a couple of minutes until the raw smell disappears.Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.Now, add the mutton pieces to the pot and sauté until they are lightly browned.Drain the soaked lentils and add them to the pot along with turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.Add enough water to cover the mutton and lentils. Close the pressure cooker lid and cook for about 4-5 whistles or simmer in a pot until the mutton is tender and the lentils are cooked thoroughly. This may take around 45 minutes to 1 hour.Once the mutton and lentils are cooked, check for seasoning and adjust if necessary.Sprinkle garam masala powder and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.Serve hot with rice or Indian bread like roti or naan.

name: Chicken Manchow Soup
description: Chicken Manchow Soup is a popular Indo-Chinese soup known for its spicy and tangy flavor. It typically contains chicken, vegetables, and noodles or rice, seasoned with various spices and sauces. Here's a detailed description of its preparation:
ingredients: 250g boneless chicken, thinly sliced,1 tablespoon vegetable oil,2 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch piece of ginger, minced,1 small onion, finely chopped,1 carrot, julienned,1/2 cup cabbage, thinly sliced,1/4 cup bell peppers (red, green, or both), thinly sliced,2-3 green chilies, finely chopped (adjust to taste),4 cups chicken stock,2 tablespoons soy sauce,1 tablespoon chili sauce or Sriracha sauce (adjust to taste),1 tablespoon vinegar,1 teaspoon sugar,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons cornstarch mixed with 3 tablespoons water (cornstarch slurry),1 egg, beaten,1/4 cup spring onions, finely chopped,Cooked rice or noodles for serving,Fried noodles for garnish (optional),Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish (optional)
instruction: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add minced garlic and ginger, and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant.Add chopped onions and cook until they turn translucent.Add thinly sliced chicken and cook until it's no longer pink.Add julienned carrots, thinly sliced cabbage, and sliced bell peppers. Stir-fry for a few minutes until the vegetables are slightly tender.Pour in the chicken stock and bring it to a boil. Reduce heat to low and let it simmer for about 5 minutes.Add soy sauce, chili sauce, vinegar, sugar, and salt. Adjust seasoning according to your taste preferences.Gradually pour in the cornstarch slurry while stirring continuously to thicken the soup.Slowly drizzle beaten egg into the soup while stirring gently, creating egg ribbons.Add chopped spring onions and give it a final stir.Remove from heat.

name: chicken roasted
description: Roast chicken is the ultimate kitchen staple! And my version is so ridiculously easy to make. There are just three ingredients, yes three! With no stuffing of the bird required. Trust me, this recipe will become your go-to oven roasted chicken recip
ingredients: 1kg chicken include salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, and herbs
instruction:
Selecting the Chicken: Choose a fresh whole chicken of desired size, typically 3-5 pounds (1.4-2.3 kg), depending on the number of servings needed.Cleaning and Patting Dry: Remove any giblets from the cavity of the chicken. Rinse the chicken under cold water, inside and out, and pat it dry with paper towels. This helps to ensure crispy skin during roasting.Seasoning: Rub the chicken inside and out with seasoning of your choice. Common seasonings include salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, and herbs like thyme, rosemary, or sage. You can also add a bit of olive oil or melted butter for extra flavor and moisture.Trussing (Optional): Trussing involves tying the legs and wings of the chicken close to the body to promote even cooking. While it's optional, trussing can help the chicken maintain its shape and cook more evenly.Preheat the Oven: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cooking:Roasting: Place the seasoned and trussed (if desired) chicken breast-side up on a roasting pan or baking dish. You can also add vegetables like carrots, potatoes, and onions around the chicken for a complete meal. Roast the chicken in the preheated oven.
Cooking Time: The cooking time will vary depending on the size of the chicken. As a general guideline, roast the chicken for about 20 minutes per pound (450 g). Use a meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the chicken (not touching bone) to ensure it reaches an internal temperature of at least 165°F (74°C).Basting (Optional): Some people like to baste the chicken with its own juices or a mixture of melted butter and herbs during the cooking process to keep it moist.Resting: Once the chicken is cooked through, remove it from the oven and let it rest for about 10-15 minutes before carving. This allows the juices to redistribute throughout the meat, resulting in a juicier bird.

name: Malai Chicken
description: Malai Chicken, also known as Murgh Malaiwala, is a popular North Indian dish where tender chicken pieces are marinated in a creamy mixture of yogurt, cream, and spices, and then cooked to perfection. The dish is typically mild in flavor, making it suitable for those who prefer less spicy foods. It's often garnished with fresh coriander leaves and served with naan, rice, or roti.
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces1 cup plain yogurt (curd),1/2 cup heavy cream (malai),2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon garam masala,1 teaspoon ground coriander,1 teaspoon ground cumin,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust according to taste),Salt to taste,2 tablespoons cooking oil or ghee (clarified butter),Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: In a large bowl, mix together yogurt, cream, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, ground coriander, ground cumin, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt to form a smooth marinade.Add the chicken pieces to the marinade and coat them well. Cover and refrigerate for 1-2 hours (or overnight) to allow the flavors to penetrate the chicken.Heat oil or ghee in a pan over medium heat. Add the marinated chicken pieces along with the marinade.Cook the chicken until it is tender and cooked through, stirring occasionally. This should take around 15-20 minutes.Once the chicken is cooked and the gravy thickens, remove from heat.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with naan, rice, or roti.

name: Chicken Afghani
description: Chicken Afghani is a delicious and aromatic dish that originates from Afghanistan. It's known for its rich and creamy texture, infused with various spices and flavors. Here's a detailed description along with preparation instructions:
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken, cut into cubes,1 cup thick yogurt,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon garam masala powder,1 teaspoon cumin powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1 teaspoon chili powder (adjust to taste),1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 tablespoon lemon juice,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons cooking oil,2 tablespoons butter,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,Lemon wedges for serving
instruction: In a bowl, mix together yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, chili powder, turmeric powder, lemon juice, and salt to form a marinade.Add the chicken pieces to the marinade, ensuring they are well coated. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or preferably overnight for best flavor.Heat oil in a skillet or pan over medium heat. Add the marinated chicken pieces along with the marinade. Cook until the chicken is tender and cooked through, stirring occasionally. This usually takes around 15-20 minutes.Once the chicken is cooked, add butter to the pan and mix well until it melts and coats the chicken.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and remove from heat.

name: Chicken Lahori
description: Chicken Lahori is a popular Pakistani dish known for its rich and aromatic flavors. It's typically made with bone-in chicken pieces marinated in a blend of spices and yogurt, then cooked until tender and juicy. Here's a detailed description of the dish along with its preparation, cooking time, approximate calorie count, and serving size:
ingredients: 1 kg chicken, cut into pieces (with bone-in),1 cup plain yogurt,2 onions, finely chopped,3 tomatoes, finely chopped,4-5 cloves of garlic, minced,1-inch piece of ginger,grated,2-3 green chilies, finely chopped,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander seeds,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon garam masala powder,Salt to taste,Cooking oil,Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish
instruction: In a large bowl, mix yogurt, minced garlic, grated ginger, chopped green chilies, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, and salt to make the marinade.Add the chicken pieces to the marinade and coat them well. Let the chicken marinate for at least 2 hours in the refrigerator, preferably overnight for the best flavor.In a pan, heat some oil over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and coriander seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and the oil starts to separate.Add the marinated chicken along with the marinade to the pan. Stir well to coat the chicken with the masala.Cover the pan and cook the chicken over medium-low heat for about 30-40 minutes or until it's tender and cooked through. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking and burning.Once the chicken is cooked, garnish with fresh cilantro leaves and remove from heat.

name: Chicken Lazeez
description: Chicken Lazeez is a delicious Indian chicken dish known for its rich, creamy gravy and flavorful spices. Here's a detailed description of the dish along with preparation instructions:
ingredients: 500g chicken pieces (boneless or with bones),1 cup thick yogurt,2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, pureed,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1 teaspoon garam masala powder,1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds,1/2 cup fresh cream,2 tablespoons oil or ghee,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil or ghee in a pan and add cumin seeds. Let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until the raw smell disappears.Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates.Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well.Add yogurt and cook until the mixture thickens.Add chicken pieces and cook until they are tender and cooked through.Add fresh cream and mix well. Simmer for a few minutes.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Chicken Sukka
description: Chicken Sukka is a popular South Indian dish, particularly from the coastal regions of Karnataka, Kerala, and Goa. It is a dry chicken dish cooked with a blend of aromatic spices and grated coconut. Here's a detailed description of the dish along with its preparation, cooking time, approximate calories, and serving size:
ingredients: 500 grams of chicken (bone-in pieces preferred for better flavor),2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, finely chopped,2 green chilies, slit lengthwise,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,2 teaspoons red chili powder (adjust according to spice preference),1 tablespoon coriander powder,1 tablespoon garam masala powder,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons oil,Fresh coriander leaves for garnishing,Grated coconut for garnishing (optional)
instruction: Clean and wash the chicken pieces thoroughly. Drain excess water and keep aside.Heat oil in a pan or kadhai over medium heat.Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Sauté for a minute until the raw smell disappears.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy.Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well and cook the spices for a couple of minutes.Add the chicken pieces to the pan and mix until they are well coated with the masala.Cover and cook the chicken on low to medium heat until it is almost done. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.Once the chicken is cooked, remove the lid and increase the heat to allow excess moisture to evaporate.Add garam masala powder and continue cooking until the chicken turns dry and starts to roast slightly. This is where the "sukka" texture comes from.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and grated coconut (if using).Serve hot with roti, rice, or as a side dish.

name: Chicken Tiranga
description: "Chicken Tiranga" is a colorful and flavorful Indian dish that features layers of marinated chicken, typically cooked in three different styles representing the colors of the Indian flag - saffron, white, and green. Here's a detailed description along with the preparation, cooking time, approximate calories, and serving size:
ingredients:
For Saffron (Orange) Chicken:250 grams boneless chicken, cut into cubes,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder,Salt to taste,1 tablespoon oil,1 tablespoon yogurt
For White Chicken:250 grams boneless chicken, cut into cubes,1/4 cup cream,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,Salt to taste,1 tablespoon oil,1 tablespoon lemon juice
For Green Chicken:250 grams boneless chicken, cut into cubes,1 cup fresh coriander leaves,1/2 cup fresh mint leaves,1 green chili,chopped,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,Salt to taste,1 tablespoon oil
instruction:
Marinate each batch of chicken separately for each color. For the saffron chicken, mix the chicken with turmeric powder, red chili powder, salt, oil, and yogurt. For the white chicken, mix with cream, ginger-garlic paste, salt, oil, and lemon juice. For the green chicken, blend coriander leaves, mint leaves, green chili, ginger-garlic paste, and salt into a smooth paste. Marinate the chicken with this paste.Let the marinated chicken pieces sit for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.After marinating, thread the chicken pieces onto skewers or toothpicks, keeping each color separate.
Cooking:Heat a grill pan or barbecue grill over medium-high heat.Cook each batch of chicken skewers until fully cooked and charred slightly, flipping occasionally. Cooking time may vary, but it usually takes around 8-10 minutes per batch.Remove the cooked chicken skewers from the grill and set aside.

name: Chicken Kolhapuri
description: Chicken Kolhapuri is a popular spicy, rich, delicious and super flavorsome dish of curried chicken from the Kolhapuri Cuisine. Chicken is marinated in fresh ground spices & coconut and later simmered to perfection until the flavors are absorbed.
ingredients: 500 grams chicken, cleaned and cut into pieces,3-4 tablespoons oil or ghee (clarified butter),2 onions, finely chopped,3-4 tomatoes, finely chopped or pureed,2-3 green chilies,slit,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1teaspoon mustard seeds,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,2-3 tablespoons Kolhapuri masala (a blend of spices available in Indian grocery stores or homemade),Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil or ghee in a deep pan or kadhai over medium heatAdd cumin seeds and mustard seeds. Let them crackle.Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Sauté for a couple of minutes until the raw smell disappears.Add chopped tomatoes or tomato puree. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and oil starts to separate.Add turmeric powder and Kolhapuri masala. Mix well and cook for a minute to roast the spices.Add the chicken pieces to the masala. Mix well to coat the chicken with the spices.Season with salt to taste. Cover and cook on low heat until the chicken is tender and cooked through, stirring occasionally. This usually takes around 20-25 minutes, but cooking time may vary depending on the size of chicken pieces.Once the chicken is cooked, check for seasoning and adjust if necessary.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

name: Chicken Mughlai
description: Chicken Mughlai is a classic Mughlai cuisine dish that originates from the kitchens of the Mughal emperors of India. It is known for its rich, creamy texture and aromatic flavors.
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces,1up yogurt (curd),1/2 cup cream,1/4 cup cashews, soaked in water for 30 minutes,1/4 cup almonds, blanched and peeled,2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, pureed,4cloves garlic, minced,1-inch piece of ginger, grated,2 green chilies, slit lengthwise (adjust according to spice preference),1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon garam masala,1 teaspoon ground coriander,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/4 teaspoon ground cardamom,1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon,1/4 teaspoon ground cloves,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,Ghee or oil for cooking
instruction: In a blender, grind the soaked cashews and blanched almonds into a smooth paste. Set aside.In a bowl, marinate the chicken pieces with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, and salt. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes.Heat ghee or oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and green chilies. Sauté until the onions turn golden brown.Add the tomato puree and cook until the oil separates from the mixture.Now, add the marinated chicken along with the marinade. Cook until the chicken is partially cooked.Add the ground cashew-almond paste, garam masala, ground coriander, red chili powder, ground cardamom, ground cinnamon, and ground cloves. Mix well.Pour in the cream and mix until well combined. Adjust salt if needed.Cover and cook the chicken on low heat until it is tender and the sauce has thickened to your desired consistency.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Chicken Lapeta
description: Chicken Lapeta is made with succulent pieces of chicken cooked in a spicy and tangy gravy, then wrapped in a soft flatbread along with crunchy onions, fresh coriander, and a squeeze of lime. The term "lapeta" refers to the rolling or wrapping of the filling in the bread, giving it a unique and satisfying texture. It's a delicious and filling snack or meal option that's enjoyed by many across India.
ingredients:
For the Chicken Filling:500g boneless chicken, cut into small pieces,2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes,finely chopped,2 green chilies, finely chopped,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves, chopped,Oil for cooking
For the Flatbread (Roti):2 cups whole wheat flour,Water,as needed Salt to taste,Oil or ghee for cooking
For Serving:Sliced onions,Fresh coriander leaves,Lime or lemon wedges,Mint chutney or your favorite sauce
instruction:
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent.Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Sauté until the raw smell disappears.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and mushy.Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.Add the chicken pieces and cook until they are tender and the masala coats the chicken evenly.Sprinkle chopped coriander leaves and mix well. Turn off the heat.
Preparing the Flatbread (Roti):In a bowl, mix whole wheat flour with salt. Gradually add water and knead into a smooth dough.Divide the dough into equal-sized balls and roll them out into thin, round rotis using a rolling pin.Cook the rotis on a hot griddle or tawa until they are lightly golden on both sides. Apply oil or ghee while cooking to keep them soft.
Assembling Chicken Lapeta:Place a cooked roti on a clean surface.Spoon some of the prepared chicken filling onto the center of the roti.Top it with sliced onions, fresh coriander leaves, and a squeeze of lime or lemon juice.Roll the roti tightly around the filling, making sure to secure the ends to prevent any spillage.Repeat with the remaining rotis and filling to make more Chicken Lapetas.

name: Chicken tawa
description: Chicken Tawa is a spicy and succulent chicken dish cooked on a tawa with onions, tomatoes, and a blend of aromatic spices. The term "tawa" refers to the flat griddle used for cooking in Indian cuisine. The dish is characterized by its smoky flavor, which comes from the direct contact of the chicken with the hot surface of the tawa.
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces,2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, finely chopped,2 green chilies, finely chopped (adjust according to spice preference),4 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch piece of ginger, grated,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,Cooking oil or ghee
instruction: Heat a tawa or a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add a tablespoon of oil or ghee to the tawa.Once the oil is hot, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions, green chilies, minced garlic, and grated ginger to the tawa. Sauté until the onions turn golden brown.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and mushy.Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well and cook for a couple of minutes until the spices are fragrant.Add the chicken pieces to the tawa and spread them out evenly. Let the chicken cook on one side for a few minutes until it starts to brown.Flip the chicken pieces and continue cooking until they are fully cooked and tender.Once the chicken is cooked through, garnish with freshly chopped coriander leaves.Serve hot Chicken Tawa with naan, roti, or rice.

name: Mutton Handi
description: Mutton Handi is a popular North Indian dish known for its rich and indulgent taste. The mutton is marinated in a mixture of yogurt and spices, then slow-cooked until it's tender and flavorful. The gravy is made with a blend of aromatic spices, onions, tomatoes, and cream, giving it a creamy texture and rich taste.
ingredients: 750g mutton pieces, cleaned and washed,1 cup yogurt (curd),2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, chopped,4 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch piece of ginger, grated,2 green chilies, slit lengthwise,1/2 cup cream,1/4 cup chopped coriander leaves,2 tablespoons ghee or oil,Salt to taste
instruction: In a bowl, marinate the mutton pieces with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, and salt. Let it marinate for at least 1 hour in the refrigerator.Heat ghee or oil in a handi or heavy-bottomed pan over medium heat.Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and green chilies. Sauté until the onions turn golden brown.Add the marinated mutton pieces and cook until they are partially cooked.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy.Now, add coriander powder, red chili powder, and garam masala powder. Mix well.Pour in 1 cup of water, cover the handi, and let the mutton cook on low heat until it's tender. This may take around 1 to 1.5 hours depending on the tenderness of the meat.Once the mutton is cooked, add cream and mix well. Adjust salt if needed.Cook for another 5-10 minutes until the gravy thickens slightly.Garnish with chopped coriander leaves before serving.

name: Mutton Nihari
description: Mutton Nihari is a hearty dish known for its robust flavors and aromatic spices. The name "Nihari" is derived from the Arabic word "Nihar," which means "morning." Traditionally, Nihari was cooked overnight and served as a breakfast dish, but it is now enjoyed throughout the day. The slow cooking process allows the meat to absorb all the flavors of the spices, resulting in a thick and flavorful gravy.
ingredients:
1 kg mutton (goat or lamb), cut into pieces,2 onions, thinly sliced,4 tablespoons ghee or oil,4-5 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch piece of ginger, grated,2-3 green chilies, slit lengthwise,2 tablespoons wheat flour (optional, for thickening),2 tablespoons Nihari masala (store-bought or homemade, see below),1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon cumin powder,Salt to taste,fresh coriander leaves, chopped (for garnish),Ginger julienne (for garnish),Lime wedges (for serving)
Nihari Masala Ingredients:2 tablespoons coriander seeds,1 tablespoon cumin seeds,1 tablespoon fennel seeds,1 tablespoon black peppercorns,1 tablespoon cloves,1 tablespoon cinnamon sticks,1 tablespoon black cardamom pods,1 tablespoon green cardamom pods,1 whole nutmeg, grated,5-6 dried red chilies
instruction: Dry roast all the ingredients for the Nihari masala in a pan until fragrant. Allow them to cool, then grind into a fine powder using a spice grinder or mortar and pestle. Set aside.Heat ghee or oil in a large pot or pressure cooker over medium heat. Add sliced onions and fry until golden brown.Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Sauté for a few minutes until fragrant.Add the mutton pieces to the pot and cook until they are lightly browned on all sides.Add Nihari masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and salt to the pot. Mix well to coat the meat with the spices.Pour enough water to cover the meat completely. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer for 3-4 hours, or until the meat is tender and the gravy is thickened.If you prefer a thicker gravy, mix wheat flour with some water to make a paste and add it to the pot. Cook for an additional 15-20 minutes.Once the mutton is cooked to your desired tenderness and the gravy has thickened, check for seasoning and adjust if necessary.Garnish with chopped fresh coriander leaves, ginger julienne, and lime wedges before serving.

name: Egg masala
description: Egg Masala features boiled eggs simmered in a spicy and tangy tomato-based gravy infused with a blend of aromatic spices. The gravy is typically rich and creamy, creating a perfect balance of flavors that complement the mild taste of the eggs.
ingredients: 6 hard-boiled eggs, peeled and halved,2 large onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, finely chopped or pureed,3-4 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch piece of ginger, grated,2 green chilies, slit lengthwise,1/2 cup yogurt (curd),1/4 cup cashews, soaked in water for 30 minutes,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon,1/4 teaspoon ground cloves,1/4 teaspoon ground cardamom,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,Cooking oil or ghee
instruction: Heat oil or ghee in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Sauté for a couple of minutes until fragrant.Meanwhile, in a blender, grind the soaked cashews into a smooth paste. Set aside.Add chopped tomatoes or tomato puree to the pan. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and oil starts to separate from the mixture.Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, ground cinnamon, ground cloves, and ground cardamom. Mix well and cook for a minute.Lower the heat and add the cashew paste. Stir continuously to prevent lumps from forming.Whisk the yogurt until smooth and add it to the pan. Mix well to incorporate.Add salt according to taste and adjust the consistency of the gravy by adding water if needed.Gently place the halved boiled eggs into the gravy, ensuring they are submerged. Cover and simmer for about 10-15 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Egg Bhurji
description: Egg Bhurji, also known as Anda Bhurji, is a popular Indian dish made with scrambled eggs cooked with onions, tomatoes, green chilies, and spices.
ingredients: 4 eggs,1 onion, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, finely chopped,2 green chilies, finely chopped (adjust according to spice preference),1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,Cooking oil or ghee
instruction: Heat oil or ghee in a pan over medium heat.Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and green chilies. Sauté until the onions turn translucent.Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute until the raw smell disappears.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy.Break the eggs directly into the pan and quickly scramble them using a spatula.Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.Cook the eggs until they are fully cooked and the mixture is dry, stirring continuously to avoid sticking to the bottom of the pan.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Chicken Kabsa Rice
description: Chicken Kabsa Rice is a one-pot dish where fragrant basmati rice is cooked with succulent chicken pieces, along with a blend of spices such as cloves, cardamom, cinnamon, and bay leaves. The dish is typically garnished with toasted almonds, raisins, and fresh herbs, adding layers of texture and flavor to the dish.
ingredients:
1 whole chicken, cut into pieces,2 tablespoons vegetable oil,1 onion, finely chopped,3 cloves garlic, minced,2 tomatoes, diced,2 tablespoons tomato paste,2 teaspoons ground cumin,1 teaspoon ground coriander,1 teaspoon ground turmeric,1 teaspoon ground paprika,Salt and pepper to taste,3 cups water or chicken broth
For Rice:2 cups basmati rice, rinsed and drained,4 cups water or chicken broth,2 tablespoons ghee or butter,4 whole cloves,4 whole cardamom pods,2-inch cinnamon stick,2 bay leave,Salt to taste
instruction: In a large pot, heat vegetable oil over medium heat.
