Add chopped onions and garlic, and sauté until softened.Add diced tomatoes and tomato paste, and cook until the tomatoes break down and release their juices.Stir in ground cumin, coriander, turmeric, paprika, salt, and pepper. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.Add chicken pieces to the pot and brown them on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.Pour in water or chicken broth, cover the pot, and let the chicken simmer for 30-40 minutes, or until tender and fully cooked. Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside.In another pot, melt ghee or butter over medium heat. Add cloves, cardamom pods, cinnamon stick, and bay leaves, and toast for a minute until fragrant.Add rinsed basmati rice to the pot and stir to coat the rice with the spices.Pour in water or chicken broth, season with salt, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and fluffy.To serve, arrange the cooked rice on a serving platter and place the chicken pieces on top. Garnish with toasted almonds, raisins, and fresh cilantro or parsley.

name: creamy garlic prawns
description: Creamy garlic prawns with rice is a popular seafood dish that features tender prawns cooked in a rich and creamy garlic sauce. The creamy sauce is infused with the flavors of garlic, butter, cream, and herbs, creating a luscious coating for the prawns.
ingredients: 500g large prawns, peeled and deveined,4 cloves garlic, minced,2 tablespoons butter,1 cup heavy cream,1/2 cup chicken or vegetable broth,1 tablespoon lemon juice,1 teaspoon dried thyme or parsley,Salt and pepper to taste,Fresh parsley or chives for garnish
instruction: Rinse the rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Drain well.In a medium saucepan, combine the rice, water or broth, and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil over high heat.Once boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat and let it sit, covered, for 5 minutes before fluffing with a fork.While the rice is cooking, prepare the creamy garlic prawns.In a large skillet or frying pan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.Add the prawns to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, until pink and opaque.Pour in the heavy cream and chicken or vegetable broth. Stir in the lemon juice, dried thyme or parsley, salt, and pepper.Cook for an additional 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce has thickened slightly and the prawns are cooked through.Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary.Serve the creamy garlic prawns hot over the cooked rice, garnished with fresh parsley or chives.

name: Tandoori Pomfret
description: Tandoori Pomfret Rice is a delightful fusion dish combining the smoky flavors of tandoori-style pomfret fish with aromatic rice cooked with Indian spices.
ingredients: 2 whole pomfret fish, cleaned and gutted,1 cup yogurt,2 tablespoons tandoori masala,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,1 tablespoon lemon juice,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,Salt to taste,Oil for basting
instruction: In a bowl, prepare the marinade for the pomfret by mixing yogurt, tandoori masala, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt.Make diagonal cuts on both sides of the pomfret fish and coat them evenly with the marinade. Allow the fish to marinate for at least 1 hour in the refrigerator.Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F). Grease a baking tray and place the marinated pomfret fish on it. Brush some oil on top.Bake the pomfret fish in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes or until cooked through, flipping halfway through and basting with oil.Meanwhile, prepare the rice. Heat oil or ghee in a pan and add cumin seeds. Once they splutter, add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.Add chopped tomatoes, green chili, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and oil begins to separate.Drain the soaked rice and add it to the pan. Stir well to coat the rice with the spices.Add water and bring it to a boil. Lower the heat, cover, and simmer unil the rice is cooked and water is absorbed, about 15-20 minutes.Once the rice is cooked, fluff it with a fork and sprinkle garam masala and chopped coriander leaves on top.

name: Egg Tawa Masala
description: Egg Tawa Masala features boiled eggs simmered in a rich and tangy masala gravy. The gravy is made with tomatoes, onions, garlic, ginger, and a blend of aromatic spices. The dish gets its name "Tawa" from the cooking technique, as it's traditionally cooked on a tawa (griddle), but you can easily prepare it in a skillet or frying pan.
ingredients: 4 hard-boiled eggs, peeled and halved,2 large tomatoes, finely chopped,2 onions,finely chopped,3 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch piece of ginger, grated,2 green chilies, slit lengthwise,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste),1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons oil,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil in a skillet or frying pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions, garlic, ginger, and green chilies. Sauté until the onions turn golden brown.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and the oil starts to separate from the mixture.Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for a few more minutes until the spices are fragrant.Place the halved boiled eggs in the masala gravy, gently pressing them down into the sauce.Cover the skillet and let the eggs simmer in the gravy for about 5-7 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.Sprinkle garam masala over the eggs and gravy. Mix gently.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Malvani Chicken Curry
description: Malvani chicken curry is a flavorful dish known for its rich coconut-based gravy and aromatic spices. It combines the heat of red chilies with the creaminess of coconut milk, creating a mouthwatering curry that pairs perfectly with rice or Indian bread.
ingredients: 500g chicken, cut into pieces,1 cup coconut milk,2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, chopped,2-3 green chilies, slit lengthwise,2 tbsp Malvani masala (or substitute with garam masala),1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste,1/2 tsp turmeric powder,Salt to taste,Oil for cooking,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until fragrant.Add tomatoes and cook until soft.Add Malvani masala, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook for 2-3 minutes.Add chicken pieces and coat them with the masala mixture.Pour in coconut milk and mix well. Add water if needed to adjust consistency.Cover and simmer until the chicken is cooked through, stirring occasionally.Once the chicken is cooked, garnish with fresh coriander leaves.Serve hot with steamed rice or bread of your choice.

name: Chicken Vindaloo
description: Chicken Vindaloo is a flavorful dish characterized by its rich, aromatic gravy made with a blend of spices and vinegar, creating a tantalizing balance of heat and acidity. Tender chicken pieces are simmered in this sauce, resulting in a delicious and satisfying meal.
ingredients: 500g chicken, cut into pieces,3-4 tablespoons vegetable oil,2 onions, finely chopped,4 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch piece of ginger,grated2-3 green chilies, chopped (adjust to taste),2 teaspoons ground cumin,2 teapoons ground coriander,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon paprika or Kashmiri chili powder,1 teaspoon garam masala,1/2 cup vinegar,Salt to taste,Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Cook for a couple of minutes until fragrant.Stir in ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, paprika or chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another minute.Add chicken pieces to the pan and cook until they are lightly browned on all sides.Pour in the vinegar and season with salt. Stir well to combine.Cover the pan and let the chicken simmer in the sauce for about 20-25 minutes or until cooked through, stirring occasionally.Once the chicken is cooked and the sauce has thickened, garnish with fresh cilantro leaves.Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

name: Al Hachi Chicken
description: Al Hachi Chicken is a flavorful and aromatic dish originating from Kashmir, India. It features tender chicken cooked in a rich gravy infused with a blend of traditional spices, creating a mouthwatering culinary experience.
ingredients: 500g chicken, cut into pieces,2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes,pureed,2 tablespoons yogurt,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,2 green chilies,chopped,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon cumin powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Cooking oil,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Marinate the chicken pieces with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, and salt. Let it sit for at least 30 minutes.Heat oil in a pan and sauté the chopped onions until golden brown.Add the tomato puree and cook until the oil separates.Stir in the green chilies, cumin powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.Add the marinated chicken pieces to the pan and cook until they are well coated with the masala.Pour in enough water to cover the chicken pieces and bring it to a boil.Reduce the heat, cover the pan, and let it simmer until the chicken is cooked through and the gravy thickens.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Laal Maas
description: Laal Maas is a traditional Rajasthani dish known for its fiery red color and rich, spicy flavor. It is a lamb curry cooked in a blend of aromatic spices and red chili paste, which gives it its distinctive hue.
ingredients: 500 grams of lamb (preferably with bones),4-5 tablespoons of ghee (clarified butter),2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes,pureed,2-3 green chilies,slit,2 tablespoons of ginger-garlic paste,1 tablespoon of coriander powder,1 teaspoon of cumin powder,1 teaspoon of turmeric powder,2 tablespoons of red chili paste (adjust according to spice preference),Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan and add chopped onions. Saute until golden brown.Add ginger-garlic paste and slit green chilies. Cook for a few minutes until fragrant.Add lamb pieces and cook until they are browned on all sides.Stir in the tomato puree, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, red chili paste, and salt. Mix well.Add water as needed to cover the meat and bring it to a simmer. Cover and cook until the meat is tender and the gravy thickens, stirring occasionally. This may take about 45 minutes to 1 hour.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or bread.

name: Meat Pasanda
description: Meat Pasanda is a flavorful and aromatic dish with tender meat slices cooked in a creamy, spiced sauce, perfect for a hearty meal.
ingredients: 500g of thinly sliced beef or lamb,1 cup yogurt,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon ground coriander,1 teaspoon ground cumin,1 teaspoon garam masala,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons vegetable oil,1 large onion, finely sliced,2-3 green chilies, slit lengthwise,1 cup heavy cream,Chopped fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, ground coriander, ground cumin, garam masala, turmeric powder, and salt to make the marinade.Marinate the meat slices in this mixture for at least 1 hour, preferably overnight in the refrigerator.Heat oil in a pan over medium heat, add sliced onions and green chilies, and sauté until onions turn golden brown.Add the marinated meat along with the marinade to the pan. Cook until the meat is tender and the sauce thickens.Pour in the heavy cream, stir well, and simmer for a few more minutes until the sauce reaches the desired consistency.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Mutton Kofte
description: Mutton Kofte features succulent meatballs infused with aromatic spices, served in a flavorful gravy. It's a hearty and comforting dish enjoyed across various regions of India.
ingredients:
For the Koftas:Minced mutton,Onion,Ginger-garlic paste,Green chilies,Garam masala,Coriander powder,Cumin powder,Salt,Oil (for frying)
For the Gravy:Onion,Tomato,Cashew nuts (optional),Yogurt,Turmeric powder,Red chili powder,Garam masala,Salt,Oil,Fresh coriander leaves (for garnish)
instruction: Mix minced mutton with finely chopped onions, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, garam masala, coriander powder, cumin powder, and salt. Shape the mixture into small balls to form the koftas.Heat oil in a pan and fry the koftas until they are golden brown. Set aside.In the same pan, add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add chopped tomatoes and cashew nuts (if using) and cook until tomatoes are soft.Allow the mixture to cool slightly, then blend it into a smooth paste.In another pan, heat oil and add the blended paste. Cook for a few minutes.Add yogurt, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt to the gravy. Stir well and cook for a few more minutes.Add water to achieve the desired consistency and bring the gravy to a gentle simmer.Gently add the fried koftas into the gravy and simmer for a few minutes until the koftas are heated through and the flavors are well combined.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Champaran Mutton Curry
description: Champaran Mutton Curry is a traditional dish hailing from the Champaran region of Bihar, India. This aromatic and flavorful curry is made with tender mutton pieces cooked in a rich and spicy gravy.
ingredients: 500 grams mutton, cut into pieces,2 onions,finely chopped,2 tomatoes,pureed,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,2 green chilies,slit,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,2 teaspoons red chili powder,1 tablespoon coriander powder,1 teaspoon cumin powder,1 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,3 tablespoons oil,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil in a pressure cooker or heavy-bottomed pan. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Add ginger-garlic paste and slit green chilies. Cook until the raw aroma disappears.Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates.Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for a couple of minutes.Add mutton pieces to the masala and mix until well coated.Pour in enough water to cover the mutton pieces. Close the pressure cooker lid and cook until the mutton is tender (about 4-5 whistles).Once the pressure releases, open the lid and check the consistency of the curry. If it's too thin, simmer until desired thickness is achieved.Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.Serve hot with rice or roti.

name: Nihari Mutton
description: Nihari Mutton is a traditional Pakistani and Indian slow-cooked stew, known for its rich and flavorful gravy. It is typically made with tender pieces of mutton or beef, slow-cooked with spices until the meat is incredibly tender and flavorful.
ingredients: 500g mutton pieces,2 onions, finely sliced,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,2 tablespoons Nihari masala (readily available spice mix),4 cups water,Salt to taste,1 tablespoon oil or ghee,Chopped fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil or ghee in a large pot. Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until fragrant.Add mutton pieces and brown them on all sides.Sprinkle Nihari masala over the mutton and mix well.Pour in water, add salt, and bring to a boil.Once boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for 2-3 hours or until the mutton is tender and the gravy has thickened.Adjust seasoning if necessary.Garnish with chopped coriander leaves before serving.

name: Crab Meat Masala
description: Crab Meat Masala is a tantalizing seafood dish infused with aromatic Indian spices, offering a burst of flavors and textures. Succulent crab meat is cooked in a rich masala gravy, making it a delightful addition to any dining experience.
ingredients: 500g crab meat, cleaned and washed,2 onions, finely chopped,3 tomatoes,pureed,2 green chilies,slit lengthwise,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 tablespoon coriander powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,2 tablespoons oil
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Stir in ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Cook for a minute until the raw smell disappears.Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates from the masala.Mix in turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook the masala for a couple of minutes.Add cleaned crab meat to the masala and mix well. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.Serve hot with steamed rice or Indian bread of your choice.

name: Assamese Fish Curry
description: Assamese Fish Curry, also known as "Maasor Tenga," is a traditional dish from the northeastern state of Assam in India. This tangy and spicy curry is usually made with freshwater fish like Rohu or Catla, and it's flavored with a variety of aromatic spices and ingredients.
ingredients: 500g freshwater fish (Rohu or Catla), cut into pieces,2 medium-sized tomatoes, chopped,2-3 green chilies,slit,1 tablespoon mustard oil,1 teaspoon mustard seeds,1 teaspoon fenugreek seeds,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,Salt to taste,Water as needed,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat mustard oil in a pan or kadhai over medium heat.Add mustard seeds and fenugreek seeds. Let them splutter.Add chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until tomatoes are soft and mushy.Add turmeric powder and salt. Mix well.Add water to make a gravy consistency and bring it to a boil.Add fish pieces to the boiling gravy. Cover and cook for about 10-12 minutes or until fish is cooked through.Once the fish is cooked, garnish with fresh coriander leaves.Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Parsi Fish Curry
description: Parsi Fish Curry is a traditional dish from the Parsi community of India, known for its rich and tangy flavors. This aromatic curry is typically made with fish cooked in a spicy and tangy tomato-based gravy, infused with a blend of Indian spices.
ingredients: 500g fish fillets (such as cod, tilapia, or halibut), cut into chunks,2 tablespoons vegetable oil,1 large onion, finely chopped2-3 cloves garlic,minced,1-inch piece of ginger, grated,2 green chilies,slit lengthwise,2 tomatoes,finely chopped,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 tablespoon coriander powder,1 teaspoon cumin powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,1 cup coconut milk,Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent.Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Sauté for another couple of minutes until aromatic.Stir in chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and break down to form a thick paste.Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well and cook for a minute to allow the spices to bloom.Pour in coconut milk and bring the curry to a gentle simmer.Carefully add the fish chunks into the simmering curry, making sure they are submerged in the sauce. Cover and cook for about 8-10 minutes or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves.Serve hot with steamed rice or crusty bread.

name: Tandoori Lamb Chops
description: Tandoori Lamb Chops are a flavorful Indian dish featuring succulent lamb chops marinated in a blend of yogurt and spices, then grilled or roasted to perfection. They are known for their vibrant color and bold taste, making them a favorite among enthusiasts of Indian cuisine.
ingredients: 8 lamb chops,1 cup plain yogurt,2 tablespoons tandoori masala spice blend,1 tablespoon ginger paste,1 tablespoon garlic paste,1 tablespoon lemon juice,Salt to taste,Fresh cilantro leaves (for garnish),Lemon wedges (for serving)
instruction: In a large bowl, mix together yogurt, tandoori masala, ginger paste, garlic paste, lemon juice, and salt to create the marinade.Add lamb chops to the marinade, ensuring they are evenly coated. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, preferably overnight, to allow the flavors to meld.Preheat grill or oven to medium-high heat.Remove lamb chops from the marinade, shaking off excess marinade.Grill or roast lamb chops for about 4-5 minutes on each side, or until desired doneness is achieved. Cooking time may vary based on thickness of chops and preferred level of doneness.Once cooked, remove from heat and let rest for a few minutes.Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves and serve hot with lemon wedges on the side.

name: Malabar Fish Biryani
description: Malabar Fish Biryani is a traditional Indian dish originating from the Malabar region of Kerala. It's a flavorful and aromatic biryani featuring fish as the main protein, cooked with fragrant spices and long-grain rice.
ingredients: 500g fish (preferably firm-fleshed fish like kingfish or tilapia), cut into pieces,2 cups basmati rice, soaked for 30 minutes1 cup thick yogurt,2 onions, thinly sliced,3 tomatoes,chopped,2 green chilies,slit lengthwise,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 tablespoon red chili powder,1 tablespoon biryani masala powder,1/4 cup chopped coriander leaves,1/4 cup chopped mint leaves,1/4 cup fried onions (optional),1/4 cup ghee (clarified butter),Salt to taste
instruction: Marinate the fish pieces with yogurt, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes.Heat ghee in a large pot. Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.Add ginger-garlic paste and slit green chilies. Sauté for a few minutes until the raw smell disappears.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy.Now, add the marinated fish pieces along with the marinade. Cook for 5-7 minutes on medium heat until the fish is partially cooked.In a separate pot, bring water to a boil. Add soaked rice, salt, and cook until the rice is 70-80% done. Drain and keep aside.Layer the partially cooked fish masala at the bottom of the pot. Top it with a layer of cooked rice.Sprinkle chopped coriander leaves, mint leaves, and fried onions (if using) over the rice layer.Repeat the layers until all the fish masala and rice are used up, ending with a layer of rice on top.Cover the pot tightly with a lid and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes until the biryani is fully cooked andaromatic.Once done, gently fluff up the biryani with a fork. Serve hot with raita or salad.

name: Chicken wing
description: Chicken wings are a popular appetizer or snack loved for their crispy skin and juicy meat. They can be prepared in various ways, from simple seasoning to complex sauces, making them versatile and delicious.
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken wings,Salt and pepper to taste,1 tablespoon olive oil,Optional: your choice of seasoning or sauce (e.g., barbecue, buffalo, garlic parmesan)
instruction: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C),Pat dry the chicken wings with paper towels to remove excess moisture.Season the wings with salt, pepper, and any other desired seasonings.Drizzle olive oil over the wings and toss to coat evenly.Place the wings on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil, ensuring they are not overcrowded.Bake in the preheated oven for 40-45 minutes, flipping halfway through, until the wings are golden brown and crispy.If using sauce, toss the baked wings in the sauce until evenly coated.Serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce and enjoy!

name: Baked Chicken Seekh
description: Baked Chicken Seekh is a flavorful dish originating from South Asian cuisine, particularly popular in India and Pakistan. It's made by marinating ground chicken with a blend of spices, shaping them into sausage-like kebabs, and baking them until cooked through.
ingredients: 500g ground chicken,1 onion, finely chopped,2 green chilies,finely chopped,2 tablespoons chopped cilantro,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon cumin powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons breadcrumbs,Cooking spray or oil for greasing
instruction: Preheat your oven to 200°C (400°F) and grease a baking tray lightly.In a large mixing bowl, combine ground chicken, chopped onion, green chilies, cilantro, ginger-garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, red chili powder, salt, and breadcrumbs. Mix well until all ingredients are evenly incorporated.Take small portions of the mixture and shape them into long, sausage-like kebabs, pressing them firmly onto skewers if desired.Place the kebabs on the greased baking tray and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and lightly browned on the outside.Once cooked, remove from the oven and serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce or alongside rice and salad.

name: Chicken Shami Kebab
description: Chicken Shami Kebab is a succulent and flavorful appetizer or side dish made from finely minced chicken, lentils, and a mix of aromatic spices. It's often served with mint chutney or yogurt sauce and makes for a delightful addition to any meal or gathering.
ingredients: 500g minced chicken,1 cup yellow lentils (chana dal), soaked for 1 hour,1 onion, finely chopped,2 green chilies,finely chopped,2 cloves garlic,minced,1-inch piece of ginger, grated,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon garam masala,1 teaspoon cumin powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,Salt to taste,Oil for shallow frying,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,Lemon wedges for serving
instruction: Drain the soaked lentils and boil them in water until soft. Drain any excess water and let them cool.In a mixing bowl, combine minced chicken, boiled lentils, chopped onion, green chilies, minced garlic, grated ginger, turmeric powder, garam masala, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix well to combine.Using your hands, shape the mixture into small patties or kebabs.Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Once hot, shallow fry the kebabs in batches until golden brown and cooked through, about 4-5 minutes per side.Once cooked, remove the kebabs from the skillet and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to absorb excess oil.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with mint chutney or yogurt sauce and lemon wedges on the side.

name: Crab Masala Curry
description: Crab Masala Curry is a delightful Indian seafood dish packed with flavors of aromatic spices and tender crab meat. This recipe combines the richness of coconut milk with a blend of traditional Indian spices to create a luscious curry that pairs perfectly with rice or bread.
ingredients: 500g fresh crab, cleaned and cracked,1 onion, finely chopped,2 tomatoes,diced,3 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger,grated,1 green chili,finely chopped,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,1 cup coconut milk,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,2 tablespoons oil
instruction: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chili. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add diced tomatoes and cook until they soften and oil begins to separate.Mix in coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another 2 minutes.Pour in coconut milk and bring the curry to a gentle simmer.Add cleaned and cracked crab pieces to the curry. Season with salt according to taste.Cover and cook for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the crab is cooked through and the flavors are well combined.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Crab Rasam (Spicy Crab Soup)
description: Crab Rasam is a traditional South Indian soup known for its spicy and tangy flavors. This dish combines the richness of crab meat with a blend of aromatic spices and tamarind, creating a comforting and flavorful soup that is perfect for chilly evenings or as a starter for a meal.
ingredients: 250g crab meat, cleaned and washed,1 small onion, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, chopped,2 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger, grated,1 green chili,slit lengthwise,1 teaspoon mustard seeds,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon black pepper powder,1/4 teaspoon asafoetida (hing),Small handful of fresh coriander leaves, chopped,Small lemon-sized ball of tamarind, soaked in water,Salt to taste,2 cups water,1 tablespoon oil
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter.Add cumin seeds and asafoetida. Saute for a few seconds until fragrant.Add chopped onions, minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chili. Cook until onions turn translucent.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy.Squeeze the soaked tamarind to extract its pulp. Strain and add the tamarind pulp to the pan.Add turmeric powder, black pepper powder, and salt. Mix well.Pour in 2 cups of water and bring the mixture to a boil.Once boiling, add the cleaned crab meat to the pan. Reduce heat and let it simmer for 10-15 minutes or until the crab is cooked through.Adjust the consistency of the rasam by adding more water if needed.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving hot.

name: Crab Biriyani
description: Crab Biryani is a sumptuous and aromatic Indian rice dish made with succulent crab meat, fragrant spices, and long-grain basmati rice. This flavorful biryani is a perfect fusion of seafood and traditional biryani spices, creating a mouthwatering delicacy that will tantalize your taste buds.
ingredients: 500g crab, cleaned and cracked,2 cups basmati rice, soaked for 30 minutes,1 onion,thinly sliced,2 tomatoes, diced,3 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger, grated,2 green chilies, slit lengthwise,1/2 cup yogurt,1/4 cup mint leaves,chopped,1/4 cup coriander leaves,chopped,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,1/4 teaspoon saffron strands (optional),Salt to taste,2 tablespoons ghee (clarified butter),2 tablespoons oil,Fried onions for garnish
instruction: Heat ghee and oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add thinly sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Remove half of the fried onions and set aside for garnish.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add diced tomatoes and cook until they soften and oil begins to separate.Mix in coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another 2 minutes.Add cleaned and cracked crab pieces to the masala. Stir well to coat the crab evenly with the spices.In a separate bowl, whisk yogurt until smooth. Add it to the crab masala along with chopped mint leaves and coriander leaves. Mix well.Drain soaked basmati rice and add it to the pot. Gently mix the rice with the crab masala.Add enough water to cover the rice by about an inch. Season with salt according to taste.Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes until the rice is cooked and the crab is tender.If using saffron, dissolve it in a tablespoon of warm milk and drizzle over the cooked biryani.Garnish the Crab Biryani with fried onions before serving.

name: Chicken Stew
description: Chicken Stew is a traditional dish from the southern Indian state of Kerala, known for its delicate flavors and creamy texture. This stew is made with tender chicken pieces cooked in a coconut milk-based broth, infused with spices and aromatics. It's a comforting and aromatic dish often served with appam (rice pancakes) or steamed rice.
ingredients: 500g chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces,1 onion, thinly sliced,2 potatoes,peeled and cubed,2 carrots,peeled and sliced,1 cup green peas,1-inch piece ginger, thinly sliced,3-4 green chilies, slit,3-4 cloves garlic,minced,1 cinnamon stick,3-4 cloves,2-3 cardamom pods,1 cup thick coconut milk,1 cup thin coconut milk,2 tablespoons coconut oil,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add cinnamon stick, cloves, and cardamom pods. Sauté for a minute until fragrant.Add thinly sliced onions and sauté until translucent.Stir in minced garlic, thinly sliced ginger, and slit green chilies. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.Add chicken pieces to the pot and sauté until they are lightly browned on all sides.Pour in thin coconut milk and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer. Cover and cook for 10-15 minutes until the chicken is partially cooked.Add cubed potatoes, sliced carrots, and green peas to the pot. Season with salt according to taste. Cook until the vegetables are tender.Pour in thick coconut milk and simmer for another 5-7 minutes until the flavors are well combined and the chicken is cooked through.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Mutton Galouti Keba
description: Mutton Galouti Kebab is a popular Indian appetizer known for its melt-in-your-mouth texture and aromatic spices. Originating from the city of Nawabs, Lucknow, these kebabs are made with finely ground mutton or lamb, infused with a blend of exotic spices, and cooked to perfection on a griddle.
ingredients: 500g minced mutton/lamb,2 tablespoons raw papaya paste (acts as a meat tenderizer),2 tablespoons fried onions (birista),1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon garam masala,1 teaspoon roasted gram flour (besan),1 teaspoon ground nutmeg,1 teaspoon ground mace (javitri),1 teaspoon ground green cardamom,1 teaspoon ground cinnamon,1 teaspoon ground cloves,1 tablespoon fresh coriander leaves, finely chopped,1 tablespoon fresh mint leaves, finely chopped,2 tablespoons clarified butter (ghee),Salt to taste,Saffron soaked in milk (optional, for garnish),Silver leaf (varak) for decoration (optional)
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine minced mutton/lamb with raw papaya paste, fried onions, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, roasted gram flour, ground nutmeg, ground mace, ground green cardamom, ground cinnamon, ground cloves, fresh coriander leaves, and fresh mint leaves. Mix well to ensure even distribution of spices.Cover the mixture and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours, allowing the flavors to meld.After marination, divide the mixture into equal-sized portions and shape them into flat round patties.Heat a non-stick pan or griddle over medium heat. Brush the surface with clarified butter (ghee).Place the kebabs on the griddle and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side or until golden brown and cooked through.Once cooked, transfer the kebabs to a serving platter.Garnish with saffron soaked in milk and silver leaf (varak), if desired.Serve hot with mint chutney, onion rings, and lemon wedges.

name: Chicken Malai Kebab
description: Chicken Malai Kebab is a succulent and creamy dish that originates from the Indian subcontinent. It features tender pieces of chicken marinated in a rich blend of cream, yogurt, and spices, then grilled or cooked in a tandoor oven to perfection. These kebabs are popular as appetizers or as part of a main course in Indian cuisine.
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken breast, cut into cubes,1/2 cup fresh cream (malai),1/4 cup yogurt,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1 tablespoon lemon juice,1 teaspoon garam masala,1 teaspoon ground coriander,1 teaspoon ground cumin,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons oil,Skewers (if grilling)
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine fresh cream, yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, garam masala, ground coriander, ground cumin, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well to form a smooth marinade.Add the chicken cubes to the marinade and coat them evenly. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, allowing the chicken to marinate and absorb the flavors.Preheat your grill or oven to medium-high heat.If grilling, thread the marinated chicken pieces onto skewers.Brush the grill grates or baking tray with oil to prevent sticking.Place the chicken skewers or pieces on the grill or baking tray and cook for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and has a golden brown char on the outside.If cooking in a tandoor oven, place the marinated chicken directly on the skewers and cook until done.Once cooked, remove the chicken from the heat and serve hot with mint chutney or your favorite dipping sauce.

name: Murgh Malai Kebab Recipe
description: Murgh Malai Kebab is a popular Indian appetizer known for its creamy texture and rich flavor. These succulent chicken kebabs are marinated in a mixture of cream, yogurt, and aromatic spices, resulting in a dish that melts in your mouth.
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces,1/2 cup fresh cream,1/4 cup hung curd (strained yogurt),2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1 tablespoon lemon juice,1 teaspoon garam masala,1 teaspoon ground black pepper,1/2 teaspoon ground cardamom,1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg,Salt to taste,Skewers, soaked in water (if using wooden skewers),Cooking oil or ghee, for grilling
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine fresh cream, hung curd, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, garam masala, black pepper, cardamom, nutmeg, and salt. Mix well to form a smooth marinade.Add the chicken pieces to the marinade, ensuring they are well coated. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, allowing the flavors to infuse.Preheat your grill or oven to medium-high heat.Thread the marinated chicken pieces onto skewers, leaving a little space between each piece.Brush the grill with oil or ghee to prevent sticking. Place the skewers on the grill and cook for 8-10 minutes on each side, or until the chicken is cooked through and has charred edges.Once cooked, remove the skewers from the grill and transfer the Murgh Malai Kebabs to a serving platter.Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with mint chutney or lemon wedges.

name: Chicken Sweet Corn Soup
description: Chicken Sweet Corn Soup is a comforting and flavorful dish, perfect for chilly evenings or as a starter to a meal. This Chinese-inspired soup combines tender chicken with sweet corn in a savory broth, creating a delightful balance of flavors and textures.
ingredients: 2 cups chicken broth,1 cup cooked chicken, shredded or diced,1 cup sweet corn kernels (fresh, canned, or frozen),2 eggs,beaten,2 tablespoons cornstarch,1 tablespoon soy sauce,1 teaspoon ginger,grated,1 teaspoon garlic,minced,Salt and pepper to taste,Chopped green onions for garnish
instruction: In a saucepan, bring the chicken broth to a simmer over medium heat.Add shredded or diced chicken and sweet corn kernels to the broth. Stir well.In a small bowl, mix cornstarch with a few tablespoons of water to form a slurry. Gradually pour the cornstarch slurry into the soup, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.Add soy sauce, grated ginger, and minced garlic to the soup. Season with salt and pepper according to taste.Slowly pour beaten eggs into the simmering soup while stirring gently with a fork or chopsticks to create egg ribbons.Cook the soup for another 2-3 minutes until the chicken is heated through and the soup has slightly thickened.Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary.Serve hot, garnished with chopped green onions.

name: Seafood Soup
description: Seafood soup is a comforting and flavorful dish that brings together the delicious taste of various seafood with aromatic herbs and spices. This hearty soup is perfect for any occasion and is sure to satisfy your cravings for a warm and nourishing meal.
ingredients: Assorted seafood (such as shrimp, fish fillets, mussels, and squid), cleaned and chopped,1 onion, finely chopped,2 cloves garlic, minced,1 carrot, diced,1 celery stalk, diced,1 potato,diced,4 cups fish or seafood stock,1 can diced tomatoes,1 teaspoon dried thyme,1 teaspoon dried oregano,Salt and pepper to taste,Fresh parsley for garnish,Olive oil for cooking
instruction: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add chopped onions and minced garlic, sauté until softened and fragrant.Add diced carrots, celery, and potatoes to the pot. Cook for a few minutes until slightly tender.Pour in fish or seafood stock and bring to a gentle simmer.Add diced tomatoes, dried thyme, and dried oregano to the pot. Season with salt and pepper according to taste.Allow the soup to simmer for about 15-20 minutes, until the vegetables are cooked through and flavors are well combined.Add assorted seafood to the soup. Cook for an additional 5-7 minutes, or until the seafood is cooked through and tender.Adjust seasoning if needed.Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley.

name: Gosht Shorba
description: Gosht Shorba is a flavorful and aromatic Indian lamb soup that is perfect for cold evenings or as a comforting appetizer. This soup is rich in spices and slow-cooked to tenderize the lamb while infusing the broth with deep flavors.
ingredients: 500g lamb meat, cubed,1 onion, finely chopped,tomatoes, diced,3 cloves garlic,minced,1-inch ginger,grated,1 green chili,finely chopped,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,2 tablespoons oil,Water,Lemon wedges for serving
instruction: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chili. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add diced tomatoes and cook until they soften and oil begins to separate.Mix in coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another 2 minutes.Add cubed lamb pieces to the pot. Season with salt according to taste.Pour enough water to cover the lamb and bring the soup to a boil.Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for 1-2 hours until the lamb is tender and the flavors are well melded.Adjust the seasoning if needed and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.Serve hot with lemon wedges on the side.Nutritional Information (per serving):

name: Thai Prawns Hot and Sour Soup
description: Thai Prawns Hot and Sour Soup is a tantalizing dish that combines the flavors of lemongrass, lime, chili, and fish sauce to create a deliciously tangy and spicy broth. Loaded with succulent prawns and fresh vegetables, this soup is a perfect balance of heat and acidity, making it a comforting yet refreshing meal.
ingredients: 300g prawns, peeled and deveined,4 cups chicken or vegetable broth,2 stalks lemongrass, bruised and chopped,3 kaffir lime leaves,2 cloves garlic, minced,1 thumb-sized piece of ginger, sliced,2 red chilies, sliced (adjust according to spice preference),1 tablespoon fish sauce,2 tablespoons lime juice,1 tablespoon palm sugar or brown sugar,1 small onion, sliced,1 tomato, diced,1 cup sliced mushrooms (shiitake or button mushrooms),Handful of cilantro leaves for garnish,Salt to taste
instruction: In a large pot, bring the chicken or vegetable broth to a simmer over medium heat.Add lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, garlic, ginger, and red chilies to the pot. Simmer for 5-7 minutes to allow the flavors to infuse into the broth.Stir in fish sauce, lime juice, and palm sugar. Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary.Add sliced onions, diced tomatoes, and sliced mushrooms to the pot. Cook for another 5 minutes until the vegetables are tender.Gently add the prawns to the soup and cook until they turn pink and opaque, approximately 3-5 minutes.Once the prawns are cooked, remove the soup from heat.Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.Serve hot with steamed rice or enjoy as a standalone soup.

name: Marag (Mutton Soup)
description: Marag is a flavorful and aromatic mutton soup popular in South Indian cuisine. This hearty soup is infused with spices and herbs, making it a comforting dish enjoyed during special occasions or as a warming meal.
ingredients: 500g mutton, cut into small pieces,1 onion, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, diced,3 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger, grated,1 green chili,finely chopped,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,2 tablespoons oil,Water
instruction: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chili. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add diced tomatoes and cook until they soften and oil begins to separate.Mix in coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another 2 minutes.Add mutton pieces to the pot and season with salt. Cook until the mutton is browned on all sides.Pour in enough water to cover the mutton pieces. Bring the soup to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 1-1.5 hours, or until the mutton is tender.Adjust the seasoning if necessary and garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Goat Curry Recipe
description: Goat Curry, a popular dish in many regions across the world, especially in South Asia, is a flavorful and aromatic curry made with tender goat meat cooked in a rich blend of spices. This dish is known for its deep, complex flavors and tender meat that melts in your mouth.
ingredients: 1 kg goat meat, cut into pieces,2 onions, finely chopped,3 tomatoes,diced,4 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger,grated,2 green chilies,slit,2 tablespoons vegetable oil,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,2 teaspoons coriander powder,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,Water,as needed
instruction: Heat oil in a large pot or pressure cooker over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add diced tomatoes and cook until they soften and oil begins to separate.Mix in coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another 2 minutes.Add the goat meat pieces to the pot and season with salt. Stir well to coat the meat with the spice mixture.Pour in enough water to cover the meat and bring the curry to a boil.Once boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 1.5 to 2 hours, or until the meat is tender and cooked through. If using a pressure cooker, cook for about 20-25 minutes after the first whistle.Once the meat is cooked, adjust the seasoning if needed and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.Serve hot with rice, naan, or roti.

name: Shammi kebab
description: Shammi Kebab is a popular Indian appetizer made from minced meat blended with aromatic spices, lentils, and herbs. These kebabs are known for their melt-in-your-mouth texture and flavorful taste. Traditionally served as a snack or starter, they are perfect for parties and gatherings.
ingredients: 250g minced mutton or lamb,1/2 cup split Bengal gram (chana dal), soaked for 2 hours,1 onion,finely chopped,2 green chilies,finely chopped,2 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch piece of ginger, grated,1 teaspoon cumin powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/4 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/4 cup fresh coriander leaves,chopped,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons oil,1 egg,beaten (optional, for binding),Bread crumbs for coating (optional)
instruction: Drain the soaked Bengal gram and boil it in water until soft. Drain any excess water and set aside.In a large mixing bowl, combine minced meat, boiled Bengal gram, chopped onion, green chilies, minced garlic, grated ginger, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, red chili powder, turmeric powder, fresh coriander leaves, and salt. Mix well.Transfer the mixture to a blender or food processor and blend until smooth. You may need to add a little water to facilitate blending, but ensure the mixture remains thick.Shape the mixture into small patties or kebabs.Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Place the kebabs in the pan and cook until golden brown on both sides, flipping them gently to ensure even cooking.If desired, dip each kebab in beaten egg and then coat with bread crumbs for a crispy texture.Serve hot with mint chutney or yogurt dip.

name: Chicken Champ
description: Chicken Champ is a popular Indian dish known for its tender, succulent pieces of chicken marinated in flavorful spices and grilled to perfection. This dish is perfect for gatherings, parties, or simply as a delicious main course for a family dinner.
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken breast, cut into pieces,1 cup yogurt,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1 tablespoon lemon juice,1 teaspoon cumin powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1 teaspoon garam masala,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,Cooking oil for grilling
instruction: In a large bowl, combine yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well to form a smooth marinade.Add chicken pieces to the marinade, ensuring they are well coated. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or preferably overnight, to allow the flavors to infuse.Preheat your grill or barbecue to medium-high heat.Thread the marinated chicken pieces onto skewers, leaving a little space between each piece.Brush the grill with oil to prevent sticking. Place the chicken skewers on the grill and cook for 6-8 minutes on each side, or until the chicken is cooked through and has charred grill marks.Once cooked, remove the chicken champs from the grill and transfer them to a serving platter.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with mint chutney and lemon wedges.

name: Saag Chicken
description: Saag Chicken is a popular North Indian dish that combines tender chicken pieces with a flavorful spinach-based gravy. This nutritious and delicious dish is rich in protein and essential vitamins, making it a wholesome meal option.
ingredients: 500g chicken pieces, preferably boneless and skinless, cut into cubes,500g fresh spinach leaves, washed and chopped,2 onions, finely chopped,3 tomatoes, diced,3 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger, grated,2 green chilies, finely chopped,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons oil or ghee,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil or ghee in a large pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chilies. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add diced tomatoes and cook until they soften and oil begins to separate.Mix in coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another 2 minutes.Add chicken pieces to the pan and cook until they are lightly browned on all sides.Add chopped spinach to the pan and stir well to combine with the chicken and spices.Cover and cook for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and the spinach has wilted down.Adjust seasoning with salt according to taste.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Haleem
description: Haleem is a popular dish in South Asian cuisine, especially during Ramadan. It's a rich and hearty stew made with a blend of meat, lentils, and wheat, cooked with aromatic spices to create a thick and nourishing dish.
ingredients: 1 cup wheat grains,1/2 cup broken wheat (dalia),500g boneless meat (chicken, beef, or mutton), cubed,1 cup yellow lentils (masoor dal),1/2 cup barley,2 onions,thinly sliced,4 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger, grated,2 green chilies, chopped,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 tablespoon red chili powder,1 tablespoon coriander powder,1 tablespoon garam masala,Salt to taste,1/4 cup cooking oil,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,Lemon wedges for serving
instruction: Wash and soak wheat grains, broken wheat, and barley separately in water for at least 2 hours or overnight.In a large pot, combine soaked wheat grains, broken wheat, barley, and yellow lentils. Add enough water to cover the grains and lentils, and cook until they are soft and mushy. You can use a pressure cooker to speed up the process.In a separate pot, heat oil and sauté sliced onions until golden brown. Remove half of the onions and set aside for garnish.To the remaining onions in the pot, add minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Sauté until fragrant.Add cubed meat to the pot and cook until it changes color.Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook for a few minutes until the spices are well combined.Add cooked wheat-lentil mixture to the pot with the meat. Mix everything well.Using a hand blender or potato masher, blend the mixture until smooth and creamy. Add water if necessary to reach the desired consistency.Simmer the haleem on low heat for at least 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it thickens and the flavors meld together.Serve hot, garnished with fried onions and fresh coriander leaves. Serve with lemon wedges on the side.

name: Hyderabadi Dum Ka Murgh
description: Hyderabadi Dum Ka Murgh is a classic dish from the royal kitchens of Hyderabad, known for its rich flavors and aromatic spices. This slow-cooked chicken dish is prepared with marinated chicken pieces, yogurt, and a blend of traditional Indian spices, resulting in a succulent and flavorful dish that is perfect for special occasions or gatherings.
ingredients: 500g chicken, cut into pieces,1 cup yogurt (curd),2 onions,thinly sliced,2 tomatoes, finely chopped,3-4 green chilies, slit,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1 teaspoon garam masala,1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds,1/2 teaspoon black peppercorns,1/2 teaspoon fennel seeds,1/4 teaspoon nutmeg powder,1/4 teaspoon mace powder,1/4 cup chopped coriander leaves,1/4 cup chopped mint leaves,2 tablespoons ghee or oil,Salt to taste
instruction: In a bowl, marinate the chicken pieces with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Let it marinate for at least 1 hour.Heat ghee or oil in a heavy-bottomed pan or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add cumin seeds, black peppercorns, and fennel seeds. Sauté until fragrant.Add thinly sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.Add marinated chicken pieces along with the marinade. Mix well.Cover the pan with a tight-fitting lid and cook on low heat (dum) for about 30-40 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and tender. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.Once the chicken is cooked, add slit green chilies, garam masala, nutmeg powder, and mace powder. Mix well and cook for another 5 minutes.Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and mint leaves before serving.

name: Hyderabadi Biryani
description: Hyderabadi Biryani is a famous Indian rice dish renowned for its aromatic spices and flavors. Originating from the city of Hyderabad, this biryani is known for its unique cooking method where marinated meat is layered with fragrant basmati rice and slow-cooked to perfection, resulting in a mouthwatering dish that's loved by many
ingredients: 500g chicken or mutton, cut into pieces,2 cups basmati rice, soaked for 30 minutes and drained,2 onions, thinly sliced,1/2 cup plain yogurt,2 tomatoes, chopped,3-4 green chilies, slit lengthwise,1/4 cup chopped coriander leaves1/4 cup chopped mint leaves,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,Whole spices (cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, bay leaves),Ghee or oil for cooking,Salt to taste
instruction: Marinate the chicken or mutton with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, chopped coriander leaves, chopped mint leaves, and salt. Allow it to marinate for at least 1 hour.Heat ghee or oil in a large heavy-bottomed pan. Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown. Remove half of the fried onions and set aside for later use.Add the marinated meat to the pan and cook until it's partially cooked and the yogurt has reduced.Layer the partially cooked meat with half of the soaked and drained basmati rice.Sprinkle some fried onions, chopped tomatoes, slit green chilies, and whole spices over the rice layer.Repeat the process with the remaining rice, fried onions, tomatoes, green chilies, and whole spices.Pour some saffron-infused milk or food color mixed with milk over the rice.Cover the pan tightly with a lid and cook on low heat for about 30-40 minutes until the rice and meat are fully cooked and the flavors are infused.Once done, gently fluff the biryani with a fork.Serve hot garnished with fried onions, chopped coriander leaves, and mint leaves.

name: Mutton Dalcha
description: Mutton Dalcha is a flavorful and hearty South Indian dish that combines tender mutton with lentils and a variety of spices. This dish is known for its rich taste and comforting texture, making it a favorite among meat lovers.
ingredients: 500g mutton, cut into pieces,1 cup chana dal (split chickpeas), soaked for 1 hour,2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, diced,3 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger, grated,2 green chilies, slit,1 teaspoon mustard seed,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 tablespoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Handful of fresh coriander leaves, chopped,Salt to taste,3 tablespoons oil
instruction: Heat oil in a pressure cooker or heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Cook for 2-3 minutes until aromatic.Add diced tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy.Drain the soaked chana dal and add it to the pot along with the mutton pieces.Mix in turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook for a few minutes, stirring well to coat the meat and dal with the spices.Pour in enough water to cover the meat and dal mixture. Close the pressure cooker lid and cook for about 5-6 whistles or until the mutton and dal are tender.Once the pressure releases naturally, open the cooker and check the consistency of the dalcha. If it's too thick, add some more water and adjust seasoning if necessary.Sprinkle garam masala and chopped coriander leaves on top. Stir gently to combine.Serve hot with steamed rice or roti.

name: Hyderabadi Dum Pukht
description: Hyderabadi Dum Pukht is a traditional Indian dish renowned for its rich flavors and slow cooking technique. Originating from the royal kitchens of Hyderabad, this dish involves marinating meat with aromatic spices, sealing it in a pot, and slow-cooking it to perfection, resulting in a melt-in-your-mouth experience.
ingredients: 500g bone-in mutton or chicken pieces,2 cups basmati rice, soaked for 30 minutes,2 onions,thinly sliced,1 cup yogurt,4 tablespoons ghee (clarified butter),1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,2 tomatoes, finely chopped,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,Saffron strands soaked in warm milk (optional)
instruction: In a bowl, marinate the mutton or chicken pieces with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, salt, and half of the garam masala. Allow it to marinate for at least 2 hours or overnight in the refrigerator for best results.Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan. Add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Remove half of the fried onions and set aside for garnish.To the remaining onions in the pan, add cumin seeds and sauté until fragrant.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften.Stir in coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and the remaining garam masala. Cook for a couple of minutes.Add the marinated meat along with the marinade to the pan. Cook on medium heat until the meat is partially cooked and the masala thickens.In a separate pot, boil water and cook the soaked rice until it is 70% done. Drain the rice and set aside.In a heavy-bottomed pot, layer the partially cooked meat along with the masala at the bottom.Add a layer of partially cooked rice on top of the meat.Sprinkle the reserved fried onionand fresh coriander leaves over the rice. Optionally, drizzle saffron-infused milk for added aroma and color.Cover the pot tightly with a lid and seal the edges with dough or a clean kitchen towel.Cook on low heat (dum) for about 30-40 minutes until the meat is tender and the rice is fully cooked.Once done, gently fluff the rice with a fork and serve hot.

name: Fried Fish
description: Fried fish is a classic dish enjoyed worldwide, featuring crispy and flavorful fish fillets coated in a seasoned breading or batter. It's a simple yet delicious way to prepare fish that appeals to both seafood lovers and those new to fish dishes.
ingredients: 4 fish fillets (such as tilapia, cod, or catfish),1 cup all-purpose flour,1 teaspoon salt,1/2 teaspoon black pepper,1/2 teaspoon paprika,1/2 teaspoon garlic powder,2 eggs,1/4 cup milk,Vegetable oil for frying,Lemon wedges for serving,Tartar sauce or cocktail sauce for dipping (optional)
instruction: In a shallow dish, combine flour, salt, pepper, paprika, and garlic powder. Mix well to create the breading mixture.In another shallow dish, beat eggs and milk together to create an egg wash.Heat vegetable oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat until it reaches 350°F (180°C).Pat fish fillets dry with paper towels to remove excess moisture.Dip each fish fillet into the seasoned flour mixture, coating both sides evenly.Shake off excess flour, then dip the fillets into the egg wash, allowing any excess to drip off.Carefully place the coated fish fillets into the hot oil, working in batches if necessary to avoid overcrowding the pan.Fry the fish for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy.Once cooked, transfer the fried fish to a plate lined with paper towels to drain any excess oil.Serve hot with lemon wedges and your choice of dipping sauce, such as tartar sauce or cocktail sauce.

name: Mutton Biryani
description: Mutton Biryani is a classic Indian dish made with tender mutton (goat meat) marinated in a blend of spices, layered with fragrant basmati rice, and slow-cooked to perfection. This aromatic and flavorful biryani is a favorite at gatherings and special occasions across India.
ingredients: 500g mutton, cut into pieces,2 cups basmati rice, soaked for 30 minutes,2 onions, thinly sliced,2 tomatoes,chopped,1/2 cup yogurt,3 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1/4 cup chopped mint leaves,1/4 cup chopped coriander leaves,2 green chilies, slit,Whole spices (cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, bay leaves),1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon biryani masala,Salt to taste,Ghee or oil,Saffron strands soaked in warm milk (optional),Fried onions for garnish (optional)
instruction: Marinate the mutton pieces with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, biryani masala, chopped mint leaves, chopped coriander leaves, and salt. Let it marinate for at least 2 hours or overnight in the refrigerator.Heat ghee or oil in a large pot. Add the sliced onions and fry until golden brown. Remove half of the fried onions and set aside for garnish.To the remaining onions in the pot, add the whole spices and cumin seeds. Sauté until aromatic.Add chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until the tomatoes are softened.Add the marinated mutton pieces to the pot. Cook on medium heat until the mutton is partially cooked and the masala is well coated.In a separate pot, bring water to a boil. Add soaked basmati rice and cook until it is 70% done. Drain the rice and set aside.Layer the partially cooked mutton along with masala at the bottom of the pot. Then, layer the partially cooked rice on top.Sprinkle saffron milk over the rice for added aroma and color (optional).Cover the pot withatight-fitting lid and cook on low heat for about 20-25 minutes until the mutton is tender and the rice is fully cooked.Once done, gently mix the layers of rice and mutton. Garnish with fried onions.Serve hot with raita or salad.

name: Mutton Do Pyaza
description: Mutton Do Pyaza is a popular Indian dish known for its rich, aromatic gravy and tender pieces of mutton (goat meat) cooked with onions and spices. The name "Do Pyaza" translates to "double the onions," indicating the generous use of onions in this flavorful preparation.
ingredients: 500g mutton, cut into pieces,4 onions,thinly sliced,2 tomatoes,finely chopped,3 cloves garlic,minced,1-inch ginger,grated,2 green chilies, slit,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,3 tablespoons oil,Water as needed
instruction: Heat oil in a pressure cooker or heavy-bottomed pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add thinly sliced onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and oil begins to separate.Mix in coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another 2 minutes.Add the mutton pieces to the masala and sauté for 5-7 minutes until the meat is well coated and slightly browned.Pour in enough water to cover the mutton pieces. Season with salt according to taste.Close the pressure cooker lid and cook for 4-5 whistles or simmer in a heavy-bottomed pan until the mutton is tender and cooked through, stirring occasionally.Once cooked, garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Mutton Chaap
description: Mutton Chaap is a popular North Indian dish known for its tender and succulent mutton chops marinated in a rich blend of spices and yogurt, then slow-cooked to perfection. It's a flavorful and hearty dish that is often enjoyed as a main course.
ingredients: 500g mutton chops,1 cup yogurt (preferably thick),2 onions,finely chopped,3 tomatoes,pureed,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,2-3 green chilies, slit lengthwise,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,2 tablespoons oil,Water as needed
instruction: In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt to form a marinade.Marinate the mutton chops in the yogurt mixture for at least 2 hours or preferably overnight in the refrigerator.Heat oil in a pressure cooker or a heavy-bottomed pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates from the mixture.Add marinated mutton chops along with the marinade to the cooker or pan. Stir well to coat the chops with the masala.Add slit green chilies and garam masala. Mix well.Pour in water as needed to cover the mutton chops. Adjust salt if required.Close the pressure cooker lid and cook for about 4-5 whistles or until the mutton is tender. If using a pan, cover and cook on low heat until the mutton is cooked through, stirring occasionally.Once done, garnish with fresh coriander leaves.Serve hot with rice, naan, or roti.

name: Mutton Rezala
description: Mutton Rezala is a rich and aromatic Bengali dish characterized by its creamy texture and subtle yet complex flavors. This traditional recipe features tender pieces of mutton cooked in a velvety yogurt-based gravy infused with fragrant spices. It's a dish that exemplifies the delicate balance of flavors in Bengali cuisine.
ingredients: 500g mutton, cut into pieces,1 cup yogurt (curd), beaten,2 onions,finely sliced,4 cloves garlic,minced,1-inch ginger,grated,2 green chilies,slit lengthwise,1/2 cup cashew nuts,soaked in water,1/2 cup fresh cream,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon chili powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,1/2 teaspoon sugar,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons ghee (clarified butter),1/2 teaspoon saffron strands (optional),Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat ghee in a large pan over medium heat. Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Drain the soaked cashew nuts and add them to the pan. Cook for another 2 minutes.Add mutton pieces to the pan and sauté until they are lightly browned on all sides.In a separate bowl, mix together beaten yogurt, turmeric powder, chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, sugar, and salt.Pour the yogurt mixture over the mutton in the pan. Stir well to coat the meat evenly.Cover and cook over low heat for 30-40 minutes or until the mutton is tender, stirring occasionally.Once the mutton is cooked, add fresh cream to the pan and stir gently to combine.If using saffron, soak it in a tablespoon of warm milk and add it to the curry for additional flavor and color.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Kosha Mangsho
description: Kosha Mangsho is a traditional Bengali dish known for its rich, spicy, and deeply flavored mutton curry. Slow-cooked with a blend of aromatic spices, this dish is a celebration of the robust flavors of Bengal cuisine.
ingredients: 500g mutton,cut into pieces,2 onions,finely sliced,2 tomatoes,chopped,3-4 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger,grated,2 green chilies,slit lengthwise,2-3 tablespoons mustard oil,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,2-3 bay leaves,2-3 green cardamom pods,2-3 cloves,1-inch cinnamon stick,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 tablespoon red chili powder,1 tablespoon coriander powder,1 teaspoon garam masala powder,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat mustard oil in a heavy-bottomed pan or pressure cooker over medium heat.Add cumin seeds, bay leaves, green cardamom, cloves, and cinnamon stick. Sauté until aromatic.Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Cook for a couple of minutes until fragrant.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and oil starts separating.Mix in turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.Add mutton pieces to the pan and coat them well with the spice mixture. Cook for 5-6 minutes, stirring occasionally.Pour in water just enough to cover the mutton pieces. Season with salt according to taste.If using a pressure cooker, cover and cook for about 4-5 whistles or until the mutton is tender. If using a regular pan, cover and simmer on low heat until the mutton is cooked through, stirring occasionally. Add more water if necessary.Once the mutton is cooked, sprinkle garam masala powder and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

name: Chingri Malai Curry
description: Chingri Malai Curry, also known as Prawn Malai Curry, is a traditional Bengali seafood dish that is rich, creamy, and bursting with flavors. This exquisite curry combines succulent prawns with a luscious coconut milk gravy, infused with aromatic spices, making it a beloved delicacy in Bengali cuisine.
ingredients: 500g prawns, cleaned and deveined,1 onion, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, diced,3 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger, grated,1 green chili, finely chopped,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1 cup coconut milk,2 tablespoons ghee or oil,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat ghee or oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chili. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add diced tomatoes and cook until they soften and oil begins to separate.Mix in coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder. Cook for another 2 minutes.Pour in coconut milk and bring the curry to a gentle simmer.Add cleaned prawns to the curry. Season with salt according to taste.Cover and cook for 5-7 minutes or until the prawns are cooked through and the flavors are well combined.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Macher Jhol (Bengali Fish Curry)
description: Macher Jhol is a traditional Bengali fish curry known for its aromatic spices and delicate flavors. This comforting dish is popular in Bengali cuisine and is often enjoyed with steamed rice for a satisfying meal
ingredients: 500g fish (such as Rohu, Katla, or Hilsa), cut into pieces,2 potatoes, peeled and diced,2 tomatoes, finely chopped,1 onion, thinly sliced,2 green chilies, slit lengthwise,2 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger, grated,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon cumin powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,Mustard oil for cooking,Water as needed
instruction: Marinate the fish pieces with turmeric powder and salt. Set aside for 15 minutes.Heat mustard oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the marinated fish pieces and fry until golden brown. Remove from the pan and set aside.In the same pan, add more mustard oil if needed. Add sliced onions and sauté until translucent.Add minced garlic and grated ginger. Sauté until aromatic.Stir in chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy.Add turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and red chili powder. Mix well.Add diced potatoes and slit green chilies to the pan. Stir to coat them with the spice mixture.Pour in enough water to cover the potatoes. Bring the curry to a gentle simmer and cook until the potatoes are tender.Once the potatoes are cooked, gently slide in the fried fish pieces.Season with salt according to taste. Simmer for a few more minutes until the flavors meld together.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Fish Amritsari
description: Fish Amritsari is a popular North Indian seafood dish known for its crispy exterior and succulent, flavorful fish. Originating from the city of Amritsar in Punjab, this dish is typically made by marinating fish fillets in a spiced gram flour batter and then deep-frying until golden and crispy.
ingredients: 500g fish fillets (such as cod, tilapia, or halibut), cut into bite-sized pieces,1 cup gram flour (besan),2 tablespoons rice flour,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon carom seeds (ajwain),1 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Vegetable oil for deep frying,Lemon wedges and fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine gram flour, rice flour, ginger-garlic paste, carom seeds, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Add a little water at a time to make a smooth batter with a thick consistency.Add the fish pieces to the batter, ensuring they are evenly coated. Allow the fish to marinate in the batter for at least 30 minutes to an hour in the refrigerator.Heat vegetable oil in a deep frying pan or kadai over medium-high heat.Once the oil is hot, carefully add the marinated fish pieces one by one into the hot oil, making sure not to overcrowd the pan.Fry the fish pieces until they turn golden brown and crispy on all sides, flipping occasionally for even cooking. This usually takes about 5-6 minutes per batch.Once done, remove the fried fish pieces using a slotted spoon and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to absorb any excess oil.Garnish with lemon wedges and fresh coriander leaves before serving hot.

name: Keema (Minced Meat) Paratha
description: Keema Paratha is a popular North Indian dish where spiced minced meat is stuffed into whole wheat dough and cooked on a griddle until golden and crisp. It's a flavorful and hearty meal that can be enjoyed for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.
ingredients: 250g minced meat (beef, lamb, or chicken),2 cups whole wheat flour,1 onion, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, finely chopped,2 green chilies, finely chopped,2 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger, grated,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves, chopped,Oil or ghee for cooking
instruction: In a bowl, mix whole wheat flour with water to make a soft dough. Cover and let it rest for 15-20 minutes.Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chilies. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy.Mix in coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another 2 minutes.Add the minced meat to the masala mixture. Cook until the meat is cooked through and the moisture evaporates. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.Once the keema (minced meat) mixture is cooked, remove from heat and let it cool slightly.Divide the dough into small lemon-sized balls. Roll out each ball into a small disc.Place a spoonful of the keema mixture in the center of the disc. Fold the edges to seal the stuffing inside and gently roll it out into a paratha.Heat a skillet or griddle over medium heat. Cook the paratha on both sides until golden brown, brushing with oil or ghee as needed.Serve hot Keema Paratha with yogurt, pickle, or your favorite chutney.

name: Rista
description: Rista is a traditional dish from Kashmir, India, known for its rich and aromatic flavors. It consists of succulent meatballs cooked in a vibrant red gravy, made with a blend of spices and yogurt. This dish is a hallmark of Kashmiri cuisine, often served on special occasions and festivals.
ingredients: 500g minced mutton (or lamb),2 onions, finely chopped,3 tomatoes, pureed,2 tablespoons yogurt,2 teaspoons ginger-garlic paste,2 teaspoons fennel powder,1 teaspoon Kashmiri red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,3 tablespoons oil or ghee
instruction: In a large bowl, combine minced mutton, ginger-garlic paste, fennel powder, Kashmiri red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well to incorporate all the spices into the meat.Shape the meat mixture into small, round meatballs (about 1 inch in diameter).Heat oil or ghee in a deep pan over medium heat.
