Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent.Add tomato puree to the onions and cook until the oil starts to separate from the mixture.Whisk yogurt until smooth and add it to the pan. Stir well to combine.Gently place the meatballs into the gravy, ensuring they are evenly distributed.Cover the pan and simmer on low heat for about 25-30 minutes, or until the meatballs are cooked through and tender.Once done, garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Bombli Fry
description: Bombil Fry, also known as Bombay Duck Fry, is a popular seafood dish from the coastal regions of India. It features tender and flavorful Bombay Duck fish marinated in spices, coated with semolina (rava) or breadcrumbs, and fried until crispy. This dish is a delightful appetizer or side dish that pairs well with a squeeze of lemon and a side of mint chutney.
ingredients: 500g Bombay Duck (Bombil) fish fillets, cleaned and cut into pieces,2 tablespoons lemon juice,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,Salt to taste,1 cup semolina (rava) or breadcrumbs,Oil for frying,Lemon wedges and mint chutney for serving
instruction: In a bowl, marinate the Bombay Duck fish pieces with lemon juice, red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, and salt. Ensure that the fish is evenly coated with the marinade. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes.Heat oil in a frying pan or skillet over medium heat.Place semolina (rava) or breadcrumbs on a plate. Coat each marinated fish piece with semolina or breadcrumbs, pressing gently to ensure they adhere well.Once the oil is hot, carefully place the coated fish pieces into the pan in a single layer. Do not overcrowd the pan.Fry the fish pieces for 3-4 minutes on each side or until they turn golden brown and crispy.Once fried, remove the fish pieces from the oil using a slotted spoon and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to absorb excess oil.Repeat the frying process with the remaining fish pieces.Serve hot with lemon wedges and mint chutney on the side.

name: Kolhapuri Chicken
description: Kolhapuri Chicken is a spicy and flavorful Indian dish hailing from the Kolhapur region of Maharashtra. It is known for its rich and intense flavors derived from a blend of aromatic spices and chili peppers. This dish is sure to tantalize your taste buds with its fiery and robust taste.
ingredients: 500g chicken, cut into pieces,2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, finely chopped,3-4 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger, grated,2-3 green chilies, slit lengthwise,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander seeds,1 teaspoon fennel seeds,1/2 teaspoon black peppercorns,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 tablespoon red chili powder (adjust according to taste),1 tablespoon Kolhapuri masala powder*,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,2 tablespoons oil
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds, coriander seeds, fennel seeds, and black peppercorns. Sauté until aromatic.Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and pulpy.Mix in turmeric powder, red chili powder, and Kolhapuri masala powder. Cook for another 2 minutes.Add chicken pieces to the masala mixture. Season with salt according to taste.Cover and cook the chicken on low heat until tender and cooked through, stirring occasionally. If needed, add a little water to prevent burning.Once the chicken is cooked and the gravy thickens, garnish with fresh coriander leaves.Serve hot with rice, roti, or naan bread.

name: Kheema Pav
description: Kheema Pav is a popular Indian street food dish made with minced meat (kheema) cooked in aromatic spices, served with soft buttered bread rolls (pav). This flavorful dish is enjoyed as a snack or a hearty meal across India.
ingredients: 500g minced meat (chicken, lamb, or beef),4-5 pav bread rolls,2 onions,finely chopped,2 tomatoes,finely chopped,2 green chilies, finely chopped,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,Butter for toasting pav,Oil for cooking
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Stir in ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2-3 minutes until the raw aroma disappears.Add chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until tomatoes turn soft and oil starts to separate.Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.Add the minced meat to the pan and mix it with the spices. Cook until the meat is browned and cooked through.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Surmai Fry
description: Surmai Fry is a popular Indian seafood dish featuring slices of kingfish marinated in spices and then shallow fried until crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. It is a flavorful and satisfying appetizer or side dish that pairs well with rice, roti, or bread.
ingredients: 500g Surmai (Kingfish), sliced into pieces,2 tablespoons lemon juice,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 tablespoon red chili powder,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons rice flour or semolina (optional, for extra crispiness),Oil for shallow frying,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: In a bowl, combine lemon juice, turmeric powder, red chili powder, ginger-garlic paste, and salt to make a marinade.Pat dry the kingfish slices with a paper towel to remove excess moisture.Rub the marinade all over the fish slices, ensuring they are evenly coated. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator.If using rice flour or semolina, sprinkle it over the marinated fish and coat them evenly.Heat oil in a shallow pan over medium heat for frying.Once the oil is hot, carefully place the marinated fish slices into the pan, ensuring not to overcrowd them.Fry the fish slices for about 3-4 minutes on each side or until they turn golden brown and crispy.Once done, remove the fried fish slices from the pan and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess oil.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Prawn Masala
description: Prawn Masala is a delectable Indian seafood dish where succulent prawns are cooked in a rich and aromatic masala sauce, boasting a perfect blend of spices. This dish is known for its tantalizing flavors and is a favorite among seafood lovers.
ingredients: 500g fresh prawns, peeled and deveined,1 onion,finely chopped,2 tomatoes,diced,3 cloves garlic,minced,1-inch ginger, grated,1 green chili, finely chopped,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,1/4 cup plain yogurt,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,2 tablespoons oil
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chili. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add diced tomatoes and cook until they soften and oil begins to separate.Mix in coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another 2 minutes.Whisk yogurt and gradually add it to the pan, stirring continuously to avoid curdling.Add prawns to the masala sauce. Season with salt according to taste.Cover and cook for 5-7 minutes or until the prawns are cooked through and the sauce thickens.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Fish Koliwada
description: Fish Koliwada is a popular Indian seafood dish that originates from the Koli community in Mumbai. It is known for its crispy and spicy coating, making it a perfect appetizer or snack.
ingredients: 500g fish fillets (such as cod, tilapia, or any firm white fish), cut into bite-sized pieces,1 cup chickpea flour (besan),2 tablespoons rice flour,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,1/2 teaspoon chaat masala,Salt to taste,Oil for deep frying,Lemon wedges and onion rings for garnish
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine chickpea flour, rice flour, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, chaat masala, and salt. Mix well.Gradually add water to the mixture to form a thick batter, ensuring there are no lumps.Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat.Dip each fish piece into the batter, ensuring it is coated evenly.Carefully place the coated fish pieces into the hot oil and fry in batches until golden brown and crispy. Make sure not to overcrowd the pan.Once fried, remove the fish pieces using a slotted spoon and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.Garnish with lemon wedges and onion rings before serving hot.

name: Fish Tawa Fry
description: Fish Tawa Fry is a popular Indian seafood dish where marinated fish fillets are shallow-fried on a tawa (griddle) until golden brown and crispy on the outside, while remaining succulent and flavorful on the inside. This dish is often served as an appetizer or as a side dish with rice or bread.
ingredients: 500g fish fillets (such as tilapia, kingfish, or snapper), cleaned and cut into pieces,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon cumin powder,1 tablespoon lemon juice,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons vegetable oil,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,Lemon wedges for serving
instruction: In a bowl, combine ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, lemon juice, and salt to make a marinade.Rub the marinade all over the fish fillets, ensuring they are evenly coated. Allow them to marinate for at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator.Heat vegetable oil in a tawa or large frying pan over medium heat.Once the oil is hot, carefully place the marinated fish fillets on the tawa.Fry the fish fillets for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.Remove the fish from the tawa and drain excess oil on paper towels.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with lemon wedges on the side.

name: Bangda Fish Fry
description: Bangda Fish Fry is a popular coastal Indian dish, particularly in regions like Goa and Maharashtra. It features mackerel fish marinated in a blend of spices and then fried to perfection, resulting in a crispy exterior with moist and flavorful fish inside.
ingredients: 4 fresh mackerel (bangda) fish,cleaned and gutted,2 tablespoons red chili powder,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 tablespoon coriander powder,1 teaspoon cumin powder,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons lemon juice,4 tablespoons rice flour (or semolina),Oil for frying
instruction: Rinse the mackerel fish under cold water and pat them dry with paper towels.In a bowl, combine red chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, salt, and lemon juice to make a marinade.Rub the marinade onto the fish, ensuring they are evenly coated. Allow the fish to marinate for at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator.Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat.Place rice flour (or semolina) on a plate. Take each marinated fish and coat it with the rice flour (or semolina) evenly on both sides.Carefully place the coated fish into the hot oil and fry until golden brown and crispy on both sides, turning once, about 4-5 minutes per side.Once fried, remove the fish from the oil and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess oil.Serve hot with lemon wedges and your favorite dipping sauce.

name: Prawn Koliwada
description: Prawn Koliwada is a popular Indian seafood appetizer originating from Mumbai. It features succulent prawns marinated in a spicy batter and deep-fried until crispy. This dish is bursting with flavors and makes for a delightful starter or snack.
ingredients: 500g large prawns,cleaned and deveined,1 cup gram flour (besan),2 tablespoons rice flour,1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons lemon juice,Oil for deep frying,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,Lemon wedges for serving
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine gram flour, rice flour, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, salt, and lemon juice to form a thick batter. Add a little water if needed to achieve the right consistency.Add cleaned and deveined prawns to the batter. Ensure that the prawns are well coated with the batter.Heat oil in a deep frying pan or kadhai over medium heat.Once the oil is hot, carefully drop the batter-coated prawns into the oil, a few at a time, ensuring they are not overcrowded.Fry the prawns until they turn golden brown and crispy, about 3-4 minutes per batch.Using a slotted spoon, remove the fried prawns from the oil and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess oil.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with lemon wedges.

name: Prawn Sukka
description: Prawn Sukka is a delectable coastal Indian dish bursting with flavors of coconut, spices, and succulent prawns. It's a dry preparation where the prawns are cooked with a blend of aromatic spices and grated coconut, resulting in a dish that's both spicy and flavorful.
ingredients: 500g prawns,cleaned and deveined,1 onion, finely chopped,2 tomatoes,diced,3 cloves garlic,minced,1-inch ginger,grated,2 green chilies,finely chopped,1 teaspoon mustard seeds,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,1/2 cup grated coconut,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,2 tablespoons oil
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter.Add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chilies. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add diced tomatoes and cook until they soften and oil starts to separate.Mix in coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another 2 minutes.Add cleaned prawns to the pan and stir well to coat them with the spices.Cook for 5-6 minutes until the prawns turn pink and are almost cooked through.Sprinkle grated coconut over the prawns and mix well.Cook for another 2-3 minutes until the coconut is lightly toasted and the prawns are completely cooked.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Prawn Kadai
description: Prawn Kadai is a delicious and aromatic Indian seafood dish cooked with prawns (shrimp) and a blend of spices in a thick, rich gravy. This flavorful dish is typically prepared in a "kadai" or wok, which enhances the taste and texture of the prawns. It's a popular choice among seafood lovers and pairs perfectly with steamed rice or Indian breads.
ingredients: 500g prawns,cleaned and deveined,2 onions,finely chopped,2 tomatoes, finely chopped,3-4 green chilies, slit lengthwise,1 bell pepper (capsicum), thinly sliced,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,1/4 cup fresh coriander leaves,chopped,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons oil,Fresh lemon wedges for garnish
instruction: Heat oil in a kadai or wok over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Stir in ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy.Mix in coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another 2 minutes.Add sliced bell peppers (capsicum) and cook for a few minutes until they soften slightly.Stir in cleaned prawns and season with salt according to taste. Cook for 5-7 minutes until the prawns are cooked through and turn pink.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with lemon wedges.

name: Egg Korma
description: Egg Korma is a rich and creamy Indian dish where hard-boiled eggs are simmered in a luxurious gravy made with aromatic spices, nuts, and yogurt. This dish is perfect for those looking for a flavorful vegetarian option or as a delightful addition to any meal.
ingredients: 6 hard-boiled eggs, peeled and halved,1 onion, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, pureed,2 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger, grated,1/2 cup yogurt, beaten,1/4 cup cashew nuts, soaked and ground into a paste,1/4 cup fresh cream,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,2 tablespoons ghee or oil,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat ghee or oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Stir in minced garlic and grated ginger. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add tomato puree and cook until the oil starts to separate.Mix in coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook for another 2 minutes.Add beaten yogurt and cashew nut paste. Stir well to combine.Gently add the hard-boiled eggs to the gravy, ensuring they are coated well with the sauce.Cover and simmer for 5-7 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.Stir in fresh cream and garam masala. Cook for an additional 2 minutes.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Egg Rogan Josh
description: Egg Rogan Josh is a delectable twist on the classic Indian dish, traditionally made with tender pieces of meat cooked in a rich, aromatic sauce. In this vegetarian version, hard-boiled eggs are simmered in a flavorful gravy infused with spices, creating a dish that is both hearty and satisfying.
ingredients: 6 hard-boiled eggs, peeled,2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, pureed,3 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger, grated,1 green chili, finely chopped,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon Kashmiri red chili powder (for color),1/2 teaspoon garam masala,1/4 cup yogurt,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,2 tablespoons oil
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chili. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add tomato puree and cook until the mixture thickens and oil begins to separate.Mix in coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another 2 minutes.Beat yogurt well and add it to the pan. Stir continuously to prevent curdling.Gently add the hard-boiled eggs to the gravy, ensuring they are well coated with the sauce.Cover and simmer for 5-7 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.Adjust salt according to taste.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Egg Makhani
description: Egg Makhani is a rich and creamy Indian dish where hard-boiled eggs are simmered in a luscious tomato-based gravy infused with aromatic spices. This flavorful dish is a delightful twist on the classic Butter Chicken, perfect for vegetarians or those looking for a unique egg-based dish.
ingredients: 6 hard-boiled eggs, peeled and halved,2 onions, finely chopped,3 tomatoes, pureed,2 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger, grated,1 green chili, finely chopped,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon garam masala,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 cup heavy cream,2 tablespoons butter,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat butter in a large pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chili. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add tomato puree and cook until the oil starts to separate from the masala.Mix in coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another 2 minutes.Pour in heavy cream and stir well to combine.Add the halved hard-boiled eggs to the gravy. Season with salt according to taste.Cover and simmer for 5-7 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Egg Pepper Fry
description: Egg Pepper Fry is a delicious and simple South Indian dish where boiled eggs are coated in a flavorful pepper-based masala. It's a spicy and aromatic dish that can be served as a side dish or as a main course with rice or bread.
ingredients: 4 hard-boiled eggs, peeled and halved,1 onion, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, finely chopped,2-3 green chilies, slit lengthwise,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon black peppercorns, crushed,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds,1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds,A few curry leaves,2 tablespoons oil,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish

name: Fish Molee
description: Fish Molee is a classic Keralan dish known for its delicate balance of flavors. It features fish cooked in a coconut milk-based sauce infused with spices and aromatic herbs, creating a deliciously creamy and mildly spiced curry.
ingredients: 500g fish fillets (such as kingfish, tilapia, or cod), cut into chunks,1 onion,thinly sliced,2 tomatoes,chopped,3-4 green chilies, slit lengthwise,1-inch ginger, julienned,4-5 garlic cloves, minced,1 sprig curry leaves,1 teaspoon mustard seeds,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder (adjust to taste),1 teaspoon coriander powder,1 cup thick coconut milk,1/2 cup thin coconut milk,2 tablespoons coconut oil,Salt to taste,Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat coconut oil in a pan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter.Add sliced onions and sauté until translucent.Stir in minced garlic, julienned ginger, slit green chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté for a couple of minutes until fragrant.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy.Sprinkle turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Mix well and cook for another minute.Pour in thin coconut milk and bring it to a gentle simmer.Add fish chunks to the simmering curry. Cover and cook for about 5-7 minutes or until the fish is cooked through.Once the fish is cooked, pour in thick coconut milk. Gently stir to combine.Season with salt according to taste.Simmer for another 2-3 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves before serving.

name: Kerala Karimeen Fry
description: Kerala Karimeen Fry is a popular seafood dish from the South Indian state of Kerala, known for its unique flavors and spices. This dish features Karimeen, also known as Pearl Spot Fish, marinated in a blend of traditional spices and shallow-fried to perfection, resulting in a crispy and flavorful delicacy.
ingredients: 4 Karimeen (Pearl Spot Fish), cleaned and scored,2 tablespoons red chili powder,1 tablespoon turmeric powder,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,2 tablespoons lemon juice,Salt to taste,Curry leaves for garnish,Oil for frying
instruction: In a bowl, mix red chili powder, turmeric powder, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, and salt to form a smooth marinade.Apply the marinade generously to the cleaned Karimeen, making sure to coat each fish evenly. Allow the fish to marinate for at least 30 minutes to enhance the flavors.Heat oil in a shallow pan over medium heat for shallow frying.Once the oil is hot, carefully place the marinated Karimeen in the pan. Be cautious not to overcrowd the pan; fry in batches if necessary.Fry the fish on each side for about 5-6 minutes or until golden brown and crispy.Once fried, remove the Karimeen from the pan and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess oil.Garnish with fresh curry leaves before serving hot.

name: Aila Curry
description: Aila Curry is a traditional coastal Indian dish, particularly popular in the regions of Kerala and Karnataka. It features Aila fish, also known as Indian Mackerel, cooked in a spicy and tangy coconut-based curry. This flavorful dish is a perfect blend of coastal spices and rich coconut milk, making it a delightful choice for seafood lovers.
ingredients: 500g Aila fish fillets, cleaned and cut into pieces,1 onion, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, diced,3 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger, grated,2 green chilies, slit,1 teaspoon mustard seeds,1 teaspoon fenugreek seeds,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 cup thick coconut milk,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,2 tablespoons oil
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and fenugreek seeds. Let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add diced tomatoes and cook until they soften and the oil begins to separate.Mix in turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Cook for another 2 minutes.Pour in thick coconut milk and bring the curry to a gentle simmer.Add the Aila fish pieces to the curry. Season with salt according to taste.Cover and cook for 8-10 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and the flavors are well combined.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Prawns Kuzhambu
description: Prawns Kuzhambu is a traditional South Indian dish known for its rich and spicy flavors. This tangy and aromatic curry features succulent prawns cooked in a flavorful gravy made with tamarind, coconut, and a blend of spices. It's a delightful dish that pairs perfectly with steamed rice or dosa
ingredients: 500g prawns, cleaned and deveined,1 onion, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, chopped,2 tablespoons tamarind pulp,1/2 cup grated coconut,2-3 garlic cloves,1-inch ginger,2-3 green chilies,1 teaspoon mustard seeds,1 teaspoon fenugreek seeds,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 tablespoon coriander powder,1/2 tablespoon red chili powder,Salt to taste,Fresh curry leaves,2 tablespoons oil
instruction: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and fenugreek seeds. Let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add diced tomatoes and cook until they turn mushy.Mix in turmeric powder and sambar powder. Cook for another 2 minutes.Dilute tamarind paste in 1 cup of water and add it to the pan. Bring the gravy to a gentle simmer.Add cleaned prawns to the gravy. Season with salt according to taste.Cover and cook for 8-10 minutes until the prawns are cooked through and the flavors are well combined.Garnish with fresh curry leaves and coriander leaves before serving.

name: Payyoli Chicken Fry
description: Payyoli Chicken Fry is a popular South Indian dish known for its bold flavors and crispy texture. Originating from the coastal town of Payyoli in Kerala, this recipe features marinated chicken pieces that are deep-fried to perfection, resulting in a mouthwatering dish that's sure to tantalize your taste buds.
ingredients: 500g chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 tablespoon red chili powder,1 tablespoon coriander powder,1 tablespoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Curry leaves for garnish,Oil for frying
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine chicken pieces with ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well to ensure the chicken is evenly coated with the spices. Allow marinating for at least 30 minutes to enhance the flavors.Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium-high heat.Once the oil is hot, carefully add the marinated chicken pieces one by one, ensuring they are not overcrowded in the pan.Fry the chicken pieces in batches, turning occasionally, until they turn golden brown and crispy on all sides. This usually takes about 8-10 minutes per batch.Once fried, remove the chicken pieces from the oil using a slotted spoon and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess oil.Repeat the frying process with the remaining batches of marinated chicken until all pieces are cooked.Garnish the Payyoli Chicken Fry with fresh curry leaves before serving.

name: Squid Fry
description: Squid Fry is a delicious and popular seafood dish known for its crispy texture and flavorful seasoning. This recipe features tender squid rings coated in a spiced batter and fried until golden brown, making it a delightful appetizer or side dish.
ingredients: 500g squid, cleaned and sliced into rings,1 onion, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, diced,3 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger, grated,1 green chili, finely chopped,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon cumin powder,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,2 tablespoons oil,Lemon wedges for serving
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chili. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add diced tomatoes and cook until they soften.Mix in turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and salt. Cook for another 2 minutes.Add cleaned and sliced squid rings to the pan. Stir well to coat the squid with the spices.Cook for about 5-7 minutes until the squid is cooked through and tender. Be careful not to overcook, as squid can become rubbery.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.Serve hot with lemon wedges on the side.

name: Naadan Crab Masala
description: Naadan Crab Masala is a traditional South Indian dish bursting with flavors of aromatic spices and fresh crab meat. This recipe highlights the essence of Kerala cuisine, known for its rich and vibrant flavors. It's a delightful seafood curry that is sure to tantalize your taste buds.
ingredients: 500g fresh crab, cleaned and cracked,1 onion,finely chopped,2 tomatoes,diced3 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger, grated,2 green chilies,slit lengthwise,1 sprig curry leaves,1 teaspoon mustard seeds,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 tablespoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,1 cup coconut milk,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,2 tablespoons coconut oil
instruction: Heat coconut oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, green chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add diced tomatoes and cook until they soften and the oil begins to separate.Mix in turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another 2 minutes.Add cleaned and cracked crab pieces to the masala. Season with salt according to taste.Pour in coconut milk and gently mix everything together.Cover and simmer the curry for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the crab is cooked through and the flavors are well blended.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Beef Dry Fry
description: Beef Dry Fry is a flavorful and aromatic dish from Kerala, India. It's a dry preparation of beef cooked with spices and herbs, making it a perfect appetizer or side dish. This dish is known for its rich and intense flavors that will surely tantalize your taste buds.
ingredients: 500g beef, thinly sliced,2 onions, finely sliced,3 green chilies, slit lengthwise,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,2 teaspoons red chili powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Curry leaves for garnish,2 tablespoons coconut oil
instruction: Heat coconut oil in a pan over medium heat.Add sliced onions and green chilies. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté until the raw smell disappears.Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. Mix well.Add thinly sliced beef to the pan. Mix until the beef is well coated with the spices.Cook the beef on medium-high heat until it's fully cooked and all the moisture evaporates, stirring occasionally.Once the beef is cooked, reduce the heat and continue cooking until it turns slightly brown and crispy.Garnish with curry leaves and serve hot.

name: Thattukada Beef Curry
description: Thattukada Beef Curry is a popular South Indian street food dish, known for its rich flavors and aromatic spices. It is often served at local eateries ("thattukadas") and pairs well with traditional Kerala parotta or rice.
ingredients: 500g beef, cut into bite-sized pieces,2 onions, thinly sliced,2 tomatoes, chopped,3 green chilies,slit lengthwise,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1 sprig curry leaves,1 teaspoon mustard seeds,1 teaspoon fennel seeds,1 cinnamon stick,3-4 cloves,2-3 cardamom pods,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,2 tablespoons coriander powder,1 tablespoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Coconut oil for cooking,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat coconut oil in a large pan or pressure cooker over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and fennel seeds. Let them splutter.Add cinnamon stick, cloves, and cardamom pods. Sauté for a minute until aromatic.Add sliced onions and curry leaves. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.Stir in ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Cook for 2-3 minutes until the raw smell disappears.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy.Add turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well to combine.Add the beef pieces to the masala mixture. Coat the beef pieces evenly with the masala.Pour in enough water to cover the beef pieces. Cover the pan or pressure cooker and cook until the beef is tender. If using a pressure cooker, cook for about 4-5 whistles.Once the beef is cooked, uncover and simmer until the gravy thickens to your desired consistency.

name: Chicken Salna
description: Chicken Salna is a flavorful South Indian curry known for its aromatic spices and rich, savory taste. It's often served as a side dish with dosa, idli, parotta, or rice, making it a versatile and beloved dish in Indian cuisine.
ingredients: 500g chicken pieces, preferably bone-in,2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, diced,3 green chilies,slit lengthwise,2 sprigs curry leaves,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon fennel seeds,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 tablespoon coriander powder,1 tablespoon chili powder,1/2 cup coconut milk,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons oil,Fresh coriander leaves for garnis
instruction: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add fennel seeds and cumin seeds. Let them splutter.Add chopped onions and green chilies. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.Stir in ginger-garlic paste and curry leaves. Cook for 2-3 minutes until the raw smell disappears.Add diced tomatoes and cook until they soften and oil begins to separate.Mix in turmeric powder, coriander powder, and chili powder. Cook for another 2 minutes.Add chicken pieces to the pan. Season with salt according to taste.Cover and cook on medium-low heat for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through.Pour in coconut milk and simmer for another 5 minutes to allow the flavors to blend.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Kori Gassi
description: Kori Gassi is a traditional Mangalorean chicken curry known for its rich and spicy coconut-based gravy. This dish is bursting with flavors from aromatic spices and coconut, creating a delightful culinary experience.
ingredients: 500g chicken, cut into pieces,1 onion,finely chopped,2 tomatoes,diced,3 cloves garlic,minced,1-inch ginger, grated,2 green chilies, slit,1 cup grated coconut,1 teaspoon coriander seeds,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1/2 teaspoon fenugreek seeds,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,2 tablespoons tamarind paste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons oil,Water as needed
instruction: Dry roast coriander seeds, cumin seeds, and fenugreek seeds until fragrant. Grind them along with grated coconut to form a smooth paste. Set aside.Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Cook for 2-3 minutes until aromatic.Add diced tomatoes and cook until they soften.Mix in the ground spice-coconut paste and turmeric powder. Cook for another 5 minutes.Add chicken pieces to the pan and coat them well with the spice mixture.Pour in enough water to cover the chicken. Season with salt according to taste.Cover and cook until the chicken is tender and cooked through, stirring occasionally.Stir in tamarind paste and simmer for another 5 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Kane Rava Fry
description: Kane Rava Fry is a popular coastal Indian seafood dish made with fresh ladyfish coated in a flavorful semolina (rava) crust and shallow-fried until golden and crispy. It's a delicious appetizer or side dish that perfectly showcases the delicate flavor of the fish.
ingredients: 500g fresh ladyfish (kane), cleaned and sliced into pieces,1 cup semolina (rava),2 tablespoons rice flour,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons lemon juice,2 tablespoons oil for shallow frying,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: In a shallow dish, mix together semolina, rice flour, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt.Marinate the cleaned and sliced ladyfish pieces with lemon juice and a pinch of salt. Let it sit for 10-15 minutes.Heat oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat.Coat each marinated fish piece with the semolina mixture, pressing gently to adhere the coating evenly.Place the coated fish pieces in the hot oil and fry until golden brown and crispy on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.Remove the fried fish from the pan and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

name: Bommidayila Pulusu
description: Bommidayila Pulusu is a traditional Andhra fish curry known for its tangy and spicy flavors. This dish features fish cooked in a tamarind-based gravy along with a blend of aromatic spices, creating a mouthwatering culinary experience.
ingredients: 500g fish (preferably any firm-fleshed fish like pomfret, kingfish, or catfish), cleaned and cut into pieces,1 onion, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, diced,2 green chilies, slit,3 tablespoons tamarind pulp,1 teaspoon mustard seeds,1 teaspoon fenugreek seeds,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 tablespoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,A pinch of asafoetida (hing),Curry leaves,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons oil,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil in a deep pan or kadhai over medium heat. Add mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, and cumin seeds. Let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.Stir in diced tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until tomatoes are soft and oil starts separating.Add coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and asafoetida. Mix well and cook for a minute.Pour in tamarind pulp and add curry leaves. Stir to combine.Add fish pieces to the gravy. Season with salt according to taste.Pour enough water to cover the fish pieces. Bring the curry to a gentle boil.Reduce the heat, cover the pan, and simmer for about 10-12 minutes or until the fish is cooked through and the flavors have infused.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Chepala Iguru
description: Chepala Iguru is a traditional Andhra fish curry known for its fiery flavor and rich gravy. This dish is a delightful combination of fresh fish cooked in a blend of aromatic spices and tangy tamarind, creating a tantalizing dish that is sure to satisfy your taste buds.
ingredients: 500g fish (any firm-fleshed variety like kingfish or tilapia), cut into pieces,1 onion, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, chopped,2 green chilies, slit,2 tablespoons tamarind pulp,1 teaspoon mustard seeds,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 tablespoon red chili powder,1 tablespoon coriander powder,1 sprig curry leaves,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons oil,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter.Add cumin seeds and curry leaves, sauté for a few seconds until fragrant.Add chopped onions and green chilies. Sauté until onions turn golden brown.Stir in chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and mushy.Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.Add tamarind pulp and salt to taste. Stir to combine.Gently place fish pieces into the gravy, ensuring they are coated evenly.Cover and simmer for 10-12 minutes or until the fish is cooked through and the flavors are well blended.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Chicken Nizam
description: Chicken Nizam is a royal and flavorsome dish originating from the Nizam region of India. It is characterized by its rich, creamy texture and aromatic spices, making it a favorite among Indian cuisine enthusiasts.
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces,1 onion,finely chopped,2 tomatoes, pureed,3 cloves garlic,minced,1-inch ginger,grated,1 green chili, finely chopped,1/2 cup yogurt,1/4 cup cream,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,2 tablespoons oil
instruction: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chili. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add tomato puree and cook until the oil begins to separate.Mix in coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another 2 minutes.Add chicken pieces and cook until they are lightly browned on all sides.Whisk yogurt until smooth and add it to the pan. Stir well to combine.Cover and cook for 15-20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the gravy thickens.Stir in cream and simmer for another 2-3 minutes.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Maasor Tenga (Tangy Fish Curry)
description: Maasor Tenga is a traditional Assamese dish known for its tangy and refreshing flavors. Made with fish and infused with souring agents like tomatoes and lemon, this curry is a delightful blend of sourness and spices, typical of Assamese cuisine.
ingredients: 500g fish (like Rohu or Catla), cleaned and cut into pieces,2 tomatoes, chopped,1 onion,finely sliced,2-3 green chilies, slit,1-inch ginger, grated,2-3 tablespoons mustard oil,1 teaspoon fenugreek seeds,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,1 lemon,juice extracted
instruction: Heat mustard oil in a pan over medium heat. Add fenugreek seeds and let them splutter.Add sliced onions and sauté until they turn translucent.Stir in grated ginger and slit green chilies. Cook for a minute.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften and release their juices.Sprinkle turmeric powder and salt over the mixture. Stir well.Place fish pieces into the pan, ensuring they are coated with the spice mixture.Pour in water just enough to cover the fish. Bring it to a gentle simmer.Cook the fish until it is tender and cooked through, usually about 10-15 minutes.Once the fish is cooked, squeeze the lemon juice into the curry. Adjust the sourness according to taste.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Til Diya Murgi (Chicken Cooked with Black Sesame)
description: Til Diya Murgi is a flavorful Bengali dish where tender chicken pieces are cooked in a rich gravy made with black sesame seeds. This dish boasts a unique nutty flavor from the sesame seeds and is a delightful addition to any meal.
ingredients: 500g chicken pieces, cleaned and washed,3 tablespoons black sesame seeds,2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, diced,2 tablespoons yogurt,3 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger, grated,2 green chilies, slit,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,2 tablespoons oil
instruction: Dry roast the black sesame seeds in a pan over low heat until they turn golden brown and aromatic. Grind them into a fine powder using a mortar and pestle or a grinder. Set aside.Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn translucent.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chilies. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add diced tomatoes and cook until they soften and oil begins to separate.Mix in turmeric powder, red chili powder, and the ground black sesame powder. Cook for another 2 minutesBeat yogurt and add it to the pan. Stir well to combine.Add chicken pieces to the gravy. Season with salt according to taste.Cover and cook for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and the gravy thickens.Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Chicken Donne Biryani
description: Chicken Donne Biryani is a flavorful and aromatic South Indian dish made with marinated chicken and fragrant spices, cooked with basmati rice in a traditional donne (palm leaf) bowl. This biryani is known for its rich taste and unique presentation, making it a favorite among biryani lovers.
ingredients: 500g chicken, cut into pieces,2 cups basmati rice,1 onion,thinly sliced,2 tomatoes, chopped2 green chilies, slit lengthwise,1/2 cup yogurt,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1/4 cup chopped coriander leaves,1/4 cup chopped mint leaves,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon biryani masala,1 tablespoon lemon juice,Salt to taste,4 tablespoons oil,2 cups water
instruction: Wash the basmati rice and soak it in water for 30 minutes. Drain and set aside.Marinate the chicken pieces with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, biryani masala, lemon juice, chopped coriander leaves, mint leaves, and salt. Let it marinate for at least 1 hour.Heat oil in a large pan. Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.Add chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until tomatoes are soft and oil begins to separate.Add marinated chicken to the pan. Cook on high heat for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.Meanwhile, boil 2 cups of water in a separate pot. Add soaked and drained basmati rice along with some salt. Cook until the rice is 70% cooked. Drain excess water and set aside.In a large heavy-bottomed pot or pressure cooker, layer the partially cooked rice over the chicken masala.Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid. Cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes until the chicken is tender and the rice is fully cooked.Once done, gently mix the chicken and rice together.Serve hot garnished with fried onions, chopped coriander leaves, and mint leaves.

name: Mutton Pulao
description: Mutton Pulao is a fragrant and flavorful rice dish cooked with tender mutton pieces and aromatic spices. This traditional Indian recipe is perfect for special occasions or as a hearty meal for gatherings with family and friends.
ingredients: 500g mutton,cut into pieces,2 cups basmati rice, washed and soaked for 30 minutes,2 onions,thinly sliced,2 tomatoes,chopped,3 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger, grated,2 green chilies, slit,1 cinnamon stick,4 green cardamom pods,4 cloves,1 bay leaf,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,2 tablespoons ghee or oil,4 cups water
instruction: Heat ghee or oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add cumin seeds, cinnamon stick, green cardamom pods, cloves, and bay leaf. Sauté for a minute until aromatic.Add sliced onions and cook until golden brown.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Cook for 2-3 minutes.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften.Mix in coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another 2 minutes.Add mutton pieces to the pot and sauté until they are evenly coated with the spices.Pour in water and season with salt. Bring it to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until the mutton is tender.Once the mutton is cooked, add soaked basmati rice to the pot. Gently mix everything together.Cover and cook for another 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is tender and all the liquid is absorbed.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Chicken Ghee Roast
description: Chicken Ghee Roast is a traditional and flavorful dish originating from the Mangalorean cuisine of coastal Karnataka, India. It is characterized by its rich and aromatic spices combined with the goodness of ghee (clarified butter), resulting in a tantalizing dish that is sure to please your taste buds.
ingredients: 500g chicken, cut into pieces,4 tablespoons ghee (clarified butter),2 onions,finely chopped,3 tomatoes, finely chopped,4-5 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger, grated,2-3 green chilies, slit lengthwise,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,2 tablespoons red chili powder,1 tablespoon coriander powder,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon black peppercorns,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat ghee in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and black peppercorns. Sauté until fragrant.Add chopped onions and cook until they turn golden brown.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Cook for 2-3 minutes.Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Mix well and cook for another 2 minutes.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and mushy.Now, add the chicken pieces to the pan. Season with salt according to taste.Stir well to coat the chicken pieces with the masala (spice mixture). Cover and cook on low heat for about 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is tender and cooked through.Once the chicken is cooked, uncover the pan and increase the heat to medium-high. Cook for another 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the gravy thickens and coats the chicken pieces well.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Mutton Korma
description: Mutton Korma is a classic Indian dish known for its rich, creamy gravy and tender chunks of mutton cooked with a blend of aromatic spices. This indulgent dish is perfect for special occasions or a hearty family meal.
ingredients: 500g mutton, cut into pieces,1 cup yogurt,2 onions,finely sliced,3 tomatoes, pureed,3 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger, grated,2 green chilies,slit,1/2 cup cashew nuts, soaked in water,1/4 cup coconut milk,2 tablespoons ghee or oil,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat ghee or oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add pureed tomatoes and cook until they soften and oil begins to separate.Drain the soaked cashew nuts and grind them into a smooth paste.Add the cashew paste to the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes.Mix in coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another 2 minutes.Add mutton pieces to the pan and coat them well with the spice mixture.Pour in yogurt and coconut milk. Stir to combine.Cover and cook on low heat for 45-50 minutes or until the mutton is tender and the gravy is thickened, stirring occasionally.Adjust seasoning with salt according to taste.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Andhra-style Chicken Curry
description: Andhra-style Chicken Curry is a spicy and flavorful dish originating from the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. This curry is known for its bold flavors, vibrant color, and fiery taste, making it a favorite among spice lovers.
ingredients: 500g chicken pieces, preferably bone-in,2 onions, finely chopped,2 tomatoes, finely chopped,3-4 green chilies, slit lengthwise,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1 tablespoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds,1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds,1/2 teaspoon fenugreek seeds,Curry leaves,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,Salt to taste,Cooking oil
instruction: Heat oil in a pan or kadhai over medium heat. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and fenugreek seeds. Allow them to splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.Stir in ginger-garlic paste and slit green chilies. Cook for 2-3 minutes until the raw smell disappears.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy.Mix in red chili powder, turmeric powder, and coriander powder. Cook for a couple of minutes until the spices are well combined.Add chicken pieces to the pan and mix well with the masala.Season with salt according to taste and add curry leaves for flavor.Cover the pan and let the chicken cook on low heat for about 20-25 minutes or until it is tender and cooked through, stirring occasionally.Once the chicken is cooked, garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Chicken Shawarma
description: Chicken Shawarma is a popular Middle Eastern street food dish featuring tender and flavorful marinated chicken wrapped in a warm pita bread with fresh vegetables and sauce. It's a delicious and satisfying meal enjoyed by many worldwide.
ingredients: 500g boneless, skinless chicken thighs or breasts, thinly sliced,4 cloves garlic,minced2 teaspoons ground cumin,2 teaspoons ground paprika,1 teaspoon ground turmeric,1 teaspoon ground coriander,1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon,1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional, for extra heat),2 tablespoons lemon juice,3 tablespoons olive oil,Salt and black pepper to taste,Pita bread,Sliced tomatoes,Sliced cucumbers,Sliced onions,Tahini sauce or yogurt sauce,Fresh parsley or coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: In a bowl, combine minced garlic, ground cumin, paprika, turmeric, coriander, cinnamon, cayenne pepper (if using), lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and black pepper to make the marinade.Add thinly sliced chicken to the marinade, ensuring each piece is well coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or preferably overnight, to allow the flavors to meld.Preheat a grill pan or skillet over medium-high heat. Once hot, add the marinated chicken slices and cook for 5-6 minutes on each side or until fully cooked and lightly charred.Warm the pita bread either on the grill or in a separate pan.To assemble the shawarma wraps, place a portion of the cooked chicken on a warm pita bread. Top with sliced tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, and drizzle with tahini sauce or yogurt sauce.Garnish with fresh parsley or coriander leaves.Roll up the pita bread tightly, enclosing the filling.Serve hot and enjoy!

name: Malabar Fish Curry (Meen Curry)
description: Malabar Fish Curry, also known as Meen Curry, is a traditional South Indian seafood delicacy originating from the Malabar region of Kerala. This flavorful curry is characterized by its rich and tangy coconut-based gravy infused with aromatic spices, perfect for pairing with rice or bread.
ingredients: 500g fish fillets (such as kingfish, pomfret, or mackerel), cleaned and cut into pieces,1 onion, finely chopped,2 tomatoes,diced,3-4 green chilies, slit lengthwise,1-inch ginger,grated,3-4 cloves garlic,minced,1 sprig curry leaves,1 teaspoon mustard seeds,1 teaspoon fenugreek seeds,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 tablespoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1 cup thick coconut milk,2 cups water,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons coconut oil
instruction: Heat oil in a deep pan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and fenugreek seeds. Allow them to splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, slit green chilies, and curry leaves. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add diced tomatoes and cook until they soften.Mix in turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Cook for another 2 minutes.Squeeze the soaked tamarind to extract its juice and pour it into the pan. Discard the tamarind pulp.Pour in thick coconut milk and bring the curry to a gentle simmer.Season the fish pieces with salt and gently add them to the simmering curry.Cover and cook for 10-12 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and the flavors are well blended.Garnish with fresh curry leaves before serving.

name: Beef Fry (Beef Ularthiyathu)
description: Beef Fry, also known as Beef Ularthiyathu, is a popular South Indian dish known for its rich flavors and tender beef pieces cooked with aromatic spices. It's typically enjoyed as a side dish with rice or roti.
ingredients: 500g beef,thinly sliced,2 onions, thinly sliced,3 tomatoes,chopped,3 cloves garlic,minced,1-inch ginger,grated,2 green chilies,slit,1 sprig curry leaves,1 teaspoon mustard seeds,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 tablespoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons coconut oil,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat coconut oil in a pan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter.Add thinly sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, slit green chilies, and curry leaves. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy.Mix in turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another 2 minutes.Add thinly sliced beef pieces to the pan. Season with salt according to taste.Cook the beef on medium-high heat until it's tender and cooked through, stirring occasionally. This usually takes about 20-25 minutes.Once the beef is cooked and the masala is well coated, remove from heat.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Kerala Style Pork Curry
description: Kerala Style Pork Curry is a traditional South Indian dish known for its rich flavors and aromatic spices. This recipe features succulent pieces of pork cooked in a fragrant gravy infused with coconut milk and a blend of spices, typical of Kerala cuisine.
ingredients: 500g pork,cubed,1 onion, finely chopped,2 tomatoes,diced,3 cloves garlic,minced,1-inch ginger,grated,2 green chilies,slit lengthwise,1 sprig curry leaves,1 teaspoon mustard seeds,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,2 teaspoons coriander powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,1 cup coconut milk,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,2 tablespoons coconut oil
instruction: Heat coconut oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add mustard seeds and let them splutter.Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, slit green chilies, and curry leaves. Cook for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.Add diced tomatoes and cook until they soften and oil begins to separate.Mix in turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another 2 minutes.Add cubed pork pieces to the pan. Season with salt according to taste.Pour in coconut milk and bring the curry to a gentle simmer.Cover and cook for 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the pork is tender and the flavors are well combined.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Kerala Style Prawn Fry (Chemmeen Varuthathu)
description: Kerala Style Prawn Fry, also known as Chemmeen Varuthathu, is a traditional seafood dish from the South Indian state of Kerala. This recipe features succulent prawns marinated in a blend of spices and shallow-fried to perfection, resulting in a flavorful and crispy appetizer or side dish.
ingredients: 500g fresh prawns, cleaned and deveined,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 tablespoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Curry leaves for garnish,Coconut oil for frying
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine the cleaned prawns with ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well, ensuring the prawns are evenly coated with the spices. Marinate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to infuse.Heat coconut oil in a shallow pan over medium heat.Once the oil is hot, add the marinated prawns in batches, making sure not to overcrowd the pan. Fry the prawns until they turn golden brown and crispy on both sides, about 2-3 minutes per side.Using a slotted spoon, remove the fried prawns from the oil and drain excess oil on paper towels.Garnish with fresh curry leaves before serving.

name: Beef Stroganoff
description: Beef Stroganoff is a classic Russian dish made with tender beef strips, onions, mushrooms, and a rich sour cream sauce. This hearty and comforting meal is perfect for a cozy dinner and is often served over egg noodles or rice.
ingredients: 500g beef sirloin or tenderloin,thinly sliced,1 onion,finely chopped,200g mushrooms,sliced,2 cloves garlic,minced,2 tablespoons butter,2 tablespoons olive oil,2 tablespoons all-purpose flour,1 cup beef broth,1 cup sour cream,2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce,Salt and pepper to taste,Fresh parsley,chopped for garnish,Cooked egg noodles or rice,for serving
instruction: Heat olive oil and butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.Add thinly sliced beef strips to the skillet and cook until browned on all sides. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside.In the same skillet, add chopped onions and sliced mushrooms. Cook until the onions are translucent and the mushrooms are golden brown.Stir in minced garlic and cook for another minute.Sprinkle all-purpose flour over the mushroom mixture and stir well to combine. Cook for 2-3 minutes to remove the raw flour taste.Gradually pour in beef broth while stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming.Add Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper to the sauce. Stir well.Return the cooked beef strips to the skillet and simmer for 5-7 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.Reduce the heat to low and stir in sour cream. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, ensuring not to boil the sauce.Adjust seasoning if necessary and remove from heat.Serve Beef Stroganoff hot over cooked egg noodles or rice.Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.

name: Pork Adobo
description: Pork Adobo is a classic Filipino dish known for its savory, tangy, and slightly sweet flavors. It features tender pork pieces marinated and simmered in a blend of soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and spices, resulting in a deliciously rich and hearty dish that pairs perfectly with steamed rice.
ingredients: 1 kg pork belly or shoulder, cut into cubes,1/2 cup soy sauce,1/2 cup vinegar (white or cane vinegar),5 cloves garlic,minced,1 onion,sliced,2 bay leaves,1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns,1 tablespoon brown sugar (optional),1 cup water,Cooking oil,Salt to taste,Chopped green onions or cilantro for garnish (optional)
instruction: In a bowl, combine the pork cubes, soy sauce, vinegar, minced garlic, sliced onion, bay leaves, whole black peppercorns, and brown sugar (if using). Mix well to ensure the pork is evenly coated. Let the pork marinate for at least 30 minutes to 1 hour, or overnight in the refrigerator for best results.Heat a tablespoon of cooking oil in a large pan or pot over medium heat. Once hot, add the marinated pork (reserve the marinade) and cook until browned on all sides.Pour in the marinade and water. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer for about 1 to 1.5 hours or until the pork is tender and the sauce has thickened, stirring occasionally.Adjust the seasoning with salt if needed. If you prefer a sweeter taste, you can add a bit more brown sugar at this point.Once done, remove the bay leaves and transfer the Pork Adobo to a serving dish. Garnish with chopped green onions or cilantro if desired.Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Steak Diane
description: Steak Diane is a classic dish featuring tender steak medallions cooked in a rich and flavorful sauce, typically made with mushrooms, shallots, Dijon mustard, and brandy. This dish is known for its luxurious taste and elegant presentation, making it a favorite among steak lovers.
ingredients: 4 beef tenderloin steaks, about 6 ounces each,Salt and pepper to taste,2 tablespoons olive oil,2 tablespoons unsalted butter,1/4 cup shallots,finely chopped,1 cup mushrooms,sliced,2 cloves garlic,minced,2 tablespoons Dijon mustard,1/4 cup brandy,1/2 cup beef broth,1/4 cup heavy cream,2 tablespoons fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish)
instruction: Season the steaks generously with salt and pepper on both sides.Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the steaks and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side for medium-rare, or longer according to your preference. Remove the steaks from the skillet and set aside.In the same skillet, add 1 tablespoon of butter and sauté the shallots until softened, about 2 minutes.Add the sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook until they release their moisture and start to brown, about 5 minutes.Stir in the minced garlic and cook for another minute.Add the Dijon mustard to the skillet and stir to combine with the mushrooms and shallots.Carefully pour in the brandy and let it simmer for a minute, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the skillet.Stir in the beef broth and let it cook for 2-3 minutes to reduce slightly.Reduce the heat to low and add the remaining tablespoon of butter and heavy cream to the skillet. Stir until the sauce is smooth and creamy.Return the cooked steaks to the skillet and spoon the sauce over them. Let them warm through for a minute.Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.

name: Sattu Paratha with Chicken Curry
description: Sattu Paratha with Chicken Curry is a hearty and flavorful meal popular in North India. Sattu, a roasted gram flour, is stuffed into whole wheat flatbreads and served alongside spicy chicken curry, creating a satisfying and nutritious dish.
ingredients:
For Sattu Paratha:2 cups whole wheat flour,1 cup sattu (roasted gram flour),1 onion, finely chopped,2 green chilies,finely chopped,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon ajwain (carom seeds),1 teaspoon cumin seeds,Salt to taste,Water,as needed,Ghee or oil, for cooking
For Chicken Curry:500g chicken, cut into pieces,2 onions, finely choppe,2 tomatoes, pureed,3 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch ginger, grated,2 green chilies, slit lengthwise,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,2 tablespoons oil
instruction:
For Sattu Paratha:In a mixing bowl, combine whole wheat flour, sattu, chopped onions, green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, ajwain, cumin seeds, and salt.Gradually add water and knead the mixture into a smooth dough. Cover and let it rest for 15-20 minutes.Divide the dough into equal-sized balls. Roll out each ball into a small circle.Place a portion of the sattu mixture in the center of each circle. Bring the edges together and seal the filling.Roll out each filled dough ball into a paratha.Heat a griddle or tawa over medium heat. Cook each paratha with ghee or oil until golden brown spots appear on both sides.
For Chicken Curry:Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.Stir in minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chilies. Cook for 2-3 minutes.Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates.Mix in coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for another 2 minutes.Add chicken pieces and season with salt. Cook until the chicken is tender and cooked through.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Ghugni with Chicken
description: Ghugni with Chicken is a flavorful and hearty dish originating from the Indian subcontinent, particularly popular in the eastern region of India. It consists of tender chicken pieces cooked in a spiced yellow peas curry, resulting in a delicious and satisfying meal.
ingredients: 250g dried yellow peas (ghugni peas), soaked overnight,250g boneless chicken, cut into small pieces,1 onion,finely chopped,2 tomatoes,finely chopped,2 green chilies,chopped,2 cloves garlic,minced,1-inch ginger,grated,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,2 tablespoons oil,Water as needed
instruction: Rinse the soaked yellow peas and cook them until tender. Drain and set aside.In a separate pan, heat oil and sauté the chopped onions until golden brown.Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Sauté until fragrant.Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and mushy.Add turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and red chili powder. Mix well.Add the chicken pieces and cook until they are no longer pink.Add the cooked yellow peas to the chicken mixture. Mix thoroughly.Add salt to taste and simmer for a few minutes until flavors meld.Garnish with chopped cilantro.Serve hot with lemon wedges on the side.

name: chicken 555
description: Chicken 555 is a dish where bite-sized chicken pieces are marinated in a spicy mixture, coated with a crispy batter, and deep-fried until golden brown. It's a delicious and crunchy appetizer perfect for parties or as a starter.
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1 tablespoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 tablespoon garam masala,2 tablespoons lemon juice,Salt to taste,1 cup all-purpose flour,2 tablespoons cornstarch,1 teaspoon baking powder,Oil for frying,Chopped coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt. Mix well to form a smooth marinade.Add chicken pieces to the marinade, ensuring they are well coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour to marinate.In another bowl, mix all-purpose flour, cornstarch, baking powder, and a pinch of salt.Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat.Coat each marinated chicken piece with the flour mixture, shaking off excess flour.Carefully drop the coated chicken pieces into the hot oil and fry until golden brown and crispy, about 5-7 minutes.Once fried, remove the chicken pieces using a slotted spoon and drain excess oil on paper towels.Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce.

name: Mutton Chowmein
description: Mutton Chowmein is a delicious Indo-Chinese dish that combines tender mutton pieces with stir-fried noodles and vegetables, seasoned with aromatic spices and sauces. It's a flavorful and satisfying dish perfect for lunch or dinner.
ingredients: 250 grams mutton, thinly sliced,200 grams chowmein noodles,1 onion, thinly sliced,1 bell pepper (capsicum), thinly sliced,1 carrot, julienned,2-3 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch piece ginger,minced,2 tablespoons soy sauce,1 tablespoon chili sauce,1 tablespoon vinegar,2 tablespoons vegetable oil,Salt and pepper to taste,Chopped spring onions for garnish
instruction: Cook the chowmein noodles according to the package instructions. Drain and set aside.Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add minced garlic and ginger paste, sauté for a minute until fragrant.Add sliced onions and bell peppers to the pan. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until they start to soften.Add the sliced mutton to the pan. Cook until the mutton is browned and cooked through.Season with soy sauce, oyster sauce, chili sauce, and salt. Mix well to coat the ingredients evenly.Add the cooked chowmein noodles to the pan. Toss everything together until the noodles are well coated with the sauce and heated through.Garnish with chopped green onions before serving.

name: Chicken Chowmein
description: Chicken Chow Mein is a flavorful and satisfying dish featuring tender chicken, crisp vegetables, and noodles coated in a delicious sauce. It's a beloved favorite in Chinese cuisine, known for its combination of textures and savory flavors.
ingredients: 200g chicken breast, thinly sliced,200g Chow Mein noodles (or substitute with any other noodles),2 cups mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, carrots, cabbage, and bean sprouts), thinly sliced,2 cloves garlic, minced,2 tablespoons soy sauce,1 tablespoon oyster sauce,1 tablespoon sesame oil,1 tablespoon vegetable oil,Salt and pepper to taste,Optional garnishes: chopped green onions, sesame seeds
instruction: Cook the Chow Mein noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add minced garlic and stir-fry for 30 seconds.Add sliced chicken to the skillet and cook until it's no longer pink and is cooked through.Add the mixed vegetables to the skillet and stir-fry for a few minutes until they're tender yet still crisp.In a small bowl, mix together soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sesame oil.Add the cooked noodles to the skillet along with the sauce mixture. Toss everything together until the noodles are well-coated and heated through.Season with salt and pepper to taste.Serve hot, garnished with chopped green onions and sesame seeds if desired.

name: Fish Chowmein
description: Fish Chow Mein is a delicious and flavorful dish that combines tender fish with stir-fried noodles and vegetables, all tossed in a savory sauce. It's a popular dish in Asian cuisine, loved for its comforting flavors and satisfying textures.
ingredients: 200g boneless fish fillets (such as cod or tilapia), sliced into thin strips,200g chow mein noodles,1 onion, thinly sliced,1 bell pepper, thinly sliced,2 cloves garlic, minced,2 tablespoons soy sauce,1 tablespoon oyster sauce,1 tablespoon sesame oil,1 tablespoon vegetable oil,Salt and pepper to taste,Optional garnishes: sliced green onions, sesame seeds
instruction: Cook the chow mein noodles according to package instructions. Once cooked, drain and set aside.In a wok or large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add minced garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.Add sliced onion and bell pepper to the wok. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until the vegetables are slightly tender.Push the vegetables to one side of the wok and add the fish strips. Cook for 2-3 minutes until the fish is cooked through.Combine the fish with the vegetables in the wok. Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sesame oil. Stir to coat everything evenly.Add the cooked chow mein noodles to the wok. Toss everything together until well combined and heated through.Season with salt and pepper to taste.Serve hot, garnished with sliced green onions and sesame seeds if desired.

name: Chicken Boti Roll
description: Chicken Boti Roll features tender, flavorful pieces of chicken marinated in a blend of spices and yogurt, grilled or cooked on skewers until charred and juicy. The chicken is then wrapped in a warm, soft paratha along with fresh salad ingredients and condiments like mint chutney or spicy sauces.
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken, cut into cubes,2 tablespoons yogurt,1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon cumin powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Parathas (flatbreads),Salad ingredients (sliced onions, tomatoes, cucumbers),Mint chutney or other condiments
instruction: In a bowl, mix together yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, and salt to form a marinade.Add the chicken pieces to the marinade, ensuring they are well coated. Let it marinate for at least 1 hour, preferably longer in the refrigerator.Thread the marinated chicken onto skewers and grill them until cooked through and slightly charred. Alternatively, you can cook them on a stovetop grill or in the oven.Warm up the parathas on a skillet or in the oven.Assemble the rolls by placing a portion of cooked chicken on each paratha along with sliced onions, tomatoes, cucumbers, and mint chutney or desired condiments.Roll up the parathas tightly, securing the fillings inside.

name: Mutton Boti Roll
description: Mutton Boti Roll is a delicious and flavorful dish originating from South Asian cuisine, particularly popular in regions like India and Pakistan. Tender mutton boti (chunks) are marinated in a blend of spices, grilled to perfection, and then wrapped in a soft paratha along with fresh vegetables and sauces, creating a mouthwatering roll that's perfect for any meal.
ingredients: 500g mutton boti (boneless mutton chunks),4-5 tablespoons yogurt,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon garam masala powder,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons lemon juice,4-5 parathas (flatbread),1 onion, thinly sliced,1 tomato,thinly sliced,Fresh coriander leaves,chopped,Mint chutney,Tamarind chutney,Cooking oil
instruction: In a mixing bowl, combine yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala powder, salt, and lemon juice to make the marinade.Add mutton boti pieces to the marinade and coat them well. Let it marinate for at least 2 hours or preferably overnight in the refrigerator.Heat a grill or a grill pan over medium-high heat. Brush with a little oil to prevent sticking.Thread the marinated mutton boti onto skewers and grill for about 15-20 minutes, turning occasionally, until cooked through and slightly charred.While the mutton is grilling, warm the parathas on a skillet or tawa until they are soft and pliable.Once the mutton boti is cooked, remove it from the skewers and set aside.To assemble the rolls, place a paratha on a plate. Arrange some mutton boti pieces in the center of the paratha.Top with sliced onions, tomatoes, chopped coriander leaves, mint chutney, and tamarind chutney according to taste.Roll the paratha tightly around the filling to form a roll.Repeat with the remaining parathas and filling.Serve the mutton boti rolls hot with extra chutneys on the side.

name: Fish Seekh Kabab Roll
description: Fish Seekh Kabab Roll is a delicious and flavorful dish that combines the succulence of seekh kababs with the freshness of fish, all wrapped in a soft roll.
ingredients: 500g boneless fish fillets (such as cod or tilapia), finely chopped,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,1 small onion,finely chopped,2 green chilies,finely chopped,2 tablespoons fresh coriander leaves, chopped,1 teaspoon garam masala,1 teaspoon ground cumin,1 teaspoon ground coriander,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons vegetable oil,Roti or paratha for rolls,Mint chutney and sliced onions for serving
instruction: In a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped fish, ginger-garlic paste, onion, green chilies, coriander leaves, garam masala, ground cumin, ground coriander, and salt. Mix well to combine all the ingredients evenly.Using your hands, shape the mixture into long seekh kababs around skewers.Heat vegetable oil in a grill pan or skillet over medium heat.
