Crack each egg into a small bowl or ramekin, then carefully slide them into the simmering water. Poach the eggs for 3-4 minutes until the whites are set but the yolks are still runny.Remove the toasted bread from the oven and arrange the avocado slices on top of each slice.Divide the cooked chicken evenly among the slices of bread, followed by the halved cherry tomatoes.Using a slotted spoon, carefully remove the poached eggs from the water and place one on top of each bruschetta.Drizzle the remaining olive oil over the bruschetta and season with additional salt and pepper if desired.Garnish with fresh basileaves and serve immediately, while the eggs are still warm.

name: Chicken Carbonara
description: Chicken Carbonara is a comforting yet elegant dish, marrying the richness of eggs and cheese with the savory goodness of chicken and bacon. It's a creamy, indulgent pasta dish that's perfect for a cozy dinner or a special occasion.
ingredients: 8 ounces (225g) spaghetti or fettuccine,2 chicken breasts,diced,4 slices bacon or pancetta,chopped,2 cloves garlic,minced,2 large eggs,1/2 cup (120ml) heavy cream,1 cup (100g) grated Parmesan cheese,Salt and black pepper, to taste,Fresh parsley, chopped (for garnish),Optional: red pepper flakes for a bit of heat
instruction:
Cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup of pasta water before draining.
While pasta is cooking, heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chopped bacon or pancetta and cook until crisp. Remove from skillet and set aside, leaving the rendered fat in the skillet.In the same skillet, add diced chicken and minced garlic. Season with salt and black pepper. Cook until chicken is golden brown and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes. Remove from skillet and set aside.In a mixing bowl, whisk together eggs, heavy cream, and grated Parmesan cheese until well combined.Once the pasta is cooked and drained, return it to the pot. Immediately add the egg mixture to the hot pasta, tossing continuously to coat the pasta evenly. The heat from the pasta will cook the eggs and create a creamy sauce. If the sauce is too thick, gradually add some of the reserved pasta water to thin it out.Add the cooked chicken, bacon (or pancetta), and any accumulated juices back into the pot with the pasta. Toss everything together until well combined and heated through.Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and back pepper if needed.Serve hot, garnished with chopped fresh parsley and optional red pepper flakes for an extra kick.

name: Egg Fried Rice:
description: Egg fried rice is a classic Asian dish known for its simplicity and delicious flavor. It's a staple in many cuisines, offering a perfect balance of protein, carbs, and veggies all in one satisfying dish. This recipe delivers a delightful blend of fluffy rice, savory eggs, and a medley of vegetables, all seasoned to perfection.
ingredients: 2 cups cooked rice (preferably day-old rice),3 eggs,lightly beaten,1 cup mixed vegetables (such as diced carrots, peas, and corn),2 cloves garlic,minced,2 green onions, chopped,2 tablespoons soy sauce,1 tablespoon sesame oil,1 tablespoon vegetable oil,Salt and pepper to taste
instruction: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.Add mixed vegetables to the skillet and stir-fry until they are tender, about 3-4 minutes.Push the vegetables to one side of the skillet and pour the beaten eggs into the empty space.Scramble the eggs until fully cooked, then mix them with the vegetables.Add cooked rice to the skillet, breaking up any clumps with a spatula.Drizzle soy sauce and sesame oil over the rice mixture, then stir to combine evenly.Cook, stirring occasionally, until the rice is heated through, about 5-7 minutes.Season with salt and pepper to taste.Garnish with chopped green onions before serving.

name: Thai Fish Cakes
description: Thai fish cakes, also known as Tod Mun Pla, are a popular Thai appetizer or snack. They're made with minced fish, aromatic herbs, and spices, resulting in a flavorful and slightly spicy dish.
ingredients: 400g (14 oz) white fish fillets (such as cod or haddock), deboned and skinned,2-3 tablespoons Thai red curry paste,2 tablespoons fish sauce,1 tablespoon palm sugar or brown sugar,1 egg,2 kaffir lime leaves, finely chopped (optional),2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro,2 tablespoons chopped green beans,1 tablespoon chopped shallots,1 tablespoon chopped garlic,Vegetable oil, for frying,Sweet chili sauce, for serving,Lime wedges, for serving
instruction:
In a food processor, combine the chopped fish, red curry paste, fish sauce, lime juice, egg, kaffir lime leaves (if using), cilantro, green beans, basil, garlic, ginger, and brown sugar. Pulse until well combined and the mixture forms a smooth paste.
Transfer the mixture to a bowl and stir in the breadcrumbs until evenly incorporated. The mixture should be firm enough to shape into patties. If it's too wet, add more breadcrumbs as needed.Heat vegetable oil in a frying pan over medium heat.While the oil is heating, shape the fish mixture into small patties, about 2 inches in diameter.Once the oil is hot, carefully place the fish cakes in the pan, making sure not to overcrowd them. Fry in batches if necessary.Cook the fish cakes for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and cooked through.Once cooked, remove the fish cakes from the pan and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to drain any excess oil.Serve the Thai fish cakes hot with your favorite dipping sauce, such as sweet chili sauce or Thai sweet chili dipping sauce.

name: Thai-style Chicken Wings
description: These Thai-style chicken wings are a mouthwatering fusion of sweet, savory, and spicy flavors. Marinated in a blend of aromatic spices and herbs, these wings are then baked to crispy perfection. Finished with a tantalizing Thai-inspired sauce, they're guaranteed to be a hit at any gathering or as a delicious appetizer for your next meal.
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken wings, split at joints, tips removed,1/4 cup soy sauce,2 tablespoons fish sauce,2 tablespoons honey,2 cloves garlic, minced,1 tablespoon fresh ginger,grated,1 tablespoon sesame oil,1 tablespoon Sriracha sauce (adjust to taste for spice level),1 lime,juiced,Salt and pepper to taste,Chopped cilantro and sliced green onions for garnish,Sesame seeds for garnish
instruction: n a large bowl, whisk together soy sauce, fish sauce, honey, minced garlic, grated ginger, sesame oil, Sriracha sauce, lime juice, salt, and pepper.Add the chicken wings to the marinade, ensuring they are evenly coated. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight for best results.Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil for easy cleanup.Remove the chicken wings from the marinade, shaking off any excess, and place them on the prepared baking sheet in a single layer.Bake the wings in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, flipping halfway through, or until they are golden brown and crispy.While the wings are baking, transfer the remaining marinade to a small saucepan. Bring it to a simmer over medium heat and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until it has slightly thickened into a glaze.Once the wings are cooked through and crispy, remove them from the oven and brush them with the prepared glaze.Garnish the wings with chopped cilantro, sliced green onions, and sesame seeds before serving.

name: Pad Thai with Chicken
description: Pad Thai with Chicken is a flavorful and aromatic Thai dish that combines stir-fried noodles, tender chicken, crunchy vegetables, and a tangy-sweet sauce. This dish is a harmonious blend of textures and flavors, making it a popular choice among Thai food enthusiasts. It's quick and easy to prepare, making it perfect for a delicious weeknight dinner.
ingredients:
8 oz (225g) rice noodles,2 chicken breasts, thinly sliced,2 tablespoons vegetable oil,3 cloves garlic, minced,2 eggs, lightly beaten,1 cup bean sprouts,1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced,4 green onions, sliced,1/4 cup roasted peanuts, chopped (optional),Lime wedges,for serving,Fresh cilantro,for garnish
For the sauce:3 tablespoons soy sauce,2 tablespoons fish sauce,2 tablespoons tamarind paste,2 tablespoons brown sugar,1 tablespoon rice vinegar,1 teaspoon chili flakes (adjust to taste)
instruction:
Soak the rice noodles in warm water for about 15 minutes, or until they are soft but still firm to the touch. Drain and set aside.
In a small bowl, whisk together the ingredients for the sauce: soy sauce, fish sauce, tamarind paste, brown sugar, rice vinegar, and chili flakes. Set aside.Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for about 30 seconds, or until fragrant.Add the thinly sliced chicken breasts to the skillet and stir-fry until they are cooked through, about 5-6 minutes. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.In the same skillet, add another tablespoon of vegetable oil. Pour the beaten eggs into the skillet and scramble them until they are just cooked.Add the soaked rice noodles to the skillet, along with the prepared sauce. Toss everything together until the noodles are well coated in the sauce.Add the cooked chicken back to the skillet, along with the bean sprouts, sliced bell pepper, and green onions. Stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender-crisp.Remove the skillet from the heat and sprinkle chopped peanuts over he Pad Thai, if desired. Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro and lime wedges on the side.

name: Green Curry Chicken
description: This vibrant Green Curry Chicken recipe offers a tantalizing blend of aromatic spices, tender chicken, and creamy coconut milk, all simmered to perfection. Bursting with Thai flavors, this dish is both comforting and exotic, making it an ideal choice for adventurous palates seeking a culinary journey.
ingredients: 1 lb (450g) boneless,skinless chicken breast or thigh, thinly sliced,2 tablespoons green curry paste,1 can (14 oz/400ml) coconut milk,1 cup (240ml) chicken broth,1 tablespoon vegetable oil,1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced,1 small eggplant, diced,1 cup (150g) bamboo shoots, drained (optional),1 tablespoon fish sauce,1 tablespoon palm sugar or brown sugar,1 cup (30g) fresh Thai basil leaves,2 kaffir lime leaves, torn,1-2 Thai bird's eye chilies, thinly sliced (optional, adjust to taste),Salt, to taste
instruction:
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.Add green curry paste to the skillet and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly until fragrant.
Pour in half of the coconut milk, stirring well to combine with the curry paste.Add the sliced chicken to the skillet, stirring to coat it evenly with the curry mixture. Cook for 2-3 minutes until chicken is no longer pink on the outside.Stir in the remaining coconut milk and chicken broth. Bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.Add the sliced bell pepper, diced eggplant, and bamboo shoots (if using) to the skillet. Stir well to combine.Season with fish sauce, palm sugar (or brown sugar), and salt to taste. Allow the curry to simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the chicken is cooked through.Once the curry has thickened slightly and the flavors have melded together, remove the skillet from heat.Stir in fresh Thai basil leaves, torn kaffir lime leaves, and sliced Thai bird's eye chilies (if using).Serve hot over steamed jasmine rice or noodles. Garnish with additional basil leaves and lime wedges if desired.

name: Drunken Noodles with Beef
description: Drunken Noodles with Beef is a flavorful and satisfying Thai dish, featuring wide rice noodles, tender beef slices, and a harmonious blend of savory, sweet, and spicy flavors. It's a popular street food dish in Thailand known for its bold flavors and aromatic spices. This recipe brings together the essence of Thai cuisine with its vibrant ingredients and simple yet tantalizing preparation.
ingredients: 8 oz wide rice noodles,1/2 lb beef sirloin, thinly sliced,3 cloves garlic, minced,2 shallots, thinly sliced,2 red chilies, thinly sliced,1 bell pepper, sliced,1 cup Thai basil leaves,2 tablespoons vegetable oil,2 tablespoons oyster sauce,2 tablespoons soy sauce,1 tablespoon fish sauce,1 tablespoon brown sugar,Lime wedges, for serving
instruction: Prepare the rice noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.In a small bowl, mix together the oyster sauce, soy sauce, fish sauce, and brown sugar. Set aside.Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add minced garlic and shallots, stir-frying until fragrant, about 1 minute.Add sliced beef to the wok and stir-fry until it's browned and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes.Push the beef to one side of the wok and add sliced bell peppers and red chilies. Stir-fry for another 2 minutes until the vegetables are slightly softened.Add the cooked rice noodles to the wok along with the prepared sauce. Toss everything together until well combined and heated through, about 2-3 minutes.Remove the wok from heat and stir in Thai basil leaves until they wilt slightly.

name: Crab Fried Rice
description: Crab Fried Rice is a delightful fusion of flavors, combining succulent crab meat with fragrant rice and an array of vegetables and seasonings. This dish typically takes around 30 minutes to prepare and cook, making it a quick and satisfying meal option.
ingredients: 2 cups cooked rice (preferably chilled),200g crab meat (fresh or canned),1 onion,diced,2 cloves garlic,minced,1 carrot, diced,1 bell pepper, diced (any color you prefer),2 eggs,beaten,2 tablespoons soy sauce,1 tablespoon oyster sauce,1 tablespoon sesame oil,1/2 cup frozen peas,Salt and pepper to taste,Green onions, chopped (for garnish),Sesame seeds (optional, for garnish)
instruction:
Heat a tablespoon of oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the beaten eggs and scramble until cooked through. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add another tablespoon of oil if needed. Sauté the diced onion and minced garlic until fragrant, about 2 minutes.Add the diced carrot and bell pepper to the skillet and cook for another 3-4 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.Stir in the crab meat and cook for 2-3 minutes until heated through.Add the cooked rice to the skillet, breaking up any clumps, and stir to combine with the vegetables and crab meat.Pour the soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sesame oil over the rice mixture. Stir well to ensure everything is evenly coated.Add the frozen peas and scrambled eggs to the skillet, stirring until they are heated through and evenly distributed.Season the fried rice with salt and pepper to taste.Garnish with chopped green onions and sesame seeds if desired.

name: Tom Yum Goong
description: Tom Yum Goong is a spicy and sour soup with a fragrant broth infused with lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, galangal, and chili peppers. It features succulent shrimp (goong) as its primary protein, along with mushrooms, tomatoes, and other fresh ingredients. This soup is bursting with complex flavors, making it a favorite in Thai cuisine.
ingredients: 1 lb (450g) large shrimp, peeled and deveined,4 cups (1 liter) chicken or vegetable broth,2 stalks lemongrass, cut into 2-inch pieces and smashed,4 kaffir lime leaves,torn,3-4 slices galangal (or ginger if unavailable),3-4 Thai bird's eye chilies, bruised,8 oz (225g) mushrooms (such as straw mushrooms or button mushrooms), sliced,2 tomatoes,cut into wedges,2 shallots, thinly sliced,3 tablespoons fish sauce,2 tablespoons lime juice,1 tablespoon sugar,Handful of cilantro leaves, for garnish,Thai bird's eye chilies, thinly sliced (optional, for extra heat),Salt,to taste
instruction: In a pot, bring the chicken or vegetable broth to a boil over medium-high heat.Add lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, galangal, and Thai bird's eye chilies to the boiling broth. Let it simmer for 5-10 minutes to allow the flavors to infuse.Stir in the mushrooms, tomatoes, and shallots. Simmer for another 3-5 minutes until the vegetables are tender.Add the shrimp to the pot and cook until they turn pink and opaque, about 2-3 minutes.Season the soup with fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, and salt to taste. Adjust the seasoning according to your preference for sweetness, saltiness, and sourness.Remove the pot from heat and discard the lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, galangal, and Thai bird's eye chilies.Ladle the Tom Yum Goong into serving bowls. Garnish with cilantro leaves and thinly sliced Thai bird's eye chilies for an extra kick, if desired.

name: Egg Pakora
description: Egg pakora is a delightful Indian snack where boiled eggs are coated in a spicy chickpea flour batter and deep-fried until crispy. It's a flavorful and indulgent treat that's perfect for any occasion.
ingredients: 4 hard-boiled eggs,1 cup chickpea flour (besan),2 tablespoons rice flour,1 teaspoon chili powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Water, as needed,Oil for deep frying
instruction: Start by peeling the hard-boiled eggs and slicing them in half lengthwise.In a mixing bowl, combine the chickpea flour, rice flour, chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt.Gradually add water to the dry ingredients, whisking continuously, until you achieve a smooth and thick batter. It should be thick enough to coat the back of a spoon.Heat oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat.Dip each egg half into the batter, ensuring it's evenly coated.Carefully lower the coated eggs into the hot oil and fry until golden brown and crispy, turning occasionally to ensure even cooking. This usually takes about 3-4 minutes.Once the egg pakoras are golden and crisp, remove them from the oil using a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels to remove excess oil.

name: Fish Kalia
description: Fish Kalia is a traditional Bengali fish curry prepared with a combination of aromatic spices, tomatoes, and onions, resulting in a flavorful and rich gravy. This dish is typically served hot with steamed rice, offering a satisfying and comforting meal experience.
ingredients: 500g fish fillets (such as rohu, tilapia, or cod), cut into pieces,2 onions,finely chopped,2 tomatoes, pureed,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,2 green chilies,slit,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon cumin powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala powder,Salt to taste,2 tablespoons vegetable oil,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat vegetable oil in a deep pan or kadhai over medium heat.Add the chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.Stir in the ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, and cook for another 2 minutes.Add the tomato puree and cook until the oil starts to separate from the mixture.Reduce the heat to low and add the turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.Add the fish pieces to the pan and gently coat them with the masala mixture.Pour in 1-2 cups of water, depending on your desired consistency, and bring it to a gentle boil.Cover the pan and simmer for about 10-15 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and the flavors have melded together.Sprinkle garam masala powder over the curry and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

name: Fish Tandoori
description: Fish Tandoori is a flavorful Indian dish where fish is marinated in a blend of spices and yogurt, then baked or grilled to perfection. This dish combines the richness of Indian spices with the delicate flavor of fish, resulting in a tantalizing culinary experience.
ingredients: 500g firm white fish fillets (such as cod, tilapia, or halibut),1 cup plain yogurt,2 tablespoons lemon juice,2 tablespoons tandoori masala spice mix,1 teaspoon ground cumin,1 teaspoon ground coriander,1 teaspoon paprika,1 teaspoon turmeric,1 teaspoon ginger paste,1 teaspoon garlic paste,Salt to taste,Vegetable oil, for brushing,Fresh cilantro leaves, for garnish,Lemon wedges
instruction:
Pat dry the fish fillets with paper towels to remove excess moisture.
In a large mixing bowl, combine yogurt, lemon juice, tandoori masala spice mix, ground cumin, ground coriander, paprika, turmeric, ginger paste, garlic paste, and salt. Mix well to form a smooth marinade.
Score the fish fillets lightly with a knife on both sides. This helps the marinade penetrate better.Place the fish fillets in the marinade, ensuring they are evenly coated. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F). If grilling, preheat the grill to medium-high heat.Remove the fish from the refrigerator and let it sit at room temperature for about 10 minutes.Grease a baking dish lightly with vegetable oil. Place the marinated fish fillets in the baking dish, leaving some space between them.Brush the tops of the fish fillets with a little more vegetable oil.Bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork. If grilling, cook the fish for 4-5 minutes on each side, or until done.Once cooked, remove the fish from the oven or grill. Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves and serve hot with lemon wedges on the side.

name: Chicken Hakka Noodles
description: Chicken Hakka Noodles is a popular Indo-Chinese dish that combines stir-fried noodles with tender chicken and crisp vegetables. It's known for its savory flavor, satisfying texture, and versatility. This dish is perfect for those craving a comforting yet exciting meal that's quick to prepare.
ingredients: 200g Hakka noodles (or any noodles of your choice),250g boneless chicken breast,thinly sliced,2 tablespoons vegetable oil,3 cloves garlic, minced,1-inch piece ginger, grated,1 onion, thinly sliced,1 bell pepper (capsicum), thinly sliced,1 carrot,julienned,1 cup cabbage, thinly sliced,2-3 green chilies,thinly sliced (adjust to taste),2 tablespoons soy sauce,1 tablespoon chili sauce (adjust to taste),1 tablespoon vinegar,1 teaspoon sugar,Salt to taste,Freshly ground black pepper to taste,Spring onions, chopped (for garnish)
instruction:
Cook the noodles according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain and rinse with cold water to stop the cooking process. Set aside.
In a wok or large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add minced garlic and grated ginger. Sauté for a minute until fragrant.Add thinly sliced chicken breast to the wok. Stir-fry until the chicken is cooked through and no longer pink, about 5-6 minutes.Push the chicken to one side of the wok and add sliced onions, bell peppers, carrot, cabbage, and green chilies. Stir-fry the vegetables for 2-3 minutes until they are slightly tender yet crisp.Incorporate the cooked noodles into the wok along with the stir-fried chicken and vegetables. Toss everything together.In a small bowl, mix together soy sauce, chili sauce, vinegar, sugar, salt, and black pepper. Pour this sauce over the noodles and toss well to coat evenly.Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, stirring continuously, until the noodles are heated through and everything is well combined.Garnish with chopped spring onions and serve hot.

name: Egg Rolls
description: These homemade egg rolls are a delightful fusion of crispiness and flavor. Packed with a colorful medley of vegetables and wrapped in a golden, crunchy shell, they make for a satisfying appetizer or a tasty snack. With their savory filling and irresistible texture, these egg rolls are sure to be a hit at any gathering.
ingredients: 12 egg roll wrappers,2 cups shredded cabbage,1 cup shredded carrots,1 cup thinly sliced bell peppers (assorted colors for vibrancy),1 cup bean sprouts,3 cloves garlic, minced,2 tablespoons soy sauce,1 tablespoon sesame oil,1 teaspoon grated ginger,2 green onions, thinly sliced,1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water (for sealing)
instruction:
In a large skillet or wok, heat sesame oil over medium-high heat. Add minced garlic and grated ginger, sautéing until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add shredded cabbage, carrots, bell peppers, and bean sprouts to the skillet. Stir-fry the vegetables until they are tender yet still crisp, about 5-7 minutes.Pour soy sauce over the vegetables and toss to combine. Cook for an additional 2 minutes, then remove from heat. Stir in sliced green onions.Lay out an egg roll wrapper on a clean surface with one corner pointing towards you. Place about 2 tablespoons of the vegetable filling onto the center of the wrapper.Fold the bottom corner of the wrapper over the filling, then fold in the side corners. Moisten the top corner with the cornstarch-water mixture, then roll up the egg roll tightly, sealing the edge.Repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling.In a deep skillet or pot, heat vegetable oil to 350°F (175°C). Carefully place the egg rolls in the hot oil, frying in batches until they are golden brown and crispy, about 3-4 minutes per batch.Remove the cooked egg rolls from the oil and drain on paper towels to remove excess oil.

name: Spicy Chicken Skewers
description: These Spicy Chicken Skewers are an explosion of flavor that will tantalize your taste buds. Tender chicken pieces marinated in a blend of spices and grilled to perfection, these skewers are perfect for any occasion, from weeknight dinners to backyard barbecues.
ingredients: 1 lb (450g) boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces,2 tablespoons olive oil,2 cloves garlic, minced,1 teaspoon paprika,1 teaspoon cumin,1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper (adjust to taste),1/2 teaspoon black pepper,1/2 teaspoon salt,1 tablespoon honey,Juice of 1 lime,Wooden skewers, soaked in water for at least 30 minutes
instruction:
In a bowl, combine olive oil, minced garlic, paprika, cumin, cayenne pepper, black pepper, salt, honey, and lime juice. Mix well to form a marinade.
Add the chicken pieces to the marinade, making sure they are well coated. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight for best results.Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.Thread the marinated chicken pieces onto the soaked wooden skewers.Place the skewers on the grill and cook for 6-8 minutes on each side, or until the chicken is cooked through and has nice grill marks.Once cooked, remove the skewers from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes before serving.Serve the spicy chicken skewers hot with your favorite dipping sauce or alongside grilled vegetables and rice.

name: Fish Karahi
description: Fish Karahi is a delectable Pakistani dish, bursting with rich flavors and spices.
ingredients: 500g firm white fish fillets (such as cod or tilapia), cut into chunks,3 tablespoons vegetable oil,1 large onion, finely sliced,2 tomatoes, finely chopped,2 green chilies, finely chopped,1 tablespoon ginger paste,1 tablespoon garlic paste,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander powder1 teaspoon red chili powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish,Lemon wedges for serving
instruction:
Heat vegetable oil in a large pan or karahi over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add sliced onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.Stir in ginger and garlic paste, and cook for another minute until the raw smell disappears.Add chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until tomatoes soften and the oil begins to separate.Sprinkle coriander powder, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.Add fish chunks to the masala, gently stirring to coat them evenly. Be careful not to break the fish pieces.Cover and cook for 5-7 minutes on low heat until the fish is cooked through and tender.Sprinkle garam masala over the fish karahi and give it a gentle stir.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.Serve hot with naan bread or steamed rice, along with lemon wedges on the side for an extra zing.

name: Beef Seekh Kebab
description: Beef Seekh Kebab is a mouthwatering Indian appetizer made with minced beef, aromatic spices, and herbs, shaped onto skewers and grilled to perfection. These succulent kebabs are bursting with flavors and are perfect for any gathering or as a delightful snack.
ingredients: 500g minced beef,1 onion, finely chopped,2 green chilies, finely chopped,2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste,2 tablespoons chopped fresh coriander (cilantro),1 tablespoon roasted gram flour (besan),1 teaspoon ground cumin,1 teaspoon ground coriander,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,1/2 teaspoon red chili powder,Salt to taste,1 tablespoon vegetable oil,Lemon wedges and sliced onions for serving
instruction:
In a large mixing bowl, combine minced beef, chopped onion, green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, chopped coriander, roasted gram flour, ground cumin, ground coriander, garam masala, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well to combine all the ingredients evenly.
Using your hands, knead the mixture for a few minutes until it becomes smooth and well blended.Take a handful of the mixture and shape it onto skewers, pressing gently to form elongated kebabs. Repeat with the remaining mixture.Heat a grill pan or barbecue grill over medium heat. Brush the surface lightly with vegetable oil to prevent sticking.Place the prepared beef kebabs on the grill and cook for about 6-8 minutes on each side or until they are evenly browned and cooked through.Once cooked, remove the kebabs from the grill and serve hot with lemon wedges and sliced onions on the side.Enjoy the delicious Beef Seekh Kebabs as a starter or appetizer with your favorite dipping sauce or chutney.

name: Lahori Chicken Karahi
description: Lahori Chicken Karahi is a popular Pakistani dish known for its rich flavors and spicy kick. This aromatic dish is prepared with tender chicken pieces cooked in a thick, tomato-based gravy infused with a blend of traditional spices. It's typically served hot, straight from the karahi (a type of cooking vessel), with naan or rice.
ingredients: 1 kg chicken, cut into pieces,4 medium tomatoes, finely chopped,2 onions, thinly sliced,4-5 green chilies, slit lengthwise,4 cloves of garlic, minced,1-inch piece of ginger,grated,1/2 cup vegetable oil,1 teaspoon cumin seeds,1 teaspoon coriander seeds,1 teaspoon red chili powder,1 teaspoon turmeric powder,1 teaspoon garam masala,Salt to taste,Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
instruction: Heat vegetable oil in a large karahi or deep skillet over medium heat.Add cumin seeds and coriander seeds. Sauté until fragrant.Add sliced onions and cook until they turn golden brown.Stir in minced garlic and grated ginger. Cook for another minute.Add chopped tomatoes and green chilies. Cook until tomatoes are soft and oil starts to separate.Add chicken pieces to the tomato mixture. Mix well to coat the chicken with the spices.Cover and cook on medium heat for 15-20 minutes or until the chicken is tender, stirring occasionally.Once the chicken is cooked, uncover and increase the heat to evaporate excess liquid, if any.Sprinkle red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well and cook for another 5 minutes.Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

name: Beef Nihari
description: Beef Nihari is a traditional Pakistani and Indian dish known for its rich, slow-cooked flavors and aromatic spices.
ingredients: 1 kg beef,preferably shank or stewing cuts, cut into pieces,4 tablespoons oil or ghe,2 onions,finely sliced,4 cloves garlic, minced,2-inch piece of ginger, grated,2 tablespoons Nihari masala (a spice blend readily available in stores),1 tablespoon coriander powder,1 teaspoon cumin powder,1 teaspoon red chili powder,Salt to taste,6 cups water,2 tablespoons wheat flour (optional, for thickening),Fresh cilantro leaves, chopped,for garnish,Ginger slices, for garnish,Lemon wedges, for serving
instruction: Heat oil or ghee in a large pot over medium heat. Add sliced onions and cook until golden brown.Add minced garlic and grated ginger, sauté for another 2 minutes until fragrant.Add beef pieces to the pot and cook until browned on all sides.Sprinkle Nihari masala, coriander powder, cumin powder, red chili powder, and salt over the beef. Mix well to coat the meat evenly with the spices.Pour in water and bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and cover the pot. Allow it to simmer for 2-3 hours, or until the beef is tender and the flavors have melded together.If desired, mix wheat flour with a little water to form a smooth paste. Gradually add this paste to the simmering stew to thicken the gravy. Cook for an additional 10-15 minutes.Adjust seasoning according to taste preferences.Garnish Beef Nihari with chopped cilantro leaves and ginger slices.

name: Egg Fried Rice with Chicken
description: This savory Egg Fried Rice with Chicken recipe combines tender pieces of chicken with fluffy rice, crisp vegetables, and scrambled eggs, all seasoned with a delicious blend of sauces and spices. It's a quick and satisfying meal that's perfect for lunch or dinner, offering a balance of protein, carbohydrates, and essential nutrients.
ingredients: 2 cups cooked rice (preferably chilled),2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, diced,2 eggs,beaten,1 cup mixed vegetables (such as diced carrots, peas, and corn),3 cloves garlic,minced,2 tablespoons soy sauce,1 tablespoon oyster sauce,1 tablespoon sesame oil,2 tablespoons vegetable oil,Salt and pepper to taste,Optional garnishes: sliced green onions, sesame seeds
instruction:
Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the diced chicken and cook until it's no longer pink, about 5-6 minutes. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the remaining tablespoon of vegetable oil. Add minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute until fragrant.Push the garlic to one side of the skillet and pour the beaten eggs into the other side. Let them cook undisturbed for a few seconds, then scramble them until fully cooked. Mix the scrambled eggs with the garlic.Add the mixed vegetables to the skillet and cook until they're tender, about 3-4 minutes.Stir in the cooked rice and cooked chicken, breaking up any clumps of rice with a spatula.In a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sesame oil. Pour this sauce over the rice and chicken mixture, stirring well to ensure everything is evenly coated.Continue to cook, stirring frequently, until everything is heated through and well combined, about 3-4 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.Remove the skillet from heat and garnish with sliced green onions and sesame seeds if desired.

name: Beef Samosas
description: Spicy Beef Samosas are savory pastry pockets filled with a zesty mixture of ground beef, aromatic spices, and vegetables. These crispy snacks are perfect for any occasion, whether it's a casual gathering or a special celebration. Bursting with flavor and a hint of heat, they're sure to be a crowd-pleaser.
ingredients:
For the filling:250g lean ground beef,1 small onion, finely chopped,2 cloves garlic, minced,1 small potato, peeled and diced into small cubes,1/2 cup frozen peas,1 teaspoon cumin powder,1 teaspoon coriander powder,1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder,1/2 teaspoon garam masala,1/2 teaspoon chili powder (adjust to taste),Salt to taste,2 tablespoons vegetable oil
For the pastry:1 cup all-purpose flour,1/2 teaspoon salt,2 tablespoons vegetable oil,Water as needed
instruction:
Start by making the dough for the pastry. In a mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, salt, and vegetable oil. Gradually add water and knead until a smooth dough forms. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rest for 15-20 minutes.While the dough is resting, prepare the filling. Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and minced garlic, sauté until translucent.Add the ground beef to the pan and cook until it's browned and cooked through, breaking it apart with a spoon as it cooks.Once the beef is cooked, add the diced potatoes and frozen peas to the pan. Stir in the cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, chili powder, and salt. Cook for another 5-7 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender. Remove from heat and let the filling cool.
Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.Divide the rested dough into 6 equal portions and roll each portion into a ball. Roll out each ball into a thin circle, about 6 inches in diameter.Cut each circle in half to form semi-circles. Take one semi-circle and fold it into a cone shape, sealing the edges with a little water.Fill the cone with a spoonful of the cooled beef mixture, then seal the open edge of the cone with water, pressing firmly to ensure it's tightly sealed.Repeat with the remaining dough and filling to make more samosas.Place the samosas on the prepared baking sheet and brush the tops lightly with oil.Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the samosas are golden brown and crispy.
